I preordered this game and forgot about it until it popped up after being released. I tried it out, having played many games on my phone before and didn‚Äôt expect much. I was quickly blown away by the visuals. I got into the story, which I don‚Äôt usually, and have found many ways to play the game if one objective becomes tiring.
However, there are 2 main things that I think should be kept in mind when determining if this game is right for you. The first is that this is a full fledged console game that is also on mobile. Therefor, the file size is going to be quite large. I think like, 8gbs for me currently? It being a full game on mobile also means that the controls can be difficult. I‚Äôm fine with them now, but it took a while. 
Second, keep in mind that mihoyo would like money for this game. It‚Äôs f2p, but that does come with the drawbacks of less and lower quality characters and equipment. But I play the game the explore, follow quest lines, and kind of just chill. If you‚Äôre expecting something special/new every time you play, you‚Äôll have to spend money. 
For a free game with a million things to do/ focus on/ explore, I‚Äôve had a ton of fun and been overwhelmingly impressed. 
*iphone SE 2nd gen*

Hi, I‚Äôve been playing Genshin Impact since launch and I am AR58. Though there are good things about the game, the bad outweighs the good for me at this point and I am no longer enthusiastic about continuing to play. First and most important are the character designs for both the NPCs and playable characters in this new region, Sumeru. HoYoVerse is trying to expand to a global audience, yet they are still placating prejudiced and colorist views. As a result, both the Sumeru NPCs and playable characters are pale and stereotyped caricatures of people from South Asia and the Middle East. It is not respectful or thoughtful representation at all and it is deeply disappointing to see. Even if you don‚Äôt take diversity into account, many of the new character‚Äôs designs are still lazy, amateurish, and unremarkable. Besides that, the lack of endgame content for veteran players is abysmal. Outside of the new quests and exploration, there is very little and what‚Äôs there is repetitive. New players will have to slog through months of quest backlog to catch up and actually be able to level their characters, with no dialogue or cutscene skip. HoYoVerse is sending a clear message that they don‚Äôt care about global player retention or new players. They just want money from the ‚Äúwhales,‚Äù a small group of players who casually drop thousands of dollars on the game. It‚Äôs heartbreaking seeing this game take a downward turn because they just refuse to listen.

I‚Äôve been playing genshin impact for almost 2 years now. The beginning was really fun! Although completely my fault, I got so addicted to the game, I wouldn‚Äôt put it down. Within 2 weeks of playing I hit AR 30. I regret that very much. If your a new player, or just a random person looking to play this wonder of a game, take it slow, this game has content you wanna take your time on. There‚Äôs 4 regions unlocked currently with 3 more regions coming out. Take your time in this game! The pros however, amazing graphics, beautiful character designs, and REALLY GOOD open world. This was my first time playing a mobile open world game. I‚Äôve experienced games like Zelda and Pok√©mon before, but I was so surprised how well the graphics were ON my phone and iPad. From starting the game till now, honestly just walking around Mondstadt, Liyue, Inazuma, and Sumeru is all the entertainment I need. Acting like an NPC is really fun believe it or not HAHAH. Lore wise, I enjoy most of the archon and story quest lore. However the world quests, there are some you should definitely read through, but the rest are infuriatingly long. Characters are super enjoyable, specifically the pyro and cryo characters. Overall great game!

I‚Äôve been playing Genshin since early 2021, and I gotta say it‚Äôs been a nice experience! If you get over ‚Äúbuilding‚Äù your characters feeling like a chore you work hard to get a character, then you gotta get a weapon, and good artifacts and level all those things then level talents and it‚Äôs just‚Ä¶ a lot. And when you start to get more and more characters it becomes incredibly tedious. And the resin cap makes it impossible to get everything you need as soon as possible and that‚Äôs a bit frustrating. And then there‚Äôs the absolute lack in representation for the wide range of skin colors. I feel like at the start, when I started playing this wasn‚Äôt much of an issue. But with it being a year now and still barely any new skin tones besides snow, peach, and slight tan it‚Äôs getting annoying. I get there‚Äôs a standard in Eastern Asia surrounding skin color but I don‚Äôt think that‚Äôs fair because they have characters from different cultures then fail to represent them properly? With almost all the new semuru characters being incredibly pale despite the fact they are inspired by places like Egypt, India, Southern Africa. It‚Äôs disgusting how they make them all barely even tan and it needs to be fixed immediately. If they decide to take inspiration from these cultures for their characters, then the least they could do was give them an accurate skin color. 

Until then one star.

So, new player here. I‚Äôve seen this with many other reviews in many other games, where the inexperienced players misunderstand something and they criticize the game for something that shouldn‚Äôt be criticized. That‚Äôs why I‚Äôm sorry if there‚Äôs any problems in this review. Anyway, I want to talk about the problems first. In the cutscenes, like the starting intro (where you explain your story to Emergency Food, aka Paimon) it was lagging like crazy. Literally every three seconds the screen would freeze, or the animation would sort-of glitch. The same thing happened when Emergency Food and I read the gliding manual that Amber gave us. I‚Äôm annoyed by this because it‚Äôs hard for me to clearly understand what exactly is going on! The audio keeps running during the freeze and then after it doesn‚Äôt match. The other thing is very small- the graphics are kinda girly... A pet peeve, if you will. I know this is your style and everything, so you shouldn‚Äôt change it. But just a little thought. Other than that, the game is great. Weapons look awesome, characters are amazing, the storyline is awesome. Progression at first is fast, and slows down after, which is a good feature to hook players at first but not make it too easy. I like this game!

I love this game. However, I‚Äôm incredibly disappointed (but not surprised) with the new leaks. Much of the player-base was hoping for hoyoverse to finally give more representation to darker skin tones with sumeru, given that the region is based on the middle east, south asia, and north africa. However with all of the characters from that region that have been shown so far by hoyoverse themselves or have been shown by leakers, they are mostly extremely pale and a lot of their outfits have been said to be culturally inaccurate or offensive (ex: dori, who is a stereotype). It‚Äôs a shame that the company wishes to use these cultures but not actually put any care into respecting them and representing them like they did with inazuma and liyue. It‚Äôs extremely frustrating, especially since hoyoverse usually does not listen to their fanbase regarding improvements that could be made to the game. It‚Äôs absurd that out of the *huge* cast of characters, only two could be considered to have darker skin (and those two characters are constantly whitewashed in official art). Even then, we have not seen any characters with skin tones that are darker than those two characters. Most of the cast is extremely pale, and it‚Äôs not that there can‚Äôt be pale characters, but it‚Äôs that there is VERY little representation for darker skin tones. I hope that there will be changes, but if not I‚Äôm hesitant to continue spending any money on this game.

I‚Äôve been playing Genshin Impact since January - initially drawn in by the gorgeous anime graphics, character design, and story. However, in recent months, my interest has greatly plummeted. The poor mobile optimization i could look past, as gameplay wasn‚Äôt too impacted beyond needing to re-boot after it‚Äôd crashed a few times a session. But, it‚Äôs gotten to the point where the game is unplayable - literally. This is a brand new iPad, and I can‚Äôt last 30 seconds in co-op without the game crashing. I haven‚Äôt even gotten into how stingy this whole game is. Going into domains is a massive gamble and even when you get the pieces you want (which is also absurdly pitted against you, by the way) there‚Äôs still a chance they‚Äôll roll into junk you can‚Äôt use. It used to be so exciting to do tasks and quests and receive primogems to wish, but nowadays the rewards are so minuscule (barely 1/4 what a wish costs, or less!) that it‚Äôs not even worth wasting my time on. And the anniversary rewards? This has got to be some kind of prank, right? MHY spends millions upon millions of dollars on *twitter stickers* but oohhh noooo they can‚Äôt give us more than one ten pull on an anniversary because they‚Äôll go broke :,( sniff sniff. I‚Äôm so sick of being so, so deeply disappointed over and over and over again. Be better, MHY. I‚Äôd say take a page out of DevSisters‚Äô book.

there are just so many problems now that even rating this game with one star is too much. not only is there no communication from the game‚Äôs company themselves, but there is also a HUGE lack of representation within their playable characters and nps. they are building each new region to be based on these very cultural areas and refuse to even do the bare minimum of giving proper skin tones. 

more specifically with their upcoming region, sumeru. with the recent livestream showing off their architecture for sumeru, that is based off south asia and north africa, there are NO dark-skinned nps OR characters to be coming out from leaks , which proves that the game‚Äôs company do not care about them offending and disrespecting the real life people from the places they are basing their games‚Äô regions off of. the characters that we are aware of from leaks are seen to be EXTREMELY orientalist & islamphobic and goes to show that the company has no remorse for those they are profiting off of.

i‚Äôve been an active player for over a year, have given this game my own money , and for this misrepresentation to come out of this with no regards or apology or change from the company, it tells us as players that the company does not care about our concerns and judgements. it is very disappointing, but i will no longer be publicly or financially supporting this game until there are changes made and i hope others do the same

Y‚Äôall this game is breathtaking and so incredible. I cannot express how much I love it. I‚Äôve been playing since December of 2020 but I finally decided to write a review. The graphics are so beautiful. Like Breath of the Wild level. This game is not just a mobile game. The gameplay is so good and fun and the story is very interesting. It‚Äôs an open world exploration game so there‚Äôs lots of stuff to do. 
HOWEVER: just a quick heads up, this game comes with lots of updates as it‚Äôs an ongoing game that‚Äôs adding onto its story and game as we go. This means that it will take a good chunk of memory and that the whole map, story, and cast of characters isn‚Äôt released yet. 
Yes, there is a gacha system where you wish for more characters, but it‚Äôs not unfair to free to play players. I‚Äôm free to play and I‚Äôve gotten good characters (and even a five star one!) so you don‚Äôt need money to enjoy it. 
I love this game so, so much and it‚Äôs worth every minute of your time. I still have a hard time believing it‚Äôs free too. Not one of those ‚Äúfree to start‚Äù games where you eventually need to spend real money; this game can be played without spending a single penny the entire time.

i didnt get this game originally because i heard it was pay to win which by the way is NOT true. this game is absolutely gorgeous and amazing, it combines good storytelling with adventuring and even cooking (which has very quickly become my favorite part). the game is also absolutely gorgeous on its own and the community is very kind as well! about the pay to win claims, it isnt pay to win. yes there are things you can buy with real money but its nothing you cant earn in game with just a little patience. the events are amazing and they dont hesitate to shower you in rewards for the things youve accomplished, whether it be a simple event like just giving a guy some stuff every day for rewards or an entire event including brand new lore and characters (even some map expansion as well!) they are both so entertaining and engaging. i have severe adhd so despite open world games being my favorite, they can bore me due to not having anything in them but despite this huge map it isnt always bare. there's enemies, loot, random quests, ingredients, etc. and it does wonders for my adhd. im struggling to get everything written down but...

tl;dr highly recommended, the best open world game ive ever played (also not pay to win!)

I‚Äôve always put off this game and joined the Genshin-hate hivemind for YEARS, simply because it‚Äôs an anime game and the abhorrent fan base. I decided to give it an actual go and now I‚Äôm completely addicted. There‚Äôs so much to explore and the world is huge. The characters are fun and unique. Music is gorgeous and SFX are great. I‚Äôm regretting the years of irrational hatred for this game, I wish I played it sooner. I blame social media and compiling a trashy community together with a great game. I just want to play more of this. Disregard the abominable community and hate altogether. 

 I‚Äôm also surprised how humorous and safe for kids this game is as well. You could definitely play with your kids here without obnoxious fan service. Before, I assumed it had it because of the sheer amount of disgusting borderline pedophilic fan art there is. But no, the fan base does not match the game. This game is awesome. Just give it a shot.

To clarify, I mainly play on PC since there‚Äôs much more detail, graphic fidelity, better controls, etc. (Also the package is 50gb rather than 12). I highly recommend you first try Genshin on a good PC. 4K res as well, this game looks glorious even with it‚Äôs simply cel-shading.

I love genshin impact so much, and the characters are amazing. However, it is not free to play. Getting primo gems is way too hard, and the amount of pity you have to work up to is insane. Even with 100 dollars, it only gets you 50 wishes. Wishes are also too expensive, 160 primos for one. Mihoyo is very stingy with the amount of primo gems in events and commissions. It‚Äôs very hard to play once you get to a higher ar. I have explored most places, and I cannot get more primo gems unless I spend money. I‚Äôve been saving for about a month and I came up with one ten pull. The amount of money needed to get five stars is insane. If you lose the 50/50 with the money you spent, you have to spend over 100 dollars to get the character you want. They should get rid of the 50/50. It just makes you mad when you lose the 50/50, and spending money twice to get the character is maddening. Another thing is that you have to buy the battle pass if you want the bottom rewards. It is very unfair, it should be unlocked. This is not a friendly game for players who can‚Äôt spend money on it. I have spent at least 800 dollars on it and have gotten some characters, but it is not worth the money. The pity scale is too high and so is the price of wishes. This is a good game, but not for you if you can‚Äôt spend money.

This is the best game I have ever played. There is always something to do and countless possibilities ranging from ascending and upgrading characters to fight, to exploring the wonderful and seemingly infinite world of Teyvat. Using different elements you can fight and create teams, fighting bosses and smaller enemies as well as playing with others in co op. You unlock teleport waypoints and Statues of the Seven to move more easily across the map and just adventure through the beautiful and ethereal scenes and animation of this stunning world. The quests that you can do are also amazing, following one archon quest that follows the story of the traveler (you) and involved the intricate stories of each person there, and of the tales and creation of the 7 archons in Teyvat. The thought and creation put into each character and their voice lines and story is truly amazing, and each part of that adds to the interactiveness and the beauty of the game. While wandering through purple covered mountaintops, windy cliffs, rocky caverns with glowing tapestries across the walls, or an amazing sunset at the roof of a building, you always will find that the beauty of the game is what makes it so special and amazing.

This game was proven to be the next game to reach #1 upon successful concepts in character design and uses along with regions to explore and mysteries to solve in stories. Not to mentioned weapons characters have to use and enemies & bosses to defeat. What ended up being half is often times the loading screen gets stuck after all the protocols as to downloading updated file, verification within the file and the save file being loaded and ready to go are dealt with and ready to begin play that the loading screen would reach halfway thru the earth symbol and stays there for eons to come. I did the best on my end to make sure game runs smoothly thru tablet restart, network reset and app restart, which all of them perform smoothly at the time. I would pray the game would no longer be required to go to the loading screen with the elements logo that would impose a favor of being stuck on the half earth logo again. Otherwise, game is successful in all other aspects, which certainly win me over to playing this game. By removing an requirement as that or perhaps another means of loading screen where it is different from the original, I would then be able to give praise to a game like this and be able to play once more.

Lastly I wish that there were more weathers like rain, thunder, snow, hail, and maybe storms where u have to take cover and it will destroy things. Also I think there should be an easier way to change the characters in the group like a simple button maybe I‚Äôm just blind but I don‚Äôt think it is there. Also when you play on an iPad it keeps glitching out and I have to start a lot of things over. I‚Äôm in the middle of a legal and then all of the sudden it glitches out and I have to start that little bit over. I don‚Äôt know if it is the game, or my divice, but it needs to be fixed. Also I wish that you could trade characters, protigim, wishes and more with your friends. 
Thank you for reading and I hope you make these changes!!üòé

There are a lot of problems with this game but the unfairness in and out-game that goes towards F2P and Mobile players is insane. First off we have the insane amount of space this game takes up. For it to be in the 2.1 era it takes up too much space. Another thing is how money grabbing this game is. This game is based off luck, sure but not everyone is lucky, especially me. If the gacha system works as it says to work, a player shouldn't have to reach full pity to get a single 5* character. I am also F2P so i have to miss atleast 2 banners to get a 5* that isn't even guaranteed. The new weapon system isn't even circling around F2P either, only for people who bring you money. With the events which only give you 430 primos each event, a player doesn't even get a 10 pull unless they spend zero primos for a MONTH straight. A little bit over an entire banner. Also, why does this game break so often? Every polearm in the game can get stuck on something small like a boulder in the open world. This game has so many issues but is only biased to fix the ones that affect people who pay. Weapon banner system, the ENTIRE resin system, like?? Fix your game dude like not everyone can or will spend their entire life savings on a game that barely cares about its players.

As it says, yes, this game deserves 4 stars at best. Number one, the music is absolutely delightful and I genuinely appreciate how much effort was put into the music and game. Number two, the main storyline is decently good? The characters have wonderful appearances too. There‚Äôs only one problem, and everyone knows what that is, Mihoyo is not grateful enough for their fans. You‚Äôve had dedicated players for a year and made thousands of dollars‚Ä¶ and then we get‚Ä¶ pretty bad rewards that anyone could‚Äôve easily paid for. I feel like as an f2p player these rewards were meant for f2p people, there is no way people spend hundreds of dollars on this game and get 10 wishes and a couple Mora, we don‚Äôt need mora Mihoyo, I have literally 1 million mora all I want is primogems. Let‚Äôs also talk about the fact that Mihoyo gives us better rewards when they fix bugs than the anniversary rewards altogether. Primogems are SO hard to get as an f2p player and some of the things we do for just a couple of primogems is insane, especially when we get achievements and mainly only FIVE primogems for them, FIVE. Trust the community knows you guys wouldn‚Äôt lose a penny for raising the primogems we get for anything and everything.

I find myself playing losing track of the time the story line keeps you wanted to play more pros they do not have a pay to win aspect you can get everything free been playing two days and I already got a 5* so don‚Äôt let the reviews say other wise yeah normally the drop rates are low but they have events that boost up to 50-75% so save and use during those like I did and the 4* characters are still just as good u want to have a variety of different squads as you progress another pro which seems to be underrated is the voice to chat with npcs I think many will agree sometimes u just wanna skip through and sometimes u don‚Äôt feel like reading not to mention you feel more immersed into the game hearving different voices as you progress with different characters the only con I really think is the no mount system while it‚Äôs still beta hope it comes in future but they‚Äôre are ways around this some characters increase your stamina for entire party so u can run longer and climb higher so they doing everything right I‚Äôm a firm believer in making a game good enough free some players choose to purchase to support versus having to purchase just to progress so this game get a a+++

honestly, i love honkai and genshin so much. hoyoverse has given me a long term source of entertainment, and each game gives a different vibe and suits a different demographic. though genshin is a gacha, the game give you enough currency where (if you grind hard and long enough), you can get through all of the content and pick up enough limited 5 stars to do so. with that being said, there‚Äôs definitely a lot that needs improvement, such as endgame content apart from abyss and a reworked resin system. it‚Äôs so hard to improve character artifacts due to the rates, and to distribute your resin throughout all the bosses and materials on top of that is a nightmare. i also believe there should be some other way for endgame players to earn primos, as right now im in a spot where there‚Äôs no more to explore and im clearing abyss every rotation. however, seeing hoyoverses improvement with honkai, I have high hopes they will slowly make changes to benefit their players. with that being said, im in love with the coziness (at least for now TT) of the storyline and gameplay, and the landscape and designs itself are stunning. great game to pick up with summer coming up!

I can say for a fact that Genshin Impact got me through quarantine. A nice, time-consuming game filled with beautiful scenery and interesting lore. The idea of the game is quite unique. If you're looking for a game to spend years on, without ever stopping, then this game is for you. Some major issues with the game is the pity system. It's not always convenient, especially when you get Qiqi on, say, Ayaka's banner. But, hey, it's a gacha game; what can you expect? I will say that this game is worth spending your money on. Though it's free to play, the quality of it is far from cheap. The music is simply amazing, and the graphics and designs are phenomenal. Hoyoverse is also not stingy with giving you rewards such as primogems and the like. Hoyo is generous with that kind of stuff, and you can expect to get thousands of primogems as a beginner from world exploration to solving puzzles and completing quests. This game will definitely be worth your time if you're looking for a good RPG game to spend your time on. Of course, if you're not looking for a time-consuming game, Genshin might not be for you. But once you join, you can really never quit, in my opinion.

I started playing this game so I could join in on something my teenage daughter loves and invited me to play with her. I enjoy the game enough that I‚Äôve managed to almost catch up to her even though she had a major head start üòÖ. I love the characters, the core mechanics, and the variety in the world. I have come close to quitting a few times when the archon quest would have a challenge l couldn‚Äôt overcome and I‚Äôd get stuck for months. The anti-Raiden Shogun training being a prime example. There was no possible way to move forward in the story without completing the training, which for some reason I simply could not do for months on end. If there were alternate tactics to complete the challenge, it would have been so much better. If it weren‚Äôt for my daughter, I would have given up. 

The puzzles also bother me because there is often no way to discern the logic of the puzzle. Some of the puzzles have enough context that I can actually figure them out, and it‚Äôs very satisfying. But more often than not, I end up having to find a video tutorial that walks me through the very random answer.

The feeling of opening this game for the first time and experiencing everything is not something I‚Äôve ever been able to recreate with anything else; it‚Äôs truly a one-of-a-kind experience. And, over the 6 months (ish) of playing this game daily and progressing through the story, I‚Äôve found myself wowed again and again. Seeing Liyue Harbor for the first time, going to Inazuma with Beidou and Kazuha and experiencing everything there, seeing Sangonomiya Shrine for the first time‚Ä¶ this game truly is gorgeous. The soundtrack is amazing, the characters are all very fun to play as, the story line (even with its holes and not so great moments) is better than most main-stream media I‚Äôve consumed, and the events are incredibly fun. Overall, this game has been a net positive for me (though perhaps not for my grades, lolololol). All of that being said, however, the Gacha element does hinder this game; you can complete the game without ever wishing, sure, but that does hinder your ability to complete certain aspects of the game. Also, the lack of endgame makes progressing somewhat unenjoyable, with most in-game content being delegated to limited time events.

Ignore any other negative review. Yes the game takes a lot of storage, for a mobile game Genshin Impact has a HUGE amount of detail, the map is huge, and it‚Äôs overall worth it all. The story is VERY enticing. Yes, it IS a gacha game, but that doesn‚Äôt kill the fun. Yes you might miss out on a character you wanted but that‚Äôs okay. Even now as an adventure rank 57 player I still use characters that have since way fallen out of meta. It‚Äôs about strategizing, and if you can‚Äôt put just a little bit of effort into learning mechanics and team building you might be disappointed at your damage. But learning how to boost team damage and completing quests is fun. Not going to lie, the game IS a grind, but even that‚Äôs all part of genshin altogether. It might pain you at times but if you wanna deal big damage then that‚Äôs what you‚Äôll have to suffer (unless you have extreme luck lol). 

Tldr: even free to play players can enjoy the game and do well, i was free to play til Adventure rank 50 and enjoyed my time as one, im just a very low spender now and it doesn‚Äôt really change much, the game is fun regardless. Give it a shot, go in and have fun thats all. Everything Genshin has to offer is worth it.

Genshin is an amazing game that I‚Äôve loved since I picked it up. The graphics are really good, even if you‚Äôre on mobile (I‚Äôm using an old iPad), the characters are likeable, and the gameplay is fun and engaging. I do have a few problems with it though. After you finish the main archon quests, the only quests left to do are world and story quests, which get tedious and boring after a while. Except for events, there‚Äôs hardly anything to do other than farm domains, and you can‚Äôt even do that after a while because of the resin limit, which, by the way, is a mechanic I really like. Using resin to limit how much farming is allowed to be done really helps players from milking everything out of the game early on. Another thing: free to play players have a hard time getting good five star characters. I found that I rarely got what I wanted when I tried to be free to play. I could hardly get to high enough pity as a f2p, and when I did I still had to gamble losing my 50/50. Even with all those things, it‚Äôs still a great game that I recommend to anyone who is willing to put time and effort in. That said, it‚Äôs fairly addicting, so make sure to manage your time right!

Genshin Impact is a beautiful game made by incredibly talented artists, but your enjoyment quickly dries up when you realize how little the people in charge care about player satisfaction. I'm an AR55 player who's been playing on and off since launch, and there have been very few quality of life updates. Some character abilities work very inconsistently (ex: Xinyan's tier 3 shield and Sara's teleport both don't work as intended, both have been issues since the characters were released and have yet to be acknowledged), but only bugs that are useful or entertaining for the player get fixed (ex: Kokomi's walking on water infinitely, a fun bug that makes exploring more fun and which MiHoYo has announced plans to fix immediately, when other characters like the ones I just mentioned have literally broken abilities and MiHoYo doesn't care).

There's very little transparency with MiHoYo. They tell players basically nothing and do everything they can to sweep player complaints under the rug.

Especially with the recent decisions made by MiHoYo to be stingy with anniversary rewards, especially the meager community event rewards that are locked behind RNG and nowhere near proportional to the work many content creators put in, I can't in good faith recommend this game to anyone. Don't give this greedy company your time and energy, and most importantly do NOT give them your money.

Really have been enjoying my time with this game the world is absolutely stunning, the dialogue I find to be quite humorous and the gameplay is overall really fun. I especially love the way the elements will interact with each other adding another layer of thought behind party builds. However this game is very very very very greedy surprisingly for a mostly single player rpg with very limited co-op. The rates for the gacha are actually absurd the rate for a 5* character/weapon is a measly 0.6% which would be acceptable if you didn‚Äôt have to get a character 7 times to actually fully unlock their constellations(abilities,talents, passives etc.) as well as the 0.6% being split between characters and weapons so realistically there‚Äôs a 0.3% chance of pulling a 5* character and 0.3% for a 5* weapon; so unless you have 10‚Äôs of thousands of dollars to spend on the game to actually get the characters you want your best bet is to be f2p and just go for 4* characters that way you may be able to unlock there full potential (constellations)
Hopefully that will be addressed considering the recuperated the development cost in 1 week of the game being out. If not I don‚Äôt see much longevity for this game which is a shame because it has limitless potential if the devs can see past the money bags.

So, obviously this game is not finished development but I do have some things to say. This game is very fun! I like to join my friends and play together, the story of the game is also very interesting and nice. If you haven‚Äôt tried it out, you definitely should. The community has a lot of funny jokes, and are very nice, although some can be very rude or toxic. So this game is a really good game if you want a fun open-world exploring Gacha game. But, This game does not give out much rewards and there aren‚Äôt a lot of options to get the in-game Gacha currency Primo gems.  This game is free, but you will probably spend money since it is hard to get Primo gems, and if you can‚Äôt afford spending money on a game, it‚Äôs pretty hard to get good characters and weapons from the Gacha. I feel like this game should include more ways of getting Primo gems. Another thing I don‚Äôt like about this game is that if you have played for a long time and finished most of the quests, explored a lot, and leveled up a lot, then you have nothing to do. The only thing you can really do is to wait for a new update, play with friends, and help other people with stuff in Co-Op. But this game is a really good game and I'm looking forward to more.

now, don‚Äôt get me wrong, i LOVE genshin. the scenery, LEGENDARY, SPECTACULAR, FLAMBOYANT!!! chefs kiss to be exact. the action and battle graphics : YES! YES AND YES! The character designing and settings? 10/10. üôå they‚Äôre extremely unique. THE PLOTLINE? GOD YES. THE LORE?????? YOU DONT UNDERSTAND HOW LIFE CHANGING IT IS. it is F2P (free to play) friendly of course, if you really get into it. it‚Äôs just that playing genshin is like taking a big risk. genshin requires quite a lot of space on pc , mobile, etc. that is not the problem. genshin impact is one of those games in which you seem to consider ‚Äúgambling‚Äù but for strengths. it‚Äôs an action but also a luck game, it requires being able to understand numbers and certain terms. also don‚Äôt explode your computer just to play this game üòÄ it happens more often than you‚Äôd think. On the bright side, there are GREAT social and interactive events in which you can be in co-op or multiplayer and interact with other players. 
also, careful with the fandom, it‚Äôs got different sides.
 either way, hoyoverse has come a long way, I‚Äôve been playing genshin since 1.3, now it‚Äôs come to 2.6, in just a short span of time, it‚Äôs began to increase WIDELY in popularity. good job, hoyoverse.

I have always loved Genshin, and I was so excited for the new region of Sumeru, but I‚Äôm beyond disappointed in the designs of the upcoming characters. The lack of diversity is blatantly racist, with Sumeru being based off SWANA, the characters should NOT be as pale as they are. It is not a true representation of that region, the characters there should be a representation of the real people who live in the region Sumeru is based on, and they are not. Genshin seemed to take so much care in the representation of their Chinese and Japanese based regions, but isn‚Äôt taking the same attitude with Sumeru. It is absolutely unacceptable to use a real life region as inspiration and then refuse to give a real representation of its own people, you cannot just use bits and pieces to pick and choose to your liking.  The Sumeru characters should have darker skin tones to properly represent the people they‚Äôre inspired by. The lack of diversity has been a problem even before the announcement of the playable Sumeru characters, as even the NPCs supposed to be from Sumeru are not good representations of the people in the region they‚Äôre based on. Even within the current playable characters there is issues of racism, Kaeya and Xinyan, the only two darker skinned characters out of 50 playable characters, are commonly whitewashed in official art. Until Hoyoverse steps up and gives us the correct representation, I will no longer be financially supporting Genshin Impact.

A great game that seems to be easily able to expand on content over time. The combat is extremely fun and dynamic. Finding gear for your character is random, but with it comes a great feeling when you finally get the one you want. The world is gorgeous and filled up with things to grab/fight! I give the game 4 stars because the resin/primogem system rewards you with a ton of items at the start, but takes that level of reward away over time like a shady drug dealer. The rates for characters are awful given the price point for a shot at them, especially after you‚Äôve spent money on the one time bonus gems packs. The more they add characters, the less likely you get the one that would fit perfectly in your team so that leaves me worried about the future of the game. I‚Äôm also going to be keeping a close eye on balance in the game. I want my money spent now on the game to be just as worth it if I had saved it till next year. Please value our spending on your game. I see myself having a lot more fun with the game and look forward to challenging content in the future. PLEASE INCREASE G√ÇCHA RATES AND RESIN CAP/RECHARGE. Thank you <3

First I really love this game but unfortunately I don't own a PC so I play Genshin Impact on my Apple iPad. Thing is it crashes way too much especially after the inazuma update. I've been trying to co-op in domains in inazuma but it crashes the minute I try to co-op. It wasn't this bad before the update and I have a few friends who play Genshin Impact mobile but they don't have any problems with crashing. Maybe it's because I'm using an Apple device but I lowered every setting in my game to prevent it from crashing even more but it still crashes. Every time the game has a survey I always keep saying to fix the crashing issues for mobile players like us cause not everyone has a PC or PlayStation to play the game on. Unfortunately nothing has been changed and I've been asking this for a long time but no one has done anything about it. I know that the Genshin Impact designers or whatever is already busy doing stuff that concerns the game but if you guys have the time please fix the crashing issue for us mobile players. It's really annoying to keep on crashing when you really enjoy the game which I really love this game but the fact it keeps on crashing even more after the update is very frustrating so please I beg you to fix it.

This game is absolutely beautiful. The animators definitely spent a great deal of care and time in bringing this game to life. The aesthetics of the world and everything within is outright amazing! The characters and NPCs all are unique as well. I spent so much time just exploring the rather large area of the world right out of the gate rather than jumping into the story line. To everybody that‚Äôs thinking of doing the same, as it is quiet fun to do, I recommend at least going along and getting your wings and first couple team mates before you do begin to adventure around. Just need a few of those perks in order to complete a number of.... well I‚Äôll say encounters so as not to spoil anything. This is in my opinion the perfect open world game for mobile. But with all the praise there is also a downside; this game is an absolute monster on battery life. Make sure you have a power source nearby if you want to dive into this world. Trust me, if you start roaming around, time and battery life will go before you even realize how long it‚Äôs been. 

Would recommend the developers to include a battery icon and clock visual in game so players can monitor both as they play. Otherwise this is a perfect game to me.

I have been playing this game since it came out and it has been one of the most amazing games I have played. The graphics look so good ( like you would see in anime) and you get to explore new cities, get characters ( that look so cool), began this journey where your trying to find your twin sibling ( you can choose the brother or the sister).
I was trying to find a fun and exciting game and I found out about this which I‚Äôm glad I did. When I started playing this game it was going good but I started having problems where when I have to level up my character I have to find things before I level them up ( defeating a cube, a big flower plant, ruin guards). When I try to defeat them I can‚Äôt because they would be on a higher level and I try different strategies to defeat them ( and do them over again) and I watch videos to see what other people do but when I try them it doesn‚Äôt work. This also happens when I‚Äôm trying to level up my rank ( I‚Äôm currently rank 35 and I have been stuck on it for a few months and I can‚Äôt defeat the domains) Can you please try to make the fighting easier? that would help out a lot. I still love this game thank you for making it.

This game is pretty good! Its fun to play with friends. Im not sure how the performance is on mobile because im a PC player, but it runs smoothly and it looks good. But there are some massive flaws with this game. As a F2P player, its very hard to get literally anything in this game. No, I don't want Lisa constellations I want a 5 star. Yes, thank you for the pity system, but its literally so hard to get a 5 star. It costs so much money/time that its honestly insane. Plus, the resin system is also like.. yk.. bad. Domains are super hard to get anything worthwhile from if you are below ar 45, and I yknow, need artifacts to get to ar 45. And I feel like the wish system is literally so biased (ik thats not how it works but like jfc), like, I'll see people who will draw 3 5 stars in one pull then 3 4 star characters. How is that fair? like the story but sometimes it gets a little confusing. And this game gets so boring after ar 40, I am aware that It's not fully released yet, but like, the only things that you are able to do is grind for artifacts in the same boring repetitive domain over and over again and then get nothing. So basically, this game is a scam. But do I care? Not really, this game is fun to play sometimes, I like the story, and it's really pretty. (It's fun to beat stuff up). Overall, I'd say if you have amazing luck, play this! Otherwise, do Not touch this game unless you want to suffer

Genshin Impact is by far one of the best games I have EVER played. There‚Äôs a few minor things here and there that I would request have some work put into them such as making traveling around the world of Teyvat a bit less boring for players after hitting a certain AR, putting in an option that allows players to go back and watch all of the cutscenes including the ones from special events that they may have missed out on because of being too low level, or maybe even giving us some more original resin and freemogems to farm domains and bosses and blossoms with? Like I‚Äôve said before, this game is beautiful and amazing and absolutely my favorite game to play right now, but it‚Äôs starting to drag and get boring and I‚Äôm stuck at AR 50 because it takes forever to get your levels up once you get past AR 30-35+ and unless you spend hours upon hours upon days building almost every character you have, the ascension quests are basically impossible to beat. Hopefully MiHoyo will listen to their players‚Äô requests and pleas and somehow make at least a few of the many requests possible ü•∞ü•∞‚ù§Ô∏èü§ó

I‚Äôve seen this game pop up quite a few times on my ads and out of curiosity gave it a go, when you run into anime games it‚Äôs common to have low expectations along with the common negative aspects of 3D Anime, but this game absolutely blew me away, the characters are loveable, goofy, and fun to interact with, the gameplay mechanics are simple yet doesn‚Äôt hand feed you the playthrough. The world building is absolutely astounding, The fact you can go to every single NPC and each one have their own stories, their own lives and original dialogue makes this world that much more immersive, I can‚Äôt imagine how much effort this team must have put into that alone. The soundtrack is beautiful, the graphics are simple yet fun and overall it is a very addictive game, the only reason I give it 4/5 would be the crashing and bugs, it is still a very /very/ new game and I presume they will be fixed in the future but it is extremely frustrating when you have such a wonderful world ready to play and it crashes every two minutes, with this you just have to be patient but if I could change anything in this game I would try to fix the crash bugs, But overall a very fun and immersive game!

Somehow runnable on mobile and ipad despite the details. Great character designs, story, and overall a really fun game. However, once you finish all the story quests there's nothing left to grind until they make another update. It then gets really boring and frustrating to wait for the banner you want and getting primogems is impossibly hard as it requires over 10k primos for 1 5* while each day you get 60 per commission and with the chance of not getting the character you want means you have to grind months just for one character. Higher ranks take forever to get, and they rarely give out interwined fates, or primogems, they only give us wishes for the standard banner when you level up. Nonetheless, it's a very enjoyable game when you first start but gets really demotivating, and without spending money getting anything you want may take months of patience, which I can say I don't have. I'd love for event reruns, or make them permanent like the Scaramouche one. And adding more gears and small co-op minigames like the hide and seek one. It'd also be fun to be able to play the lyre without doing the windblume ode event, as it is a very old event many people did not particpate in. Thanks!

The game is a gorgeous world with plenty of explorations to make. I have plundered quite some time into the game over the past few days since launch. It is absolutely interesting and fun to play. However, there are some design I, as a player, would like some change on. 
First, about monetization, it is absolutely fine to expect making a lot of money from this game consider the development cost and everything. However, one thing this game does not differ from many other Chinese games is a hard effort cap in gaining characters. I have played effortlessly on gaining in-game currencies but I would say it at maximum gives one draw each hour of gameplay. With a 0.6% chance, you barely gain any 5 star characters by only playing. Before the game launches, I was honestly expecting to see more monetization options on skins and other customizations, instead of on characters.
Second, about protagonist gameplay, personally I would like the protagonist ‚Äútraveler‚Äù to have more weapon options, the ability to wield two elements at the same time, and cross-element skills.
Third, vehicle, bike, horse, or anything. :)
Fourth, about map improvement, currently the in-game map does not display any progression on one time collections or any collection.

Ok.. so we all know there is some cons to every pro in gaming. Well it‚Äôs basically a Japanese gotcha game. You don‚Äôt have to throw money at it but you can be rewarded for everything in the game which is slower. But the real reason for this review is the combat.. it‚Äôs amazing! Four party members to rotate in combat and different elements to play mix and match with. You can go for pyro-electro for explosions for massive AOE damage. There is an element to every character and they transfer to the next chosen character in battle. The targeting is pretty spot on to. Most games have this weird tap to cycle target but this one doesn‚Äôt. It lets you do everything on your own. The biggest con that this game has to begin with is grouping with your friends. The game doesn‚Äôt allow you to group till adventure level 15 (not character level 15). When you are able to get with your friends man it is so much fun cause the mix and match of elements is pretty crazy for the amount of things going on in the background. I give this game an honest 8/10.. The reason for is the gotcha system to pay to get ahead is a gimmick.. but other than that it‚Äôs super fun and would highly recommend to anyone and it‚Äôs free to play.

Genshin Impact is a fantastic game.  From the get go, its absolutely beautiful and the attention to detail in each and every frame and background is astounding.  The story is captivating and every quest is interesting and not boring at all.  It definitely is a game that will keep you wanting to play more and more.  The way that the game changes weather and time is also beautiful as well.  I‚Äôve watched sunrises, sunsets, battled in the rain, fought numerous amounts of monsters, all within a MOBILE game.  The game is such an amazing mobile game that it feels like you‚Äôre playing on an actual console (or on the computer).  Paimon is definitely the most annoying character out there and RNG is the worst way to try and get characters ever because I have terrible luck BUT EVEN SO, the game is so much fun to play you will have trouble putting it down.  Each character also has unique abilities and there is so much to learn in this game.  Definitely would recommend and I‚Äôve had the most fun playing this game over all other games that I have ever played on a mobile phone.  Hands down, if I could give it 10/5 stars, I would. (But please, make Paimon less annoying, please).

It‚Äôs like the love child of The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild, Monster Hunter, Fire Emblem and Skyrim! Although the game has 4 player coop it is very much a solo experience. It plays like an actual game you would buy for the Nintendo Switch (of which is coming later). There is also a PC version which I recommend the most because it feels the most native, like it was made for it originally. It supports controller too! The game is cross platform save, meaning you can play with someone whose on their phone even if you‚Äôre on pc and even if you switch to a phone yourself ‚Äî you‚Äôll still have your save! There is voice acting for Chinese (The original I think? The only one to have the protagonist‚Äôs voice over in his profile‚Äôs story section), English (it‚Äôs grown on me and I really like some of the characters voices), Japanese (this is the most popular because of anime), and Korean (I also really like this one!). You can choose the female twin (Lumine) or the male twin (Aether) at the beginning, there is no difference except personal choice. I chose Aether because he reminded me of Link. I highly recommend Genshin Impact. You seriously won‚Äôt regret trying this game!

Mihoyo, Genshin Impact is a great game. So great, that instead of curtains, I have a picture of Venti hanging over my window. But in order to convince my parents to pay for a five star every few weeks I have to make an entire slideshow trying to convince them they‚Äôre not wasting their money, you might say ‚Äúoh, just grind primogems, it‚Äôs not that hard‚Äù but taking honors classes, being in NJHS, playing 3 sports, and learning flute and guitar, doesn‚Äôt leave much time to grind, I have a friend who has nothing but free time, and we spend very similar amounts of money even though he plays much more than I do, every 5 star has cost us between 100 and 200 dollars. I hqve every 5 star besides Albedo and Mona, he has every 5 star besides Ganyu and Diluc. Not to mention with all the money you have to get from these insane prices, why does the game still crash every 10 minutes on iPad, I would play on my computer, but that‚Äôs even worse since the graphics, even at their lowest setting give my computer the equivalent of a seizure, making archery impossible, and causing the game to freeze when using Diluc‚Äôs alt. I find these things to be very annoying and hope they will be fixed in the future, thank you for reading until the end, have a good day/night!

Genshin Impact draws you in like no other game. Since day one I have been blown away by the graphics the story and the level of detail put into this game. Not only are the graphics stunning the characters and their back stories are as well. There has been a ton of thought put into this game from the smallest blade of grass to the highest mountain top, everything you look at is detail oriented. This game is free to play, and they do not disappoint their players either. With thousands of quests and many different ways to earn in game currency they offer also a five dollar package that also gives you currency. I am not want to normally spend endgame, however, this game deserves every single penny that I spend on it. From the five star and 4 star characters to the Packages you can buy to upgrade them this game gives you everything that you ask for anymore. If I could give this app 10 stars I would I have never been so satisfied with a game in my whole entire life since the final fantasy series. Thank you for all that you guys do and I cannot wait for the next available character banner. I‚Äôm saving up those primogens! ‚ù§Ô∏è

The games great, I played it on my moms ipad for a few decent moments and the animation was smooth, no lag. Im amazed that there can be a mobile game this good, but Im disappointed that on the ipad I played on, brand new by the way, without anything on it, deleted all photos and all other games, I was still kicked out every 5-10 minutes. I couldnt actually gain progress because it wouldnt save the things i did in simply 5 minutes, which is reasonable, but I dont think thats a problem I should have to worry about. Then, I tried to play on my iphone 7 to find it doesnt show water or sky, its black, and you can only see a half a chunk away. Of course, this is only for iphone 8s or lower, as it says in the game description. My problem with that is I dont understand why that would happen?? Iphone 7 or 6 is a phone i see a lot of people owning so its disappointing that it means a lot of iphone users cant play. I then tried it on my computer, and my moms computer, and yet again can only be in for a few seconds and get kicked out of the game almost as soon as it loads up. Genshin is amazing yes, but Im sad I have to save up for an entirely new computer to play it. Please fix these flaws.

Has some of the worst pull rates I‚Äôve ever seen in a gacha. You can spend $450 on genesis crystals and still not get the character you want. The sad part is people are spending thousands of dollars to get these characters and the developers know the low rates bring profits. They‚Äôve figured out that people will pay massive amounts of cash to win, even if the rates are nearly impossible. People will literally spend themselves into debt to get these characters. Developers know this and take full advantage of it. 

The developers constantly ignore player feedback and don‚Äôt care what anyone thinks. Imagine paying a PS5 for each 5* character you want. That‚Äôs how much people shell out per character. It should be illegal to take advantage of people this way, but then again, if someone‚Äôs dumb enough to pay that much it‚Äôs hard to feel bad for them. All I will say is don‚Äôt get sucked into the trap, people. Stay away. 

If you ARE going to play this, I strongly recommend spending absolutely nothing. You should still be able to clear most of the game and not go broke in the process. Seriously, don‚Äôt spend a single dollar. It won‚Äôt get you anything anyway. Not with an 0.6% pull chance. The game itself could have been good, but the predatory design is wrong and not something I can support. For me, it‚Äôs too hard to enjoy the game knowing how greedy this company is.

I‚Äôve had Genshin impact for a few months now and I absolutely love it however some quests and commissions plus character trials are too difficult. For example the quests where I‚Äôm timed are way too hard I almost always fail and can‚Äôt complete them on time. I also don‚Äôt understand what‚Äôs the point of doing commissions if they reset every 4 hours. I keep getting the same ones over and over again and it‚Äôs really frustrating because I know I‚Äôve already done them. Some of those are also timed so that makes them even more difficult and frustrating. I‚Äôm having a hard time leveling up my characters too because I don‚Äôt have enough mora to level them up because I‚Äôm not able to complete my quest and commissions which makes it hard to complete quests and commissions that aren‚Äôt timed as well as character trials. I‚Äôd really appreciate it if the developer or developers of Genshin impact read my review and looked into these issues I‚Äôm having and fixed them or at least gave me some tips on how I can do them without having as much issues as I‚Äôm having now, please and thank you!

First, let me just say this game is absolutely fantastic and fun to play...for a week or so. Once you hit around Adventure Rank 30 you will become gated so hard by the resin (energy) system that you can only play for 30-60min a day with meaningful progression. Resin refreshes at a rate of 1/8min so you can regenerate 180 resin per day. All content that you need to grind (Mora [in game currency], character exp, weapon enhancement mats, skill enhancement books, world bosses, weekly bosses, equipment dungeons, etc) costs 20-60 resin each! Be careful spending money in this game because they have cleverly hidden this restriction since you can play an unlimited amount through exploring the map in the early game. It will not become apparent how painfully limiting this energy system is until you have finished the current main storyline (AR30). If you are an extremely casual player who can only play an hour a day, then yes you will be able to enjoy the game for quite some time. But if you are gamer that loves to progress as much as possible and level up all your characters then you will hit a brick wall. Even if you spend money to refresh your resin, your money will only net you a few extra minutes of playtime. One star until the devs fix their energy system and actually allow people to play their game without having to spend hundreds of $$$. Such a disappointment because this is one the best games on mobile

This game is easily the best one I have ever played, especially since it‚Äôs able to be played on mobile. I literally got a new phone to play it. The graphics and music are absolutely stunning. I will listen to the soundtracks on Apple Music because I love them so much. Whether you are a free-to-play player, or you spend money on it, you can do anything. Each boss has its own challenge to it and it has never failed to amaze me. There isn‚Äôt one thing in the game to complain about. I‚Äôve fallen in love with every single character they‚Äôve released and I know I‚Äôll love all the ones they continue to make. They constantly add new and exciting quests and challenges every single update, each one better than the last. Each character and quest has such good background and lore behind them. Everything is so well written and thought out. The voice actors are also incredible no matter what language. If you have never played, you are missing out on so much. I cant even explain how addicting and fun this game truly is. Please give it a shot, I know you never be able to put it down after you do.

I don‚Äôt know if this is intended but Mona‚Äôs dodge initially goes towards the enemy instead of the direction I‚Äôm trying to go. Whenever I use her ult the joystick disappears and I have to lift my finger and hold down to move again. This is REALLY annoying especially when I‚Äôm in a sticky situation where I have to back up that very second after casting the ult but I have to take that second to reactivate the joystick. Mona‚Äôs recovery takes longer than other characters...why? I‚Äôve actually tested this in the stone chamber domain. Once the Cryo mages dance (summons ice shards that orbits the mage) I constantly get knocked around until I‚Äôm out of the range, meanwhile when I use someone like chunyun, after the first knock up, he recovers pretty quickly (just like everyone else except Mona) and can dodge the second knock up. Next, I want to talk about her ‚Äúmirror reflection of doom‚Äù. This ability is weird with ranged enemies. Let‚Äôs say I activate this skill and it‚Äôs sitting between me and the ranged enemy, sometimes they redirect to the taunt but most of they shoot past the taunt and target me. If a solution can be made for the issues I‚Äôve explained, it‚Äôll make mine and probably other‚Äôs experience more enjoyable!

Genshin Impact is one of my all time favorite games. It‚Äôs just the right mix of intense, fun, and difficult, and it makes me just went to keep coming back for more. The Wish stars in this game are even, too. Unlike other games, there is a good chance you will get something decent from every pull of a wish. I‚Äôve already gotten 2 characters and I‚Äôve only been playing for 1 1/2 months. The map and teleport waypoints are useful, because some other games make you walk or drive everywhere. I like how there are random camps of the enemy‚Äôs to keep battling and raising your points to level up. With brings me to the Adventures Guide. You get all sorts of rewards when you level up, and you can use some of those items to upgrade your weapon, or even get some Wishes. To me, there are no problems with the game. It does not get repetitive at all for me. There are no issues with the gameplay, and the game is always smooth and the graphics are amazing. There was a good amount of storyline at the beginning of the game and that storyline is starting to slack off, but I like the gameplay still beyond belief.

I‚Äôve started to play this game a year ago, and left to the staggering amount of storage and data it took. Now, rejoining back to the game, I can see so many aspects that were overhyped and simply awful. First, you would believe that with how fast it takes to download the app, you *wouldn't* be greeted a massive data installation. The data took over half an hour to install. Second, I would find it a lot more convenient for transportation besides waypoints, because some quests in the game would take an ungodly amount of time. Third, the gacha system is way too time consuming to grind for a new character, let alone an ensemble of characters that the game has. Currently, I‚Äôm on Eagle Pass in the game, and the climbing system broke to a point where I can‚Äôt reach the next level. I can‚Äôt tell if it‚Äôs a puzzle, but suspecting the point to climb to get to the next level, I‚Äôve tried every place to climb, and it‚Äôs absolutely unreachable. The tasks will take hours to complete, and even then, if you stop midway through a cutscene, you‚Äôll have to rewatch the entire cutscene AGAIN. The game is full of unnecessary time wasters, and I definitely wouldn‚Äôt recommend the game to people who just want to quickly sit down and play a good RPG.

For an open world game, the quality, character designs, music, and word setting is pretty good. I like it alot, and play for a few hours or less, so I have plenty of game content to go through.  However, my main problem is storage. While, I have plenty of it to play on my tablet, it‚Äôs a pain to backup on the cloud. My internet speed is fast, but it still takes too long that I decided to pass. I‚Äôll play the game still, but no backup on the cloud, for now. Gacha rates could be better. There should be an option to earn characters and weapons through quests (King‚Äôs Raid style), beside gacha. This would make the game player friendly since more options are better to pleased players. Storage problem gives me mixed feelings to get into any future games by this company. While, Honkai: Star Rail looks beautiful and fun, I‚Äôm hesitated to try it as well. Some may like this game on mobile, but while playing a bit, Genshin Impact feels it meant to be on consoles, PC, and physical copies more. It would be much easier to deal with, while adding new events. If the game ever comes on Switch, I would like to play it there more than mobile though.

This is probably one of the best games I‚Äôve played period and the fact it‚Äôs available on iOS is AWESOME. I originally started playing on my boyfriends phone which the game runs so smoothly on, but when I wanted to play it myself on my phone it crashes about 14 times within a hour in which my progress is not saved and sometimes when I load back in my character has plummeted to their death from gliding. If I am running through Liyue if I don‚Äôt wait the respective 15 seconds for the next 3 blocks to load I will also fall through the map (I.e at any bridge or uneven pathway) and end up dying or having to reset the game. Also during any ACTUAL cutscene it struggles and will freeze and the audio gets choppy and glitches out so I don‚Äôt get to see it at all, all the while my phone so hot when I am playing for longer than half an hour my phone will get almost unbearably hot. It would be pretty cool if The developers could create a low graphic mode to attempt a fix at the problem, I‚Äôm not tech savvy but I will be playing this game for a while and it would be so convenient if my game didn‚Äôt crash. Overall it is a great game and it‚Äôs worth it‚Äôs salt. But apparently my iPhone 9 doesn‚Äôt seem to be able to handle it.

I gotta say I was a big Hu Tao main back last year. I loved Genshin back then and would play it every day, every hour. However, I started losing interest because you leaked the entire map of Sumeru, which made me lose all excitement about the map. Honestly, I preferred the Genshin where every update was mostly a mystery, that way I get the thrill. Now that you‚Äôre just exposing everything, it‚Äôs worthless playing if people online are just gonna spoil the game. Since Sumeru released, I lost total interest in the game, I tried going back, but it was boring to know what happens next since it has already been leaked. I can‚Äôt play this game without having a poker face, and I feel like I shouldn‚Äôt even be playing anymore. 
Let‚Äôs just say, I hate Sumeru, and all the characters and storyline. I may be sounding immature for saying that I hate the entire region and everything in it, but I can‚Äôt see myself ever getting excited or happy in that region. The Sumeru leaks, updates, and fandom ruined everything for me about Genshin. It made me lose a part of myself that I will probably never get back.

I have been playing Genshin Impact for almost 2 years now, and I must say that this is THE BEST game I have ever played. I‚Äôve tried so many other games, and so far this is the only one that‚Äôs stuck around. It is honestly hard to get bored! Sometimes you may lose motivation when farming Primogems to then use to pull for new characters and weapons, but not often will there be a moment when you don‚Äôt want to move forward in the game. I wish that there was a better way for me to say just how much I like this game. Even the frustration from battling bosses and solving puzzles quickly resolves when I get the satisfaction of receiving good rewards. That definitely comes into play the most when farming for artifacts üòñ. It is quite the challenge getting your perfect artifact especially with the resin issue. It will definitely take multiple runs of a domain to find even a decent artifact! But when you finally get the artifact you were looking for, you feel great. I am so grateful to the game developers for their hard work and I am so proud that their game is getting the popularity it deserves! Thank you Hoyoverse!

A few suggestions‚Ä¶ Hi, it‚Äôs me I commented about this game I believe a month ago. It was brought to my attention that I should suggest a few things to make this game better than it already is, don‚Äôt get me wrong this game is a very well done game and deserves more than a 5 star review believe me, but I‚Äôd like to add a view suggestions. Let‚Äôs start out with #1. When a player gets Co - op mode and everyone seems fine at first but then as your progress your unable to play with other people, and we get very confused then we figure out we must do quests to play Co - Op. The thing is, the second quest bugs everyone on mobile and or who have Lumine. ‚ÄúTrails in Tianqu‚Äù is the quest needed to complete  in order to be able to play with people again, for me it‚Äôs impossible to come Pete this quest because I‚Äôm on mobile and I also have lumine and in order to complete the time challege you need a geo character which I have only noelle. I cannot play until I login on computer which I complained about in my previous review. The second recommendation is to add crouching, crouching can be useful to dove attacks and to plunge onto enemies. This is all I have to say for now. Great game, I love it.

So! I play this a good bit. Great game! But the gacha part of this game is never in your favor.
Everyone remember Hu Tao‚Äôs rerun? Well! I saved up to 12,800 primogems to wish for Hu Tao do the math. 80 wishes and I didn‚Äôt obtain Hu Tao. I got Ganyu in her rerun after I paid to get the crystals to get primogems! Short answer for how much money I spent to get Ganyu. A LOT. This games odds are stacked against you. From leveling to getting new characters. If you never use the wish system you are simply stuck with Aether (or Lumine), Amber, Kaeya, and Lisa. Unless the story calls for it. You will NEVER get another character in this game. The game relies on something called relics, weapons, and leveling. Don‚Äôt worry about weapons though! The wish system will pump those out more than character‚Äôs so you‚Äôre good there! But relics? Sorry bub you have to do domains to get good relics to help you in your quest! But‚Ä¶YOU GUESSED IT. That system also relies on RNG to get stuff you actually need to make your characters effective. Game also gets harder the more you get your adventure rank up. So more grinding! As I said without relics or good weapons you may as throw rocks at whatever you‚Äôre fighting. They did a good job with odds of getting characters in Honkai impact idk why the system works the way it does now. Good luck getting yelan. Quick way for developers to make money off you.

i can‚Äôt say that i‚Äôm not obsessed with this game: i 100% am. i just think there‚Äôs a lot to be worked on. the boss drops are so stingy it hurts. the amount of primogems/fates you get is so stingy as well. i understand being stingy to a degree; you need to make money one way or another, yes, but making it so you have to grind for months on end if you‚Äôre a free to play player for a what? 90 wishes? i‚Äôve seen people grind for 4 months straight and only get 180 wishes out of that, which yes is good! but if we got a little bit more primogems with specific quests or challenges that would be so much more worth it. like the spiral abyss, 100 primogems per 3 stars is really good and that makes a lot of sense!! but you‚Äôre telling me that i‚Äôm only going to get 100 primogems after getting to Adventure Rank 35? unbelievable. besides how stingy the game is with primogems and loot drops, it‚Äôs utterly amazing. the storyline and characters are great and it‚Äôs definitely addicting! the resin refill time/amount of resin is baffling. it takes a long time to refill your resin (unless you have primogems, but f2p usually don‚Äôt spend them on resin) and you only get 160. that‚Äôs hardly enough to farm for 4 characters ascension materials and talent books.

ive had this game since it released and it is honestly the best game ive ever played(ive played a lot). the story line is really good and theres always twists and turns in it. the voice acting is amazing and full of emotion(not cringey) and i actually grow attached to the characters. it's open world which i love, you can play with friends which i also love, its not p2w at all, and u can take ur time without feeling like u have to catch up. i love building the characters and every aspect of the game. the bosses and enemies aren't overpowering so u wont get stuck somewhere. i honestly didnt think i would like a game where u pull for characters but this game changed my mind. im honestly shocked this game is free. 
i do have an idea that would be cool to see. it would be awesome if you guys could add adventure teams or ‚Äúgroups‚Äù where friend‚Äôs can join or create their own teams and visit each others world and fight together and get rewards for it. even i think that would help keep ppl playing and get more attached to the game if they grew closer with other players and make memories together.
anyways great game i dont see myself quitting anytime soon!

I‚Äôm literally addicted to this game. There is not a single bad thing about the game itself, and the graphics are SOOOO AMAZING! I never have internet problems or lag while playing this!<3 If you‚Äôre wondering why I gave this 4 stars instead of 5, well there‚Äôs 2 reasons‚Ä¶ 1- I CAN‚ÄôT GET ANY CHARACTERS EVERY TIME I WISH I GET A STUPID SWORDS- but I know there is obviously a pity system and out of all the time I‚Äôve been playing now I already have tons of 5 star characters! I am a f2p player 2. It takes soooo much storage, now I know not much can be done about this. If we want the full amazing experience that Mihoyo has created for us, I understand that it‚Äôll take us to sacrifice a bit more of our storage then we expected! I still love the game wholeheartedly, and if you got through reading this entire review well‚Ä¶. You‚Äôve gotten this far, download it already or you‚Äôll have wasted your time!
Edit: after Sumeru‚Äôs release I kind of fell off from playing Genshin and now that I feel more left behind in the content I kind of have no motivation. I will try to get as much content as I can done to get myself back in the zone.

I am continuously disappointed by the misrepresentation of darkskinned individuals and cultures. The release of Candace‚Äôs splash art has officially proven that your company is racist and colorist. Kandake, who Candace is based off of, is described as a very dark skinned woman. The blatant disrespect of Candace‚Äôs design is prevalent with her skin color. She is tan, not darkskinned. The representation that many we‚Äôre looking for in her is completely lost because of this. It is outrageous that time and time again, your company is able to represent culture through characters. The most prevalent example is Yunjin. Her design embodies Chinese culture, in my opinion, pretty well and the fact that you cannot do this with Candace is blatantly racist. You continuously refuse to give darkskinned people their representation and I‚Äôm disappointed. You, as a multimillionaire company, should be able to give characters a darker skin color and to be able to properly represent Egyptian culture. Another issue that I‚Äôd like to point out is Dori. Her design is stereotypical and orientalist and you should remove her from the game. The pink creature she is seen to be sitting on is representing a god. It‚Äôs disgusting how you allowed this to get into your game. I hope you can correct this mistake and represent cultures better in the future. I am absolutely in love with this game!! The graphics are so smooth and beautiful. The scenery is very well done. The animations are pretty as well. Everything is so beautiful. i was skeptical at first, because most games that look this beautiful are usually false advertisement. But, this game truly is as beautiful as it looks. It is absolutely so fun, and there is so much to do when it comes to both main and side quests. It is an open world type game, so look for hidden gems and chests, too! Just exploring is beautiful and all the stories somehow fit together. Ranking up is fairly easy, but it still can be a bit of a challenge, which is great. You don't want something you can just blow through. They have great in-game shops where you can spend coins you find from just exploring. Hardly would you have to ever actually use real currency to play or profess, which in itself is amazing! The voice overs and the characters you can both earn, and win through Wishes are so great, and some of them are so adorable lol. I've already found quite a few I favor. This game is great to pass time and I highly recommend it simply because it's relaxing, yet has a lot of combat, exploration and just all around goofy fun, too. It's free, so it wouldn't hurt for anyone to just give it a try. You'll fall in love, trust me. <3

This game is really fun! There are lots of things to do in the game. I love the scenery and the playstyle of various characters. There are a few problems though, grinding primogems is hard late game where there are not lots of quests to do. You end up spending hours to grind a few hundred primogems. It is hard to grind without feeling tempted to spend money. The female characters outfits are almost always way too revealing, and I think you can make a good looking outfit without revealing clothes. I would also like more dark characters, it would make dark skinned people feel more respected. There is no one of African descent as a playable character yet there are characters of every other racial/ethnic group. Most of the time the suggestions to make the game better are ignored and some people start to quit. If Mihoyo listened to the community, they would gain more players. Overall, the game itself is fun and interesting and keeps me occupied for a long time, if Mihoyo listened to our feedback, they would get more players to join and would get people to play the game while keeping old players at the same time.

1. The render distance could be fixed, for example over at Dragonspine the mountains look completely rendered and high quality and keep in mind they are way over a mile from you sometimes but in the kingdom of Monsdadt you could be less then a mile and it looks like a Ps1 game
2. The characters, the characters when you are playing them are very high quality but when your talking to them through dialogue there is no details the cloths are basically painted on there skin but when you are in a normal fight your characters, your teammates characters and the monster are perfectly detailed so that does bug me a lot
3. The game is hard to actually make look good without constant crashing. The game when you have it in high quality settings is rlly good but at the same time you open your wishes and bam crash which greatly annoys me. It would be nice if you could add a feature where you could see what settings would cause your games more lag so that way you can make your game look good with more control.
That‚Äôs about it the rest of the game is pretty good and I enjoy the game besides those issues
Great job Mihoyo
