When I first started Genshin, I enjoyed it very much. The initial grind was rewarding, exploring Teyvat was fun, and the stories of Mondstadt and Liyue were enjoyable and well written. Though once you start to get up into higher AR ranks, grinding for artifacts and weapon materials becomes almost like a chore. When you are lower you seem to have so much to do, but when you‚Äôre higher it‚Äôs like all you can do is sit there and wait a month or two for a ‚Äúnew‚Äù event to come out which has similar mechanics to older, previous events but just with some new story line that is hardly entertaining. Inazuma‚Äôs story pales in comparison to Mond and Liyue. Raiden was a decent villain, but her redemption was rushed and almost felt like they wanted us to sympathize with her just so that they could sell her off to us in the gacha. Also, as a mobile user I sometimes have issues with turning the screen. I am not sure if this is my phone‚Äôs fault or if it‚Äôs the game. But it refuses to turn sometimes when I am fighting. Overall Genshin is a very nice game visually and has wonderful voice acting, also it has many lovable characters to choose from, but after the initial excitement of the game you will start to get a bit bored.

This game is by far the best for a free game, the story is amazing, the graphics are stunning, the music is beautiful, however, my slight complaint with this game is similar to ramƒìn‚Äôs review, yet again another game that is lower quality on mobile. Same thing happens on my gen 7 iPad and I at least think it would be fair to fix the animation cutscenes from stuttering, the rest I can deal with, but the stuttering is just too annoying... don‚Äôt get me wrong, like I said at the beginning, this game is very fun and enjoyable when all is added up, not to mention it‚Äôs ranked as the #1 game (as of January) in the App Store and has a lot of positive reviews. I just wish I don‚Äôt have to have a pc just to get a better experience out of it. Oh yeah, and also I‚Äôm stuck on adventure rank 31 because the COMMISSIONS ARE TOO FRIGGIN HARD, how do you think I‚Äôm supposed to make my way over to someone who ordered food AND defeat 3 Pyro slimes including a mega slime in under 2 minutes?! so to the person who wrote a review with the title ‚Äúyou won‚Äôt regret downloading this game‚Äù I have a statement for you, the only thing I‚Äôm not going to regret is uninstalling this game! How disappointing üòí. I‚Äôm sorry if at this point I‚Äôm sounding like an App Store Karen, but I don‚Äôt see a point in putting this game in the mobile App Store if it‚Äôs not fully playable for MOBILE USERS. Thank you for at least reading

This game is simply beautiful, it‚Äôs fun and well written. Aside from the little hell spawn that is Paimon, I love all the characters and find them engaging and well designed. It looks great on ipad and even better on PC (though I‚Äôd love to see it come to MacOS), and while it does look great on PS4 as well, Sony, as always, refuses to play ball so there‚Äôs no cross save available for it. I‚Äôm really enjoying the world so far and am quite intrigued to see how it will open up. So why not 5 stars? As with all gacha games, the method of acquiring new heroes is even more annoying than Paimon. I really enjoy Mihoyo games, they‚Äôre top quality stuff and really entertaining, but as much time as I put into Honkai Impact, I just couldn‚Äôt bring myself to keep playing because it would end up costing upwards of $500 to get the character I was actually looking for. As much as I‚Äôm loving this game, I worry the same will happen. I would gladly pay $60 for this game and $20 for every expansion they added and like $5-10 or whatever for skins if it didn‚Äôt have those god awful random loot mechanics. It‚Äôs a wonderful game, but knowing I‚Äôd likely have to reach into my pockets for it to give me a 5 star hero is going to keep me from giving it a 5 star review.

When I say non-gamer, I mean the last time I played an RPG was On a game boy advance or PS2. Obviously you can still use those systems now, but technology has allowed for games to develop far more than what I‚Äôm used to. That being said, as much as I find these sorts of games to be interesting to play, the interface is unfamiliar, the stories are elaborate and the game as a whole just feels overwhelming to play. NOT Genshin Impact. 

My entire time of playing this game I‚Äôve thought how easily accessible it is to people who normally don‚Äôt play these types of games. The graphics are amazing, the music is relaxing, the story is engaging and everything is easy to follow! The beauty of being able to play across platforms makes it THAT much easier to fall into the depths of this game. I‚Äôve missed my stop on the bus going home twice within the first week of playing because it was so addicting. 

Any person who plays games or RPGs might probably say that there are many games that are like that once you give them the chance. And there probably are, I‚Äôm in no position to say. BUT I will say if you wana try to get into RPGs, Genshin Impact is a wonderful place to begin.

As a long time player I honestly love the game and enjoy it. I do wish that it didn‚Äôt use gacha systems though as I‚Äôve lost so many 50/50‚Äôs even when I spent money (I do not suggest as it is not worth itü•≤) the pity system is kind of nice but it takes so much time just to build it. I also wish there where more ways to get primogems because I‚Äôm broke and genuinely need better characters lol. I love the community and enjoy how helpful everyone is with everything and how funny but wholesome the game can be. (Story wise and just playing with friends or strangers) However with so many updates coming out it‚Äôs really hard for my friends who play on phones to keep the game as they don‚Äôt have enough storage space. I wish that they would bring the game to more platforms such as The Nintendo switch or maybe Xbox because so much of the player base is only on phone. It genuinely breaks my heart seeing so many people have to leave the game just for the sake of their storage space. At this point you need a whole phone just dedicated to playing it. So please Mihoyo add this to more consoles. But otherwise this game is very fun and enjoyable.

When Genshin first launched, it was honestly amazing how a free mobile game can have such amazing graphics. Big enough to pull its stars rating down. It‚Äôs not the Hours and hours of continuous entertainment you get from playing. Whether you play solo or up to 4 people together. The game runs smooth on Apple iPad . Its size is not one of the issues. it‚Äôs the biggest game thats ever been. Once installed it takes up 15GB. Even so, I recommended this game for anyone above 8yrs old. The first issue with the game. We use to have total control of who is targeted 100% of the time. That is no longer true. Now. You can be in the middle of a battle if you get to close to a tree and suddenly your battling wood while the enemy is blasting away at your HP. Changing targets back requires finesse. I‚Äôve tried to find a way to turn this off without success. The other issue. Updates. There always about 3.5GB. They don‚Äôt simply add new data. You install the game over and over every update. MiHoYo has done a very poor job in proving they are receptive to the community‚Äôs concerns about a number of things over the last 2-4 months. It goes to show just how little they care about providing an actual enjoyable experience to their user base. The game has seen the release of some of the worst characters to date and when players voices their concerns through the appropriate channels, they intentionally deleted or hid the criticism. The 1-year anniversary is literally one day away and MiHoYo has made zero effort to mark the significance of this day. The player-based helped this game get as popular as it is. They deserve a show of appreciation. It is laughable that MiHoYo thinks they can give players copy-paste rewards from a previous event and consider this sufficient. The character designs, game play, lore, and amazing music and voice acting make Genshin Impact my favorite game thus far. After a full year of playing, I am staying enjoying it every day. The amount of care and effort, and the attention to detail put into this game is insane. I think the pacing of new content is just right, where you don‚Äôt feel overwhelmed with too much all at once but you also aren‚Äôt stagnant and bored for a long time. If you binge the game in one go and play non stop, of course you‚Äôll get burnt out and tired (like any other game). But if you take it at your own pace and enjoy the story and music and scenery, it‚Äôll be a fun time for a long time. 

The music is probably my favorite part of the game. They put so much effort into incorporate regional instruments and culture into each piece of music, and further more the music are performed by live orchestras from each area the regions are inspired by. (The London philharmonic for Mondstat, Shanghai philharmonic for Liyue, and Tokyo philharmonic for Inazuma so far). 

I can‚Äôt wait to see what else will come and foresee playing this game well into the future!

I‚Äôm going to make this quick and simple. There is a distinct lack of communication and appreciation from Hoyoverse to the Genshin Impact community for what the players wish for and what they get instead. Genshin Impact has made billions in the last two years of its release, and this is due to fans supporting the game through in game purchases and buying their merchandise. However, the appreciation that Hoyoverse has given to their fans, who have built the tower they stand on, is non existent. The rewards from both playing the game itself and from major events such as the anniversary are so minimal for what the fans have given them that it is insulting. For the amount that they earn from our money and time towards the game, they give less than 10x the amount back in the game. The Genshin Impact community does not even feel in the least as though Hoyoverse appreciates our support for them. Along with how repetitive and boring the gameplay has been and addressing of very little of what the players have been asking for, it has created an environment between company and fans where no one can appreciate the other. I can only hope that 2022‚Äôs anniversary rewards aren‚Äôt as disappointing and pathetic as 2021‚Äôs, and that it genuinely feels as though we are celebrating something grand.

I really love this game! The graphics are amazing, the battles are fun, and the voice acting is really nice to listen to. However, this game also has a few problems. One of them is the immense crashing. Every 5-15 minutes, the game crashes and it's getting really annoying. If it helps, sometimes I see red or green lines on the buildings before the game crashes. Another problem is the battery usage. Only this game drains too much of my battery and sometimes my iPad starts overheating. I've checked the other apps ands it's only this game that's causing the problem. Also, the enemy spawns sometimes takes way too long. For example, there's this quest where you have to unlock a tri-seal. The Meaty tribe has this sort of challenge and you get 1 minute and 35 seconds to defeat 10 enemies. The problem is, the enemies take too long to spawn and the result is 50 seconds of battle time. And those 50 seconds are becoming shorter because of the spawn time of the boss, so I can't pass the challenge. Please fix this, especially the crashing. I will hate to have to delete this game because of it.

When I first heard Genshin Impact, I thought it‚Äôd just be a boring game of having to go with the starter characters and etc, but when I delved into this game the game was really fun. However, Genshin Impact does not do this, instead they just let you go hunt for treasure chests to level up, (it‚Äôd take longer to level up if you just do that). The game is absolutely F2P friendly. The downside of this is that ‚ÄúCo-Op‚Äù the resources and work you‚Äôve done in another player‚Äôs world does not TRANSFER over to your own world. Genshin Impact is a good game, but it takes up a lot of storage. I know a majority of mobile players complain about this, but it really does take up A LOT of storage. As a F2P (free-to-play) player, it‚Äôs pretty hard to resist spending money on this game with so many characters. Most of the 5 star characters are very OP, but because they‚Äôre 5 stars, they are harder to get. That means that you have to farm Primogems (a currency for wishing) all of the time to save up enough just for a 5 star character that you might not have even wanted (because there is a 50% chance that you get another character) I know a lot of people wrote reviews about they not getting the character they wanted, or things that people who never played the game can understand, so if you‚Äôve never played this game before, you‚Äôre welcome for writing a decent review that you can understand. If I could go back to the past, I would just finish the main story and stop playing. I think that way I wouldn‚Äôt waste so much time farming for a video game character that I think is cool, and get burnt out. But, I do like how much effort was put into this game. The graphics are amazing. Sadly most people playing on mobile might not even be able to see the amazing graphics because of the horrible lag.

I was very curious about this game and heard it was an open world RPG, so I had to try it. I regret nothing. I love it. I love more than Breath of the Wild. Okay maybe not more than Breath of the Wild, but it‚Äôs definitely up there. There are so many lovable characters and the story goes on forever. There world is pretty big and I believe there‚Äôs even more of it that I haven‚Äôt unlocked yet. Best: it‚Äôs free and doesn‚Äôt have a single ad. It‚Äôs the game of my dreams. The combat system is well thought out and interesting, there is a wide variety of enemies, and there‚Äôs even dogs and cats (that you can‚Äôt pet, but oh well).
My one problem: the game crashes all. The. Time. It doesn‚Äôt matter what I‚Äôm doing, I‚Äôll get a good 10 minutes of gameplay and boom, crash. Most of the time everything saves before it crashes and I don‚Äôt lose any progress, but when in the middle of a fight or conversation, I‚Äôll have to start over, which is a pain. Also not the best thing when playing in co-op. It‚Äôs frustrating, but I guess it‚Äôs a small price to pay for greatness. A large price to pay for greatness? A medium sized price.
Overall, wonderful game. Definitely recommend.

The hate and backlash this game is receiving at the moment is absolutely shameful and have absolutely nothing to do about the beauty of this game. This game is absolutely gorgeous to be able to play for free. Lovely graphics that are pleasing to the eye (and I should know! PC player here. I played this game when it released and did not follow the story at all, just explored. I love Genshin it is one of my favorite games, but there are a few problems with it. First of all the biggest problem is resin. Most of the important resources required to progress are locked behind Resin. The problem with this is that it RECHARGES SO SLOW! It takes 8 minutes to obtain 1 resin. So to get 5 resin you would need to wait 40 minutes! And that‚Äôs only a 1/4 of the resin you need to obtain anything! Second of all primogems. This is a gacha game. And primogems are essentially the material you need to do ‚Äúpulls‚Äù and use the gacha system. Mihoyo starves us on these. We get about 2 ‚Äúpulls‚Äù per 3 week event and 1/3 of a pull each day (for doing daily quests). That‚Äôs it. Sorry to go on a rant. I gave it  four stars because honestly I enjoy this game. It‚Äôs not bad by any means, but these issues are pretty big If you wanna enjoy the game long term.

Extra: If you spent money (which not many are willing to do) you can somewhat get around these problems. Buying the battle pass for 10:00 dollars can give you massive amounts of resin locked resources (this can require a lot of grinding though ).And welkin blessing can give you a massive amount of primogems for its 5 dollar cost.

First off this game is amazing! I have been playing since day 1. This game has loads of things to do for newer players. It‚Äôs an open world gacha game. This game is amazing because you get to explore around the world and fight enemies, there‚Äôs also an amazing storyline. Of course like all gacha games though, in order to get all the characters you want being a f2p can be hard. Genshin constantly has new content. But there are some downsides for those who really want to get into genshin. First off the fan base can be really toxic, please don‚Äôt listen to them and play the game however you like. Second of all this game requires a lot of downloading and storage if your device can‚Äôt handle tons of data I don‚Äôt recommend this game. Also the gacha system and the way of getting the ‚Äúcurrency‚Äù to pull for characters is a bit annoying. There is a pity but if you are planning on being a f2p the chances of constantly getting the characters you want is difficult. Overall though this is an imagining game that is rarely dry of content. I promise once you get into genshin you‚Äôll love it.

Ok, right of the bat, I don‚Äôt like Japanese styled games. I‚Äôm just not a fan of the art. But one thing I love is Breath of the Wild legend of Zelda. BOTW is a Japanese game at its heart but has kind of American graphics. It is my favorite game of all time. But, this game...... is exactly like BOTW but Japanese and mixed with the new hyrule warriors. You can switch people but it‚Äôs still you. You can glide. Sounds like the same world audio, (like the grunting of climbing a mountain sounds the same in both games). It is not my favorite game, but my favorite mobile game. I would rather pick BOTW if I had to but, full disclosure, I actually don‚Äôt own BOTW but have deafened ganon multiple times with on my friends switch without any intervention, so I‚Äôve experienced the story, so i would recommend BOTW if you already have it but don‚Äôt want to pay and have the almost same experience this game is amazing and worth the 8 GIGS!! It takes to download. (READ HERE) But, I haven‚Äôt finished the story, not by a long shot, so the story may be good but I don‚Äôt know. The BOtW story was really good. But the story may be the turning point if you are into the story part of open world games.

Overall, I‚Äôm very impressed with the quality of this game. The graphics are so beautiful, and it is very aesthetically pleasing whenever I play. There is a bunch of cool characters and an amazing storyline to play through. When I first downloaded Genshin Impact I was skeptical, and didn‚Äôt really know what it was. Now, after only a few days of playing, I am officially addicted. You can explore the map, battle monsters, collect cute, new characters, and complete quests to progress in the story. I am absolutely in love! However, there are a few small mistakes that the creators may have overlooked. At one point while summoning Dvalin, Paimon was talking to Lumine about her sister, when Lumine only has a twin brother. The game must‚Äôve thought that I was playing as the brother, but I wasn‚Äôt. That‚Äôs about the only mistake I‚Äôve found in the game, just pronouns. Otherwise everything seems perfect! I notice that the creators are frequently updating the game, which is always great to see. This game is by far my favorite RPG, and I would definitely recommend playing it. Thank you for creating this masterpiece! üíó

Genshin is my favorite game so far. Whenever I‚Äôm bored I like to play, and there‚Äôs a lot to do. I think all the mechanics in the game are great, and that only a few things need to be changed. I think that there should be more things that are similar to the abyss, since higher ranked players are unable to get primogems as easily. Also, with the weapon banner, it is annoying that the fate points don‚Äôt carry over after the banner changes. I think it should, since for F2P players it is harder to get primogems then those who spend money on the game. I also think that there aren‚Äôt enough year round 5 stars. There is a 50% chance you‚Äôll get the character on the event banner and a 50% you‚Äôll get 1 of 5 5 stars. There should be more, different 5 stars that are similar to the year round 5 (Jean, Diluc, Qiqi, Keqing, and Mona), there hasn‚Äôt been a new one for a while, and players that have been playing for a long while most likely have all of those characters already, along with constellations. Overall genshin impact is a really good game, and I highly recommend it to others.

They went an entire year without buffing electro element and starting with update 2.0 they‚Äôve begun treating the players like nothing but money bags and have been actively gimping newer characters because they think people will just take their wallets out anyway, this has CONTINUED in 2.1 where the newest archon is a joke and her element is still incredibly mediocre. And as for the anniversary rewards? Despite the billions they‚Äôve made in a year the most they could manage to give the players in return is a 10 pull (from logging in for 7 days mind you) and a sad amount of gold and xp crystals, they quite simply don‚Äôt care or value the players anymore now that they game has blown up and it‚Äôs incredibly disappointing.

I absolutely love this game! It is absolutely fun and I never see myself getting bored. The graphics and character design are beautiful, there is so much attention to detail and a lot of stories to hear from the NPCs. 

However, I am AR 44 and I don‚Äôt have many 5-star characters. I only have Mona, which I am fine with but I don‚Äôt use her a lot. I am also an F2P, meaning that I don‚Äôt spend money on this game. I feel like players who pay for stuff in the game have a higher advantage than those who don‚Äôt pay to play this game, especially on the wishing banners where the chances of getting a 5-star character are slim unless you have a lot of primogems and fates.

I‚Äôm not asking for much but to just increase chances of getting a 5-star in one 10-pull or at least make it more fair for those who don‚Äôt have the money to spend it on the wishing system. Perhaps you can decrease the amount of primogems needed for one intertwined/acquaint fate or make it more easy to gain primogems, because from someone who is broke, I can‚Äôt get 5-stars and I don‚Äôt have the best luck at this game.

Genshin Impact has long been known as a money grab. Sure, it is monetized in many ways, but as a free to play player, I find it easy enough to get by. People have been very unhappy with the update and anniversary lately, but for me, they were getting more than they deserved. The people complaining that the game is trying to take all their money are also mad about the anniversary, which literally handed them intertwined fates when they logged in! Intertwined fates are the very thing you spend your money on. Some players just cannot be satisfied. So, here is a completely unbiased opinion:
Genshin Impact is a very balanced game. It can be confusing near the beginning, with its many monetary systems, but eventually, it all makes sense. The game doesn‚Äôt crash unless your phone is too old, and graphics are very well done. The only problem is the player base. The community is, for the most part, pretty nice. Of course, there are always haters. Try to form your own opinion. Don‚Äôt listen to the haters. Don‚Äôt listen to me. Just download the game for free and give it a shot for a week or two. You can drop it later. It won‚Äôt hurt you.

Hello. I‚Äôm new to the game but I can give you a good rundown of how it‚Äôs going so far (2nd release day). So far, I do have to say that the graphics/visuals and the audio as well are amazing! At first I had trouble loading the beginning cut scenes, but after that, I never had trouble with lag our audio glitches. The visuals are bright and beautiful, much better than most games out there currently. Now as for the gameplay itself, I am a newbie to this game, but it focuses mostly on grinding levels for many different characters and completing many different quests across the large world map. I love running across the map and not having to stop for any loading screens, it‚Äôs all one big world!

Now there is something for the developers to work on, as this is rated four stars and not five. As in many other reviews, there are many, many times where I will just be playing and either the screen will freeze or the game will completely crash. That gets quite annoying. 

Now I do understand that this is only the second day off of launch, so I will give them grace... hopefully they can fix the crashing issue, then I will rate it 5 stars!

I usually don‚Äôt write reviews but this is a special occasion. I am a whale turned casual that has spent 10s of thousands over the years on dozen of different Gacha games and while all these games have had their good and bad aspects about them all respected and went all out for the anniversary. No matter how well or bad your Gacha is received and doing the anniversary was also event/celebration you as the company/dev gave back to the fanbase/community that supports, spends and plays your game and Mihoyo and Genshin have pretty much spat at that concept. From lackluster rewards that is equivalent to one multi summon after you log in for 7 days, to collecting 20 primo for having 15 ppl click on your ‚Äújourney link‚Äù to having a chance to win 100k Moro and one resin refill. These rewards if you want to call them that is beyond lackluster and worse than that some are RNG based. It‚Äôs insane and laughably that this dev/company would offer this as some celebration for the community that has made them massively more wealthy and successful. This review will stay 1star until this is changed or addressed and furthermore bugs and QOL changes are finally announced for problems the community has been asking / complaining about for the better part of the year. What a complete joke this situation and this game as become.

As a Genshin Impact player and lover, I adore all the features the game has. Although I would like to suggest one thing. Earlier in my Genshin experience, I started to love and learn all the characters the game offers, but it was a struggle for me to get the character(s) I wanted. I understand that every player can‚Äôt get the character(s)/items they want. And with that being said, I would like to suggest a Trading system where all the players can trade character(s)/items/etc. At a certain Adventure Rank, players are able to trade items as the same value. A character for a character, an Item for an Item, you get what I mean. If the person that has the desirable Item (say a Character) and the other person does not have a character that the other person wants, they should be able to trade in the same amount of values as the Character such as, Artifacts, Weapons, Food, Wishes, and etc. I have been thinking about this feature a lot lately and all of my friends that are also players think it would be a great feature as well. just a little suggestion :)

Okay so i‚Äôm gonna cut it short i love the game from the beginning to the new updates the game is beautiful and requires a lot of work obvi but i really hate the wishing system like i‚Äôve been saving up for a long time to *try* to get 1,600 primogems and what do i get for it? i get one 4 star. This game is amazing. The graphics are magnificent, and the playstyle and storyline is beautiful. What a well thought-out game. This cures my boredom, but I do want to recommend some things. For players adventure rank 45 and up, there should be special features and quests popping up everywhere. There isn't much to do after hitting ar 45, except for a potential event or archon quest coming out rarely. Another request is  for ar 60 players; once hitting adventure rank 60, you should be able to pick any five star character or weapon of your choice, whether it be an event five star or a standard five star, and maybe a set of ten intertwined fates for wishing. Hitting AR 60 is a big deal, because it takes so long. Another recommendation is similar - at adventure rank 30, halfway through, you should be able to pick any four star (character or weapon) of your choosing, and five aquient fates for the standard banner. I'm sure this has been requested a lot - but it would be amazing and have many more people play instead of hitting AR 35 and quitting. Thank you for reading this!

This game has a very good story line for those who like to know the story of the game, it has a large map with treasures and games all over the place, the enemies are diverse and many for those who are here for combat, and has an awesome gatcha system for those who like that. The gatcha system has weapons from 3-5 stars on the weapons and standard banner, and characters from 4-5 stars on the character banner and standard banner. On the character banner, you are given a 50/50 chance of getting the featured character or getting a standard character. If you get a standard character, the next 5 star is the featured character. On the weapons banner, you have a 50/50 chance of getting your selected weapon or getting any other weapon. Once you fail twice you get the one you want as your next 5 star. It‚Äôs overall a great game for anyone, and it has great music for everything, so if you‚Äôre worried about the large amount of storage it takes up, think about all the things you can do with this game!!!

To say that this game is addictive is a HUGE understatement. The graphics are beautiful and the story is very engaging and interesting (for the main storyline). There are a lot of small details in every character‚Äôs design that make you stop and think. However, as good as this game is, being f2p is EXTREMELY difficult. They are very stingy with rewards to their players. A single wish cost 160 primogems, but for those who have finished exploring and such, you can only earn 60 primos a day through daily commissions. This alone wouldn‚Äôt be so much of an issue if it weren‚Äôt for the limited amount of time on wishing banners. After the banner ends, the five star character is unobtainable unless MhY decides to give them a rerun. On top of this is the 90 wishes. Considering you can get about one wish every two days, 90 is far out of reach for older players. MhY being stingy with their players is nothing new. We saw it with the rewards given for the 1 year anniversary and we saw it again with how fast the primogem codes expired from the newest livestream. The codes expired in less than 24 hours. I know personally I was working during the livestream, so when I got home to watch the recording, I was disheartened to learn that the codes had already expired. Not all of us can drop everything for MhY sake.

I never thought I‚Äôd play Genshin Impact as much as I do now. It was always something I scrolled by or saw other people hyping up and didn‚Äôt really think it was all that great. I clearly stand corrected as I‚Äôm almost adventure rank 40 and I‚Äôve caught up on all the archon quests. I started back in May but then fell of it. Then I really picked it up late august to September. I‚Äôd say that‚Äôs excellent progress! I wish there was a feature that let you reclaim resources and materials used on characters you don‚Äôt really play with anymore though. Like you could get back all the mora you spent for ascension and upgrading your character as well as whatever was needed to ascend and upgrade, that would be really cool and save on some of the grindiness if that makes sense. I‚Äôm all for grinding but when I‚Äôm low on resources and can only get so far collecting, I‚Äôd like to be able to reset a least played character back to level one and use their materials to upgrade a main character that I play with constantly. Just some food for thought, everything else about this game I‚Äôm in love with!!

Still not sure how they made this a mobile game. Pretty much a free to play breath of the wild. The graphics are breathtaking and somehow the game still runs really well on my iPhone 8plus. The world is huge and being added to as I am writing this review. There is so many small side quests, puzzles, and objectives. The world is well done and the small treasures you find just feeds your brain dopamine and you can‚Äôt stop. The main story itself is alright with nice animations and cut Scenes. The game play itself is also really fun with a pretty neat combat system.

There are some downside with this game. If you binge play this game (like 40hr/week) you will likely run out of things to do within 2-3 weeks and then have to wait for the new map expansion. There will still be things to do during that time but definitely not enough to keep you playing at your 40 hour/ week  pace. But if you take things slow and investigate/explore the world as you slowly progress the main story and not rush and binge play you will have high quality entertainment for a long time.

The game is ridiculously beautiful, there‚Äôs no mistaking there‚Äôs a lot of effort put into this, alongside the top tier Japanese voice actors. The designs, world, all of the exploration aspects are very detailed and it‚Äôs a very good open world. However I have a bit of concern that from the Wish rates this game will turn into a pay to win, with the abysmal drop rate. Granted, you can get characters from progressing with the story, however, there‚Äôs no denying that there is this feeling that you can just cruise early and be ridiculously op from the start, it can break a hardworking player‚Äôs spirit, and hopefully the devs will take this into consideration, and make sure that all players will be given equal satisfaction so that whale players can still be whales and free to play players don‚Äôt feel like their hard work becomes obsolete. I feel this game has a very good potential and it would be a waste to see the joy ruined by a pay to win, since the team really put a lot of effort into this game. Personally I don‚Äôt mind giving support to the devs by making small purchases now and then, but I‚Äôd rather not have my hard work flushed down the drain just because the game says ‚Äúpay to win, baby‚Äù.

Hi! i absolutely adore this game! it has amazing graphics, diverse characters, and super fun and challenging quests. It feels so good to just sit down and play after a long day. this game has given me so much joy since i downloaded, and i don‚Äôt regret doing so at all. the only thing i would say is if you want to download genshin, you have to be willing to sacrifice some other apps on your phone for storage purposes. this game is amazing, but for it to be as enjoyable as it is, it uses lots of storage. and as someone who doesn‚Äôt have the most storage on my phone, it‚Äôs been a little challenging picking and choosing what i keep and what has to go. not at all blaming the game makers, it‚Äôs an amazing game and i would 100% recommend, just warning people with low storage that it takes a LOT of storage to be able to play and regularly update this game. overall, it‚Äôs an amazing game and one of my personal favs, but it‚Äôs also a big commitment (storage-wise) i‚Äôve really enjoyed playing this and i hope anyone who downloads it can enjoy it too! üíóüíó

With the addition of controller support this game is now the best thing on the app store. You can play this game as little or as much as you like. There is no energy system outside of resin to just play. You can play 100% for free. Although you will likely never see a 5* character. And they are very strong. There is also no sign of Venti or Klee in the game which is very disappointing. I stopped playing the game because of no controller and now i have lost my chance to acquire 2 of the best characters. But even without those 2 or a 5* character the game is just amazing. Huge open world at console quality, lots of events, crafting, boss fights, co-op and a growing character roster. This game proves what ios gaming could truly be.

 The only reason it is 4* is because 5* is reserved for perfect. And underneath it all this is still a gacha game with elements that can really only be unlocked with cash. Im all for giving you 60 bucks for a game and even buying expansion packs that include new characters and areas. To ask people to spend 100‚Äôs for a .06% chance to get a character or item is the most insane thing. Luckily this game is still enjoyable without using the gacha system.

I‚Äôve been playing Genshin Impact for about a year and a half, I first downloaded back in December 2020. As time went on, and updates passed, I enjoyed the game as it was‚Äî but it soon became a major storage issue for my phone, taking up almost 70 gigabytes of extra file storage. Genshin is originally marketed as a PC game, so I understand why PC players may not have those issues and continue to play freely, but because of my storage, I had to delete the application in order to software update my phone. Will I redownload it? Perhaps on a tablet, or something that can handle the amount of files, since I really do enjoy the game. I just wish there was a way that the mobile phone version was able to take up less space and still be the amazing game it is today.

Overall this makes me disheartened, because I was looking forward to Ayato‚Äôs banner and saving for it, but I can‚Äôt do anything about it until I free up more storage (somehow) or find another device to play it on (which makes me grateful for the cross-platform for Mobile-iPad-PC. I have c1 level 80 Raiden and a level 90 Venti! Which is a big deal to me, since I‚Äôm not really much of a grinder).

This would be a great game if it was not for the totally crappy wish system that is used to obtain new characters and weapons. Early on you get a lot of characters, but that tapers off around chapter II.  Players end up investing a ton of time earning primogem in order to buy fates,  just to get crappy duplicate weapons or the same characters over and over. It is really flawed and disappointing.  Once my characters were between level 50/60, I spent 70 wishes over a two week period and did not get one new character. 
Also never received a 5 star weapon from  any of the wishes the entire time I played. I had to forge and level up any weapons that were worth having, like the dragonspine spear, which is a ridiculous process (like the gae bolg in final fantasy 14). So disappointing. I even dropped wishes during promotional periods where the drop rate was up too. Nada. 
At a certain point you need more characters to progress and they just don‚Äôt drop. You can run the abyss for big primogem hauls but once that is done, you have to look elsewhere. This is to the point where the game is no longer enjoyable to play.  Developers are just hoping players get impatient and spend real cash for additional primogem. No thanks. Fix the character drop rate, get  rid of the stupid gamble, and this could be a great game.

I don‚Äôt normally write reviews but this game blew me out of the water. I‚Äôve been playing rpgs for years and I never stick with one for more than a couple weeks, but I‚Äôm so captivated by the sheer amount of things to do and detail in this game there‚Äôs never a dull moment. The character design is insanely detailed, there‚Äôs not a single undynamic character. You‚Äôd think with the amount of npc‚Äôs  there‚Äôd be many that you can‚Äôt talk to; but every single one I‚Äôve encountered tells you paragraphs of actually interesting story that is going on in this persons life. You can even go find the family members that they‚Äôre talking about and fawning over in their dialogue, and they‚Äôll share with you the other side of the story. It looks like breath of the wild for gods sake!

It‚Äôs a gorgeous game, with a gorgeous community to match. Mihoyo  is a wonderful company from what I‚Äôve seen and I adore their work on this game. It‚Äôs easy to drown in the serotonin you get from this game, so be careful! 

I highly recommend it, my favorite game to date on pc and mobile.

for context, this is coming from an Adult hardcore player in the 'late' game who's spent over $500 USD in a year period. I DO NOT RECOMMEND anyone to spend any kind of money in this game, I will explain why...
GI it's a great concept for a game in itself, being managed by the worst company I've seen in my gaming history, yes I see you MIHOYO! Best way to describe them: a greedy, anti-consumer, and misleading corporation. 
This game is geniously designed for two types of players, 1. Casual free to play and 2. Heavy spenders in the thousands of dollars. This game is not catered for us hardcore players who spend lightly on a monthly battle pass. There's literally no grey area. At the start of the game you are overwhelmed my the amount of content, it gives the impression of a full on RPG game with plenty hours of gameplay, but there comes a threshold we call the 'late' game when there's nothing to do! it is literally 30min of daily grind. Unfortunately content updates are not substantial enough for hardcore players to be entertained for long.  So back to the original idea, you will have a great time with this game in two scenarios, if you don't spend any money (zero) and not rush through the content, or on the other hand you spend hundreds of thousands of dollars so you can refresh the in-game 'currency' used for the gated content.

To start: This has NOTHING to do with the anniversary.

When the game starts it‚Äôs amazing, so much to explore, and the game feels endless. The memories this game have given me and so many others are nothing short of magical. If Genshin wasn‚Äôt live service, this would be an easy 4.5/5 for sure. But it‚Äôs not. This game has the worst returns for real life time that I‚Äôve ever seen. 8 minutes for 1 resin. With that you can less than 1 level on your weapons. 1 hour and 20 minutes for nothing. A domain is 20 resin (2hrs 40min) for 1 bad 5star artifact, or a minimal amount of talent/weapon ascension material. Then there‚Äôs the expeditions. 20 real hours for items that could be easily obtained within 20 minutes of casual play. And the Adventure rank system‚Ä¶ pathetic. The months of effort and time to rank up ONCE past 55 earns you the i game equivalent of pennies. The fact that none of these changes - or those that have been brought up by the playerbase numerous times - have not even been acknowledged is disturbing. Especially for a game that is constantly updated. I love the memories this game has given me and for them I am thankful. But I can never and will never recommend this game to ANYONE, for how poorly it responds to the community.

This game is by far one of my favorite open world mobile games! With all the details, fantastic voice acting, the scenery, everything is perfect! I‚Äôve played maybe 10 minutes so far and I‚Äôm already hooked. I gave the creators many hints with a tweet and feedback saying this game would be amazing if it had controller compatibility. I don‚Äôt want my fingers all over my screen covering all the beautifully crafted visuals! I really do hope they add controller compatibility to mobile or just put it on Xbox one please!

But, I know I‚Äôve only played 10 minutes and I‚Äôm already writing a review. The reason why is because I‚Äôve played multiple MMOs and open world games. The first 5 minutes literally got me hooked because of how they executed the intro. And not even that, the small details in the game like climbing trees to get to higher up fruit! The voice acting is amazing, and the characters are so far adorable, even the monsters! I can‚Äôt say to much because I haven‚Äôt played an hour or two yet, but this game is definitely worth playing if you‚Äôre a huge ‚ÄúSkyrim‚Äù like person! (Cause I am)

I have always wanted to play a Massive open world game on my phone. It‚Äôs been years of searching for games on the App Store and I found a few games that were good, but they were not exactly the kind of game I was looking for. I was looking for a game where you have freedom instead of following a single storyline, I was looking for Amazing graphics in a game, and I was looking for something that is long and satisfying. This game has gone way past my expectations, from graphics, to gameplay, to story/side quest, to exploring freely. There‚Äôs just so much to do, I look forward to playing more and getting new updates to add even more improvements. Keep up the good work! (Also a few suggestions to make it better, Add more side quest that has some useful rewards maybe, and maybe a friendship or couple system to make it more realistic; like more interactions throughout the game, most likely with online people, oh and one more thing; even more characters and weapons which will draw more people on as well as keep players playing for who knows how long) thank you.

This game keeps you involved and interested! Their updates and new quests keep it interesting and a challenge! My only complaint is how hard it is to advance levels, weapons, talents etc the higher you have your characters and AR. Much Higher rewards for higher AR. Players put the effort into the game reward on that. The different characters to obtain are a lot of fun if you can get them. It is rather difficult to obtain 5 star characters unless you pay for unlimited primogems. I think the pity should be a little more player friendly than money making. Not everyone can afford to play this game as they would like to! This should be equal among all. I think resin should increase with level advancement as well other leveling items! The higher AR the more Resin you can acquire in a day. The game is amazing and I play every day due to this reason, even though sometimes boring waiting for new areas, releases, etc. Much luv to the developers! You‚Äôve all put a lot of effort into this game. A few tweaks and it could keep people interested.

I actually really enjoy this game! This is the first time i‚Äôve played a game like this, so it‚Äôs definitely challenging as well as a fun experience! Although, there are quite a few problems with co-op. 

Starting off, quite a few players haven‚Äôt been able to join their friends‚Äô worlds. When one requests to join their friends‚Äô world, the friend doesn‚Äôt receive a notification that someone is requesting to join their world. Secondly, when my friend joins my world, i‚Äôm suddenly not able to talk to the npcs. This is a huge hinderance since we want to do quests together! Even after my friend leaves and comes back, it still won‚Äôt work. As for me (since it‚Äôs my world), it takes me quite a few times to leave and come back to get the npcs to work again! Lastly, there should DEFINITELY be more co-op story quests available. As to my knowledge, there are no co-op story quests, which is a bit heart breaking. 

I want to enjoy having fun with my friend with not only world quests (which we rarely get to do since the npcs don‚Äôt work during co-op), but with story quests too! I genuinely hope the creators take not of the reviews from the players so we can all have a fun time.

For the amount of time I have been playing this game I have come to realize that it isn‚Äôt really intended for mobile device users. Now don‚Äôt get me wrong, the design of the game is amazing! You really feel like you are living in a fantasy world, the music and landscape are wonderful. Though, I have been continuously having the problem of the game just not loading. I have to keep closing and reopening the app to be able to proceed, otherwise I will spend 3 minutes at a black screen with fantasy music playing. That may not sound so bad, but 75% of the time I am trying to play the game I encounter this problem. So warning to mobile users, beware of this problem and not just dive in immediately. Consider using a PC if you have one. I should also tell you that it does not just impact the amount of time it loads, but it also takes away from the amazing animation. You end up just staring at the beginning of it and hearing the scratchy noises of the narrator of that animation.

Then again, this game is amazing! I totally recommend playing it. The characters that you meet are very easy to get attached to and there is no shortage of quests.

Apple store editors choice and well deserved. A flagship title for the appstore and an amazing game all around, have yet to find an aspect about the game i don‚Äôt like. it‚Äôs jam packed with hours upon hours of exploration, quests, it‚Äôs regularly updated and not pay to win. large open world games like this are especially hard to come by and for a ios/android title it really sets the bar high. it‚Äôs got plenty of mechanics in place to keep you intrigued and wanting to go out and complete quests to level up your characters or their gear. 

the only reason i deducted a star is because of the lack of customization, a must have in any open world RPG. there‚Äôs no character creation, no special moves to choose for the characters you have unlocked, and not even outfits. the closest thing the game has to customization is changing your glider. not to mention the glide function had a lot more potential than it was given

Don‚Äôt let that negative aspect ruin your experience however, it‚Äôs still honestly even trumps some console and PC games in my opinion and i believe anyone who avidly or even casually games on their pocket device should try it out.

Overall, this game is stunningly beautiful and the game mechanics are well thought out and in depth compared to even most AAA titles. However, where this game falls short is the fast of how much it costs to be able to upkeep the game itself. If you are a person who gets dedicated to a game and wants to grind, this game might be too much you. The amount of investment to level a single character to maximum level will literally take months of daily grinding using the little bit of Resin they give you. The worst part of it all is it seems the developers realize this and refuse to change their flawed system that they have implemented on their players. The response to us not having enough Resin was met with an increased cap of Resin... but that doesn‚Äôt fix how long it takes to refill? Even without the Resin issue there still character tomes (xp) Imbalance issues, Mora income imbalance issues, heck even basic character xp issues from combat. I will reiterate that this game is beautiful and a blast to play but for long term investment it just doesn‚Äôt seem worth it. For now it will take my spot for the Gacha that I play but will be looking for other games to take its place as the grind is far too great.

This is one of the best games I‚Äôve played in years. Yesterday I spent almost 8 hours playing. I starting reading the reviews and saw a minor trend. Some people were saying they experienced graphic and audio lag and black spots. I‚Äôm using the iPhone 11 Pro Max and experience no issues. It‚Äôs the most graphically stunning game I‚Äôve ever played on a phone. So if you if don‚Äôt have some power under the hood of your phone it may be difficult for you. With that being said this game is so refreshing. It breaks the static mold of mobile gaming today. It‚Äôs so underwhelming playing the same card based energy consumption model over and over that unoriginal developers have been using for years. Baffling how they seem to believe that we enjoy our games all playing the same with the same inherent limitations. Surely they must play games themselves. With the power that phones and tablets can come with today finally a developer has started utilizing it. Hopefully this is a turning point and other developers will see this creating a new model for mobil gaming. Thank you miHoYo for this epic creation!

I honestly kinda had high hopes for this game when i downloaded it because i watched some game plays about the game But it didn‚Äôt turn out well, This game is going to need major bug fixes for the mobile before doing anything else with the game like updates and so on. And i know i should play on the ‚Äúrecommended‚Äù version of the iPhone but you cant expect people to go out and buy some expensive phone just to play some lame game. 
For more the opening of the game is my first impression. I just ended up with a nice headache because i used headphones. The audio was.. like all scratched up or, i don't know how to put this and the animation or video or.. whatever you want to call it was stopping non stop. The only smooth part of it was the character picking and picking your name. Then once i finally loaded up i was surrounded with darkness, that made it really uncomfortable. 
I‚Äôll still and try to play the game and might leave another review. all i want is the mobile experience for ALL versions of the iPhone to be improved and not just the iPhone i want all the different platforms experience to improve if ey are having this same problem 

And sorry if this sounds all weird, random or doesn‚Äôt sound right. I don't have the best English.

This game is really the best game on both sides. It has an amazing story line, as well with rewarding with primogems, it‚Äôs amazing graphics, and it has good bosses to fight. It's nice how everything you do is an adventure, and the voice actors did really well. The gacha is balanced because it does take a while to get a 5 star character (which sadly, I haven‚Äôt gotten yet after playing for around 3 months from now) but the happiness of getting a 5 star character is well worth the wait. Also, there is this system that the game gives you a 5 star pity if you haven‚Äôt gotten a 5 star yet and you have to do 90 wishes to do so. Well that being said, everything in this game is really wrapped up and is beautifully and well executed. If you haven‚Äôt played this game yet, what is wrong with you (no offense.) I hope more people play this game because this is probably the best FREE GAME ON THE APP STORE!! Also, the updates are constantly happening and the updates are well worth the wait too. I wish for all genshin impact players good luck on their adventure of getting a 5 star character!!!!

I really love the game and I‚Äôm enjoying it quite a lot. It‚Äôs really a fun game and I like the variety of missions that you can do as well as the characters in the game. I especially enjoy the characters the most. My only complaint on the game is that I‚Äôve noticed that when you choose to play as the male traveller the characters you interact with still refer to you as female when voiced but the captions do refer to you as male. So I would like to see that resolved in a future update, if possible. I like that I was able to choose the gender of my character giving it a RPG feel to the game which I really love. However,  I‚Äôm not fond of how because I didn‚Äôt select the female character the voices of the characters I interact with don‚Äôt follow the dialogue of the game captions so I‚Äôll hear them calling me a girl or hear them say ‚Äúhope you find your brother‚Äù but when I read the dialogue I‚Äôll be reading the opposite. The upside is that I‚Äôve noticed that Paimon seems to get the genders right so at least my travel companion doesn‚Äôt refer to me as the wrong gender. Lol.

I love the game, I enjoy most everything about it. I just can‚Äôt play it a lot because of logistical reasons. It takes up about 50% of my storage which wouldn‚Äôt be a huge deal except for the fact that I have couple other problems. I would maybe play more when I‚Äôm on the go, to and from places except that it gets really laggy, I understand that it‚Äôs a big game, but it is also laggy when I‚Äôm at home‚Ä¶ The game also drains my phone battery, which once again, I understand that it‚Äôs a large game,however, that doesn‚Äôt change the fact that it isn‚Äôt very convenient for me. I do happen to have an Xbox though, and I do use one of my wireless controllers to play on my phone. It works just as well with my controller as with the touch commands. What I‚Äôm trying to say in a round about way is that you should put the game out on Xbox. That would fix all of the problems that I am having on mobile. Again, I do love the game, but it would be much better if I could just play it on my Xbox console because of the storage and the cleaner game play. I appreciate you taking the time to read this and I hope you have a great day.

I love Genshin so much, but there are a few irks. The lack of melanin in characters is alarming.. and also the cultural appropriation. Not to mention the file space on mobile. As a mobile user myself, there were rumors or ‚Äúleaks‚Äù going around stating that come the 2.8 update players would be able to delete past files to free up storage. While I do not know if this was ever true or not, I wished it was. Sadly that rumor has been debunked and now Im deleting precious photos, videos, apps, and so much more just for this game. I would appreciate it if Genshin was just a little more mobile friendly :D. I would also like to see a change in character design and skin color. POC (People of color) characters have been scarce and if there are poc characters, theyre harmful stereotypes. It would be lovely to see POC characters increase amongst the other characters PROPERLY. Now, hoyoverse if you think melanin characters wouldnt make bank, youre wrong. I would love to pull for a POC 5 star in the game and see them with a proper design and playstyle that isnt harmful. Though tjere is a rise in melanin characters, theyre only NPCS. It would be much appreciated if they were the actual playable characters. But overall this game is a wonder. Truly plenty of space to explore, and lore to speak of. Really just lets your mind wander.

Ill have to admit, I wasn‚Äôt a big fan of genshin when I first downloaded the app. I thought it was too hard and I could never rank up. But now, I find the game really fun! The places you can explore makes it better. Such as Mondstadt, Liyue, Inazuma, Dragonspine, Etc..But overall the story quests are amazing. I just redownloaded the game to try it again. I‚Äôm now Adventure Rank 24, and I‚Äôm trying to do the Liyue Archon quest. So good so far. Plus, every character has their own design. And with Ayato coming out soon, we‚Äôll be able to do more quests. The entire lore of this game is awesome! Venti, the Anemo God, also known as Barbatoes. Zhongli, the Geo God. And Raiden Shogun, the Electro God. All of the gods are 5star characters. You‚Äôre able to get good weapons and good characters as well. Such as Fischl. Fischl is a 4star Electro bow user. I used her to fight bosses all the time. The pity system is also great. The highest pity you can go up to to get a 5star character or weapon is 90. Not that bad, now is it? Overall, the game is amazing! If your looking for a fun RPG story game, this would be the one!

How about add a pvp system or a multiplayer pvp system in game? 
Because some players like me likes this game about everything about it like the characters, graphics, the animals roaming around and we can actually make them our food oh and the mobs all over the map and also roaming around not like any other games I have ever played. But I feel like there is something missing, which is pvp. I love the game‚Äôs battle system where u can actually doge skills but we are only playing with NPCs which we can get use to because they are programmed to fight like how do fight. But pvp is gonna be a challenge or unpredictable of how the players move. I was think of a rank system where the more you win the higher and much harder players there will be and maybe a 1v1-4v4 match up? And the lobby will be you world and invite your friends on your lobby and start the match up while you are doing what ever you‚Äôre doing on the world then it will tell you to get ready when you are matched up with another then to you to another world/area.

I‚Äôve been playing Genshin Impact for almost a year now, and the gameplay is fun, the story‚Äôs are good and the characters well written (mostly). My one problem is how pale they all are.  The darkest playable character in the game is Xinyan, and she hasn‚Äôt been given any black features other than her skin, and while she does have a little more melanin than the other characters, it isn‚Äôt right to excuse the colorism that is going on in this game. Almost all the characters are pale white or very very pale tan, including characters that are inspired by darker people (for example: Candace). People have talked about it many times but we never see the issue being addressed or solved. This is especially a issue because the regions (Monstadt, Liyue, Inazuma, Sumeru, Fontaine, etc;) are different regions where they should have different skin tones but don‚Äôt. In real life, Most people in Asia arent even pale white, but a mixture of tans, brown and blasian people, so why can‚Äôt this be shown in Genshin Impact? It would improve the game so much and there would definitely be more players if you actually listened to this. Please solve this issue because not just everyone in the world is pale.

I love Genshin Impact I really do. I love the type of games where it‚Äôs an open world and you can do whatever and go wherever you want, I love those types of games. Genshin was really fun and addicting and well written in the beginning but as I started to play more, it seemed like there wasn‚Äôt really a storyline anymore. And if I wanted to continue the storyline I would have to grind my adventure level for like 30 minutes just to level up once. Mihoyo idk if you guys read your reviews but just update your game more instead of adding characters. Make the upgrading mechanic a little easier, maybe add other ways to upgrade. And I know a lot of people can agree with me on this one: add character customization please. Let us be able to customize our hair, skin tone, clothes, weapons, shoes all that stuff. The next time you update your game ADD CHARACTER CUSTOMIZATION. Overall the game is pretty good. There are some minor downfalls but it‚Äôs really good. So I‚Äôm giving it 5 stars. Great job on the game Mihoyo but please just add some more stuff to the game.

ive been playing genshin for over a year now and its great! i play nearly everyday and its all i do in my free time. however i do have some issues with it. its NOT free to play friendly at all. grinding for primogems (the gachas currency) can take WEEKS to be able to get enough for a ten pull if youre a late game player. you need at LEAST 90 pulls for a guaranteed 5star. i think this system would be pretty good for the players if it didn‚Äôt take 160 primogems for 1 wish, seeing as though opening one chest can give you anywhere from 2-10 primogems. another thing i have an issue with is the absolute massive amount of storage this game takes up. i play on both pc and mobile and its an issue with both platforms. this game takes up 20 GB so far, 1/3 of my total storage, AND ITS NOT EVEN FULLY RELEASED YET. the mobile player base will probably die out within this year because of how much storage this game needs. pretty soon ill have to buy another storage card for my pc because it‚Äôs almost filled. genshin is the only game i even play on the computer and its still a MONSTROUS amount. i think this game needs LOTS of improvement, but these are just my biggest critiques.

This game is fantastic at the start. However the biggest turnoff is when you get closer you endgame, you‚Äôll see how this game is limiting you to build any character stats. Just like any other mobile game there is some type of energy system. Well this game has it, you are discouraged to keep continuing to upgrade your character as you have to wait or pay your way to grind. Grind? Did you hear that? The grind in this game is far worse than any other rpg I‚Äôve ever played. The energy system combined with RNG elements from getting the perfect drops for your character is insane. You can be grinding for months and still haven‚Äôt got the stats you want for one character. I‚Äôm currently suffering from burnouts endgame, mainly since I really can‚Äôt enjoy building my characters and lack of challenges. This game is predominantly story-focused and adventuring. You will find your self not challenged in the story. The only challenge in this whole game is an arena mode, called spiral abyss. Which you have to fight through 12 floors and rinse and repeat. It‚Äôs a pain to have RNG elements and energy system tied together. It‚Äôs a pain to catch limited events to farm a currency to roll on an another character. Mihoyo needs to do better, otherwise I can‚Äôt justify playing this game years to come.

The game is so much fun and is worth the hype. There‚Äôs a reason why the internet and gaming communities in general went crazy for this title and it‚Äôs deserved!!

ive been playing genshin impact since xiaos banner (im ar 55), and one of my biggest issues is the resin system. i have to farm multiple times daily because i dont have enough resin (this is with fragile resin and transient resin) to farm for my characters ascension , their weapons , AND their talents. i have to farm talent level ups , weapon level ups , and heros wit + character ascension materials. i simply do not have enough resin to do all of those things without having to wait days at a time. i would also like to mention the horrible pity system , and the impossible to get primogems. theres a certain point in the game where its so hard to be f2p , and its easy to quit. it could take about a month for someone whos f2p to get just a simple 10 pull without help of events/updates/gamecodes. our anniversary rewards are a complete joke unless mhy has something planned. we got the same rewards for the lantern rite‚Ä¶im not ungrateful for the 10 fates i just wish there could be something more given to us as players. other than these issues i love the graphics , and i love the storyline. both are amazing and i wish i could replay a lot of the main/character quests ^^ i also really love the character designs they are really cute !

It‚Äôs challenging on my iPhone 6‚Äìprobably because it‚Äôs a lower end device‚Äîbut it still runs and it‚Äôs fantastic on my laptop. It‚Äôs a free world RPG with magic, character building, a fun gacha component (that‚Äôs difficult to understand at first but easy to use for free when you figure it out), interesting world building and characters, and beautiful graphics and music. The first anniversary rewards *are* disappointing so far, but it‚Äôs truly not a big deal, and the recent 1 star reviews based on that are extremely embarrassing. 

The game is free, so just give it a shot if you‚Äôre not sure about it. Despite what the complainers cry about, the game is perfectly fun and playable without spending a dime. I would recommend not going through it too fast though‚ÄîI completed the first two regions very quickly and didn‚Äôt have much to do in terms of exploration or achievements before the next region was released, but major updates happen every 6 weeks, so if you pace your gameplay just right you won‚Äôt run out of content.

It is up to personal preference but it is too much of storybook or movie for me. The gameplay it has is redundant collection, long walks to waypoints you usually don‚Äôt have yet type of games. It has tons of cutscenes and dialogue screens. It has a decent story but in my opinion it‚Äôs overbearing. Now I don‚Äôt want to narc on this game,  I liked the combat and characters I started playing Genshin the first week it came out. But I have just grown tired of the routine like gameplay. It has great graphics and the characters overall are likable. But backing up, the missions that aren‚Äôt story quests are usually the same old mission you have played 20x before. The side quest are long enough to be actual storylines themselves and the spacing of way points in is bothersome. They usually get you kind of close to where you are going. But some quests have you out where there is 30 minutes of climbing and no waypoint to avoid climbing forever. So if you are a story driven player this game is for you. but if you like unique fights you mostly face the same enemies. Cutscenes and run about missions throw you into the action then pull you right back out of it. I wanted to love Genshin but it just isn‚Äôt my game, not that it‚Äôs Mihoyo‚Äôs fault they can‚Äôt make everyone happy no matter how hard they try.

I love this game! It has consumed me for weeks.  I‚Äôve been looking for a game that actually has a RPG gameplay with grinding and an open world for forever. Plus it‚Äôs not pay to play or one of those games where you have to rely on other players to proceed or beat bosses.  It does have a co-op mode which is easy to use during special events, but not mandatory to win. The story is nothing special but you can skip through dialogue if you‚Äôre bored and still complete everything without confusion. My only real issue is the advertising that this game has seven continents to explore when there are only two. Once you finish those you‚Äôre just left with no missions and wondering where to go next and what you need to find! Eventually I went online and asked where I go next and I found out that the game is still being developed that the other continents aren‚Äôt open and it‚Äôll be months and months before they do.  I think that should be made apparent or you just should talk about how you can explore all 7 continents.

This game is very popular and I love it too. The story line, setting design, character design, etc. There are some things I have some issues with mainly with WiFi and downloading. WiFi for genshin needs to be strong so you don‚Äôt lag out, but lots of people don‚Äôt have really strong WiFi (coming from a mobile player) The downloading also takes pretty long at least an hour. Though, I‚Äôm okay with part of this because the game is really detailed it needs all of this. Improvements could be made and I do have suggestions. Such as the anniversary gift, not many people enjoyed it because the gift was to many people for f2p people. I would find this pretty cool, though it would take up a lot of GB too and probably lots of updates for it. These are all some of my opinions but I really enjoy this game and think it‚Äôs a great game for people to play!

I‚Äôll be honest, this game spoils the player base. And I love it. The amount of care and details that go into everything- from the lore, actual books that you can read, the npcs different actions depending on the nation, each characters well throughout design (both in appearance, attacks, personalities/voice lines, and elemental skills).  
There‚Äôs a lot to do. Wanna go fishing? Wanna farm to better your characters/personal level? Wanna go on story quests to get to know the characters? Or hangout events, or world quests, or the main quest, or the events. You can cook, make a house, catch critters, fight monsters, delve into the complex stories and theories. I play nearly every day, and have been playing since the game came out. Each update welcomes new events or even open world locations. Not to mention that it‚Äôs still going!

Honestly, I love this game so much. It consumes so much of my time and it got me through Covid. Ok, you guys have definitely raised the bar with mobile games. I love this game and it is currently is one of my favorites. I definitely recommend. A lot of people have talked about it‚Äôs pros so I‚Äôm not going to spend a lot of time on that and get straight to what I don‚Äôt like. Hopefully the developers may see this. 
One thing I dislike is that characters true potentials are locked behind constellations. The only way to unlock constellations is to win that character multiple times through a gacha system, which is incredibly hard to do unless you pay a crap ton of money. I think constellations should be more accessible, with other ways to unlock them. For example, with primogems, an in-game currency. Or, you should be able to trade characters you do not want for constellation material. 
Also, I‚Äôve never been a fan of gacha systems. It‚Äôs incredibly frustrating not getting what you worked / paid for. I think the rates could be a bit better. 
Other than that, the game is awesome. Those problems are a bit annoying, but do not overall ruin the game and it‚Äôs still worth playing.

I just want to say how much I admire the work that was put into creating this game for mobile. The level of detail and overall immersion involved in this game really can make you wanna play for hours just discovering the land! I mean yes the combat system is by far one of the best that I have encountered not only amongst RPG genre but for many other combat involved games as well, Genshin Impact takes the cake! My only suggestion as for something to make the experience even better, would be controller support. I‚Äôm sure you folks down in development have heard this a million times over, but please would you consider at least adding it for a short time and letting us, the players, decide if we like it or not. There are many of us who prefer mobile or can‚Äôt afford consoles so for you to make this one a mobile was a huge one up for the mobile community. It‚Äôs just that some of us still enjoy remote control playing. If you could please hear us out, it‚Äôs the only thing we are asking. Oh and of course PVP!! Because who doesn‚Äôt love PVP! And then maybe co-op campaign?

I know there‚Äôs more content coming out which is great but once you finish the story so far the games true character comes out. It‚Äôs nothing but a cash grab. Once you have beaten the story everything left to requires money to do. Console quality graphics and story. Mobile game mechanics and monetization.  This game is a gacha game meaning there‚Äôs a gambling element to it. For characters and weapons. Compares to other games in this category the rates for pulling characters and weapons are FAR lower than other games and the cost for pulling is twice as much as most other games. Character progression is gated behind an energy system on top of a grinding system. Most other games of this type are far more generous with their energy system.  It gets worse. You can spend hundreds trying to get a specific top tier character you want but only to realize that the character is in balanced to the point where he is out classed by mid tier characters. Once the entire players base is up in arms about this the developer responds basically with ‚Äúlol git gud‚Äù. So my advice for everyone is enjoy the game for what it is. Take your time to go through the story and don‚Äôt spend a single time. Use the free rolls you earn and don‚Äôt spend another time trying to pull anything else. It‚Äôs just not worth it.
