Genshin Impact is by far my favorite game. I‚Äôm not much of a gamer but it makes it all the more impressive how obsessed I am with this game. The world is so immersive I feel like I‚Äôm exploring all the magical places with my own two feet and meeting all the wonderful characters myself. I would give this game five stars but my one critique is a pretty big one. It lacks dark skin representation. I mean all the characters are almost paper white. This made some sense when all the regions where based on countries where being lighter skin was more standard. But now with Sumeru which is supposedly based on Egypt, Persia, and India it‚Äôs makes zero sense. It‚Äôs just straight up colorism. At this point we only have two tan characters and literally no NPC‚Äôs. I would be so much more excited for Sumeru if they weren‚Äôt they weren‚Äôt messing up so bad. I‚Äôm also surprised at how most of the player base doesn‚Äôt seem to care enough and is even defending Mihoyo. With such an internationally renowned game and so much other types of representation I really would have expected more. I love this game but honestly, do better.

I adore this game. The artstyle, combat, story. It‚Äôs all really amazing, and if you‚Äôre looking for a fun I open world game to play I can‚Äôt recommend this enough. It‚Äôs free on all platforms and has cross save, so it‚Äôs great on the go or at home. One issue though, resin. Resin is an awful system. You get limited amounts a day then you have to wait hours for it to restore. Resin is used for almost everything you grind, money key limes, exp key limes, domains, events. For all the things you can do with it you don‚Äôt have near enough of it. After you do the main story the game relies on you to grind your characters up, and get new ones to incentivize playing but you can‚Äôt for more than an hour because the resin system prevents long term gains. You should add a system where you can stack resin if you‚Äôre not using it, or increase the cap. Anything to make resin a resource that drains less quick. I want to spend hours grinding on your game but the resin system prevents that. Though that being said, there is a lot of things that don‚Äôt use resin such as side quests, main quests, and exploring so it‚Äôs still a great game despite this system.

I love this game and the story and the characters. The startling lack of representation outside of pale Asians and white Europeans, however, is a HUGE issue with this game. The next major update of this game is planning to mash several Middle Eastern and North African cultures into one, which is horrible and wrong. Plus, there is no acknowledgement of any African or Latine or Hispanic or Caribbean or Indigenous countries or cultures in this game at ALL. Nearly every single character in this game is pale, it‚Äôs like Hoyoverse is afraid of people who aren‚Äôt. Many video game developers have finally began to represent and acknowledge the diverse cultures and races that live around the world, why doesn‚Äôt Genshin reflect that? People of every race and shade love this game and it‚Äôs disheartening that those of us who are Black, Latine, Native, and outside of East Asia are never represented. For the Sumeru update, or for further notice, please bring on a team of developers and writers from around the world and fairly represent the different countries and people of the world individually as our cultures beautifully are. If you can do that for Japan, China, Germany, and France; please consider doing that for other countries as well, people are hurting at your decision and we want to see you do better. Thank you.

I‚Äôve seen plenty of ads for Genshin Impact and I wasn‚Äôt sure if it was like some other mobile games where the ad and the game are completely different. Safe to say, GI is exactly like it‚Äôs ads.
The world is beautifully crafted and fun to explore. The combat is engaging and is based off not just mashing the melee button but figuring out which characters element will give you an advantage against whichever enemies. 
This is a great game to have on your phone if you‚Äôre on the go but it‚Äôs also just a great game in general and has become my go to when chilling on the couch.
Keep an eye on your battery though, I played so much already that within a few hours I received the battery low message while in the middle of a fight. 
It‚Äôs a beautiful game with an interesting world and fun as h**l combat. If you have the space, download it and give it a try. There are in app purchases but nothing is mandatory for playing the game. I‚Äôve already sunk a few hours in and I‚Äôm sure I‚Äôll sink many more into the lovely world.

While the game has outstanding overall production (which is be the one thing that will reel you in to play the game) it‚Äôs not until you invest a ton of time into the game do you realize it‚Äôs mediocracy. For an open world game, it is a very bland experience. While the sights are nice to look at, the exploration is terrible because of how little the game rewards you for exploring. You‚Äôre basically running around looking for chests that included nothing more than exp fodder. The progression is also terrible, probably one of the worst I‚Äôve seen because of how many materials it takes to completely build a character while the game hardly gives you the necessary resin to do so. The rng aspect of the artifact drops is also horrendous. While the game is open world, it gets old rather quickly because of how you manually have to run around the map and collect food ingredients, ore, enemy mats and such. It is a very monotonous and tedious task to do this on a daily basis. Gameplay is rather average; it has the same fundamentals as it‚Äôs predecessor Honkai Impact 3rd. Having listed all my gripes of the game, I believe my rating of the game is justified. In my opinion the only praise-worthy aspect of the game is it‚Äôs production.

Hihi! I‚Äôm a player from the NA server and i‚Äùm really enjoying this game so far! i‚Äôm at 35 and i‚Äôm having a blast! there‚Äôs just one problem. if you‚Äôve played genshin, or atleast heard of it, you‚Äôd know of their wishing system. it allows you to get new characters and weapons. but of course, it‚Äôs not free. since i don‚Äôt want this review to be too long, and over explained, just google up ‚Äúgenshin pull/wish system‚Äù if you don‚Äôt know what i‚Äôm talking about. moving on i‚Äôll get straight to the point. i‚Äôm an f2p player, (free to play) and i‚Äôm just so infatuated with the amazing characters mihoyo comes out with. but the thing is, none of them are free and most of them are hard to get as they are 5 stars. it‚Äôs costs about 160 primo gems to get one wish, and most of the time you can only get a 3 star weapon. the pity system is extremely unfair. almost 90 wishes just for one five star? even the ‚Äúgenerous gifts‚Äù you guys give us aren‚Äôt enough for one wish. do better mihoyo. consider the fact that most of your players are broke minors, who have no intention of spending money in the game.

I‚Äôm quite surprised with the production quality of this game. For the internet to brush it off as a BotW knock of does it a disservice to the overall experience. Sure there are mechanics like climbing and use of a glider, gathering materials spread through out the over world, and the general environmental design and look similarities. But due to the combat and now the narrative is progressed, it‚Äôs a far different experience. It‚Äôs has taken good aspects of BotW and established it‚Äôs own game, I consider this to be a homage with extreme similarities than just a knock off trying to piggy back on BotW popularity and polish. I myself brushed it off as a BotW copy cat, but I was very surprised to be wrong about that. Now I hope the gacha mechanic doesn‚Äôt sour the overall experience and make it worth while for free to play players. Though like Arknights, I hope this game becomes something the player wants to put in their own hard earned money due to how well made this game might be. But this only has bouts been released, and the studio probably are planning to hold events like other gacha games, adding to the game.

Storage is a huge problem for this app. I believe that in the 2.8 patch, its an option to delete the saved dialogue from quests (which shouldve been implemented right away). But the problem with this, if it was even added at all? You have to download the full game, including that saved dialogue first. Which doesnt make sense- in Honkai, your able to download the basic resources and then download voice&story if you wish later on. Genshin shouldve done this- it wouldve caused a LOT less trouble. Instead, your forced to download the full 15/16 gigs and THEN, if the feature is even available this update, possibly delete it. Genshin itself is a good rpg/exploration with a pretty good storyline. The storage space and lack of representation is the real problem. Would like to play a rerun of my favorite event before im unable to download it at all, but considering that ive spent literal hours trying to make space and download the game, i dont think im gonna be able to. Disappointing.

Edit: I‚Äôve discovered that i CANT actually download basic resources. Considering they‚Äôve done this with Honkai, id honestly expect that they would have added it WAY earlier in genshin. Spent 2 hours clearing up space just to delete again, wish it didnt take up about 15 of the 32 gb i have.

I‚Äôve just got to say, this is an amazing game! The graphics are TOP TIER, the storyline is great! I love open world games. This game overall is great! What I don‚Äôt like is the gatcha system. It‚Äôs almost impossible to get any five star characters without paying a lot of money. I think that‚Äôs one BIG flaw to this game. The next thing I have an issue with is leveling and gaining experience. It‚Äôs getting more challenging as you progress through the game. Some people will just be stuck on AR 54-56 for months. To gain any kind of EXP you need resin, and domains cost 20 while bosses cost 40 and you have to make do with only the 160 you get which is really kind of crappy. It‚Äôs repetitive and that‚Äôs one of the reaosns why people are losing interest. I used to spend hours on Genshin grinding away and leveling through, but now I only spend about 30 minutes because there‚Äôs just nothing to do. Sometimes I just don‚Äôt even bother to log in anymore. I feel that with the way things are going, people will lose interest and stop playing Genshin all together, and that‚Äôs just sad. I really love this game but, I wish I could enjoy it more.

Genshin is an AMAZING game, and it‚Äôs pretty much the only thing I play these days. The graphics and animations are amazing, and the voice acting is top notch. I would suggest making the loading screen with the elements take less time because I always need to swipe up and try again. Otherwise, it‚Äôs a great game and keep up the good work!!!

Fun and full of adventure. Genshin Impact is a RPG game. It has an anime style with beautiful scenes. You fight monsters and there's lots of characters you could get. Some are stronger than the others. They are marked by star ranking and colors. Purple is really good, blue is ok. Its Free and fun to play. My personal feelings for it is that I love the action but there's a lot of talking. Sometimes I just skip throws and hope for the best. The more you play the more you level up. The more you level up the more stuff you unlock and gain to upgrade your character and the weapons for your character. This Game reminds me of an anime I watched a long time ago. Sword Art Online. It's almost the same. Except in Genshin it's not Vr and there's not that many monster variations and you are not able to create your own character. What I like about Genshin is that it's a free map. You have missions to accomplish but it doesn't force you to complete them automatically. You can be given a mission and then do whatever you want. You can either explore the world and hunt and cook or you can carry on with the mission.

I‚Äôve been playing Genshin for quite some time now and there are only a few features that bug me otherwise this games is amazing! The open-world experience, the quests, every aspect of it I love. However when I fight bosses for things that‚Äôll help my characters grow, for example artifacts. Artifacts are a really useful way to up your characters stats so they become stronger or whatever aspect you‚Äôre focusing on upgrading. Sometimes you don‚Äôt get those artifacts and instead your left with a whole lot of resin wasted, and resin takes a while to replenish, 8 minutes for 1. So in theory 16 hours for all 160 to replenish. Anyways where I‚Äôm going with this is trading, I think a trading aspect would be super great for the players! Maybe someone has an artifact you don‚Äôt and they have a weapon you don‚Äôt, trade request bam! And then they trade. This would make obtaining artifact sets a whole lot less of a hassle and would be an amazing feature to add! Thank you for reading! -sincerely, GaryTheCanary

After I achieved AR 56, I can proudly say that this is a game well worth my time. Although these days I play mostly periodically (especially when a major update comes out), this game is truly something magical. I am engrossed with the main lore and sub-plot involving the characters. Speaking about the characters‚Ä¶ They are so well crafted, with not only aesthetically-pleasing design, but also intriguing personalities. And of course, what has drawn me in this game was initially the open-world dynamics. It is such a breath of fresh air to come back to this game and feel a sense of wonder that I‚Äôve felt in lower AR levels. However, one criticism that I have with this game is the overall gameplay. Although this gameplay can be switched up with events, overall, completing commissions to get primogems becomes rather boring. There is little to no variety in slaying monsters and the like. So I would suggest incorporating more ways to gain primogems, so that everyone‚Äôs experience is more dynamic with less monotony. But otherwise, solid game! Amazing.

This is a super good game for being on a mobile device! I love everything about it except three things! I wish that there was a way to fully customise whichever sibling you choose to play as (hair, face, body, etc.), another way besides teleporting and gliding across the world (or running) I‚Äôve seen some mobile games add creatures such as horses or mythical animals that you can collect and I would personally love love love to have a horse and just run through this world! It‚Äôs already so beautiful and amazing I don‚Äôt want to teleport and the running is just a little too slow for my personal taste (It‚Äôs perfect when you‚Äôre in the city parts though!) and gliding to me is just meh. The game was great at first but with time it started rotting. With all the nations we have Liyue is the only one that gets the best lore or attention from the company, while all the other nations are ignored or left with mid lore, Something a high schooler can write for their creative writing if they try hard enough. Not to mention lack of representation, they‚Äôre currently making a new region which is Sumeru, a country inspired after Indian/Middle Eastren culture. You‚Äôd expect the major skin tone of characters would be dark, no? However most of the ones leaked today are extremely light. White washing is a very common theme in Asia especially countries around here, so what they‚Äôre doing is not helping. Not to mention them mixing Indian and middle Eastern culture alone is so wrong on many levels. All the other regions were inspired after only one country alone but sumeru is mixed and messy bc of lack of research and respect. Honestly expected more from this game, it was so good at first but now it‚Äôs terrible. Don‚Äôt download it, not worth it at all it‚Äôs time consuming and has bad rng for both farming certain material in game and pulling for characters you want, don‚Äôt download especially if you have gambling addiction or struggle with those kind of things.

Okay, first of, let me say Genshin Impact is an amazing game and you should try it out! (if you have enough storage space). You almost always have something to do in the low ar‚Äôs.

However, Mihoyo doesn‚Äôt seem to pay attention to feedback, so it‚Äôs always the same cycle of farming for a character for weeks, if not a month or two, then getting the character and the cycle restarts. And that‚Äôs if you‚Äôre lucky enough to get the character, which isn‚Äôt all that high of a chance, seeing as you have to pull 40 times to get to 90% pity. Unless you use money or you‚Äôve been farming for 6 months, you won‚Äôt have nearly enough primogems for that. And if you lose the 50/50 it‚Äôs pretty much over. 

Genshin Impact is a wonderful game to play, especially if you like fighting and leveling up characters without the gore and stuff. But soon you‚Äôll find that if you want to get good at the game, you‚Äôll need to spend money on the game, which isn‚Äôt great since many items are a bit overpriced. This os only my opinion of the game, you should definitely try the game out of you want your own experience to go off of.

I love this game. The characters, story, and gameplay are all fun and engaging. I was enjoying nearly every moment I had with this game up until now. When the 1 Year Anniversary hit, I was hopeful for some kind of fun celebration between the players and Mihoyo, that included rewards and events. Instead, I was met with disrespect and a slap to the face, followed by childlike ignorance of a major problem. The rewards were almost nothing, and the events required either essentially free advertising, or hours of work by artist for only a chance to receive anything in return. There was hardly even a celebration at all, and it truly felt as though Mihoyo spat in the face of those who have supported their game since the beginning. The way the company is treating this issue is outrageous, and I am thoroughly disappointed. Deleting negative reviews, banning accounts that speak up, shutting down the Reddit page, it is all truly disgusting behavior. In due time, I'm sure this review will be taken down as well, but I want to get my word out there, as I am a player of this game and deserve a voice. I hope that someday, Mihoyo will make up for their mistake and apologize, as the scar left within the community is a deep one that will take a long time to heal.

I‚Äôve played since Kaedehara Kazuha‚Äôs release and it‚Äôs been a very fun game! Very nice art design and gameplay. I love how the elemental reaction makes it easier for players to crit or just for the damage to be way better. The banners last a while which makes it easier for you to save up for another or the same wishing banner. The wishing system is a little complicated but once you play for 1 month or longer, you‚Äôll understand that you need to get a standard 5 star character to be guaranteed. Theres no character better than another, which means you can build any character and get good damage. People say the starter character, Amber, is horrible but she is really good with Constellation#2. The co-op system is really fun but I wish they the partner could stay while we unlock a statue. I also want it to be possible to talk to npcs during co-op. Another thing I want the Hoyoverse to do is make the possibility of the 3 starter characters; Amber, Kaeya, and Lisa, to be higher in the wishing system. Besides that, TCG is great and the game is too.

Genshin Impact is,just such a good investment for you‚Äôre time. There is just so much content,so many updates and events to look forward too all the time! There is just one issue that I have with the game is how much storage and space it takes,and how much lag I experience while playing sometimes,however that‚Äôs the only complaint. There is always something you can do in the game. You can really never be bored. I think the lag and whatnot might just be on my end,considering the devices I use to play genshin are a bit outdated and I‚Äôm getting a new laptop and iPad Air, so hopefully that will help with the lag. If found myself spending hours on this game when expecting to really only play it for like 30 minutes a day. Honestly,not a game to install if you are often short on time üòÖ. But this really is an amazing game,and the amount of content and quality that this game contains,is worth the storage space and lag. Thank you for reading <3. Have a great day/night :)

This is the first multi-platform game to ever really capture my attention and keep it.
I‚Äôve been grinding out working on my characters and team, and I love to see their growth. Not to mention the story is very cool and keeps us busy as players.
However. In recent game play we‚Äôve seen the boss ‚ÄúChilde‚Äù get his difficulty lowered to make it more accessible for all players. Which is awesome. But there‚Äôs a boss in particular, the Oceanid is ridiculously overpowered. Even with a team of 3 level 60 characters, a level 50 healer, and a level 3 world my team was absolutely obliterated in under 2 minutes. I can‚Äôt even fight this thing anymore to level up my healer because of how strong it is. I know how you stack your team plays a big part in this game but you should still be able to at least be able to fight and make progress. It‚Äôs ridiculous.
I ask the game developers to consider taking a second look at the stats and difficulty of the Oceanid and consider lowering it‚Äôs difficulty like Childe‚Äôs

I've played Genshin a lot, the most obvious issue is that this is possibly one of the most Grindy types of Mobile gacha games I have ever experienced, I haven't had terrible luck at all but it honestly is far too much to even get a singular summon, let alone 10 just to have a minimum chance at getting a character you like. This game almost forces you into that pay to win mindset just to be successful or get what you want. Free to play should be a lot more relaxed, so as an overall it should give out more of it's own in game currency. This brings me to the other issue, the game doesn't really have any good events or rewards, especially with the recent anniversary, it is almost empty feeling and the grind for leveling up characters is even harder, many resources often not even being able to be accessible easily, leaving you many times, more often than not, heavily under leveled. As of now I am unwavering in this review and until I see change I won't change or remove this review and if you see this review disappear, most likely the developers have removed it to silence us.

A chinese company making a free to play game that captures all the best aspects of JRPG‚Äôs & breath of the wild! This is one of few times the gatcha system didnt dissuade me from playing. The game has a great original soundtrack, combat system, & (something Botw lacked) voicelines for practically everything (& in multiple languages)! To top it all off, the game is cross-compatible w/ ps4, pc, mobile; cross-save for mobile & pc, & a tba switch date! All of this free so i dont understand how anyone could give this game anything but five stars. The story & dialogue are better than most retail games lately & the cutscenes are as beautiful as the world that‚Äôs created. There‚Äôs gonna release more content for free. I could go on about how astounded i am by this game & i recommend to anyone who enjoys PvE & multiplayer. I have an iphone xr & it runs super smooth & my phone doesnt get as hot as i thought it would. 

my only negative critique is the lack of keybinding/being able to edit the location or functionality of the mobile controls.

I almost never write app reviews, but I just really feel the need to say how much I love this game.  I‚Äôve never played any game for this long (8 months now, I think), but Genshin Impact has kept me so engaged because of the story and characters, as well as the astounding amount of constant new content even when the next piece of the story is far off form being released.  The characters are easily my favourite part of the game, they‚Äôre all so beautifully designed just like the scenery and they‚Äôre all so easy to get attached to, especially since the voicelines almost let you interact and build relationships with each one.  Aside from that, the gameplay is really fun and the whole thing is so beautiful, and the gacha system is one of the easier ones I‚Äôve encountered to be honest because there‚Äôs so many ways to get the currency for it.  Absolutely incredible game, planning to stick around until the whole thing‚Äôs been released and I know I won‚Äôt regret doing so for a second!!

I can‚Äôt put into words my dissatisfaction with this company‚Äôs handling of the first anniversary. Something needs to give, and I think leaving a review with an honest rating and telling both them and the people who will read reviews before playing what needs to change.

I've been playing this game since April 2022 and I , am in love with all the characters and regions. Mondstadt is charming, Liyue is exciting, Inazuma is stunning, and Sumeru is so full of life that even Sumeru City is lined with plants and NPCs! This game has wonderful designs, great humor, exciting adventures, adorable creatures, intricate storytelling, etc. I highly recommend for everyone of all sorts for all sorts of reason. Min-maxers for the character builds and spiral abyss, shippers for the many exciting relationships between characters, artists for the beautiful landscapes and intricate character designs, very angry people for all the things to be mad at in this game (abyss mages, spiral abyss floor 12, fatui, the chasm archon quests, artifact rolls, banner rolls, etc.), and even people with good luck can benefit from their good luck because of how. many. things. in. this. game. rely. on. luck. (i.e. artifact sets, artifact substats, artifact stats, artifact substat upgrades, solvent rolls, banner rolls, 50/50s, crit%, talent books, mob drops, and MORE). Basically this game has it all and I love it so much.

I love this game with a passion and have been playing for almost 1-2 years now. I find the game graphics beautiful and the character designs are wonderful, yet at the same time the characters are the issue about the game. Of course we have some issues based in storage as it takes a lot, also the pity system isn‚Äôt very f2p friendly. The biggest issue about the game nonetheless is the lack of representation. Throughout the lore we can see the nations are based off real places and cultures, yet they tend to stereotype it in places and refuse to make any characters that aren‚Äôt white except for two extremely lightskinned people. The community has been asking for so long for representation to be made for the poc community, and when we finally think hoyoverse will give the people the representation it needs for South Asians and Middle Eastern cultures the company shuts us out. All white and pale characters and still 0 representation the community is dying for. It‚Äôs obvious the game is racist and/or doesn‚Äôt care about the community. I find that a MAJOR flaw in any game, if hoyoverse were to fix this, I‚Äôd be willing to give higher ratings, but for now I absolutely will not until they listen to their community and other cultures.

Don‚Äôt get me wrong- Genshin Impact is one of the most graphically beautiful, well crafted and well plotted, filled out game I have ever played. The stories of each character are full of anguish and sorrow and strife, the views and landmarks breathtaking to say the least and the gacha system and game play well made. But I do have a few problems. For one, there isn‚Äôt a whole lot of diversity. At first they had all white characters, and they have quite a few characters, except for two light characters repeatedly called strange and weird. Now, after all the diversity controversy stuff they have strived to fix their mistake and have added multiple beautiful characters with darker skin. However none of them have dark skin- only light brown. Of course there‚Äôs nothing completely wrong with that, it would just be nice to see more diversity. My second problem is that the plot line is a little predictable. I don‚Äôt know fault the game for that however as it is derived from a manga. My last problem is how unlucky I was. Ughhhh

I think this is an epic game, the graphics are unreal and the story is amazing. Other then that, this game has no problems and is a great game, and for new players I recommend not wasting all your resources on leveling all your character, first aim to get al l the characters, then play with them, and then decide which ones are the best although in the process you will have to level up some of your characters but you only have to level up your two mains. I‚Äôve been playing since launch. It‚Äôs fun and addictive for a while but the gameplay loop starts to take its toll after you‚Äôve built your 20th or so charecter. The cycle of get currency gamble for x charecter, build charecter to beat content and get more currency to get more charecters may be fun for some. But there is no end game beyond that. This is a gacha game through and through. Overworld rewards are paltry and everything you collect is fodder to feed the rng. Don‚Äôt expect to find a legendary weapon in the woods or suddenly find a quest in a book or anything like that. The combat is fun but the effects can be overwhelming to the point where there‚Äôs nothing but chaos on the screen and you are basically just using the same maneuvers blindly. There are different weapon types but each type works the same within its category, polearm users typically use charge attacks, claymore users spin around etc. combos never really deviate from the normal attack 3 or 4 times, skill then burst, then switch charecter rinse and repeat. It has great graphics and if you love anime girls/boys you‚Äôre gonna love collecting but that‚Äôs it, that‚Äôs the game.

I loved my first couple of months playing this game. The world and characters are rich and well crafted, especially for a mobile feature. Unfortunately, the drop off past AR50 is stark. The game is clearly designed to get you to form addictive habits and normalize casual spending, and it‚Äôs dark the way these patterns manifest. Perhaps even more importantly, the dev team has completely ignored user feedback about a wide array of bugs and issues, including auto-targeting problems, lack of constellation toggles, resin gating for time gated content, diminishing rng returns in domains, etc. I would recommend this game up until AR50, but then run far far away, before you get addicted and do something you might regret. Lastly, and just as a side note, the management team for this game is completely non-responsive to the playerbase, basically insulting us with their silence in the face of outcry about pervasive issues and insulting mechanics. Better management is needed asap. Corporate greed is ruining this game, just like everything else in this world. Where are the tech otakus to save us? Just my 2¬¢. Fingers crossed we see change soon! If so I‚Äôll gladly return!

Why does this game have to require me to spend so much money in order to get who I want when I do decide to spend money I worked for. I just spent 165 dollars for venti and got jean and a bunch of 4 stars instead of venti. I don‚Äôt need jean I need venti for my xiao but now I just threw 165 dollars down the drain for this game. I just want the rate of getting the feature 5 star to be higher. 100 dollars WITH bonus is enough to get 81 summons, 70 is where you hit soft pity which is a 50/50 chance for a five star but not the feature ones just the select few and him so you could possible get someone other than the one you want. 100 dollars without bonus would get you around 40 summons and if you were sitting at 0 pity you might have to spend 200 dollars just to hit soft pity at 70. These rates for these featured five stars are outrageous and invigorating I want to enjoy characters that come out and be able to get them without spending and outrageous amount of money. As you can tell from above, this is my first review on App Store and I have no regrets and am proud that my first review is of Genshin Impact. As an artist, this game encaptures my eyes with its creative character designs and personalities. I love the scenery in the game and it is great for photography. As a writer, the story lore is complex and amazingly funny at times. The dialogue and voice actors in different languages all have their strengths and weaknesses. Their diversity in voice languages and text is another thing that stands out. I have played this game since its early days and I am sure I will continue to play (as a high adventure rank player) despite there being a lack of content at times since I am already up to date with most of the things in-game. Highly recommend for those who like to invest in characters and see them do big damage! I am also F2P and a lucky fellow to get the five stars I want. It's not hard to get five stars (in my opinion) as long as you have the time and patience to farm for primogems.

Wow where do I even start? This is a great game for a lot of reasons! For one, there‚Äôs a giant world to explore with endless side quests and treasures to find! If you‚Äôre trying to level up you could do things such as fight monsters, do daily commissions, side quests, co-op, or challenges. Basically there are endless things to do! And with all the characters and weapon upgrades there‚Äôs always something to work toward. I myself have spent a few hours fighting monsters trying to get primogems to get characters. On the subject of characters, I think the idea of a completely chance-based system to get a character makes the game a lot more fair than games that just let you pay to get them. If I have any complaints, it‚Äôs that it can be difficult to get enough primogems to do wishes. Sure if you grind enough challenges youll eventually save enough up but maybe it would be better if we could get a few more per chest. Like maybe instead of 2 per common chest, it could be 5? Well I‚Äôm rambling- uh this game is great, download it!

I downloaded this game the day it came out, and I gotta say I‚Äôm pleasantly surprised. The gameplay is pretty good and simple, the music is nice and fitting, the graphics are great for a mobile game, I like the anime aesthetic, the voice actors are good(at least the japanese ones), and open world games like this are my favorite. It feels like Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild but with magic. The story is relatively engaging and there are mechanics that make it feel like a survival game, like cooking, climbing and hunting. Some downsides I can think of are that the game is really big. Right now, it‚Äôs sitting at 7.12 GB of storage and took around half a day to download. Another downside is the rarity of the good characters. I have pulled quite a few times so far (around 30-40 times) and have gotten no characters, only items. And the last downside I can think of is that sometimes when alot is going on, the FPS drops like crazy, but that‚Äôs expected for such a big game. Overall though, this game is good enough to get 5 stars from me.

The game is overall fun when there‚Äôs a new event or you‚Äôre a new player. Although there‚Äôs a few issues that I think that should be worked on. The primo gem system is overall not very good and annoying to collect. Leveling up to high levels is really annoying because after playing for so long you get only a bit a mora, a few xp books and one or two standard banner wishes. It‚Äôs overall bad for that system. But the most thing I dislike is how much space this game takes up. Sure it‚Äôs a good game to grind and play but it‚Äôs not worth deleting important images and apps just to update it and just fill up your phone and make it overheat. Besides all of that I liked the early game better. Edit: another issue I have thought about is genshins lack of dark skinned characters. Sumeru is based off an area where people often have lots of melanin in their skin but most of the released characters are as white as paper, even the archon. The npcs of sumeru themselves are darker. It has gotten to the point where I think hoyoverse is just racist with the lack of appreciation towards people of color.

A lot of people get angry over things that I personally think are a tad bit odd. Like the game isn't about collecting waifu‚Äôs or a massive co-op fest. 

 Its a single player game with an amazing story and lore that has a gacha system. You don‚Äôt need to pay to win, you can beat every boss with just the first 4 characters. 

 The story is beautiful and as a person with siblings I can relate to it a lot. I love the people we meet along and way and I love learning about everyone‚Äôs background

 I love the open world too; its so expansive and amazing. The characters fit in with the world it isn‚Äôt like the world or characters are too realistic or too cartoon‚Äôed to fit.

 I enjoy the long journey and look forward to the future nations. The character‚Äôs are all so unique and pretty, and I have hope there will be character‚Äôs with darker skin in the future.

This game is amazing, I love it so much. But I‚Äôm gonna get to the point, I think that everyone should get a new type of character, preferably a shifter type. And some side stealth missions. Alright, this has got to be the BEST game I‚Äôve ever played on my phone. It‚Äôs incredibly immersive, expansive and so finely-detailed for a game that‚Äôs adapted to the iPhone. It‚Äôs like playing an actual console game on your phone. No lagging, no annoying ads to watch or skip, no required in-app purchases or pay-to-play/win nonsense. It‚Äôs got a Zelda BotW vibe, mixed-in with maybe some Kingdom Hearts/Final Fantasy elements. 

The developers put so much detail in the game, and it shows. There‚Äôs voiceovers, a free-roam environment to explore, tons of quests to complete, etc. Honestly, I‚Äôm blown away that this game is free. Games like this is so rare nowadays, where develop quality games for others to enjoy first and foremost, and cashing in on the game from it being less of an emphasis. Not saying we all deserve free games, but it‚Äôs easy to see how money-hungry game developers are nowadays, and are willing to churn out a mediocre game year after year for the sake of money, and expecting people to pay top dollar for them.

I HIGHLY recommend this game.

I‚Äôve really enjoyed the exploration and the story aspects of this game. But man the grind! You literally need to plan your days around grinding for mats for characters and weapons as only certain mats are found on certain days of the week. Some of the larger non story quests have huge, visible impacts on the world around you but are never mentioned in the main story or by most NPCs. It takes you out of the immersion. Also although it‚Äôs mostly unneeded to enjoy the game, the gotcha system is the most unfair, inaccurate mess of a lie and in todays age I‚Äôve no idea how they‚Äôre getting away with it. Part of the issue is they mix weapon with character pulls and another huge issue is you can pulll 100 wishes and not get a single character. 

I‚Äôve really enjoyed the story for the most part, I wish there was a skip button for some stuff though that isn‚Äôt that engaging though. I could nitpick more but honestly between the grind and the unreal gotcha mechanics I‚Äôm thinking about uninstalling it and just watching lets plays instead or wait until the anime comes out.

I love this game! I have it it on mobile and on PC. Though the main problem that most people are complaining about is,storage. It is true that it takes up a lot of storage but it didn't bother me. What is really good about this game is the story, how it works, and how frequently it updates! The story- the story is rich in action, and the plot is very good. How it works- the instructions are very clear and the player (hopefully) understands clearly. Updates- the updates aren't just "fixed bugs" there us much more, it updates almost every month and the updates are very interesting (see the newest updates!) 
There is one problem that isn't that big of a deal but may be infuriating to others, it crashes too much. When I first started it crashed like every 10 mins or so. It made me very frustrated but then after a bit it became a mild issue.

Thank you for reading my review! Hope you have a good morning,night,evening,or whatver time it is!

I‚Äôve been really enjoying the game so far on my phone. One of the biggest draws is that you build your party to your play-style. I love being able to switch to various party members to maximize the elemental combinations. You do have to be a bit lucky at times in getting characters that work for you but it‚Äôs fairly easy -so far- to get the means for the 10 items ‚Äúwishes.‚Äù It‚Äôs primarily single player ‚Äúworld‚Äù that allows you to have other join your world (or you theirs) once you reach a certain level so you have the option to co-op. There are times where certain mechanics are frustrating (you dodge an incoming attack that hits anyway and it becomes a chain of knockdowns with no escape) but that happens with any game. This is one of the few games that seem truly f2p and is one of the few games that has earned my respect enough to debate donating. I just wish the formatting of the PS4 account linking would allow for cross-save between mobile and the console

So I was skeptical about this app at first. I don‚Äôt play many ‚Äúgotcha‚Äù games or games that required payments and money to win/advance: this game is totally different! No adds or anything bombarding you to buy something!! You just dive in and play the game. Just focus on 2 main DPS. Have a support and an extra. Manage your resources and you‚Äôre good to go! Also, there is no rush to be on leaderboards or anything like that at this time. It‚Äôs an actual game with a ton of content. I‚Äôm new to the game. Just a few days into it. AR20 and I can say the story and side quests so far is amazing and I love the open world concept. Also, it‚Äôs amazing I can play in my laptop to give my phone a break! I only have 8 characters or so but each one is unique and combining elements is awesome to weaken foe. Can‚Äôt wait to get further along in the game and enjoy the content that comes out! So much to do in this game as well! I also like seeking out achievements and this game has a lot so far! I just hope it doesn‚Äôt turn into a gotcha game and remains as good as it currently is.

I‚Äôve been playing over a year, and it‚Äôs a fun game honestly. There‚Äôs a lot of content for beginner/mid players and the community can be really helpful with exploring and building characters. The stories are heart wrenching at times and the scenery is absolutely stunning. But unfortunately there‚Äôs a lot of issues that need to be fixed. The teapot load limit, characters lack of diverse skin tones, sexualization of characters (women and children) and lack of content for late game players who have finished all of the quests. The adventure rank rewards are really sad as well, you‚Äôd expect to at least receive a ten pull for reaching adventure rank 60 but you only get a few blue wishes. Getting characters you want can also be extremely difficult if you have not saved up months of primos and you are not guaranteed. The weapon banner is a whole other war zone I don‚Äôt even want to get into. So unless you plan on spending money or spending hours of your time (or your whole life) on this game then I wouldn‚Äôt really recommend it. Otherwise, good luck because you‚Äôll need a lot of it.

Honestly love this game to pieces! The world-building and story-telling are both stunning and the visual effects pop off the screen. There are so many cool and unique characters to collect and the levelling up system is easy to use. I like how creative some if the designs are and how much variety there is between characters of the same element. Your gameplay can really change depending on which twin you choose and who you main. I personally like the close-combat style that comes with the sword-wielding characters and a friend of mine likes the ranged attacks, which makes for perfect team gameplay. The multiplayer gameplay is also really nice, although a wish you were able to do a bit more with it story wise. My biggest critic would be that there are so many cats and dogs but no way to interact with them! I wish you could pet them or play with them during downtime. Other than that I love the game. I would recommend it to anyone who enjoys fantasy and battle games.

I'm really loving this game so far! It's fun and the characters and graphics are awesome! Then, I noticed something... In the storage section in the settings of my iPhone... Genshin Impact takes up more than 3x more storage than the app with the 2nd most storage. I just got it TODAY and it's 7GB already. My next closest is photos with 2GB. I don't think the number will go down. Most likely it will go up as I play more. I wish it was less storage but I tend to use up storage a lot so I can't just games above 5GB. 5 is pushing it but 7 is ridiculous! I like to have all my games within a 2GB limit but if it's one of those can't live without and it's 5GB or less then I'll keep it. But I don't think it's worth the storage take up. If you're on mobile and you don't have a problem with the storage thing then I think you should definitely get this game because it's really cool. But, if you're like me... Then this game might not be worth it to you. I will have to delete this sadly but it's a really great game. Just not worth the storage.

This game has 3 types of people who can enjoy it long term. 1, the casual who literally just wants fun gameplay (which this game has, but please get it on your pc or PlayStation.) 2, the ‚Äúwhale‚Äù who is more than willing to spend $2-3k (USD) to get the best version of the character they want (you make wishes and get characters/weapons; duplicate characters and weapons give ‚Äúconstellations‚Äù and ‚Äúrefinements‚Äù respectively) but you have to get 7 of any character (6 Constellations after you first get the character) to max their constellation. This makes the 5 star characters in the game about $200 to even get a chance of getting them once. All in all, it‚Äôs a good game. But the people who control the prices of Genesis crystals and the amount of event rewards (the games gacha currency) are SUPER selfish. They will not reward you for being part of their community. They will only reward you for giving more money than you should ever give to a game like this.

I‚Äôve been playing Genshin Impact for a long time and I know how greedy Mihoyo is when giving out free primogems, but this is just sad. Most games would celebrate their first year by being more generous and letting the community have fun. But giving away only 10 wishes and having events or contests where people have to spend hundreds of dollars or spend a lot of time for these contests only for the chance to win the cheap awards or 100 primogems. 100 PRIMOGEMS IS NOT EVEN 1 WISH. I‚Äôve played other faces games that give massive awards during special events, but this is just disappointing. Genshin Impact is a fun game and has some great stories, and this was one of the first games I‚Äôve spent money on. It seems like Mihoyo doesn‚Äôt really care anymore with Baal not collaborating with Beidou and Kokomi just being one of the worst characters in the meta. I really don‚Äôt want to leave this game, but please LISTEN TO US AND DONT INGORE US. The players and content creators of this game deserve that much.

Way back in 2016 I started my first ‚Äúmain‚Äù game. Which was destiny 1. I had a lot of fun up until it died in September 2017. Destiny 2 is just bad so I‚Äôm moving on. Then I discovered warframe and it became my main game for 3 years! But burnout and sickness of the developers actions made me quit. Then on October 19th 2020 I found Genshin impact. I immediately fell in love with it, I explored for 8 hours a day and collected absolutely everything. I‚Äôm still playing to this day, I‚Äôm adventure rank 57 and I‚Äôm still using fischl to this day (got her October 31st) this game filled a void that other games had left and it‚Äôs absolutely amazing. Even if the anniversary rewards are disappointing (aside from the amazing web event that brought back so much nostalgia) I will love this game till it‚Äôs end. Im going to play it until it dies in 5-15 years and I‚Äôll be one of the few 1.0 veterans left by the time it dies. I love this game and I will continue to support it for many years to come. 
Sincerely 
-Syhyronica

It was very fun at the beginning, but once you progress more, you realize how much this game lacks. When you are in co op mode, the only thing you can do is fight. I don‚Äôt even mean domains either. Spiral abyss? Not in co op. Claim adventure rank rewards? Not in co op. Unlock statues? Not. In. Co op. When my friend had to do adventure rank quest, the trial was so long she lost complete battery before completing the electro hypostasis. Which is why I began grinding for her when she couldn‚Äôt. Over the past few weeks, I have been doing her commissions, but every time I have almost killed all 18 monsters? Hahahahaha- NO. The game decides to crash the exact moment I killed it. When I got back in, I had to do the commission. Again. And I had less health than when I tried the first time, and I froze to death in the dragon spine commission.

Enough ranting. Despite all the flaws, I guess the game is still fun, just lacking some features I would like. (As in, Let us do more things in co op please??) I still really enjoy the game, just maybe not as much as before. Please read and consider my review. Thank you HoYoverse!

How are you as a now global company going to base an entire region off Middleeastern/south Asian cultures and then fill it with paper white characters and orientalist designs? It‚Äôs embarrassing. I loved playing genshin and was looking forward to Sumeru since I saw how culturally rich liyue and inazuma were for example. What did I expect when the only dark skinned characters are kaeya and Xinyan and even Xinyan is stereotyped as being scary? Not to mention those characters are four stars and get no attention. Get it together. I know you have the funds and it isn‚Äôt hard to research. You did it with the previous regions and put in so much effort into Yunjin to accurately showcase Chinese opera. But it comes to Arabs and south Asians and suddenly you drop some stereotypes and call it a day? I saw the WEBTOON with how the one villain looked like a stereotypical Arab. That was the one time they made the character dark skinned, have an ethnic looking nose, and ‚Äútraditional clothing.‚Äù And he was the ‚Äúugly villain.‚Äù I regret ever spending money on this game. It‚Äôs a waste of your time. Even the endgame content itself is nonexistent. Hoyoverse never listens to its fans even after wanting to expand globally. Get it together. Im going to pull for kazuha and wait the ‚Äúsumeru‚Äù characters out.

Let me get this out of the way. First, YOU NEED A STRONG DEVICE to even run this game properly. iPhone 8 Plus and above will do the job. Sexond, the gacha, THE GACHA RATES ARE LOWER THAN FGO. Though you get a lot of currency to pull near the start, I recommend saving and not immediately rolling the gacha unless you‚Äôve already decided to pay up. Third, BE CAREFUL REROLLING, YOU MIGHT GET BANNED because bots are rerolling accounts which are being sold. Fourth THIS WILL BE GRINDY I played in the beta, and most other players will agree, it takes time and many resources to build teams, and I specifically said it with a plural word. Fifth, YOU WILL NEED MULTIPLE UNITS for end game since dungeons have different effects which will benefit specific characters. I think I mentioned most of the things that WILL RUIN most people‚Äôs experience, now for the good stuff. This is MiHoYo‚Äôs third major game, Honkai impact blew my expectations and standards for a mobile game, and I know this will do it again. I wouldn‚Äôt have imagined an open world mobile ga,e like this when I first downloaded Honkai. THIS CAN BE AN AMAZING GAME, it just needs time...

Genshin Impact is a wonderfully thought out game. Just by the loading screen I‚Äôm blown away. Every touch added to the game makes to so much more beautiful. I love the voice acting, the art style, the story and character designs. Each character looks like much time and effort was put into them, along with the story. Each frame of this game is something wonderful and just pure eye candy. Everything about Genshin Impact deserves a 5 star rating. I‚Äôve only just started the game, so I have no complaints what do ever. I have an iPhone 7, and it doesn‚Äôt lag, and the graphics are still very nice. Only thing problem are the cutscenes don‚Äôt load, but there is nothing anyone can really do about it. Like said I have an iPhone 7 so I don‚Äôt expect them to work. But even without the cutscenes the animations and overall the whole game makes up for it. I can tell you guys spent a lot of time into this game, and I thank you for having such dedication to make something so great. I wanna say you‚Äôre inspiring. Thank you for making this game.

My graphics before this 1.3 update have been great even set at medium as the game still looked very sharp. However, after this latest update, when I logged back in, the loading screen and in-game graphics look very weird. The graphics look blurry and are wavy and soft. Also, the pixels (don‚Äôt know what you would call it) surrounding the character and ground seem to slightly shake. The slight shaking and blurriness together makes me feel sick. I have tried toggling with the graphic settings and setting them back to what I had them at, but it still looks weird. I even deleted the app and re-downloaded it because I know that sometimes it will fix itself, but it has yet to do that. I am hoping that this is only temporary and that it does not have to do with my phone (IPhone 8, though still should work fine). Genshin Impact is a lovely game though, and I am really enjoying the storyline and adventure ! This was the only issue that I had, hence the 5 stars. Hopefully it will be fixed next maintenance.

I knew nothing of this game until my friend got into the beta. I‚Äôve been following it ever since. I couldn‚Äôt wait for its release. The game itself is fantastic. The music the story, sure it‚Äôs a BOTW clone but it does so much of its own thing that it really stands on its own two feet. This is my third‚Ä¶ and last‚Ä¶ attempt to play this game. 
The game starts out good with lots of things to do but‚Ä¶. Then it just peters out into glitchy lameness. 
Every time; once I advance to adventure rank 30 and world rank two; without fail, the characters start acting weird and become almost uncontrollable during battles as the view automatically changes to where you are staring off somewhere else as you are being pummeled by ‚Äúenemies‚Äù and can never get the viewpoint to face a battle or the character becomes so touchy while navigating precision steps that it does stupid things like jumping off cliffs for no reason other than I move forward and the character steps directly off the edge‚Ä¶.beside me NOT forward. 
The ruin guards‚Ä¶ why in the heck do they, in the middle of a battle with over half damage, just disappear to respawn at full power again? My character (Amber) maintains all the damage from the battle while having to beat the same exact ruin guard 3 times because it keeps respawning. 
I feel like the game is DESIGNED to ‚Äúcheat by glitches‚Äù once you reach a certain level.

this is probably one of my favorite games of all time, and definitely my favorite mobile game. the graphics are beautiful, the characters have unique designs, the character models look amazing, the fighting mechanics are fun, and the story is interesting & compelling. my only complaints are how often it crashes and how it lags sometimes? im aware that this is because the game has such a big file size (which is another issue, the game is 12 GB), so i have a suggestion for that; the voice lines in the game take up about 35% of the file size (yes, really), and most players only use 1-2 voiceover languages. it'd save a lot of space if players had the option to undownload the languages they didn't use; for new players, they could choose which voiceover languages to download and not download. i'd also like more ways for f2p players to farm primogems!!
tl;dr: amazing game, but not recommended for old phones or phones with less than 60 GB of storage. it's on ps4 and pc for free, so maybe get it there instead

The game is definitely worth getting. I recommend that the primogems (in game currency) be saved up until player level 20 or so just to get a grasp of what the game has to offer. It‚Äôs a gotcha game so summons are always pretty much rigged. You gotta be lucky or spend money until you hit their pity. I know the game is unfinished but they need to work on boss difficulty when four players are able to join in together in one world. The bosses at that point gets killed in 2 seconds and there‚Äôs pretty much nothing to do after spending your daily 160 resin. There‚Äôs not really any point in co op mode because the game itself is easy to cheese through solo. They need to focus on end game more than anything else. The only thing still keeping high level players playing are the mini events. Even so, they log in for a couple of days and finish the event. I hope this game isn‚Äôt just about a lot of characters and easy difficulty. Then it‚Äôll be another trash game like warframe. There‚Äôs no point in playing with no difficulty.

Let me start by saying that I am AR40 at the time of this review. The gameplay and story are amazing. The gacha aspect is a hit or miss with their low rates. However, once you get past the honeymoon phase of the first 20-30 hours, you will start to realize that miHoYo designed the game in a way that limits the player‚Äôs progression in every single way possible. From the smallest thing such as crafting ores to level up your weapons to spending resin for running dungeons and bosses to get ascension materials. They limit it all. It‚Äôs like they are trying their best to prevent players from progression in an OPEN WORLD game. Some might argue that the game is design as a mobile game. The funny thing is that playing on mobile is the hardest compared to playing on PS4 or PC. Furthermore, I have never seen a greedier company than miHoYo. They made $100 million (their entire production cost) in the first 2 weeks, yet they don‚Äôt have any sort of daily login rewards outside of the initial 7 days and when they do send out codes for rewards or host events they give you crumbs - not even enough for a single gacha pull. I hope to see big changes soon because they seem so inexperienced even though they have another game Honkai Impact for the past few years.

I would just like to start off by saying an amazingly well written and programmed game. I play both on PS4 and mobile but far prefer the console version. This game is a true open world game which is rare in games nowadays, with the amazing storyline and side quests. If I had any complaint about it, it would be about the fact that after level 20 leveling up gets increasingly difficult, repetitive and time consuming. Most side quests have to be found by just walking around I would like it more if you added more features to the map like possible side quests or explorable areas for more experience points to help with leveling. I also feel like there should be more mobs it gets a little repetitive fighting the same kinds on repeat though I understand since the game is fairly new. The last thing I would add is a monster dossier that‚Äôs probably one of my favorite thing about games I love being able to see all monsters I‚Äôve fought/unlocked and also a little backstory on them.

first off i just wanted to say this game is amazing. they really payed attention to detail with some things that have heavily peaked my interest, therefor making me want to play even more. although, i am only a mobile user! i play on my iPhone 8, before (a few months ago) i tried playing this but it just led me to a black and white screen. im not sure what fixed the issue because after i waited 2-3 months for it to be fixed and it started working after i get an update for my phone? anyways, the bugs i deal with on a daily basis NEEDS to be fixed because it‚Äôs the small things ruining my gameplay. sometimes, when i‚Äôm fighting monsters, it lags a whole lot and the day switches to night, and the night switches to day. that happens about 3-4 times. it‚Äôs really annoying. whenever it‚Äôs raining for me, my game lags and crashes. and everytime i go into monstatd, the graphics become blocky, and i have to restart the game in order for it to be good again. amongst all these small bugs, i still enjoy the game. but PLEASE please please fix this. thank you

When I first saw this game, I mocked it, failing to see what was special about it. It looked like an attempt to connect an anime artstyle to an open world rpg. Months later, here I am practically addicted to this game. The world of Genshin Impact is such an immersive and enjoyable experience I‚Äôm sure most people will be able to find something they‚Äôll enjoy. There is a solid story with great characters, a beautiful world featuring great scenery and music, enjoyable battle that‚Äôs easy to get used to, and gorgeous characters you can potentially add to your party and grow stronger with. Yes, this is a gacha game, but once you start playing, it‚Äôll hardly feel like a gacha game. A lot of people put too much emphasis on the gacha aspect of the game, and end up spoiling for themselves everything that makes the game great. You needn‚Äôt focus entirely on the wishes, the game has so much more to offer. If you‚Äôre looking for a great game to dive into, then I‚Äôd recommend giving Genshin Impact a try. 
p.s. ‚≠êÔ∏èBennett is absolutely amazing ‚≠êÔ∏è

i‚Äôve been playing the game for a year now.. at first it was wonderful, i‚Äôd play it during class and any time that i could, i took a small break because it got boring, then an uprise of players joined and i started again. we got this game on the leaderboards and still got nothing. i get that ‚Äúthey don‚Äôt owe us anything‚Äù but we‚Äôre the ones paying their bills and Mihoyo does nothing but spit on us and smush us into the ground. your gatcha percentages are terrible, your game is repetitive and terrible(feels more like a chore that i have to play to have a 0.6% chance to get a good character, that might not even be the event character), and you are the most selfish and greedy company ever. you‚Äôve proven you know what 1st year anniversary gifts to give through Honkai, and yet you give us the rewards we got during the lantern rite event. I have put in about 40 hours of gameplay so far. Haven‚Äôt spent a dime but I have quite a few characters unlocked from playing the game. Sure you could easily dump some money in the game to get the characters you want but they give you plenty of currency in game. I find myself making a ten times pull every other day at this point. I know early on this will be easier to do with the rewards in game for the launch but you don‚Äôt have to spend a dime to enjoy this game. The graphics are great the story and lore has been fantastic. There‚Äôs so much to learn and the characters you talk to fill you in on a lot of the worlds background. The voice acting has been awesome and the soundtrack is so good I have to play with my sound on always. A year or two ago, I was suffering from absolute boredom. My friends, who were also suffering, tried finding games we could all play together. We met some people online via some social networking apps, and were introduced to Genshin Impact, the game with walking- no, floating- emergency food. We all quickly got addicted, but had to take a very, VERY long break due to school. During that period of time, we eventually forgot the game even existed, and ended up not playing for many months. I eventually got back into it after discovering some of my favorite influencers played it, and started grinding. The wishing system and animation is great, the characters are adorable( and, if I may, hot), and the player base is filled with awesome people. Building characters is relatively easy if you just search up how or if you know how to, but the game can sometimes be tiring. I look forward to playing with you all for many updates to come.

- AR. 58 - playing since day 1

Honestly, the only thing I look for in a game are good graphics and design. For me, genshin is the model of that right now. Yes, I know there‚Äôs problems in the game, like any other game, and yes, I would like more endgame content, an expanded co-op feature, more resin, and a better artifact system (My suggestion is to make artifact domains similar to talent and weapon ascension domains. For example, make Emblem of Severed Fate on Monday, Wednesday, Friday, and Sunday & make Shimenawa‚Äôs Reminiscence on Tuesday, Thursday, Saturday, and Sunday. Sundays will allow you to choose which artifact set you want. This will allow players to farm artifacts the same way since you can make condensed resin on off-days while removing a layer of RNG). However, I am fine with the state of the game right now because the quality of almost all the content (hangout events are a little boring, but it‚Äôs such a small part of the game that I don‚Äôt mind) that comes out amazes me.

I love this game so much and have been playing since the very beginning. I didn‚Äôt really notice this issue in the beginning because i‚Äôm aware of the different cultures being offered to us and how it‚Äôs less than likely for there to be large groups of darker skin characters or poc. But given that we are about to receive an update that gives us a new chunk of world that explore (a part of the world that is HEAVILY influenced by south asian / Egyptian culture) the lack of diversity is SO disappointing. My expectations for this company are already low but if you‚Äôre going to pull inspiration from a culture SO diverse and a culture that includes skin tones of all shades, you need to match that with the characters that are playable to us as well. There are only 3 TAN (no darker than just tan‚Ä¶) playable characters that I know of and none of which are 5 stars‚Ä¶ compared to the 50+ characters that are pale or white. It‚Äôs so disappointing because it seems like something people have been complaining about a lot recently and we were still met with no improvement for Sumeru‚Ä¶ I really hope there are darker tones characters added to this game in the future otherwise I fear I‚Äôll have to put it away.

Ok so honestly this game is fantastic. The story line is enthralling and fresh. Not to mention the amazing art quality and art. I also never fail to be impressed by the writers. Everywhere you look you can find little snippets of lore and mythology. It has a little bit of something for everyone. But, it‚Äôs missing on key element; it‚Äôs incredibly difficult for casual gamers to get into. If you don‚Äôt have the time to get on almost every single day and do your commissions and battle pass it‚Äôs hard to collect the materials that you need to advance in the game. From Liyue to inazuma there is an insane leap in difficulty. And the fact is, if you didn‚Äôt invest either time or money or both into the game it is hard to advance the story. Not that a game shouldn‚Äôt have some level of difficulty but I think that it would benefit from being a little kinder for players who enjoy the story line but aren‚Äôt super into the experience of mindlessly grinding for materials or studying game mechanics. 

That‚Äôs my two cents on the game. I love it to pieces but it stands to improve in a few areas.

I‚Äôve always loved fantasy games and open world so when I found this game I was ECSTATIC! I‚Äôve been waiting for a really long time to receive my church mission call and this wonderful game has helped me pass the time. Yes, it is a gacha game which does make obtaining certain preferred artifacts and equipment frustrating at times, but this almost adds to the game‚Äôs charm. There‚Äôs ALWAYS something to do whether that be exploring, upgrading weapons and artifacts and talents, gathering materials, advancing the storyline, hidden or side quests, helping other players in co-op, daily commissions and weekly bounties and requests. Even when you‚Äôve done all you need or want to do in a day, there‚Äôs always more you‚Äôre able to do the next day as your resin replenishes, commissions reset, and expeditions for materials are completed. 
I absolutely love this game and can‚Äôt wait to see what the developers have in store for us in the future! Thanks for reading my review; I hope it was helpful!

It‚Äôs a great game. Like many reviews say, it‚Äôs a free to roam and you sometimes get to choose between different dialogues. At lvl 16, you can play with friends(cross platform too.) you can wish/summon for new characters. If you get a character again, you use them to upgrade your characters constellation. I have seen some people complain about not being able to get a lot of characters. After a while it‚Äôs a bit harder to earn primogems, but only if you don‚Äôt play enough or do any daily commitions. The game is also a gacha related game. You get a percentage chance of getting something. So after so many wishes your gunna get someone. Once you get to lvl 30, you level slow but with inazuma out rn, it shouldn‚Äôt be too slow anymore. AND THE GRAPHICS ARE JUST *CHEFS KISS.* I mean they put a lot into the designs, maps and scenery. Cut scenes are also so pretty. Sometimes I forget that it‚Äôs not reality and sit there sad because it‚Äôs all just a game. But def recommended. Mihoyo makes really good games. The only thing I dislike it the resin and primogems

ill preface by saying i absolutely love this game. the lore, characters and graphics are the reason i continue playing. i along with many others feel like we got a slap in the face in turn for our support because of the anniversary rewards and not to mention its super predatory gacha system that feeds into gambling addictions. at worst it can take a couple hundred to get a character you want, the banners feed of your FOMO. its a shame we are treated this way because this companies audience are the reason they have reached such high places both in status and monetary gain, and by implementing a lower shop value im sure many more people would be inclined to spend. i truly love this game and i wish they took things like the anniversary as seriously as we do. players are just big money signs to them, or free marketing (as we saw when they tried preying on artists and cosplayers.) i am grateful theyre trying to patch things up now, but it still hurt knowing they truly didnt care like we did; it felt like when someone close to you forgets its your birthday or something lol.

I understand that many people right now are very mad at Genshin for no anniversary rewards but put yourself in there shoes you know how much money they would lose if they have given people what they expect? People were saying at least 40 pulls. Yes I understand they gave us nothing but they have absolutely no obligations on giving you anything. They could delete your account for all they care be thankful it was nothing and not something ‚Äúworse‚Äù (like changing my beautiful Venti) It may sound greedy of them to not give us anything, (which In my opinion at least they may have given us a 10 pull) and that they made a ton of money of certain characters but they need the money to pay the programmers, designers, actors, dubbed actors, and new updates, funding for other stuff like conventions or advertising. So before you go on complaining you got nothing think back and step into there shoes for once and see both sides of the situation.

Ive been playing this game since February and have invested around three hundred dollars in the game. There are many things I like about genshin, but many more things I dislike about its company, Mihoyo. Mihoyo, even compared to other gacha games of lesser popularity and content, is a greedy company and this has been proven with the recent anniversary rewards.

I‚Äôm very active in the fandom and we were all very excited about the anniversary rewards, but mihoyo has failed our expectations. It‚Äôs been highly successful yet the most mihoyo has decided we deserve is a single ten pull. Some members of the fandom had lofty expectations such as getting a free features five star in addition to weapons and even more wishes, while other thought that the least mihoyo would do was simply give us a standard banner five star of our choice, similar to how they give a limited choice of S Rank Valkyries in some of their special events in mihoyo‚Äôs other game Honkai 3rd. This was the minimum of what I expected from mihoyo, especially since in earlier events such as the Lantern Rite event we were able to get a choice of Liyue four star while also getting a free ten pull.

I have other complaints, but this is the most notable as if recent times

The game looks stunning and has fun gameplay. There are daily rewards and there seems to always be something to do even after finishing all your quests! I‚Äôm impressed that a game like this runs well on mobile aside from somewhat frequent crashes and occasional fps drops. The only negative is that the in app purchases are expensive. Whenever I teleport to mondstadt or Liyue on mobile, the game crashes. I tried teleporting right outside mondstadt and then entering the city from the bridge, however when I go inside the city things aren‚Äôt fully loaded and I crash. However, on PC my game never crashes :)

Edit: This is not much of a mobile game anymore unless you have an iPad. With each update I have to delete apps and photos to try to make space. I enjoy the convenience of the phone but it is no longer playable because it requires too much storage.
