Trust me Genshin Impact is a great game, it has a beautiful landscape, the lore and story are amazing, and the characters and their designs are irresistible. But the game is not for casual players. If you want a game that‚Äôs easy to play and where it‚Äôs relatively easy to gain levels this game might not be for you. It‚Äôs is also quite aggravating to play this game without spending money but it is doable. All around this game is pretty good but there are still some bugs and voice over flaws in the beginning and it takes a lot of patience to progress in the story, main leveling system, and character leveling. If you want an immersive game that can last you for a while you will probably like Genshin. The update schedule is every 5-6 weeks but don‚Äôt rush through because then you‚Äôll be bored for a while. The character attainment system is very addicting but don‚Äôt get your hopes up because you still might not get the person you want. If anyone reads this I hope it helped! Have a good day!

Initial impressions are very high but like my favorite gum it loses steam quite fast and you end up hitting a wall of grinding and tedium in order to progress. Have no fear just buy the monthly pass or spend money on a battle pass you might say? Both of these things don‚Äôt actually compensate you with progress within the game or speed up the character progression system. Even if you do end up pulling a 5* character later the resources needed to max them out make it feel like less of a good thing and more of a sinking dread of choosing between progressing and gearing or wasting thousands of resin leveling up a new character. 

Mihoyo is this game a collectors game or not? What‚Äôs the reward in spending any money here. I‚Äôve never played a game where I‚Äôve spent so much and gotten so little, I understand there‚Äôs not a lot of content because it‚Äôs new but this monetization strategy might be successful initially but will drive off spenders like me because unless I keep spending I basically have to grind endlessly just to hit a pity banner. 

Until the game improves and they make more significant changes to the resin and summon system id stay away.

I hope someone out there will see this some day, the game is absolutely stunning, in my opinion it‚Äôs on par with breath of wild, and it‚Äôs as close to breath of wild as you can get on mobile but, (and I‚Äôm probably the only person here with this issue) I was raised a devout Christian, and I can‚Äôt play games with elements of magic or dark magic in them, so I‚Äôve never been able to play a game that‚Äôs as visually stunning as this, because of the sorcery and witchcraft which in my religion and culture is strongly banned. I hope one day someone will make a mobile open world game, as beautiful as this, maybe with technology as the ‚Äúsuper powers‚Äù of the characters or mecha monsters, horizon zero dawn had this concept and I still couldn‚Äôt play because I have Xbox, not play stationüòî it would make me so happy if one day, a game as beautiful and expansive as this, with legendary items and characters, could be made without utilizing magic or bloody gory violence. I think such a game would be able to increase its customer base to no end

First off, I haven‚Äôt played the game too much, but from what I have played and continue to play the game is just amazing, the graphics, frame rate and dialogue are truly top notch. And with elements like the open world and polished combat you are sure to have loads of fun! I also want to address the negative reviews, pretty much ignore almost all of them, those reviews are mainly talking about how the game wont open or doesn‚Äôt have controller support. To that I would, chill out. The game has been out for like 2 days and I experienced the same issue with logging in, but after a little while I was able to get in and start playing. It makes no sense to me when people rate a games quality based on the fact they couldn‚Äôt get into it. I understand it‚Äôs frustrating, but that‚Äôs kind of a weird thing to give the game a 1 star when you literally just need to wait a small amount to play. Overall the game takes a lot from BoTW and I‚Äôed say if you download this you‚Äôll absolutely love it!

I been playing for around 20 hours now and I can say that Genshin Impact is probably the best open world RPG you can get. It‚Äôs similar to breath of the wild where you can interact with many of the world‚Äôs elements. The graphic is insanely well done and the storyline is exceptional. Game like this are free because they rely on the Gacha system to profit. There‚Äôs nothing wrong with this because the developers put in an insane amount of work and we can support them by purchasing stuff. However, if you are free to play know that in the latter stages, it will get increasingly difficult to progress without spending. I Benn playing for many hours now and haven‚Äôt reach that stage yet. So rest assured that even if you are F2P, you can have a very good time as Genshin impact focused on solo progress and PvE instead of PvP. I spent $20 on the game and progression would still be normal if you didn‚Äôt. Overall this game seems very balance and it‚Äôs clear that the developers put a lot of effort in making this game.

This game is super fun and I enjoy it a ton but there are two things that for some reason annoy me, 1st off the primogem situation, I have to farm hours just to make enough for one wish which I guess is fine but I wish they would just gift us some more sometimes and give a little more after some of the quests like the dragon spine in the mountains one, IT TOOK FOREVER to do that quest and only got 60 gems, which isn‚Äôt close to at least one wish, I know they need to make money because this game is free but dang gift us a little more in the mail or something. And the 2nd thing which is very controversial but the weird kinda racist outtake on some of the game play like the hilichurls, from readings online they seem to base them off people of African culture or something related to that which is very weird and not so go great, I wish they would address the issue and figure out a way to change sometime about it, but I can‚Äôt magically make that happen.
But yes this game is great in general just some of the issues related to that.

I remember when I first started to play this in 2020 hard to believe it‚Äôs been two YEARs I‚Äôve longed on just about every day, I usually don‚Äôt get attached to games but now I‚Äôm like if I didn‚Äôt have this game in my life I wouldn‚Äôt be apart of such an amazing community and not only that but everything about this game is just amazing! Couldn‚Äôt have played a better game in my life, the truth is that I have been in search of a game like this for a while and thanks to this game I have come to the end of my search! Dam hard to believe I‚Äôve been playing this for two years! I remember playing this on Christmas Day trying to get that last check point and hope that my phone battery doesn‚Äôt die or worse take me back to my Home Screen‚Ä¶I had the iPhone 8 which I believe if you have the iPhone X and up you should be able to play this game without issues, I got the iPhone 13 now and it works great! This game has brought me and my friends closer

I was introduced to this game by a few of my friends. I had heard about Genshin impact, but never really felt compelled to try. When I finally did, I was quickly hooked, and I have been playing for almost a year now. The lore and storyline in this game is GREAT, and I love how deep it goes! The fighting aspect is super fun, and one thing that I love about it is that EVERY character can be amazing. In some of the other games I‚Äôve played, you‚Äôre sort of forced to play specific characters because you can‚Äôt get through the content otherwise. In Genshin, if you put time and effort into ANY character, they can become powerful. A lot of people say that it gets boring late game, and I get that. There‚Äôs not as much to do once you‚Äôve explored everything and done all the quests, but I still have fun running around and doing weird challenges. Genshin is a fantastic game that has helped me get through a tough year, and I can‚Äôt wait for future updates!

When you start out its great, the world is really immersive and you get a a lot of things to do and have fun with, especially for a mobile game. 
I‚Äôm AR57 now. Things have kinda took a large turn from there.
Late game besides the every now and then events and weeklies it just gets boring, and practically feels like a chore, and there‚Äôs really only one place to get currency for the gacha system which is a dungeon (abyss) that to be honest is practically impossible once you get to the later floors that are the ones that give you primos again, not to mention the buffs that you get really are just to urge you to spend on their gacha banners.
And don‚Äôt get me started on the lack of diversity, yes the regions are based on certain areas of the world but that doesn‚Äôt give excuse for only TWO playable characters of 50 overall to be TAN. Especially with the new region coming out based on desert and forest areas around the middle east/south asia there‚Äôs no excuse if the vast majority of the characters will be paper white üíÄ
If you wanna get into the game, great! But stay F2P, spending at least for me is definitely not worth it anymore when nowadays Hoyoverse is just making characters powercreeped over eachother.

After watching an ad, I got interested immediately because of how greatly presented it was. The gameplay? Amazing! Great graphics, voice acting(Japanese dub, mmmm), effects, animations and everything else is as awesome.
 They certainly made NPCs and playable characters have a lasting impression as they can play a role in a quest and interact with each other letting us see the social connection between characters more deeply. 
Even the gameplay too, you can choose to do anything: Exploring, defeating bosses, clearing domains, fight enemies, do commissions, do quests,...There are even random events or small tasks given by various NPCs, it makes the game more interesting, you do not have to stick onto the plot too much, you don't have to follow the same route.
 Overall, Genshin Impact is a truly amazing game according to me, it may take a bit of patience and time to grind and unlock characters, it's a luck-based system, keep on trying and you'll have it.(there's no good characters or artifacts, it's just your skill that would determine things)

I've been playing since launch, and am currently AR 57. All the positives you hear about this game are true. The lore, atmosphere, music, combat, everything is great. Unfortunately, all of this is rendered null by an extremely greedy company that has consistently alienated and recently, have tried to SILENCE its own playerbase. Instead, the new content they put out hand us nothing but scraps, and endgame content is already barren as-is. They refuse to listen to our feedback, and as of the current 1 year anniversary event, refuse to give us any kind of worthwhile reward, especially when compared to other gacha games and are currently undergoing damage control by outright deleting complaints off of various social media. Not only that, but the game as a whole is taking a turn for the worse by constantly releasing new characters that have subpart/undertested kits that lack proper synergy, which is incredibly important for this game's combat system. Once again, instead of listening to our feedback about this, we're constantly ignored and basically told to "take it or leave it." If that's their philosophy, trust me, before you get in too deep, leave it.

Hi, I have been playing genshin for a long, long time and at this point I‚Äôm on AR 50. I cannot express how much this game has helped me, through even in real life situations. From Diluc talking in riddles, to Paimon complaining about everything in her way, this game is hilarious and I even wish I could spend more money on the game, despite it not being a ‚Äòpay to win‚Äô. Then again, the fact that Genshin is not a ‚Äòpay to win‚Äô is very rare for gacha games if you will, and this makes me happy to see. Most of the things in the game depend on chance, like getting certain characters. You can‚Äôt just go to Paimon‚Äôs bargains, swipe a card, and kill Stormterror or get Diluc to level 100. In Genshin, you have to work for what you have. May I also add, that the character designs are adorable, and they keep getting better and better! The animation is the smoothest I‚Äôve ever seen in a game, and I cannot even fathom how hard the team worked to create, and are improving, Genshin Impact.

I‚Äôve been poking at Genshin Impact the last couple of days. I love the graphics! The character system is really fun too. I love being able to swap between the main character and others to combine elemental powers and find new ways to take down enemies. Being able to climb every where and glide is a lot of fun too. However I will say the mobile controls are a little annoying at times. 

I love that you can summon more heroes to fill out your team. It‚Äôs tempting to use real money to keep pulling for a hero, however it‚Äôs nice that you can earn in game currency to do the same. I look forward to seeing what new heroes they bring to the game.

I haven‚Äôt been able to find anything that suggest this game can use a controller. I play on an iPad Pro and have a lot of space to navigate, but I find when running around the world it‚Äôs hard to pan the camera around with out hitting other abilities or sometimes my thumb doesn‚Äôt register when I‚Äôm tapping on powers to activate. If developers could add controller support I‚Äôd give it a 5 star.

I love this game and have played it for about a year.  I would give this 5 stars except for an issue that I find very unfortunate.  Rewards collection. 

Be careful when looting, their is not an auto loot setting and you can accidentally leave a dungeon without your rewards.  I recently lost high level loot after barely finishing a dungeon.  I needed that loot.  Dungeons at different levels have different ways to collect rewards.  I imagine this occurs because of different devs working on different parts of game play.  Even for something that appears as auto delivery loot often requires you hit a ‚Äúconfirm‚Äù key to get it.  That‚Äôs what happened to me - why can I leave without my rewards?  I didn‚Äôt play it just to look at the rewards.  That loot should also auto deliver to my mailbox as tons of other games do.  

Developers please take a look at providing a consistent structure to rewards collection- it would be a huge help. Then I can focus on actually playing the game!

So I am officially addicted to this game. So much replay ability is very good in a game and this game feels like it should cost money, and deserves a 5 star review. However, as with many games, there is also a problem. The problem with this one is that it fails to run well on lower end devices. Don‚Äôt get me wrong, I am still addicted to this game. The constant crashes and massive lag spikes don‚Äôt deplete that much from the game itself, as they barely ever screw you over. I wasn‚Äôt actually going to write a review, until the lag spikes interrupted my gameplay. At the Luhua Pool, there is a quest where you have to help a man find his art supplies. However, my lag spike did not load that character. Or the door to the temple. Seeing as there was no door, I walked into the temple, without doing the quest and a supreme lack of oversight. I claimed the chests when they loaded and teleported out. Now I attempted the quest just because I need XP. So here I am, an idiot who opened a door with no chests. So now I can‚Äôt complete the quest. Thanks, game.
Please fix this I need it badly.

The game and it‚Äôs company definitely has shown previously that it can be respectful and interesting when taking inspiration from actual cultures around the world, which further helps the feeling of diversity through its stories. Each nation is rich in lore, and characters are able to have personalities and backstories that can keep you playing. 

However, with the soon to be release of Sumeru, a glaring problem has shown itself to be the very thing I compliment the game for: taking inspiration from actual cultures. Because it‚Äôs one thing to research and explore peoples cultures to use it in a fantasy setting to show the beauty and history of it, and another entirely to then remove any ethnic features from your characters and also make one of them a straight up stereotype of a greedy merchant. This game has been something I‚Äôve followed for a year and a half, and while I was aware at the start that Genshin had a colorism problem I‚Äôm surprised it‚Äôs gone this far when I really shouldn‚Äôt have been. I‚Äôm not even really excited for Sumeru to drop at this point. I‚Äôm more just waiting to see the fanbase‚Äôs reaction and what‚Äôs going to happen after.

While I was reading the reviews I saw a lot of people saying ‚Äúthis is a P2W game!‚Äù To all those people, I wish you would take a good look at the game. This is a game that is still going. If you are joining late then I can get why you would think it is P2W because of all of the characters. BUT THINK ABOUT IT! Some of the BEST teams out there are made of ALL 4* characters! They don‚Äôt even have to be maxed or have the best artifacts. Those videos that tell you which builds are great are just telling you their recommendations, NOT a FACT that they are 100% always best with those 5* weapons and artifacts. Also, to the people who gave bad reviews because of glitching and other technical issues, please check your storage. I used to have a 16GB Ipad (which was really old) and when I tried Genshin it was pretty laggy, so it may be your storage. Sorry if anyone read all this and had no issues, but this was just really bothering me.

I started this game in version 1.1, so I daresay I know a lot about it.

The lore in this game is PHENOMENAL. I‚Äôve spent hours upon hours just theorizing and exploring the world of Teyvat to learn more about the mystery of what, exactly, is happening, and who the real heroes are. The game provides just enough information to draw real conclusions and make exploration rewarding, but still reveal major bombshells in future updates. I cannot emphasize how interesting the universe and main story is. Even limited time events like both dragonspine events, the unreconcilced stars event, and the golden apple archipelago have been packed with information, stories, and memorable moments.

. The writing for many characters can be surprisingly subtle and nuanced. It‚Äôs almost as if the game offers multiple levels of understanding everything, making the game easy for very casual or young gamers and still engaging for people who love to analyze and break apart stories. 

The environment is utterly gorgeous and only gets better and better. Exploration can feel magical. Even after well over a year of playing, I still regularly discover new things. I haven‚Äôt lost that feeling of excitement, joy, and novelty. (I think the best way to get this feeling is not to play TOO much! You‚Äôll get tired of anything if you play it constantly.)

Overall, I didn‚Äôt enter this game expecting to adore it, but here I am. Looking forward to what else Mihoyo has to offer!

Besides the anniversary drama currently, I would like to throw in that this is a free game and you don‚Äôt even have to play it‚Ä¶ some people act like they have to play it when that‚Äôs not good at all. Having that mindset only gets you stressed. It‚Äôs ok to take breaks if you‚Äôre upset about the rewards or just tired in general. Onto my review, I absolutely love Genshin impact. I don‚Äôt like the gacha aspect, I really only participate just for, like everyone does, the characters I love, but that‚Äôs not my main focus. I think the main things I love about Genshin is the co-op experiences, the story, the scenery, etc. For me, it‚Äôs like an escape. It‚Äôs unfortunate that the community has resorted to review bombing not only Mihoyo‚Äôs apps, but other apps that aren‚Äôt even associated with Mihoyo. They‚Äôre making the community look like fools. For me personally, I really could care less about the rewards as long as we‚Äôre getting something. So Happy Anniversary Genshin impact and I look forward to the years to come <3

Genshin Impact is a wonderful but ultimately deeply flawed game. It will enthrall new players with exciting world to explore and story to follow. Up until they reach the end of the main quest to discover there really isn‚Äôt much to do. The content you can expect at that point is limited to about 20min of gameplay in the form of grinding and dailies. At which point you‚Äôre basically done. The developers are stuck in a mindset of overly focusing on short term events which add some new boss or piece of content temporarily. The problem being that it doesn‚Äôt actually net add more content, and poof it‚Äôs gone. Any other developer would keep the exiting boss fights and mini games to cumulatively add to the permanent end game of things to do. But not MiHoYo. It would appear in an attempt to pull players in with FOMO they are handicapping the experience for players. A new player today would have not experienced nearly half of the new content that had been released over the span of a year because all of that content was temporary. That‚Äôs why after a year the game continues to feel empty.

I absolutely love and adore this game and the characters. I‚Äôve been playing since launch and have spent quite a bit of money on this game. It was fun to watch it grow and get the appreciation I thought it deserved at launch. 

However, after one year of ups and downs with the game. The anniversary for the game is finally here and do you know what the company decided to do to show their appreciation? They give out 10 intertwined fates (Not even close to a guaranteed 5 star) and use the communities creative talents to promote their game even more. It‚Äôs honestly just so sad and disgusting because we‚Äôve had other events that have felt more anniversary like than this one. Heck, even at launch they gave like 40 wishes!! And after a year of success, Mihoyo has turned greedy. I won‚Äôt be spending any more money on this game because Mihoyo needs to show appreciate for their player base and community.  Giving away a standard 5 star character or weapon would not have even put a dent in their profits, it‚Äôs ridiculous. 

On top of all the outrage from the player base about this hella underwhelming (understatement) anniversary, Mihoyo chooses to stay quiet amidst of it all and not even respond to their player base.

The game is really fun. There‚Äôs lots of places to explore, a story behind every character, and you can play with your friends. But there are some things that bother me.
First, the game takes up a lot of storage if you play on mobile. Second, sometimes the game gets really laggy, but it‚Äôs not really a problem for me. Third, if you really want a specific character, you‚Äôre going to have to work hard, complete a lot of quests, and save up your primogems to even get a CHANCE to unlock a character. Fourth, even though this game is free to play and you don‚Äôt have to pay real money, it gets annoying when the only option you have left is to pay money for in-game currency to buy things. I‚Äôve never spent any money on this game, but I just wish there were easier ways to get wishes.
If you‚Äôre thinking of playing this game, I would recommend it. There‚Äôs some flaws, but this game can be challenging and fun at the same time.
Sorry for the long review, but have a good day!

The game is amazing the graphics the story is just amazing but they are issues. Once u reach ar 45 or higher the game does get boring and no longer fun but some might disagree. 2) the wishing system is a problem more likely the weapon banner. Adding the the path systems is extremely useless tbh like the system was fine before WHY CHANGE IT INTO SOME MORE EXPENSIVE like I know your trying make a profit an all but add this new system into the weapon banner is just you asking for more people to spend on it for your own greed. 3) going back to the weapon banner system u at the same time don‚Äôt even give good or enough rewards to make up for the your useless weapon system if u gave some actually good rewards then maybe  the weapon banner wouldn‚Äôt be useless and even if it still was useless you giving good rewards would make up for it. Sorry but I‚Äôm giving this a solid 3 if u want higher rates then remove your useless weapon system.

My name is Yoshikage Kira. I‚Äôm 33 years old. My house is in the northeast section of Morioh, where all the villas are, and I am not married. I work as an employee for the Kame Yu department stores, and I get home every day by 8 PM at the latest. I don‚Äôt smoke, but I occasionally drink. I‚Äôm in bed by 11 PM, and make sure I get eight hours of sleep, no matter what. After having a glass of warm milk and doing about twenty minutes of stretches before going to bed, I usually have no problems sleeping until morning. Just like a baby, I wake up without any fatigue or stress in the morning. I was told there were no issues at my last check-up. I‚Äôm trying to explain that I‚Äôm a person who wishes to live a very quiet life. I take care not to trouble myself with any enemies, like winning and losing, that would cause me to lose sleep at night. That is how I deal with society, and I know that is what brings me happiness. Although, if I were to fight I wouldn‚Äôt lose to anyone.

Genshin Impact is so successful and deserves that all, I play the game non-stop and can never put down my phone! I love it so much and the game is just amazing. The open world to go anywhere is amazing, with the sights and the realistic touches, along keeping its own design aswell is so smart. The fact the combat makes sense and is easy to do is AMAZING!! The game is so easily good and difficult, it‚Äôs not too easy but not too difficult. Knowing I can build a dream team is awesome too, but as saying that‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs way too difficult. I have tried for almost a year now to get the latest characters but they leave too fast, and are way to hard to get. No matter how much you sit and play the game, it‚Äôs like it‚Äôs pushing you to keep playing or spend money.

Genshin has its flaws but it‚Äôs an awesome game, and the fact you need to work hard is the point, to strategize and be hardworking for what you want! It‚Äôs a 10/10 game and I definitely recommend you play it!

I‚Äôve been playing this game, as of today, for six months now and I‚Äôve never gotten bored.  The story is interesting, the characters are wonderful‚Äîeverything about the game is absolutely stunning. I‚Äôm Adventure Rank 54, soon to be 55, and there‚Äôs still a lot to do, even though I‚Äôm an endgame player.  This game has kept me hooked for hours on end, with something different to do everyday.  Whether that be farming for artifacts, ascension materials, doing the spiral abyss, exploring, or doing quests, I never feel like there‚Äôs nothing to do.  Though the wish system is a little tedious at times, at least you have something to look forward to as you finish your commissions, explore, do quests, etc.  I now have level 90 Kazuha, Tartaglia, and Diluc, and I‚Äôm still building them, even though I‚Äôve maxed out their levels.  

Anyway, this game is wonderful and it has inspired so many people, including myself.  Keep up the great work, Mihoyo! :)

I love playing Genshin; the characters are amazing, the gameplay is satisfying and the art looks beautiful. My problem comes with everything else; barely any quality of life changes since the games release, no new end game content added but plenty of other filler stuff (teapot aka housing, new RNG based rewards to bang your head against and new characters that you can‚Äôt even use if you‚Äôre new to the game) and stingy business practices with outside game events leave a bad taste in my mouth whenever I‚Äôm not playing the game. If I had a full team of the characters I wanted and I could use them in some fun content that shows what a good action rpg this game is I would give five stars easily but as it stands I‚Äôve been playing since the release casually and I have a few half built teams with bad rng artifacts. That means I struggle with content at my world level and am constantly grinding for materials to level up, not a very fun part of the game. If you love gambling you rewards and constantly grinding the same few fights every day download away but unless some things are fixed I will not change this review.

literally played since day one done most almost all events, the game itself is decent at best after the honey moon phase. The game play loops get boring after a while with events just recycling the same ideas over and over again, daily login, mine, resin, and i forget the last one cause its all so boring, farm artifacts because you can never get the ones you want, and roll the stats for it, this whole game is a cash grab after you run out of story, and the only end game content is the abyss, which gets boring to do. Events feel like a chore after a while just to make the game feel new or relevant, but honestly the game just feels like its a giant chore and with story quests being tied to semi monthly updates and content it loses its magic every update fast after while. Then the anniversary just shows they dont care and want money from us with a 10 wish pull item and some scraps of resources. Its honestly laughable at how little they gave back to the community after a year of supporting them. Its been a grindy ride but honestly the game is boring to me and the company that runs it is greedy, even with buffing weak characters so whatever i‚Äôll look for a new game or something.

By far the best game i have ever touched on mobile, as a matter a fact the best game anyone could play right now. The time put into the environment, the characters, the elements reacting with each other and acting as balance in Tevyat, and the gameplay which is the amazing cherry on top.

Despite being a gacha game, this game pushes all factors of pay to win progression into the trash as the free to play route is absolutely rewarding. Each character you are rewarded with performs in different ways which will help you complete missions, the story and even the treacherous endgame we‚Äôve all worked our way to, Spiral Abyss.

Veterans at games in which they are pitted against AI and hard bosses which require the use of the 7 elements, utilizing your surroundings and building teams that will conquer even the strongest of enemies, but it is not without a challenge. 

As a regular player, adventure rank 49, I have never put more hours into any video game as much as this game. The music and the feeling of being in the world of Teyvat is so immersive, and the weather blending in with the amazing soundtrack. I get lost and end up adventuring just to open chests and run around to find places to capture amazing photos and moments. This is a game which holds a place for everyone, and it‚Äôs a wonderful journey. And the best part is it‚Äôs just the beginning.

Thank you everyone at Mihoyo, for making this game, it really was the best thing 2020 has brought for me.

I do really like this game. The art style combined with solid mechanics and an interesting story make it worth playing alone. That said, there are things that do need to be fixed. Early on they throw a lot of free stuff at you (as most f2p games do) and there is a decent amount of content to keep you occupied. The problems start once you hit adventure rank 20 or so. After awhile the game literally becomes pay to play. You have the energy to do a max of 6 missions (depending on the mission, could be as low as 2.) you are basically given a choice, save the daily gems you get to do a free 10 summon once a month, or use them to get more energy so you're able to upgrade and level up characters and gear. Despite this I do really enjoy the game and will continue to play, but if the current resin system doesn't change or they don't add other free ways to just play the game then I will be abandoning the game. Definitely worth checking out for now. Without a few changes in the future I would definitely say pass and spare your wallet.

I usually hate games like these because they require skill to play, but this game requires no skill. The amount of serotonin I got from this is amazing. I especially love the amount of voice acting in this game along with the graphics. I also think it‚Äôs a very nice feature to have a time and weather cycle going even if you‚Äôre sitting idly by. You also get to cook foods and ingredients with items you have collected on the ground or have bought with the game currency which I think is a very nice side feature. I do have a question though, I noticed that we get to form bonds and friendships with the characters but does it go any farther than that? If so I think that‚Äôs really interesting. I‚Äôve been playing since yesterday and I‚Äôm already in love with this game, the plot, and the characters. If you‚Äôre reading this to decide if you want to play the game or not, I highly suggest it. It‚Äôs not a pay to win game, in fact I don‚Äôt think there are any in-app purchases though you‚Äôll have to check.

This game is AMAZING. It takes place in a fantastic open world rich with lore, scenery, and people. The gameplay mechanics are easily learned and the player characters are all very unique. Quests are easy to understand, but difficult enough that some might take some actual planning to beat. The leveling system is simple and gets increasingly harder as you go on. There are  multiple different types of puzzles out in the world that give rewards when completed. Other features such as gliding and cooking will never not be fun to do. 
It‚Äôs truly an amazing game. 
However, it‚Äôs also prone to lag and random crashes. I‚Äôm nearly 100% sure it‚Äôs due to the massive amounts of data within the game that they let you download all of at the beginning of your journey. The crashes can take place at the worst times, but they miraculously always start you back off only a few steps from where you were. 
Other than the lag and crashing, I have nothing but positive experiences playing this game. 
This game IS worth the hype.

EDIT: after about a week of playing, the crashing has almost completely stopped, though once in a blue moon does it happen again. The lag also becomes less common, though not to the same rate as the crashing. Lag occurs mostly in battle, and while it can get annoying, it‚Äôs understandable with all of the fire, magic, and claymores being thrown around. 

Still an amazing game, just thought I‚Äôd add this.

I really love this game a lot. I‚Äôve never played an open world game like this and I see what people mean when it is compared to BOTW. There are so many amazing qualities about this game that I could go on forever.
My issue and small complaint is something I believe quite a few others are noticing as well; the lack of mobile to ps4 cross save feature. I currently have the mobile version but the data this game takes up is horrendous! I have a ps4 that I could play on but I don‚Äôt want to start an entirely new game in order to switch platforms. Because Genshin Impact does have a feature to transfer saves from mobile to PC, I remain hopeful that the same is given to ps4 as well.
I don‚Äôt know whether creating a Mihoyo account would allow me to transfer my data; I can‚Äôt seem to find any answers regarding this anywhere.
Genshin Impact is an absolutely beautiful and astounding game but it would be much better enjoyed if it was possible to transfer mobile data to the ps4 for a better immersive experience.

I‚Äôve been playing on and off since 2020 and every time i come back there are fun things to do but then i get bored again. Sometimes i wish that we could dress up the characters instead of having set outfits, i know that they are putting out different outfits but sometimes i wish we could mix and match. I love all the characters and the lore behind everything is really cool and ties together well, i think they should definitely add more diverse skin shades on characters from the regions that are supposed to have darker skin shades. I‚Äôve been playing since may 5th 2021, I‚Äôm a few XP away from AR 58, I log in every single day and play for hours, I have multiple high AR accounts, I play on all servers. The current available regions Mondstadt, liyue, and inazuma are based off Germany, China, and Japan, respectively. Germany I can kinda understand but China and Japan?! No way! China and Japan are very skin tone diverse countries, although skin lighting creams and skin lighting filters are very popular in these places it doesn‚Äôt change the fact that their people have a wide variety of skin shades, I have seen East Asian people darker than black people.

and in the new region Sumeru which is based on the SWANA regions which tend to have more dark skinned people, yet in the new trailer every single NPC is titanium white, as well as some of the characters from sumeru have been leaked and they‚Äôre lighter than any other characters. This is very disappointing. Hoyoverse, Please, please care about your fans. üôÅ

I have been playing this game since June 2021 and it was extremely fun for a while. Until it started to show that the developers don‚Äôt really care about their players and only care about the money. It gets stressful and annoying and starts feeling more like a chore than anything else after you keep playing. It‚Äôs more fun if you have tons of money because that means you would be able to get the 5 star character you want. Because F2P players can spend months farming for primogems to get the character they won‚Äôt, only to lose the 50/50 and having to farm all over again and it just takes up a lot of time that most people don‚Äôt have. It would be really nice if the developers could make it more F2P friendly instead of having this as a game for whales and for people with money to just throw at it. And the anniversary gifts could be better. You make enough money from this game to give us a better thank you gift because without your community and players, this game wouldn‚Äôt of become as popular as it has. So please work on making it more fun for your F2P players. Thanks.

Genshin is truly a unique gem of a game. The world and art style is absolutely gorgeous. The story, for the most part, is well written. The characters are amazing and they keep introducing new ones to fall in love with. The game gets constant updates to always give you something to do or something to look forward too. 

Now to address some concerns. The biggest thing people talk about is the gacha. Everyone wishes it was more generous but I don‚Äôt mind it. If you save you can get the character you want. I only buy the bp and monthly moon but even if you took away half my 5 stars I would still have a lot. 

The biggest problem I have with the game is the artifacts. I just wish there was some way to have a artifact pity system. My poor Klee still doesn‚Äôt have a good crown even after many, many tries. But overall this problem isn‚Äôt enough to lower it a star. This game is fantastic and I don‚Äôt see myself stopping anytime soon.

Sadly Genshin has a few limitations. I wish that it was more compatible with most devices but I‚Äôll take what I can get. I play on mobile due to the fact it‚Äôs not compatible with both my laptops. On mobile there are a few issues. Whether it kicks you out or just freezes. But still it is still impressive to be able to play on mobile. I think the plot and the idea of the game is good! I honestly really like the adventure aspect of the game. Getting to do and walk wherever you want is quite fun! Having the freedom to grant any of your wishes. The characters are cute! Just like any Gacha game! It‚Äôs sooo tempting to just spend primogems and money on every character. I think that in the beginning It wasn‚Äôt as intriguing but once you get past the ‚Äúfighting dvalin‚Äù it definitely starts setting in. I like how most of the quests seem to connect to the plot. The graphics are to DIE for. It‚Äôs a really great game! And I think I‚Äôm already obsessed.

So i had genshin, and i was all about it. I played for HOURS at a time and yet i didn‚Äôt know it had co-op. Now a-lot of parents don‚Äôt like multiplayer games with people you most likely don‚Äôt know, thats fine, worrying about your child‚Äôs safety. The slight problem is that parents are most definitely going to delete the game if it had co-op installed in the genshin system. Which might default the company‚Äôs game content as a whole. 
A smart add is for a parental control,
Which would manage how much time you can play for and co-op settings which enable removal or only being able to chat with certain people. My mom deleted it for this reason. Altogether, many people cant play genshin because of co-op, and it would be nice if they added controls for parents such as these. Other than that, beautiful graphics and good characters, and controls aren‚Äôt confusing at all, just needs some child safety. 
9/10, would play again if i ever get the chance. Thank you devs for reading. (*'‚ñΩ'*)

I really didn‚Äôt get the hype over this game when i first saw it, it looked liked every other game out there. But when i downloaded it i was impressed. The characters are well made, and the storyline is what makes this game interesting. I found no holes in the storyline, the characters are easy to play, fun to look at, and the powers are very satisfying to use. The graphics are really nice, and this game requires no money to be able to progress further, and to be a good player. The only flaw is the amount of gb it takes, and the lag. Also it can be frustrating when you are in the middle of a boss fight and it kicks you out, and when you join back you are at the start of the mission and your all your food that you used in the fight is gone. This game also requires a lot of grinding, and time, but I still can play for up to an hour and get good results. Would definitely recommend. (ps, don‚Äôt use lisa for climbing)

This game compared to mobile games is definitely a must have. It being a open world breath of the wild style game. Exploring and grinding quite fun. The story while so far nothing spectacular is fun. The only two things that brings this game down a little. Is the gatcha system and rates. While free I wish they did things like separate the weapons from the character banner. Do what epic seven and allow multiple rerolls. So you don‚Äôt have to make a new account. Plus that would stop people selling accounts. Another thing is for people that aren‚Äôt used to gatcha game or rusty. Give them some more tips like focusing on two dps rather than the whole team. Had to start over cause I had to much fun and spread my resources thin. Trying out all the new units. Still for a mobile game this is the best of its kind. It‚Äôs about as good breath of the wild a fun but flawed game in iteself. So yeah I recommend it...... though devs can you please stop giving me 5 star weapons and just give me a five star character instead. XD

The tldr is. If you don‚Äôt own a switch and always wanted to play breath of the wild, go head and give this try. If you own a switch just play breath of wild. 
If u want to play this game because of a certain character, then good luck. After 60+ pulls I‚Äôve got 8 characters, 3 of them are different characters the other five where duplicate of same person, the other 52 things from the pulls are weapons. Why weapons/items don‚Äôt have their own banner is beyond me. And if u think ‚Äúwill I‚Äôll just reroll until I get the person I want‚Äù, it takes u 30-40 minutes to hit lvl 10. Which is when u get ur second x10 free roll, so with the odds on the banners you might be rerolling for days and u can‚Äôt skip cut scenes. Yes you can play this game with any character but if your like me and a certain characters combat is what caught your eye to begin with, don‚Äôt hold your breath when it comes to getting that person

After play for couple months and getting to world lvl 6, u got to love how something just straight up insta-kill ur toons. Doesn‚Äôt matter if u have 3-4 lvl 20 artifacts and lvl 80, something still just kill you in one hit regardless if ur full hp

You cannot claim to be international yet be completely exclusive of races other than PALE WHITE. The only moderately tan characters we have are 4 stars xinyan and kaeya. I have been a long time genshin player. I joined in the 1.4 patch, and let me tell you, it was a blast! Not only was the game beginner friendly, but there were so many things to do at the time! I caught up to the story around the 1.6 update, just in time for the Inazuma update. I loved inazuma, there was so much to do and I have completed and maxed out that entire region. However , the game has now started to change. It is no longer beginner friendly. The character designs are repetitive and unoriginal. As of today, character designs from the new region have came out and they are horrible. Zero representation for darker skin colors , or just any skin colors other than paper white. This company supports the sexualization of young children and makes promises they can‚Äôt keep. At this point in the game, it is taking far to long to get anything done. There are many flaws in the gameplay, many of which haven‚Äôt even been reconsidered to be changed or fixed. They give out surveys monthly yet only listen to the Chinese players. Overall, I‚Äôm considering quitting and not continuing unless the clean up their act. 1/10 , do not recommend!

Genshin Impact went downhill after the Windblume festival. Company stopped interacting with its fanbase, released characters with really bad kits (some of which can only be improved with multiple constellations, forcing players to spend even more money on the gacha). And don‚Äôt even get me started on the anniversary rewards. 400 primos, a ten pull and a glider. Comes off as really ungrateful for a company who made 2.45 billion dollars in a year just from mobile players. The only other things we got were literal contests, the winners of which had a 10% chance to win 100 primogems. Mihoyo has no respect for its playerbase or fanartists, and calling company advertisement with minimal rewards an ‚Äúanniversary celebration‚Äù shows that. No wonder everyone‚Äôs moving to Cookie Run. For Honkai‚Äôs anniversary, mihoyo gave players a five-star equivalent for free. What happened? The company got so, so stingy when they released Genshin Impact. I love the game and it had so much potential, but with the lazy writing of the recent quests and everything i‚Äôve listen previously, my opinion of this game is getting lower than the company‚Äôs generosity. I and everyone else in the fanbase are extremely tired of this behavior from mihoyo.

I LOVE the game so far! It really is like botw, which makes me appreciate it even more. The graphics, storyline, and everything about the world is beautiful. I‚Äôve spent a good few hrs so far without getting bored. I also like how this game isn‚Äôt pay to play. The spawn rates aren‚Äôt that good but I can live with it. You can still progress in the game with the default characters. The game itself is great, but I do have some suggestions that I think will make the game even better:

- The ability to go into every building. While the towns are beautiful and big, I think it would be great being able to walk into houses and every business.
- Have more ways of healing. Cooking is great but maybe add an inn at each town? And also, have characters revive over time after getting defeated in battle? Or you can even add a feature where characters heal little by little whenever they sit.
- Have the npc conversations go back to where you left off prior to you selecting your reply. It‚Äôs kind of annoying having to go through all the dialogue in order to read the answer to every choice.

Like I said, the game is fun. The only real con I have is that the game overheats my phone and crashes at times. I usually have to play with my phone near a fan and plugged in to keep it cool and prevent the battery from draining. Other than that, you would not regret downloading the game!

Note: I play on an iphone 8 so I can‚Äôt speak for the experience on older models.

This game was one of the few games that I played almost every day. I did commissions, I did quests, I pulled for characters and so on. Now I‚Äôm AR 56 and I‚Äôm taking a break from it. One of the reasons being, that my favorite part of the game, the pulling for characters has become so hard. I‚Äôm a very very very light spender and it takes so long to get even 160 primogems for one pull. I feel the commission rewards, quest rewards, especially archon quests since they take very long, and chest rewards should increase and the rarity for 5 stars should decrease just a tiny bit. Another reason why I‚Äôm taking a break is because of the storage. I‚Äôm only able to play on mobile as my desktop is very slow, and even on the lowest graphics, it‚Äôs extremely laggy. I understand though, it‚Äôs such a beautiful game with amazing graphics, it can‚Äôt be helped. It‚Äôs really, sincerely, a lovely game that I made a lot of memories with, and I hope one day I‚Äôll come back to it and get excited again <3

Genshin Impact was a fun game. It was adventurous with characters and all this fun stuff to do- but no. Here are my reasons of why I don‚Äôt like Genshin Impact anymore: 1. It takes up so much storage. Once, I had deleted ALL of my apps just to play this game and it STILL didn‚Äôt work! Even my best friend had a whole different iPad just for this to work! The creators of this game are pedophiles. Hi, I‚Äôve been playin Genshin for a few months now! I really enjoy all the adventures, quest, characters, and more! I wanting to share an idea Ive been thinking about for sometime. I started Genshin Impact not to long ago, and I cannot get enough of it. The aura around it, the feeling of pride when accomplishing something- it‚Äôs a rare trait for games to have. Genshin brought me back to games. The characters play a big role in it too. The characters feel real, they have personality‚Äôs, they‚Äôre fun. The quality of the game is amazing, the way it feels real and the cut scenes are so beautiful. It‚Äôs got be so addicted, I stayed up from 3 am to now, not leaving the app ONCE. 
I personally love Venti, he is my favorite character and I‚Äôm even getting a cosplay of him! miHoYo, if you‚Äôre reading this, please bring the Venti banner back. I was very bummed when I saw that you couldn‚Äôt get him any other way. But still, he ranks top tier of my fiction crushes :).

If you want to download Genshin but aren‚Äôt sure about it, definitely do it. I cannot even describe the tips of this game‚Äôs addictiveness in a paragraph, but know it is the best game I‚Äôve ever played.

Mihoyo seems to be making a lot of money but doesn‚Äôt like to reward their players for that donation. I have seen the charts on how much Mihoyo makes from banners and it‚Äôs amazing to think that people pay that much for characters but you would think that Mihoyo would show gratitude to the players by adding new ways to gain the currency to get said characters for free at times. In the game it may seems like their are a lot of ways to get that currency but there will come a time that players just plateau and will have nothing to do in game other than dailies and weeklies if you need them then log off for a repeat the following day. Chests are not infinite and once all quests have been completed you are left with nothing much to do. Events are a way for Mihoyo to show gratitude for the players but are lackluster once played. Events can get you some currency but the amount is lackluster if you think about how much is needed to obtain a character, plus on how much you have to wish to obtain the character you want with a 0.67% drop rate. In the end i say that Mihoyo should take better care for players as they are the reason why they still exist. They must be fair!

If you‚Äôve played games like Breath of the Wild, maybe some of the ‚ÄúTales Of‚Äù series, this game is so good. The graphics are absolutely phenomenal. The sights to see are so beautiful, it‚Äôs so detailed and pleasing. From the graphics to the gameplay, this game is flawless. They‚Äôre constantly coming out with new characters and weapons, making adjustments so the game runs to its full capacity, and making sure the players are satisfied. You earn rewards for being adventurous and making mistakes. The developers also give you many free items in your in-game mailbox which helps a ton. There‚Äôs always new events and ways to earn primogems and mora (in game currencies) to help you out! Despite some easy glitches, such as chests sometimes not opening in co-op mode, or your friends swimming in the ground (it‚Äôs hilarious), this game is everything I‚Äôve wanted in a mobile game. It‚Äôs hard to believe that this is free to play. Start your own adventure and play with your friends!

Gameplay:
From the few minutes I played this game I could see it had tons of potential. The gameplay felt good, the world seemed interesting, and overall made me think of Zelda: Breath of the Wild, which is a good thing. The fact that it is a mobile game is impressive as well; it being free to try is probably the biggest reason to check it out and adds for it are not even overhyping it like other games have done with misinformation (RSL).
Performance:
The large scale environment combined with the console level gameplay is truly impressive with no graphical issues or gameplay bugs. With the ZBotW style gameplay, you can explore freely and see the nooks around the map and still with no glitches.
Visuals:
The performance could come down to the semi simplistic styles but that is also a catch of the game. It is colorful but controlled which makes everything distinct. I am a big fan of environments and atmosphere in video games and I hope to see a bit of variety. I enjoy darker tones and colors but I could still enjoy the lighting and colors.
Hopes:
I want to see this team tackle more types of generas with this similar gameplay and performance. I have seen a lot of fantasy games with the similar visual style and this one has done the best from a glance. However even though they have done it the best doesn‚Äôt mean they can‚Äôt spread there wings and possibly save mobile gaming from the repetitive fantasy worlds.

Genshin is fine. Aesthetic wise, it‚Äôs above almost every mobile game I‚Äôve played, and the first few hours are a blast. However, because it‚Äôs trying to be both a gatcha game and an open world game similar to others, it fails at both. It‚Äôs not good at being open world due to having to grind repeatedly, making the world feel less and less interesting by the day. And it‚Äôs not a good gatcha game by making it not worth paying under hundreds of dollars. But the biggest problem with genshin impact is how it punishes you. If you play through the game fast, it punishes you by not having any end game content, and if you play the game slow, it punishes you by having the difficulty go above what you‚Äôre capable of, making everything even slower. To get the most out of the game, you have to play as efficiently as possible while keeping a very specific speed as to not fall into the boredom that comes with moving too fast or slow, and that‚Äôs no fun. This might improve in the future, but that would likely take a year at least.

This tame overall is vey fun and addictive. The characters are easy to get attached to, and the cut scenes, animation, and storyline is very fun. If you enjoy fandoms this game is very good for that, just be careful of the weird people. And don‚Äôt feel like you have to be in certain part of the game. You don‚Äôt. It‚Äôs a game, take as long as you want. And when you wish for a character and don‚Äôt get them, don‚Äôt worry. You can get them next time ofc. Genshin Impact has saved me from boredom and has also been my escape. I love making videos about it, and also my own stories or au‚Äôs (Alternative Universe). If you wanna play a game that really feels alive i recommend this. Also, I think an anime is coming out soon. I believe it‚Äôs going to be animated by Ufotable (?) The group who animated Demon Slayer !! So yeah, don‚Äôt let the negative that might be shown make you think this game is not good. It‚Äôs amazing. From characters, cutscenes, music, voice acting, nations, play style.

This is easily my favorite mobile game of all time, thanks to the gorgeous graphics and extremely fun gameplay. The fighting mechanics are nearly flawless (with elemental reactions being a very big contributor to the fun). The story itself isn‚Äôt the game‚Äôs greatest strength, but it is still very fun to play through and see how everything unfolds. I am quite intrigued how everything will play out in the future; it is incredibly hard not to find spoilers all over the internet! It‚Äôs hard to believe that so much content can be found in a mobile game. My only complaint about the game is the whole ‚ÄúGacha mechanic‚Äù rewards system, which makes it incredibly difficult to get good rewards from your rolls without paying money. The pity system is a very welcome addition to this mechanic, but I think the rolls should be a bit more ‚Äúmerciful‚Äù. However, even though I am completely free to play, I was able to get a five star character eventually, and despite not having many, I still greatly enjoy the game! Keep up the good work, Mihoyo!

I had got this game around the time of its release, and I thought it was fun. I played through the two available areas, completed some side quests, but I never increased in rank that much. Eventually, I realized the gatcha rate was pretty awful. 5 stars are extremely difficult to pull, you barely get any free currency, and you need multiple copies of a character to reach full power. Eventually, I just stopped playing, thinking maybe I‚Äôd come back to it if things got better. Fast forward to now, and I check the reviews. Sure enough, it hasn‚Äôt improved. Gatcha still as terrible as ever, mechanics nobody wanted, and I‚Äôve even heard you need 20 GB of space for it. I‚Äôd say I have a relatively good storage plan, but this is almost a sixth of it by itself. That was enough for me to finally uninstall. I figured if they hadn‚Äôt fixed it yet, they aren‚Äôt planning to. I‚Äôve also heard rumors of issues of representation of people of color in the game, but I‚Äôve been away from the game‚Äôs community so I can‚Äôt say for sure what‚Äôs going on there. Either way, it hurts knowing the game could have been better, but the company‚Äôs lack of care just held it back.

First of all, I want to mention the racism that this game includes. The Sumeru cast was leaked, and there is only ONE character that isn't white. (The region is based off of south asia?) And Dori is a whole stereotype? Like what's going on with that? Also, the lack of communication with the fanbase is astonishing. This company does NOT listen to the fanbase or take criticism unless their own money is at risk. Also, there is a severe lack of endgame content, there's nothing to do after AR 55, and events feel repetitive and boring. And lots of story quests don't contribute much to the lore, and center around boring npcs we don't care about. Also, the rate resin refills at is way too slow. And, artifacts are NEEDED to make your characters good, but it's total RNG, and it takes FOREVER to get good ones. Also, bosses aren't getting harder, they're just getting more HP stacked onto them, and Hoyoverse is so afraid of powercrep they don't come out with more powerful characters to easily take them down. Until this game starts improving, I would advise not playing it, or spending any money on it.

The game is good in terms of play and being able to roam freely. There is a variety of things to do and characters to unlock. Plus, events and good lore. But, the rewards for such efforts are quite underwhelming and the anniversary‚Ä¶ yeah that is just 100 times worse. I mean, a total of 60 primos a day without any events doesn‚Äôt help someone get banner character back to back especially in a 6 week span. In addition, just giving people 30k mora after a survey isn‚Äôt much of anything especially for an AR55 ranked player like myself. Now, lemme get to the crappy part which is the anniversary web event rewards. 90% chance to win 100k mora and then there‚Äôs 1,000 people who only get 100 primos. That is just like giving people the middle finger after playing your own game. Plus, the developers don‚Äôt even own up to such mistake which is not a good business move on their end. Just letting it run rampant while sitting back and thinking it is not normal isn‚Äôt right. At least mend the mistakes or else it only gets worse as time progresses.

Goodness I am in love with this game. I have tried to leave but so far no game I've tried feels quite right. I love how it feels to play the game and I have an emotional attachment to some of the characters, including NPCs. The only problem with Genshin Impact is the enormous amount of space that it takes, especially for a mobile game. I have never had this sort of problem with any other game and it gets more outrageous with each update. Another thing is that there isn't enough things to do in late game, and while i haven't yet tried this new permanent update gameplay thing, I feel like there probably never will be enough content for late game. Also, the updates seem to be getting even more boring as they come and I'm afraid that by the time that all 7 nations are out that it'll just be repeating what happens in the first few nations. These are my only few complaints about the game, and I totally recommend it to anyone who likes open-world gameplay.

I have seen so many mobile MMOs that I was scared this would just be a carbon copy of the others gameplay wise. I was so pleasantly surprised. There is no button you can press to have the game play itself, there is nothing to automatically move your character from place to place. You are forced to run around this world and explore which I absolutely adore. Not only that but the graphics are stunning! I don‚Äôt even mind that I had to free up quite a bit of storage on my phone just to download this, it was worth it! I wouldn‚Äôt have even minded paying for this game. I genuinely never expected the quality to be as good as this. Yes Honkai Impact is fun, but this game is on the next level. 
ALSO WHY ARE THERE SO MANY ATTRACTIVE CHARACTERS IN THIS GAME LIKE WHAT?! I‚Äôm going to be really irritated when I look at one of my sketchbooks and it‚Äôs just filled with these characters and human versions of monsters bc I totally haven‚Äôt started drawing the monsters as humans already. 
Send help I‚Äôm obsessed.

Coming into this game I thought i was fake when I saw the trailer on the App Store but it blew my MIND when I started playing it first of all I‚Äôve never thought in a million years that a game like this open world battle game would exist this early I‚Äôm very HAPPY ‚ù§Ô∏è I think this is the very very closest game that comes anywhere near Breath of the wild I‚Äôd BOtw had a combat system like this one I would still be playing Botw when I found out of can change the graphics to even higher same with the FPS THE GAME RAN EVEN SMOOTHER!!! And more beautiful I kinda feel guilty playing this game for free I wouldn‚Äôt complain if you charged for this game but thank you so much for making this game free a lot of people including myself can‚Äôt get the money right now but I‚Äôm happy it‚Äôs free thank you so much I‚Äôll complete this game it‚Äôs lot of fun I recommend going into settings and changing the FPS to 60 and the graphics even higher your experience will be 100% even more enjoyable thank you!!!!

So, I was a little hesitant to get this game at first. I saw someone playing it, and it seemed kinda fun, but I didn‚Äôt actually get it until around a year later, when another person was playing it. I decided, since it was free, to give it a try. I started the game, and at first I was kind of confused, since some stuff was a little hard to understand without other people explaining it, (wishing, artifacts, enhancing weapons) but once I got the hang of it, I fell in love. This game has cured my boredom so many times, and I don‚Äôt usually do this, but I love it so much, that I have spent a good amount of money on it. It‚Äôs such a fun game, and if you are debating getting it, I would really recommend getting it. Genshin Impact is an amazing game, with amazing graphics, story, and everything about it. I even recommended it to several of my friends, and they love it just as much as me. 10/10 would recommend you get this game. <3

This game is absolutely stunning; it‚Äôs a console game on your phone. Beautiful animation, amazing voiceovers, vast worlds, compelling characters, and more. That being said there are a few things that need to be addressed by the developers: ‚Ä¢ When using PlayStation controllers the UI still shows a,b,x,y instead of the PlayStation controls ‚Ä¢ Controllers don‚Äôt connect automatically like most games. Instead you have to switch from touchscreen to controller in the settings. ‚Ä¢ UI needs to be adjusted slightly to avoid pressing on the Dynamic Island on iPhone 14 Pro. ‚Ä¢ Other than those small things, this game is amazing. The time that is spent on everything is incredible. There‚Äôs TONS of content and regular updates. Some people may complain they have to buy Primogems, but so what?? The game is free to play. I recommend spending at least $60 (the price of any normal game) in the app to support the developers and get more content. Stop being cheap and expecting games of this caliber for free (it already is).

Presented as an open world game, it really is dynamic, and it doesn‚Äôt cling to one thing or one aspect, the game has a lot of aspects and a lot of things you can focus on, like? do you want to explore the map and collect items, or do you want to build characters to defeat bosses, ect,

thought the game has a couple of downsides to it, starting with several glitches in events, the really bad rng, greedy company, and the miserable fanbase.

Breaking it down, 
the game revolves a lot around rng/luck based iteams, characters, weapons, and more, this is something most people can progress and deal with, but in late game, things like this just become frustrating and makes the game repetitive and very non-entertaining‚Äî THOUGH because of events and ongoing story quest IT IS something you can cope with,

Also, I have used money on this game‚Äî explaining this in a central way, Mihoyo is a very greedy company when it comes to Genshin, rarely do we get awards worth while, and the game truly does cater to heavy spenders, through for a casual player, I can see how this isn‚Äôt even an issue. 

One thing that‚Äôs also very frustrating is the gacha system, though, thanks to more frequent reruns, it does make things slightly better.. 

anyhow, This game has really meant the world to me for the past year, I‚Äôve been through tough times and getting on genshin and finding something to distract myself with has truly caused for an amazing experience overall, I truly recommend it.

This game is over really fun! I love exploring the new areas, but something I‚Äôve been seeing a lot recently is this game‚Äôs lack of darker skin tones. attractive characters, great graphics, awesome storyline, amazing animations, professional voice acting, etc!! i could rant for hours about how awesome this game is, but i do have one complaint. i‚Äôm not exactly rich and so to get good characters and weapons, this is definitely a more pay to win game. i‚Äôll admit ive spent money on this game and i have a decent amount of 5 star characters but losing the 50/50 on a banner to a character you don‚Äôt want and then having no more primos is the worst feeling ever. ive rage quit this game several times because i‚Äôm so upset about not getting a character i wanted so it‚Äôs a lot harder to get good weapons and characters as a free to play player. id also like to make a comment on the storage this game takes up. i have only 64 gb on my phone and a majority of it is taken up by this game. i only have like 300 pictures due to the 17 GB THIS GAME TAKES UP!! is it worth it? ofc but i‚Äôd love if there was a way to reduce storage space haha. anyways download this game you‚Äôll love it.

Dear mihoyo your game genshin impact is really good and I love it so much the characters the lore the gameplay it is all amazing I always get so excited to play but I think we should change the wish system a little bit and other stuff you see We should maybe lower the pity system to 90 to 70 it seems like a good update both for players and can also Benefit you!
