actually, i really enjoyed playing Genshin for year till i reach 54 AR, because right here you start the thing that players called ‚Äúlate game‚Äù and this means that you have completed about 90% history quests and other sources of primogems and AR experience, so after 54 AR the only thing that you can do is daily commissions and exploring world but its very boring. another problem is resin and domains: you need farm a lot after you reach a high rank, but you always have about 200 resin per day include waiting time for some more. its only about 10 times getting artifacts and you have a little chance to get artifact that you actually need: usually you are getting trash artifacts with DEF in the main attribute. its would be cool if hoyoverse make system like in weapon banner to get what you want.
above all, the game is very interesting, but a little amount of resin and game content for late game is the reason why you can hate Genshin or forget about game after 54 AR.

The world is pretty and the characters make some fun teams, but all the designs are very chaste and puritanical compared to MHY‚Äôs other efforts. It‚Äôs also somehow even greedier and stingier than HI3, a game that was renowned for both its combat and its stinginess towards players. Lack of rewards, bonuses, a pity system that is a couple steps backwards from HI3 including a worse UI, and the ever present requirement for dupes to unlock character traits lead to a very player unfriendly environment.

The biggest claim to fame here is support that extends to console (although even that is limited so much it‚Äôs almost not worth mentioning), but the hoops they had to jump through for that means that monthly logins are awkwardly through a website that has no direct connection to the game.

Overall what we have is a game that is superficially great but ultimately fails in every single aspect once you dig below the surface. If you absolutely need a gatcha game with an explorable 3D overworld then it‚Äôs worth playing because options are limited, but other games have better combat, better systems, and are friendlier to players.

Okay so, I NEVER have enjoyed mobile gaming other than your casual mindless low budget games. Games that you play cause you‚Äôre bored and waiting around. Nothing that you really need to focus on. 
But THIS? This game is absolutely fantastic. It has an amazing story line. It‚Äôs fully fleshed out. Ease of access to play. I downloaded it about 2 hours ago and have been playing it since. I‚Äôm only now taking my first break from it to write this review and then I‚Äôm jumping right back into it. Its beautiful graphics and gameplay design, open world exploration features, and my interest in anime rpg‚Äôs, has sucked me in and I have no intentions of stopping until I need to go to work. This is absolutely amazing. Developers? If you see this? Please continue making games. Don‚Äôt ever stop. I would have paid good money for this if you asked me to. Thank you for being the first to make a mobile game I am willing to put my time into. Would have given this 100 stars if I could. WOWOW!! ü§©

this game is a really immersive and enjoyable game to play, but the only reason why this didn‚Äôt get a 5 star review is because of a couple things. first, its the slightly not f2p friendly game system. i know that this game generally can be played perfectly well without purchasing anything, but its difficult, especially with the way you earn primogems. hoyolab has been generous on some occasions with primogems, but the way you earn them is a long process, and sometimes you don‚Äôt even gain a good amount after completing an excruciating quest. on to the next reason; the storage. this game takes up SO much storage on my phone. of course, if you play this game on PC then you might not have this struggle, but as a mobile player, this is difficult. although these problems bother me, id still recommend this game to anyone that wants to experience a really beautiful game with lovely characters + graphics.

Awful customer service.  After I changed my card I got charged erroneously by two apps, one of them Genshin.  I disputed both with Apple obviously.  Hoyoverse accused me of attempting malicious fraud, threatened to ban my account if I didn‚Äôt spend real money to replace my negative balance after they deduced in-game currency as a punishment, and I‚Äôve yet to get a customer service response that shows they‚Äôve truly read my dispute.  They won‚Äôt even comment on whether or not I‚Äôm still at risk of being banned.  All we‚Äôve established so far is that the evidential charge they cite in my in-game message does not have a charge associated with it, but they‚Äôve yet to acknowledge that it‚Äôs only further evidence I did nothing wrong.  The erroneous charge was for something you cannot buy two of during the same patch - it is literally a pass only available one time because it unlocks rewards.  I couldn‚Äôt have purchased it if I tried.  I will not spend money on this game again, even if they replace my deduced in-game currency and reimburse me for what I was bullied into spending to save my account.  The company is not trustworthy for billing matters.

Overall, Genshin is a very fun game! I‚Äôve appreciated the characters and story so far, just having fun and enjoying it for what it is. However, as Sumeru approaches, it has become very clear how Hoyoverse is going to treat this wonderfully diverse region. As a brown person myself who descends from one of the regions Sumeru is inspired by, seeing most of the characters being sheet pale is just‚Ä¶ sad, not to mention the clashing and stereotypical designs. I understand being uninformed, yet Hoyoverse has made clear effort in the past with Yun Jin, for example. Chinese Opera is a very rich and beautiful art, and they made sure to treat a character with this background respectfully and carefully. They did very well with her, creating and interesting and engaging character. The lack of care with this region is saddening and loses a lot of the depth that comes with it in exchange for cheap orientalist takes on the life and most importantly people in these places. 

Hoyoverse has the power to make this change and they should. The places that inspire Sumeru have incredibly rich histories, cultures, foods, and life. Leaving such behind will ultimately be a huge loss for the story they‚Äôve crafted.

I don‚Äôt care who the kind of people are that work at hoyoverse and I don‚Äôt care of you are for some reason disgusted by what I and many others are saying. Even if you are racist and orientalist at least be realistic and acknowledge that there is more then one dark skinned person in each part of the world, ESPECIALLY IN A PLACE THAT IN REAL LIFE HAS MOSTLY DARK SKINNED PEOPLE. It doesn‚Äôt matter if you hate people because of their race which I don‚Äôt understand personally, your player base shockingly consists of POC and the fact that you are misrepresenting them has everyone angry, not just POC. I garuntee you will see a drop in your banner sales and player rate until this problem is fixed. I know I‚Äôm not spending money even if I can‚Äôt, if I had the chance to, I wouldn‚Äôt take it anyway though because it‚Äôs not okay wether you like it or not. You guys care about your money so much, so even if you don‚Äôt give a crap do what you do so your players can be satisfied and you can get all of your money again. This review will change only if your acts change. Sumeru better have a good storyline too to make up for this, and I want a better anniversary this year too.

This game, is great. You can tell a lot of detail has been put into the world and the stories and the side quests. Which might just be my problem. I understand that the point of this story is to find our sibling but it feels like that whole point has only been brought up once or twice. We‚Äôre just hanging out with cool characters and maybe, just maybe one of them will actually help us out while we run around doing quests for them. I shouldn‚Äôt be taking things too seriously, that‚Äôs just something that‚Äôs been bugging me about this whole game. When are we getting to the point?

Ok on a more positive note, the attention to detail is great. I love the character‚Äôs personalities and backstories. There are different visions that are unique in their own ways and the fact that you can spend quality time with some of the characters is great. This game is great and definitely makes time go by

I‚Äôve been playing for a while, due to school and stuff being stressful it‚Äôs great to relax and play a game. There are some things that could be changed seeing as though this company makes BILLIONS of dollars. Firstly, they could work on their servers more and try to resolve lag issues with co-op mode. Secondly, the resin system is absolute garbage. You need 20 resin for a single domain to get bad artifacts you can‚Äôt even use   , and you get one resin every 8 minutes so i could go take a shower and only have one resin back. Thirdly, it is very hard to get the main currency, primogems. This is not a problem if you are just playing for quests and use the  first free characters. This is only a problem for free to play players and light spenders, as we cannot get enough primogems to properly play in the gatcha. Lastly, the current anniversary awards are not very good. This company has BILLIONS of dollars and it would not hurt to give back to the community that made it happen. I‚Äôm not talking about 90 wishes or a five star. Maybe just a free Inazuma four star and like 40 limited wishes. But it cannot hurt them to actually care about the players that make them rich.

I will say, there are some disadvantages to playing on mobile, but that‚Äôs always gonna happen, no matter the game. I love the graphics, the stories, all the quests that give you a deeper look into this fairy-tale like story, but then you realize it‚Äôs a lot more real life than we may like, from timmie‚Äôs father gone missing, sage‚Äôs childhood fantasies, and to Eury‚Äôs drunkard husband and Noelle not being healthy, in an attempt to make others happier.

Only thing I would recommend is an option in settings to more the buttons around, like for sprinting, attack, ult, burst, etc. so you can move them to a place you‚Äôre more comfortable with. This game is amazing though, absolutely love it and all the updates (actually, I also wish there would be a banner where you have a [smaller] chance of getting them, but all characters on it all the time, as opposed to the normal banners where, for example, Klee is gonna be undrawable in a few days)

I play this game mostly on PC so it‚Äôs much harder by comparison to play on my phone, even with an external controller. The screen is too tiny and the device gets warm. BUT this app satisfies the itch and allows for checkins, shopping, and claiming rewards. The developers have done a fantastic job with almost constant updates and events. Gets a little boring after you complete all the events and quests, but it takes a long time to get there. The grind is real, but I don‚Äôt mind. That‚Äôs the game. You really don‚Äôt have to spend a dime to have a good time in Teyvat and you get all you need to get through the game for free. I spend a small amount of money to keep the devs fed and to keep content coming, and I get to pull a cool weapon or character in return every once in a while. Don‚Äôt listen to all the entitled people complaining about not getting enough rewards. People are responsible for their own spending habits and shouldn‚Äôt expect more than is ever promised out of a gacha game.

I‚Äôm not hip to Genshin Impact, tbh I wanted to find a game to play that was close to a console and man this is it! I‚Äôm my opinion, the graphics are beautiful and it kinda has this Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wind style to it. specials and etc. It‚Äôs not a big problem maybe the feature is unlocked later on in the game idk, but it will make the game a dozen times better, regardless this is still a great game and definitely will get my 5 stars!

If your looking for a fun game to either pass time or invest your days into this is the game to do it with. The other review is someone who tried to launch it when the server wasn‚Äôt live yet. So that problem won‚Äôt happen for you. Back to the review. I‚Äôve played over a hundred hours during the beta and everything translates well to the base game as well. This game has full voice acting for most of the characters in the world going into this game don‚Äôt think of this as a BOTW clone. This game was heavily inspired by BOTW‚Äôs art style but that‚Äôs the only part taken. This game is built from the ground up and people can easily sink 200 hours into the game. A heads up is the company who makes this game is famous for making gatcha games. Everything in this game can be earned in game but it also can be bought with money. There is also co-op in the game. So if the gatcha style bums you out just know that the summon system is the only gatcha mechanic.

 I hope this review helps you out.

This game is great in a lot of ways. The graphics are fantastic. The combat system is sophisticated and fun. The majority of story is inspiring and deep. The world is vast with many many scenery to explore. The events have varied gameplay and great stories too.

The only thing I find problematic is that new players are missing a lot of content and equipment from past events. There are no alternative ways to get them back other than watching videos from other players. Given the quality of these content it‚Äôs really a pity. There are limited stories, weapons, characters, areas, and more. The FOMO is super strong. As the game keeps growing, it would be less and less appealing to new players as the limited content they are gonna miss keeps growing too. Some of these limited content is only for more various play style. Others contain important lore and are crucial for cohesive storytellings. The later is even worse as it prevents new players from fully experience the story.

The graphics for this game are stunning, and I love that there is a storyline besides just mindless grinding. I also like that the gacha system seems fairly balanced, where it‚Äôs not to a point of being a p2w game. However, I feel as though gameplay can become slow at times, especially when you finish the main storyline quests. For example, after finishing the original stormterror quest (the one in the very beginning of the game), you need to reach adventure rank 18 or so. That‚Äôs fine and all, except there isn‚Äôt much to keep you occupied during this time period of ‚Äúin-between‚Äù (ranks lower than 18 but higher than 10) except for daily commissions and some side quests. Unless you want to do what I mentioned before (mindless grinding), there isn‚Äôt much story to keep you going. The commissions become repetitive and there isn‚Äôt much story behind the other side quests.

Still a fair 4/5 though. If you read through my entire ramble, thank you.

When I first started playing the game I had a lot of fun exploring the open world, doing quests, and building characters. But Hoyoverse has very clearly displayed harmful stereotypes through its reveal of the Sumeru characters along with an antisemitic caricature Pulcinella. The three current regions each have their separate representation and inspiration from China, Japan, and Germany, while Sumeru will be a ‚Äúexotic‚Äù muster of a nation. Not to mention the colorism that‚Äôs shown through the lack of varying skin tones, only two playable characters being brown thus far ‚Äî with no dark skinned characters ‚Äî which Sumeru characters so far have barely added to that number. (The majority of characters of Sumeru characters to brown ones is incredibly high). It‚Äôs very clear the company and its employees have done no research nor care about the cultures and people their work is inspired by and it shows that in incredibly harmful ways. It clearly caters to a certain ‚Äî racist and ignorant ‚Äî audience. With the racist direction Genshin Impact is taking, I will not be playing if it‚Äôs not changed. I was looking forward to Sumeru but with each reveal of what will entail is greatly disappointing. Hoyoverse, do better.

Genshin Impact is an amazing game and I always look forward to logging in and exploring Teyvat. The character design is so beautiful, the graphic design on the world is outstanding and overall this is such a fun game. 
I love saving primo gems and wishing for new characters. It‚Äôs always a good feeling to get and test out new characters. I personally have a couple favorite characters that include Thoma and Lisa. They are both calming characters and miHoYo did something right when they created this game.
I 10/10 recommended getting this game- it will change your life in ways you never would have thought of.
The characters back stories are so interesting to read. They also help get into the zone of getting to know these characters. I love how everyone has a different personality. It makes the game a lot more interesting. Sometimes I wonder how the day is going to go after logging in. ‚ÄúIs Kaeya going to flirt with me today?‚Äù ‚ÄúI wonder w

When I first started this game, it truly was the most fun I‚Äôd had in a long time. The devs truly seemed to love what they were doing, and they understood what their players meant to them. But now, sitting at this games one year anniversary, I and so many others feel incredibly hallow about this game. Mihoyo no longer has respect for the people who play this game and strictly prioritize financial gain. Even while spending so much on twitter hashtags, they couldn‚Äôt once think of saying they were thankful for where their players have gotten them. They ignored complaints they received from players about how they felt regarding the anniversary rewards, they continue to ignore bugs and fixing broken characters that desperately need fixed. They‚Äôve gone as far as to block anyone on certain websites that mention the anniversary rewards. Even typing this now I fear what could possibly happen to my Genshin account for saying the things I am. It‚Äôs become an even more toxic environment than it already was and I unfortunately don‚Äôt know where I stand with this game anymore. So please, don‚Äôt waste your time with a game that doesn‚Äôt care about you.

Firstly I want to say i‚Äôve never been more addicted to a game before Genshin Impact. The game is absolutely breathtaking from graphics, to beautiful scenery, and how realistic the game actually is. I really wish I could rate this game higher than one star.  It has a ton of potential, and I looovvvee the idea of a wide open world with quests.  I play on an iPad, and the first problem I encountered was basic navigation.  There is a joystick control in the lower left corner of the screen, but it‚Äôs never mentioned in the help, and there‚Äôs not enough contrast that you can easily see it.  I only found it because I remembered another game with a similar control that I hadn‚Äôt been able to see either.  Once I got navigation sorted out, I advanced to Adventurer 4 and had fun doing that, but then I got to the part where I made it to Mondstadt and was given my glider and forced into a confrontation with Stormterror.  The audio is apparently corrupted because it keeps stuttering and the screen is completely black except for a few controls.  Every now and then, I see a red arrow, and I assume Stormterror is in that direction, but I can‚Äôt see what I‚Äôm supposed to be doing.  Things like this really ruin the game for me.  I will probably uninstall and reinstall and try again, but I don‚Äôt hold out hope it will help much.  I‚Äôd like to be able to escape that quest, but I can‚Äôt.

So I I got the game and decided to check it out since the ads on it were really good. I really want to enjoy the game, but the entire game is just like, "no you don't get to enjoy this". 

The intro backstory is very VERY laggy. Like I couldn't really enjoy it and no matter how many times I close out the game and reopen it to see if it'll stop the lag, it doesn't. 

The second part is the game. The entire world is literally a black void, not even joking with you. There's nothing but black void. I was heavily confused and tried accessing the game controls and couldn't find them to see if it'll fix the black screen that I'm seeing. 

Last part is that Everytime the character steps in water, (can't see the water mainly because the entire world is a black void but know it's water because it keeps saying wet) it give this bright blob of light, not letting me see the character at all and it won't go away for like half a minute. 

These are the only problems I'm experiencing at the moment so I would really really REALLY be grateful if there was a way you guys could fix this because the game looks absolutely amazing from the ads. Since it's very much new to the public, I highly understand why this is happening. Which is why I'm still giving 4stars since this is very much excusable. 

Overall, I'll be fully ready to give a 5star when these little malfunctions are fixed. ‚ò∫Ô∏è

this game is a masterpiece of modern game engineering. any way you choose to play the game, there is something to entertain according to the taste of each player. this game is also a global conversation between players from all over the world, and the game mirrors the perspectives of our planet in the game; european/american, china/mainland asia, japan/korea, which also mirrors the cultures of the players in a fun way, and the co-op opportunities and social media presance of content creators is also a global conversation. probably one of the best action-rpgs i've ever played, a new sort of model, though! the game is free to play because the "whales" pay for the game and that allows folks to play for free and get an equal enjoyment of the game. a revolutionary sort of approach to gaming. also, being on mobile, counsole, and PC means that multiple platform communities are goong through the same content regardless of the method of gameplay. quite a fascinating game.

Claiming that the fictional regions in these games are portrayal of actual countries, yet not properly depict them is not only concerning but ignorant. Yae Miko, as a shrine maiden, should have proper shrine clothing, Nilou and Dori are not a belly dancers and therefore do not need to show that in their models, and lastly being scared to add darker skin-tone/variety to the character models. Sumeru is based off of the SWANA regions and Natlan is based off Indigenous North America, yet you make the models shades lighter than Mondstadt‚Äôs NPC and characters, a German-portrayal region, and Sumeru‚Äôs archon #FFFFFF. You even make the enemies be shades darker than the playable characters, which makes me and many others believe that you view anyone with a darker tone (not the tan you slapped on Dehya, Cyno, and Candace/ Kandake) as antagonistic (ie Xinyan‚Äôs storyline and scenes from the GAA). It‚Äôs showing that you could not care for proper representation, design wise and even the pronunciation of some characters‚Äô cultural names, and care for some loose change. You were supposed to shine this region but now you are making us waiting for the umpteenth redemption for Natlan, which majority of your players have little to no expectations for already.

Right now when I start the game on my powerful iPad Pro all I get is a blank white screen for about 10 minutes, then music starts and I‚Äôm able to ‚Äúplay‚Äù. Upon initiating my game, the intro cutscene was 98% frozen and only offered about 3 seconds of actual footage until I got disconnected somehow from Ethernet (likely server side issues). 
	After about 6 forced restarts of a broken laggy cinematic that I cannot skip, I managed to reach a very smooth part where I could pick and name my character. After that it was a couple more seconds of broken cinematic which I somehow managed to get through on the first attempt. Then the real horror began... 
	My first open world experience was that of a 5 inch view distance and then black nothingness. All enemies were giant blobs of white light, and only some of the grounds textures would actually load in. The only part of the game that actually works smoothly and completely is the User Interface Game Menu such as talents etc etc.
	Character animation is very well done, but with all these other issues mounted up I‚Äôm gonna have to call this a game flop for IPad Pro users.  üëé I do not recommend this game for anyone using a Mobile Device.

Overall, I am absolutely blown away with this game. *F2P means Free to play* 
Genshin impact is an amazing game for anyone interested in open world RPGs. It has UNLIMITED things to do: world quests, side quests, boss fights, story quests, world exploration, etc etc. Though you have infinite things to do, you can spend a lot of time playing the game only to earn a measly amount of primogems (the currency used to gamble for characters). For example, by completing all four daily commissions, you obtain 40 primogems and a 20 primogem completion bonus. To put this into perspective, you need 160 primogems for a singular wish. Every ten wishes, you are guaranteed a 4‚≠êÔ∏è character OR weapon. After around 75 wishes, you are guaranteed a 5‚≠êÔ∏è character (or a weapon in some cases). Though the game isn‚Äôt solely about getting new characters and weapons, it‚Äôs nice to be able to obtain cool in game content without needing to pull out the credit card. Other than that, I think the game is phenomenal and I can‚Äôt wait for future updates and content.

This is literally the best game ever made. It has a interesting storyline, and enough fighting that it‚Äôs not boring and not too hard either. I also like how it is very user-friendly, for example there are tutorials and systems that allow you to get free characters so that you have protection. Plus, the characters have a lot of backstories, too, each with their own unique personality and amazing features. One of the things I like the most is that it‚Äôs free. I know a lot people like to spend a heap of money on games, thinking that it would help them, but seriously, this game is just as interesting and fair without money. The only thing that is kinda‚Ä¶ not good about this game is that it takes up A TON of storage. But of course, that‚Äôs fully expected with such spectacular gameplay, graphics, and storylines!

Firstly, I genuinely do recommend this game. The beginning of the game is so much fun and there‚Äôs a bunch of content and stuff to do! You get a lot of  in game currency and you‚Äôre able to get a bunch of different characters for free! The graphics are stunning, it‚Äôs satisfying when you level up your characters, theres a bunch of different activities, and lots of events. However, the reason why I didn‚Äôt rate it five stars is because of the endgame. After playing for a while you exhaust the content and it gets really grindy and theres not much to do. Of course, there‚Äôs events and all that kind of stuff, however besides that there‚Äôs really only the spiral abyss.
My recommendation is to take the game slow, enjoy it in the beginning! If you don‚Äôt like the endless grind at the end you can always just come back to it later when there‚Äôs more content. So while I do recommend the game, just be aware there‚Äôs not much to do in the endgame. :)

The game itself is absolutely fantastic. The characters, the storyline, the graphics, it‚Äôs all great. The main reason why I can‚Äôt give it a full five stars is both because of the community and miHoYo. All of the drama surrounding the first anniversary is being handled terribly on both sides. I can understand why people are upset, the first anniversary was a highly anticipated event and it fell short. The rewards were mediocre at best, and the web event only benefited a very small number of people. MiHoYo has also been censoring people by removing the signature feature in-game, and by removing posts and banning people in Discord and on HoYoLAB. I don‚Äôt believe it‚Äôs right at all, but I also believe that the ridiculous backlash from the community was completely unwarranted. Particularly when it comes to the negative reviews that are being spammed both on Genshin, as well as on Honkai. Overall, it‚Äôs a mess of a situation but if you‚Äôre a new player who wants to get into the game then do it. I would highly recommend it, just avoid the community at the moment.

The game‚Äôs graphics and music are beautiful and the world is fun to explore, but once you‚Äôre done exploring and doing the quests there isn‚Äôt much to do. Most end game content uses resin and you use a day‚Äôs worth of resin in like 15 minutes. 

The rewards the game gives you are negligible and embarrassing when compared to other gacha games. AR rewards are nothing considering how long it takes to get AR levels after 50. Getting primogems is difficult and is required to get characters in the game. The likelihood of getting characters is very low and the pitty system doesn‚Äôt even guarantee you the character/weapon you want. And there are no deals or bundles in the shop that help you get characters. This is very disappointing as players have the potential to enjoy the game so much more if their favorite characters were more accessible. 

The game is enjoyable and has potential to be far better. It is worth trying, but at the moment I would suggest new players not to buy anything in game as everything is overpriced and simple not worth what you pay for.

I wish there was a huge variety of outfits or skins for the characters. Like October is coming up and it would be nice if each character can have their own Halloween costume

Fun game, i can honestly say i dropped more hours in it than i expected. Very dynamic play style and the first mobile mmo to feel like an actual mmo. A lot to do and a fantastic story. Now why my review is 2 stars. Reward scaling is ridiculous. You have a game mechanic called your adventure rank which governs in game difficulty and level caps. Every time you gain a rank you get a reward to help with the new difficulty. Except, the rewards are useless by the time you reach that adventure rank. They would have been useful maybe 20 ranks ago. You can only get meta characters and weapons through very low chance summons. With maybe 2-3 banners up for 6 weeks. It takes at least 50 summons for a guaranteed 5 star. Summon mats are not easy to get so youre grinding for a month just to get maybe 20 summons. Improvements‚Ä¶allow players to grind for characters and character constellation materials. More banners! Larger shop for in game currency and purchasable currency. Better weapon acquisition system for 5 stars. Logical reward scaling for AR40+ ‚Ä¶System to grind for cosmetics

I starting playing Genshin Impact back in March 2021; I downloaded it in a mediocre hotel room over crappy wifi after having seen the millionth ad for it. I have not been disappointed. Although, some of the ads are quite questionable in nature and don't represent the game well enough, I assure that it's a great game. It's a very wide-open map with plenty of things to do and explore; (I've even tried to get my partner to download it so we could go on Genshin dates just because it's such a expansive world map.) The problem that comes with large maps and plentiful content though is the amount of storage it takes, but it hasn't been a major problem for me.... yet. I'm also grateful for the many platforms that can be used to play GI; I play on mobile, but I'd like to play on PC as soon as I can. There's so many options and opportunities in Genshin. I highly recommend downloading it!!! üò©üëç‚ù§Ô∏è - Owl

First off let me say that I love this game. I have played gacha games for many years but have not found any as immersive as Genshin. The music, the scenery, story, gameplay and characters are amazing. I play just about every day. That being said, there are some things that could be added or improved.

1. Weekly boss battles don‚Äôt need to cost resin. They are only playable for rewards once a week and the resin they cost could be spent on other things such as artifact quests, wits, material and mora quests.

2. Resin either needs have a higher cap or a faster refill time. Both would be preferable as that would allow for more game time between updates.

3. I also think it would improve the game to have occasional quests that offer up free new four and five star characters/ unique weapons/ skins (like the quest for Barbara‚Äôs summer skin for example). Other games do this and still use the gacha system to release characters. This idea would help with the oft heard lament that game content gets finished too quickly. The interesting part of this idea is that it could be used to encourage exploration or could require players to visit multiple regions.

4. Certain characters in the game get a lot of negativity due to having not aged well as the game has progressed. These include Amber and Qiqi and would benefit from buffs to improve gameplay

I‚Äôll admit ‚Äî I‚Äôve never been interested in the mmorpg-style of online games, and I had no problems initially disregarding Genshin Impact because of its mainstream hype during the year. But to my surprise (and slight chagrin), the game turned out to be incredibly engaging! I‚Äôve never been so invested within an open-world setting before and the fact that certain adventures and events are ‚Äúunlocked‚Äù throughout the months allow the environment to not feel stale or boring like most other rpg games. 

Honestly, I haven‚Äôt stopped playing it daily after downloading it only a few days ago, and after thoroughly enjoying it for a while, I couldn‚Äôt believe that a game with this much world building, fantastic art, game mechanics and story was listed as a free app! I could go on and on with how much I love this game, but just know that you will not be disappointed when exploring the world of Genshin Impact!

The fact that people are giving this game one star because of the skin colors of characters in game is frankly ridiculous. It seems snowflakes are getting offended on behalf of the Middle Eastern community, many of whom have expressed time and time again that they love how their culture has been shown and that they appreciate the new Sumeru region. 

This game is honestly beautiful and a joy to play. The graphics, music, and gameplay are all on a totally different level than most mobile games. I‚Äôve been playing since launch and just played through some of the Sumeru update with it‚Äôs whole new map and new story quests, and I am in total awe. I didn‚Äôt think the exploration could get any better but it did. The story quests have also improved in writing and I was on the edge of my seat the entire time. Exploring the world in this game is truly a magical experience.

I love this game but I had to take a star off for everything that is bothersome in this game. 
1st is paimon. There needs to be an option to completely replace or mute paimon without muting the other characters. Paimon is not a guid nor is she a good companion. The way she is used to further the plot is annoying at best. If the traveler has a voice, then WHY do we need this flying piglet to speak for us? This is not how you do the ‚Äúsilent but deadly‚Äù troupe. There‚Äôs a long list of issues I have with paimon but I will leave it here.
2nd: the lore. This game loves to shove lore down your throat at every given turn. Lore being in some story quests are fine but I play the events to get primogems, not find out about razor‚Äôs parents. This could‚Äôve been explored in his story/hangout quest. Why they felt the need to add it just as a new map launched is beyond my understanding. There‚Äôs just way too much lore and too much forcing a connection with npcs. I don‚Äôt care about them, I want to find my sibling.

Oh and the drop rates for gacha are despicable.

I have been playing since beta. I like to put time into a game before I write a review. I can honestly say I have fun with this game. I have played on all available platforms (PS4/PS5, PC, iPad, Mobile). This game is perfect when traveling or visiting family or friends out of town as you can take it with you wherever you go! The gameplay is great, You can always hop on and off as you please. I would say if you enjoy anime aesthetics and gameplay that resembles something like Zelda BOTW and the like then this game is worth your time. It is a FREE to play game so if you are on the fence, download it, try it. Literally nothing to loose, and you may gain a game you enjoy playing. If you ever feel like spending money on it you get characters/ weapons for doing so. If not you can still earn them by playing the game. Not sure what else to say. Go try it for yourself!

Thank you for your time.

This app is a great app. The visuals are amazing and the story is the best. Three characters have very cool designs and you get a lot of freedom. There‚Äôs also lots of things to do so you don‚Äôt get bored! Such as hangout events, wishing, daily commissions, world quests, story quests, archon quests, and much more. This is a great game and I‚Äôve spent quite some time on it. Its truly addicting. But, there are two main problems that I‚Äôve had so far. First, let‚Äôs say I‚Äôm running toward a mountain or a hill. When I get closer while I‚Äôm running, it takes a while to load. Basically, its just a solid color and takes a while for it to get its actual texture. That is really annoying because as I said, the visuals are amazing and I would love to see them. Second is crashing. I crash so much and I gotta say it really gets on my nerves. Thats really all I can say, thanks for this great game and I also recommend getting Genshin Impact.

I‚Äôm not the type who usually enjoys MMORPG‚Äôs, they‚Äôre incredibly grindy and boring for me. However, Genshin Impact is one of the games that has changed my view on MMO‚Äôs. Not only are the graphics and characters great, but the story keeps your interest. I can‚Äôt wait to see how far this game will come along!!

Couple suggestions though!!

Is it possible to have friends on other servers? I wasn‚Äôt able to locate one of them because he was in Europe, and I was in the American server. If not, definitely should be a thing! :)

Another thing that would be really neat is romancing characters in game! Going on dates and gifting them things.

Some other suggestions would be to make talking to friends more accessible, even if we‚Äôre not in co-op, it would be nice to talk to the ones online. 

I think the co-op mode definitely needs some tweaks, but it‚Äôs getting there. It‚Äôs not the greatest game for co-op, because there‚Äôs a lack of things your friends can do with you. We should be able to do more quests with them. It would also be nice to be able to have avatar emotes in game. 

Another thing I think could need updating, is the camera option. There‚Äôs a lack of poses and features for it, as a creative person, it would be nice to be able to take more photos of my game and with my friends! 

But all in all, you guys did a really good job with this game, though there‚Äôs still a few things that need to be tweaked.

When I first checked out this game in the App Store I thought it would be another one of those poorly made mobile games with the same concept as always. Genshin Impact does not fail to change that. Graphics/Gameplay wise don‚Äôt feel bad at all. The game can get immersive and keep you busy if you‚Äôre into rpg games. The character design as well as the environmental design is eye catching as well giving a ‚Äúlifting-mood‚Äù to me. 

The dialogue isn‚Äôt that interesting but the voice actors sure do make it like it doesn't matter what they say. They did a good job trying to pick voice actors for the characters.

In conclusion I definitely do recommend everyone to check out this game if they‚Äôre bored or tired of the same old poor designed mobile games. Genshin Impact so far has definitely changed my perspective of mobile gaming but there‚Äôs always some downside of it. Let that reassure you that it shouldn‚Äôt stop you from enjoying it. 4/5 (no ducks in the game)

Genshin. I first started playing couple months ago and at first it was really good. The graphics is amazing, voice acting is top tier, and the story line is great. The only reason I would grind was to get primogems but no matter how many countless hours of grinding and over thousands of primogems I haven‚Äôt gotten one five star character. It‚Äôs so rigged and the chances are way to low. Back to quest, some is unnecessarily long with barely primogems rewarded, the texts get extremely long and boring. A lot of the time I wanna punch Paimon because she‚Äôs the most annoying thing in the game. My advance to improve the game, add a lot more creatures and animals because it doesn‚Äôt feels Livy, make the grind and rewards much better, MAKE WUSHES COST LESS.

I want to start off by saying how amazing a game genshin is- and i 100% recommend people to play it‚Ä¶ if they can. Now with the app at a total of over 14 gb, it makes it almost impossible to download, and, if i want to play it, i have to delete almost everything else on my iPad. Now don't get me wrong- i LOVE the game- i just really wish that the developers could find a way to make it take up less storage- although i understand that with how detailed the game is, that making it online would make it even more laggy. Anyways, its a great game overall!!! Thank you for making this, we love it! <3

When I first got Genshin impact, I thought I wouldn‚Äôt really like it ( I‚Äôm not big on rpgs). But when I fought my first fight, I knew I would love it. There‚Äôs so much to explore and so many different ways to play the game, I‚Äôm never bored. A really good thing is that you don‚Äôt necessarily have to pay to be good at the game, you just need skills. And the game never pressures you, so you have all the time in the world to get better at whatever it is you need. One small complaint from me, though, when you‚Äôre in a cutscene and you leave the game, when you rejoin you have to watch the cutscene all over again. But overall, even though the game might seem challenging at first, it gets easier as you learn different things from the helpful npc‚Äôs. One big thing that you can notice is the graphics. They are amazing! Sometimes better than pc graphics. 10/10 Amazing game, great for all ages.

Very appreciative of how I notice the clock counting down to maintenance. And then once it happened, I found some work to do and came back just moments ago to find what was an estimated 5 hour update with 90 gems per hour and still got more gems than the time was worth.

I like how feedback is actually taken in as it‚Äôs a huge part of what sets this apart from other games like it. Is it perfect, no, most things aren‚Äôt. You‚Äôll definitely want to invest in a controller for your phone if you‚Äôre like me, however, the cross platform accessibility is a huge plus. 

The game is charming in visuals and for a mobile user (once again üòÇ) it‚Äôs on the top of the ‚Äòputty games‚Äô.

As a lover of the old LoZ, FF, and the old platformers, it is its own game. Not to say it doesn‚Äôt borrow mechanics heavily, as literally MOST games do! but it also makes it its own before presenting it to you in an optional play for play or play and pay to play.

In that regard, I was never forced down an ad, a reminder that could spend money, or any real roadblock in the main game.

However, I‚Äôm told the curve flattens out once the story is done and you are faced with a slower progression. I‚Äôm fortunate to play games slow in progression but quick and numerous with farming anyways so it‚Äôs a treat.

Give it a try, and at the cost of a download, install, and 10gbs of space you‚Äôll find out if it‚Äôs a good fit for you.

As of writing this I have just finished the chapter 1 prologue missions on PS4, mobile, and PC. I‚Äôm a heavy mobile gamer that dabbles into the console from time to time. This game has great longevity and playability... there are elements of a lot of games in this one including BOTW but it‚Äôs also very different than those games in a lot of ways. There is a unique gameplay and style to this game that you can‚Äôt find anywhere else.... from playing through the opening fights and missions I‚Äôve found the load times and quality of graphics on the PC far surpass the PS4 and mobile... my computer isn‚Äôt the best gaming computer either (acer nitro 5) runs seamlessly and feels more fluid.... this is also my first ‚Äúcomputer‚Äù game I‚Äôve played that‚Äôs not solitaire or some match 3 game... I highly recommend this game for everyone.... now if they can get on board with the Apple TV and run the game through that platform... I feel like there would be great potential!

I have been a long time player of genshin and probably will still play for awhile more. With this recent dehya banner and my summons on it I have come to realize how terrible it all is. Not only did they release dehya as one of the worst characters ever released the rates of getting the character/weapon are so terrible I can‚Äôt continue to condone and spend money on this game. For frame of reference I spent a minimum of 354 summons on her banner and her weapon banner (about 120 on weapon and 230 on her banner) which if you look at in the store is equal to $900 of summons. Yet with all that I only got her once and her weapon once. That is not okay. The summon rates are too atrocious for me to support anymore especially if they are going to release a character that me and many others have been looking forward to for a long time now in such a horrible condition. The game is a good game overall but the horrible summoning rates and price of summons just kills any interest in supporting this game monetarily anymore. You can play the game but I would suggest never spending money on this since it will all just go to waste.

So this game is actually AMAZING. You can explore and adventure throughout the entire game. There are just absolutely beautiful graphics and characters to discover. This game is basically perfect!‚Ä¶ except for the storage and updates. If you have an older device you might find that this game is capable of taking up half of your storage alone. But it you‚Äôve got plenty of room on your mobile device, you won‚Äôt have any trouble with this game. Now for the updates, I love them! The only problem is that every time genshin updates I have to wait for my phone to update the app ( with it open and on ) for up to an hour! I really love genshin impact i just wish it would be a little less of a hassle to play. But keeping in mind that it has such amazing gameplay it is understandable why it needs so much storage, especially since it‚Äôs mobile accessible.

before i say anything controversial, i‚Äôve been playing genshin impact for about two years now. this game is beautifully designed, and i couldn‚Äôt recommend it more. though, there are a few things that i want to talk about. as i‚Äôm sure you‚Äôve seen before, there is almost no content for endgame players. seriously. sure, it may take a while to get there, but for the people that have, it can be really dull. secondly, the wishing system. (this is how you get cool weapons and characters.) getting primogems as an endgame player is a pain. sure, you can go exploring but that only gets you about 1~5 gems every chest. the only way to get a ton is the spiral abyss, which has stupidly difficult mechanics. even if you somehow save a load of primogems, there is still a chance you may not get the characters you want. there are a ton of f2p players that are incredible at this game don‚Äôt get me wrong, but i honestly feel like the majority of players can agree that this is mainly a p2w (pay to win) game. i know that these developers need to get their money somehow, but baiting people into buying stuff is just wrong. there would be so many more genshin players if we were able to get characters easier. once again, don‚Äôt get me wrong, this is a fun game, but i regret spending money. enjoy new players (: ad astra abyssosqe!!

This is definitely the best game on the App Store, but honestly that‚Äôs a low bar to clear. Genshin impact is easily on my top 10 favorite games of all time! Genshin impact has a massive world brimming with life, characters that have depth and feel real, deep yet simple combat and story that had my jaw on the floor. Genshin impact is known for its gacha and for good reason, because it‚Äôs gacha is one the worst I have ever had the displeasure of witnessing, it‚Äôs less about getting lucky as it is getting 80 pulls and having a 50% chance to even get the character. For scale I‚Äôll give you the numbers, one pull is 160 primos, each day you have daily commissions that give 60 primos and events will typically give 50 primos per day. So each day you get 110 primos and each pull is 160 primos so you will spend well over a month gathering primos trying to get the character. Absolutely horrible.

If you have not downloaded this game then you are missing out.

Ever since I started this game I was just glued to it. I got qiqi, my first 5 star in just 20 pulls and I was happy! The archon quests were so fun and exciting, PLUS the world quests were all so creative! I got so many primos and free wishes, and I saved for zhongli and got him, guaranteed. Overall, I was happy. My limited 5 stars collection was growing and I finally made it to the end of the current archon quests available! Then, everything went downhill. I had finished most of the world quests and archon quests and I was getting kind of bored, cause I had nothing to do now for primos and entertainment (besides my dailies, which only gives me 60 primos a day and spiral abyss which only happens every month) It was also hard to save for characters now because I‚Äôve basically explored everything and already claimed the primos. 5*->4* because of the rates. Makes me want to stop playing tbh. This game has such miserable rates. Don‚Äôt even get your hopes up for a certain banner or you‚Äôll be crushed. Saved 60 summons for a certain banner.. nothing. The only way you‚Äôll get it is if you have 180 summons saved (which takes forever) to be able to hit both the normal pity and then the banner pity. Absolutely disgusting when you can‚Äôt even level the constellations of these characters until the next banner hits (if you have wishes saved and skip on any other cool summons...) Good thing the art in this game and the exploration help to make up for the trash rates, hence my rating. The grinding is a drag but luckily it ends when you hit cap level & get the needed artifacts. However, this game could be so much better if it weren‚Äôt so stingy on wishes and drop rates. They‚Äôre hard enough to obtain as it is‚Ä¶ I get wanting the game to last, but there are other ways to do this.

1) Loyal Genshin players have been asking for months for Genshin to increase resin count/lower resin time to make up for the increased amount of domains to farm. They have not listened or made adjustments.
2) Design team puts in research and effort in making characters properly represented by the cultures they are inspired from (Liyue = China, Inazuma = Japan) but does not give the Middle East, North Africa, and South Asia the same treatment. Whereas other regions are representative of specific countries, the region of Sumeru is an orientalist mess, taking from various different cultures in countries that are separate from one another.
3) Design team is allergic to creating characters with melanin. Other games such as BOTW, Dislyte, etc. are able to create culturally researched characters with varied skin tones. 2 out of the 48 playable characters in Genshin, including the ones from Sumeru (a region with NPCS and enemy bandits with darker skin tones) have skin tones darker than a paper bag. 

As the game developers continue to show blatant disrespect to feedback from their fanbase, I am no longer supporting Hoyoverse as a whole including their future games.

i will preface this with i love the gameplay. i play every day, am currently ar 54, and love exploring! BUT. there are some HUGE issues that are entirely unacceptable. despite being a mobile game maker, mihoyo makes this game impossible for mobile players. my game will crash ~every 15 mins or if i teleport more than like 5 times. this makes it difficult to do co op with others, because i will just freeze up and i either have to be kicked so they have a full team or they wait a few mins for my game to start back up (neither solution is that good). the updates also take up an outrageous amount of storage, and to update i have to delete pictures and apps to be able to play (i cant even imagine how it will be with all 7 nations). these issues have to be fixed because at some point these issues might grow so huge i have to stop playing (i know mihoyo doesn‚Äôt care, but if you are considering downloading this on a phone, please make sure you have tons of storage or can transfer to a computer if needed).

Ok so to start this game is amazing, the graphics are really nice and gameplay and lore is creative and fun, the main problem that most players have is that the primogems and resin system is really bad. Once you get into higher adventure ranks it‚Äôll be even harder for people to get primogems for wishes which is really bad altogether for a gacha game and to top it off the resin system is also really bad when players want to buff up their characters. You get 1 resin every 8 minutes and it‚Äôs terrible for people who need anything from any kind of domain, please Mihoyo at least upgrade the primogems earnings and resin time. Free to play players won‚Äôt be able to enjoy this game without a difficulty spike and since they are free to play they won‚Äôt want to spend their time buffing up their characters, I beg of you Mihoyo please make this game gacha system easier, you will still get millions even if you add more ways to get primogems and resin.

I‚Äôve played this game for the past year, albeit I took a couple months break. Everything about this game is amazing. From the lore and storyline to the voice acting, combat, and open world - it‚Äôs seemingly a AAA Action RPG title, that‚Äôs free to play. The only gripes I have is the lack of content in some patches, which some call them ‚Äúfiller‚Äù patches and how hard it is to get Primogems (premium currency in-game) as a free-to-play player. This is coming from someone who has a ‚Äúpay-to-play‚Äù account AND a free-to-play account. Aside from that, I‚Äôm grateful for a game that keeps me excited to play everyday and new content from patches to come. Genshin Impact is the only game I‚Äôve consistently played for the past year. Every other game I‚Äôve played, even if I logged hundreds of hours into it, gets stale. However, Genshin Impact doesn‚Äôt. Thank you Mihoyo and the Genshin Impact development team. I can‚Äôt wait to try Honkai Star Rail.

This has become my favorite game. I am disabled and it helps me pass the time I‚Äôm confined to my bed. I love finding treasure and oculus as well as solving puzzles. The combat isn‚Äôt my favorite part but it‚Äôs fun. It‚Äôs a pretty well thought out system so that for people like me who aren‚Äôt crazy about grinding for artifacts or can‚Äôt afford the best weapons or units or constellations can still play all of the content and do reasonably well. Nothing in particular feels insurmountable even with basic units. I love that they added finding chests and oculus into the anniversary rewards though as a budget player I wish they had given out a free 5 star for the anniversary or done double artifact drops or given out 100 wishes like other gatcha games. I will continue telling others about the game and recommending it to my friends and family members but I will let them know the issues as well as the perks.

To start off this review please know that this is a gacha game. The content isn‚Äôt necessarily pay to win but it will definitely make it easier. Being a F2P player will definitely ask for a lot of grinding. With it being a free game the gameplay is more than enough. On the same level as mmorpg‚Äôs you would buy. The reason for my rating is the lack of end game content. Millions of players have been constantly playing since the release who are now in the end game. We are getting bored. It‚Äôs becoming a chore to play the game at this point. The lack of any decent anniversary rewards doesn‚Äôt make it better either. Expect nothing but stingy-ness from the company. They only want your money and don‚Äôt care what their consumers think. They also show favoritism to their Chinese consumers. Also currently now putting out censorship on all their forums resorting to any negativity towards the anniversary rewards. Mihoyo is a joke. I would still definitely recommend this game if you‚Äôre looking for a game to explore a new world and NEVER spend your money.

I really, really love this game. It has kept me company during quarantine and (I play on my phone) has let me explore something absolutely stunning without the need to buy a console. The soundtrack is perfect and I find myself listening to the songs just to relax or to relive the moments of the story, a story which is actually pretty well written for a gacha game. I spent quite a bit on this gem of a game and I do not regret it. But gosh, what are the rewards for the anniversary? I wasn‚Äôt expecting a lot but this has just made me feel awful, it‚Äôs plainly underwhelming. I don‚Äôt understand why, what‚Äôs the need to reward your players with what‚Äôs very close to nothing? The rewards‚Äô page in game doesn‚Äôt even say that it‚Äôs the actual anniversary. It doesn‚Äôt feel like it is, in fact, since the game is pretty much empty as of now. I can‚Äôt wrap my head around it, everyone is disappointed or outraged and I‚Äôm just incredibly sad. 
I don‚Äôt want 100 wishes or a 5 star selector, I just want to feel like I‚Äôm actually celebrating. Like a year actually went by and we reached this milestone together. I love this game but all of this is awful.

I‚Äôve been playing this game for a long time, and I‚Äôve also contributed to the amount of income the game has received. Not only me, but others too, have given their love and devotion to the game. So you can imagine how we felt, when we were given rewards that weren‚Äôt up to par with our expectations. The rewards do not thank us for the dedication and love we‚Äôve shown so far. It almost feels like mihoyo does not care about the players they bring in, and the ones who are still here. Not only have we been disappointed yet again by the greed of this company, but we have also been given characters with terrible kits recently. These characters, the company still chooses to not fix. So far any attempts to give them constructive criticism have been in vain, because they have all been ignored. We want to be able to stick with this game, but it‚Äôs been getting a bit hard to stay. Especially when you have the company completely ignoring our concerns and inputs. Im not telling new people that they should play this game, but I‚Äôm saying that they should be prepared, because it might get worse from here.

Update: Controller support has been added with update 1.3: I originally gave the game 3 stars, but have increased to 5. Thank you developers for listening! This is definitely my favorite game in recent years.

genshin has brought me a lot of comfort since i started playing back in february, and being able to wander around a different world than my own has brought me a lot of happiness. though i can understand why people have their gripes about certain things, and i do too, for me personally the good far outweighs the bad.

i adore the characters and story, you can clearly see a lot of thought and care put into each design, not just in the characters but in the environment as well. and the story itself just feels so big and grandiose to me, since we've barely scratched the surface of the tale being told. i'm very much looking forward to seeing how the plot plays out!

though, this game is not without issue. once you get pretty late in the game there's not a whole lot to do, you can wander around but past ~AR45 there's a good chance you've explored most of the area already. there are constant events which is great, but they're never permanent and there's only so much substance they provide. 

all in all, genshin impact is a great game, though it takes up a lot of space i'd say it's well worth it if you enjoy open world exploration and intricate storylines, and if you're willing to wait for new content to be added once you reach the end of the currently available archon quests.

and to mihoyo, keep up the great work!

This game is honestly one of the best games on mobile, I‚Äôm not surprised it came from the creators of Honkai Impact. I don‚Äôt see it as a Breath of the Wild clone, it has its own uniqueness and even with similar functions when controlling the character I barely even think about the similarities. My only gripes with the game are the lag in certain places, especially when fighting against lots of monsters. The lag mostly happens whenever I use Klee. The voices and dialogue are great as well, but there are some places where the dialogue box either doesn‚Äôt match up with what the voice line of the character is saying or it‚Äôs incorrectly saying something. (For example, I am using the male character for the game, but Paimon refers to me as a ‚Äòshe‚Äô when talking about going into Stormterror‚Äôs Lair.) Overall not too bad of an issue, since this doesn‚Äôt happen all the time, but it would be wonderful if you guys could fix some of these bugs. Thanks!

AR 40 here
No matter if you are a hardcore player or a casual you will eventually hit AR 30 and you will start to run out of meaningful things to do in Monstadt and Liyue then you‚Äôre left with a few options, scavenge the world hope there‚Äôs a respawned chest or one you‚Äôve missed, wait for daily commission and resin, or pay the absurd price for resin that also increases in price. Don‚Äôt forget about co-op, with only 180 resin a day you can do 9 domains with your friends! Even if it took 10 mins to do one domain thats 90 mins of gameplay that you would have to wait 2hrs and 40 mins to even do one domain. The game has so many hours and hours of content all for free. I cannot thank Hoyoverse enough for letting us play this. Getting into the game first;of course; can feel slow to a lot of people. Genshin is honestly peerless in its category. Imaginative, massively broad in scope, graphically beautiful, satisfying to optimize and learn. The greatest challenge facing Mihoyo at this point is endgame content, which can feel somewhat limited and repetitive after several months of dedicated play. However, that is not nearly enough to condemn it, and Genshin has been a daily part of my life for over 400 days now. I even decided to run a second account from scratch to relive the story and see what luck it would have with the gacha system. The fan base can be uncomfortably fanatic sometimes, but you can probably avoid the odd ones and find a good niche. My largest caveat is about the gambling experience of gacha, which some may not struggle with at all. If you are like me, this game can become a major outlet for creativity and stress relief. Would download again if I went back in time.

This game is open world yes, but they lack endgame extremely. If you‚Äôre looking for a game with good endgame then pass along as this game only offers 4 floors called the abyss. It is four floors and refreshes only once every two weeks. That it‚Ä¶ that‚Äôs the only endgame they have. Also, they don‚Äôt have guilds, pvp, or actually dungeons. Only these things called domains which take about 3 minutes each to play. Don‚Äôt waste your time on this game until they add the things listed above that they‚Äôre missing. If a game doesn‚Äôt have good endgame then it will die faster than the company thinks. Plus the community has been asking for these fixed including a fix to the resign system since day 1 and they haven‚Äôt addressed or properly fixed the issue everyone is having. There are multiple better games out there as this one is incomplete with the terrible lack of endgame content. Once you get there you will see that there is literally nothing left to do. Pass on this game and go find a game with good endgame content. You can thank me later.

First of all, I can't believe this game is free to play. It's expansive, includes TONS of characters, has interesting and interactive world building and the lore is is unique. Maintenance is always rewarded generously, and there are CONSTANT events going on. You seriously can't get bored of this game.
 
However, it's poorly optimized and doesn't run well on most devices, which is why I play mainly on my PC. I wish we were allowed to limit render distance so the game would run better. I also wish there were more options for customizing the settings, such as eliminating all the animated grass. I just don't enjoy how it looks personally. 

Otherwise, the gameplay is fun an innovative, they add new mechanics (such as my favorite new mechanic: fishing!) and the daily commissions are extra incentive to play daily. I always have quests to do and areas to explore. I look forward for the content to come! Thank you Mihoyo :)

I generally don‚Äôt write reviews, so I‚Äôll try to keep this short. Genshin Impact is definitely my favorite mobile game I‚Äôve ever played. I definitely would recommend it to just about everyone. The mechanics in the game are easy to use and leveling up actually makes sense. This game is basically a crossover of Nino Kuni, if you‚Äôve ever played it, and Skyrim. I absolutely love this game. So, now on to a few issues I‚Äôve found. This game takes up about 10 gigs of storage, making it impossible to make room for. I‚Äôve practically deleted my whole iPad for it. I‚Äôve also found that the game will randomly crash at points, making me have to open it up and wait for it to load each time it crashes, and it‚Äôs quite annoying. Besides those few things, which I hope they can patch, Genshin Impact is a fantastic game. Thank you so much for reading this, and please go download it and give it a try!

Its amazing to me games are allowed to collect and store troves of personal information. This app wants total access to everything on your phone. Why does a game need to access my contact info? Why does it need to have the ability to access, modify and even delete any photo on my device? Its insane that so many people don‚Äôt understand the consequences. Some random person in china can look and examine every single photo on your phone, copy and save said photo without notifying you. Snap a pic of your ID for employment or other reasons yep this company now has your ID. A sexy selfie for someone. Yep they have that as well. There is no restrictions because you have given permission under the false guise of ‚Äúerror reporting‚Äù or other problems. You think they can only access game related photos but no they get all your photos. Also they get access to your info like emails, phone numbers, age, device info like OS and OS version so they can exploit vulnerabilities. Even worse if you play on PC. Absolutely zero reason for a game to need this info outside of ID theft and stealing period.

This game is extremely stingy for no reason. It is a great game which is why it got a 3/5 stars. It has three main problems. One is that it is a game that forced you to log into the game everyday with its resin system combined with a slim chance to get good gear it takes more than a month to fully complete your character. The second problem is that it is super stingy and greedy right now is the anniversary event for a game that has been out for two years you would expect the game to give us a good reward, but no it gives us a single ten pull     ( you need 90 pulls to get a guaranteed 5 star character) and a trash event that I would assume takes 2-3 hours of boring story that I don‚Äôt care about. I have seen games that make way less money than this game and is way more generous. It is greedy also in the sense of that you need to pull 90 times to get a guaranteed 5 star. The. Once you get a 5 star you only 50/50 chance for your desired 5 star which is a problem because it is extremely hard to get primogems in the late game. So overall this game is extremely mid and needs to be more generous.

This may sound clich√© or dramatic, but two months ago I lost my grandmother to kidney failure. She was my best friend in the whole world and I went into a deep state of sadness. My friends texted me about Genshin Impact, so I tried it. I immediately fell in love with the character design and the The Outlander Who Caught the Wind story quest. I‚Äôm not saying that this video game fixed my sadness but it did make me feel more joyful. Although some may say Mihoyo is not genserous to their community, you may be saying something in the ballpark of the truth. Nevertheless Mihoyo has represented that they could build an uplifting community from scratch. Though there are a multitude of reasons I play Genshin Impact, I mostly play for the experience and for fun. Personally I have become very emotionally invested in this game and I have not been disappointed. Thank you to Mihoyo for brightening my world and other‚Äôs. You truly are great.

Now, before I go off about the things I don‚Äôt like, it‚Äôs worth mentioning that this is probably one of the funniest games I‚Äôve played. There‚Äôs a HUGE variety of things to do with a compelling story and charming characters. I mean it‚Äôs heavily inspired by Zelda (breath of the wild to be exact) but it‚Äôs free. But that‚Äôs the thing. I wanna be a f2p gamer but getting a character is so hard. Not to mention the fact that you have to wait for you‚Äôre favorite character‚Äôs banner to come back or might not even come back at all. It‚Äôs stressful because the chances are SOOOOO low and annoying. Ppl can spend a lot of money on the game and not get anything from it, I mean there is literally a 0.6 % chance of getting the banner character. Anyways I think that to fix this problem you should
Number 1: increase the chances of getting a character ( or 4/5 star weapon) and not some useless 3 star weapon 

Number 2:  give me better rewards and more primogems, I mean ppl can reach up to adventure rank 56 and only be given 1 wish which would probably end up being a skyrider sword per usual, maybe at least 10 wishes every 10 adventure rank reached, or 1 wish per adventure rank 

Number 3: I think this the best option which is to add all rerun the banner characters the standard, it doesn‚Äôt have to have a high chance just as long as i know that someone I can bring home venti or zhongli

ok, yes i‚Äôm just writing this for nahida luck but i actually really enjoy this game. i don‚Äôt log on all that much except for new updates or whenever i feel like it, so im not an endgame player yet and there‚Äôs still a lot for me to do. for new players, there‚Äôs going to be a whole lot, and that avoids what most endgame players complain about. the graphics for this game are absolutely stunning, and the character designs are so pretty and intricate, i find myself just staring at them for a while. the quests are really immersive and fun to play if you don‚Äôt mind the cutscenes. one of my problems with it is i play on mobile, and it  takes up so much storage. i understand this is kind of unavoidable, but it‚Äôs still something i think should be addressed to new players before they find themselves addicted and purging apps and photos to be able to play. definitely not speaking from experience. another problem i have with it is how difficult it is to get primogems when you‚Äôve done everything. you‚Äôve done most if not all quests that give you primogems, and the only way to get more is through daily commissions, that don‚Äôt give you a lot, and buying some. events give some too but they‚Äôre temporary and not always consistent. aside from all that, this is a great game, and one i highly reccomend!

I completely love Genshin impact. I‚Äôve been playing it for almost a year, and first off, the characters are all very good and the GACHA system is pretty good . The characters are super detailed and all unique. The combat is smooth, and the storyline is engaging (yet it is unfinished) And the game is pretty F2P friendly, if your not trying to collect every character. For example, your going for someone like Hu Tao, who is a five-star. Instead of getting her, you get Bennett. Bennett is a Four star that even if he isn‚Äôt a 5-star, he can still carry and help you along the story. The design of the open world is just gorgeous and I love taking pictures. The one very small problem is that I don‚Äôt see as many POC characters. Though, a new place is coming out soon based off Egypt, so I think we‚Äôll be seeing more characters of color. I definitely recommend this game!!

I discovered Genshin impact over a year ago because my dad played it and wowowow do I love it I really do like how there‚Äôs events frequently and there‚Äôs a LOT of content especially when you join the game now! I do love the free rewards when you first join :) I do have to say (so far) after about adventure rank 45-60 there‚Äôs not a lot of content left to play but there‚Äôs still a lot of stuff you can do even after there‚Äôs not a lot of content coming out and I do love welkin! I do think it‚Äôs worth the $5 I‚Äôve gotten it multiple times and no regrets! It definitely helps if your trying to save primogems for a character that you want!  I do wish there was more ways to obtain primogems as an F2P but overall the game really has no flaws to me! I do enjoy the new patches ever 40ish days! To anyone who‚Äôs reading this review I hope you get the game and enjoy it as much as I do :)

This game is amazing with a couple of flaws. The two main problems I have is the co op and I can‚Äôt find anything to do. Sure you can do the bounty‚Äôs, daily commission‚Äôs, boss battles, and the reputation commissions, but it all has a limit of some sort. Edit: I just crafted a portable waypoint and when I tried to use it I deleted it by accident. If you could add a screen asking if you are sure you want to delete the waypoint that would be nice.

I‚Äôm in a hard place in my life right now with no way out. This game is the highlight of my day. Finding things that distracted me from the abuse I‚Äôm going through are hard to find let alone keep. I‚Äôve had this game for about 3 weeks and my mental health has improved. The characters are interesting and unique. The graphics are nice plus the game almost never glitches. There‚Äôs no need to spend money on the game unless you really don‚Äôt want to wait to get a character. The story plot it follows is interesting and introduces the characters as your adventure level go‚Äôs up. The people I‚Äôve met and talk to on this game have been so kind. I have never reviewed a game before, but I had to for Genshin Impact. My phone is constantly full of games that I download, play for a week or two, and get bored of and delete. Genshin is definitely not going to be one of those. 

It‚Äôs an absolutely beautiful open world with great character designs, good plot, and lots of side quests to keep me interested. Even better: it plays like a solo player game and doesn‚Äôt constantly throw pay-only opportunities at you. I feel like I can play in peace without having to make a bunch of ‚Äúfriends‚Äù in a guild I don‚Äôt care about or never able to do anything really fun without shelling out real money to get to a certain VIP level. Really, the only downside is the fact that it eats my battery up and I have to plug in to keep going. But the fact that I want to keep playing even plugged up to my too short charger just shows how great the game is!

Highly recommend!

Hello Mihoyo, I hope your seeing this. First of all I just want to say that Genshin Impact is super fun to play and it‚Äôs literally the only thing that saves me from boredom. Second is I have a really cool idea that I think a lot of players would like. If possible, is there any way you can make a thing where you can duel other players? If you don‚Äôt get what I mean let me explain. So basically, you could ask someone to duel and you bring along four characters. If the person accepts the request you will be automatically be sent to a open area to duel. After you and your opponent click ready, the game will begin. While your opponent charges at you or decides to dodge, you also unleash attacks. To make this more simple, your basically fighting a monster accept that monster is your player opponent. I get if your too busy to do this but please consider!

It‚Äôs been 2yrs and I can‚Äôt believe this game is free to play when it‚Äôs an entire, complete video game with regular updates and events. I know people complain about gacha and the amount of content, but you genuinely don‚Äôt need to use gacha to play, and there‚Äôs an obscene amount of content (especially if you‚Äôre someone with a full time job and other hobbies lol). You can play difficult end game content with F2P characters if you put in the time and look up one of the hundreds of guides online for F2P team comps üßç‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èAnd you don‚Äôt NEED the battle pass to get the most of the game; you don‚Äôt need to buy the Welkin Moon.

I hesitantly downloaded Genshin over a year and a half ago.  I had very low expectations as everyone called it a ‚ÄúBreath of the wild‚Äù ripoff.  Very quickly I discovered that the open world and exploration were the similarities ended (maybe the climbing mechanic and cooking are also similar).  What I found was that this was an extremely polished game that had a very engaging world full of characters and stories.  I have loved every minute in game and discussing it when away from it.  The music, the graphics and gameplay are all fantastic.  The game is generous too.  You can actually do pretty well with just four star characters, I personally have pulled characters because I love the design and the way they enrich the gameplay.  The lore is also really, really good.  I really enjoy this game and hope you will too.  Happy second Anniversary!!
