I have spent a lot of time playing this game since it was recommended to me 2-3 months ago, and I have made lots if progress, reaching Inazuma, unlocking the bottom of the Chasm, have level 60+ characters, etc‚Ä¶ Lately, there has been a massive connection issue, where it will start loading, and damage will only register onto me, which means my character dies when the opponent dies if enough damage was done. Not only that, but although it may be integrated this way, I have begun to grow distant from this game after reaching AR 40 and having to deal with level 70+ NPC enemies, and bosses. I main as Razor and Bennet, and although having done around 50 pulls on the Ayaka banner that has been present since I started playing, I have not gotten close to having a single character who is completely worthy of building. Aside from all of this, the graphics are great, the gameplay is stunning, and the Co-Op feature is a fun way to help lower leveled players.

I see a lot of people complaining about the primo gems thing, but if you are grinding out the game and are willing to buy the welkins thing you can get almost a wish a day for a month (28 wishes) by also completing all the commissions. And if you need some primo gems just grind out dragon spine I got like 300 primo gems from the quests alone and probably another 300 from all the chests and then 100 for all the achievements and like 50 for all the waypoints so roughly 750 primo gems from dragon spine alone not counting the frost bearing tree rewards. If you are going to complain about lack of in-game currency on a game that offers it for free in practically everything you do then you need to get your priorities straight, however if you are going to complain about getting Qiqi and a skyward atlas instead of any good reasonable 5 star then I‚Äôm all ears.

So.. usually when I see games like this I expect it to be a knock off version of something, or its just not a type of game where you say ‚ÄúHey, I love

I just like walking off the edge of the cliff and flying off. Very fun, would recommend.

I absolutely love Genshin, it‚Äôs a great game and I enjoy all its content, however there are a few issues. Kokomi is a 5*. Her value should be comparable to 4* c6 character but she does not. She is outlclassed by so many 4 stars. A healer that needs to be on the field (her elemental burst require u to be in field). What a piece of garbage unit. If ur gonna give her hp scaling and take away crit, at least give her decent scaling. She is so bad. Her kit is so wacky. Love her design but whooooo made her kit. Where is the balance team. Kokomi jelly fish does constant 99 damage. Garbage, during her ult it does maybe 1-2k but guess what she needs to be on the field and can‚Äôt reposition it. Garbage. Why is she built like a hyper carry???? If u want ppl satisfied. Either make her elemtal burst not selfish, or give her hp scaling better so she is comparable to other dps. Also her jelly fish really needs some rework in numbers. It‚Äôs pathetic. Give jelly fish go scaling. For goodnes sake u took away her crit. At least justify that.

This game has been on my radar for a couple of months now. Gotta say I‚Äôm pleased with the results. This game is stunning! Exploration is a pleasure because you never know what you‚Äôll find; the story is decent, and it‚Äôs really satisfying to pull off elemental reactions! I do have some gripes though. As a F2P player, getting new characters is hard. You can (mostly) only do so through wishing (gambling). It probably is possible to progress to end game without a super diverse roster, but I only have two archers and I can‚Äôt increase the level cap of one because I haven‚Äôt made it to a certain region. This brings me down to one useable archer. This could pose some problems with bosses, and this is where I have to wish. Trying to get new characters is hard for F2P players because you get little more than 60 primogems (currency to buy wishes) daily. To make 10 wishes, you need 1600 primogems. This is how the game entices you to spend money. If you are prone to a gambling addiction, do not download this game!

So I have been playing Genshin since February, and it was like love at first sight. The graphics are incredible, especially for a free game. The character designs are beautiful. The open world factor of the game makes everything so interesting. Honestly I could write a ten page essay why this game is the best, but I also came to make a suggestion. My only issue/ complaint I have with the game is that you can't add friends from different servers or play co op with them. For me, this is really frustrating since I have a lot of online friends from Europe or just friends who like servers where they're from better. I feel like there might be a reason why you can't add friends from other servers (like difficulty connecting in co op, etc.) but if it's possible, I really think it would make the game more enjoyable. 

Happy traveling!

I‚Äôm sure many people have heard of Genshin Impact by now, and I have to say it‚Äôs for good reason. This game is genuinely so fun and immersive to play, plus the characters designs and backstories baffle me with all of their detail. Of course no amazing game like this doesn‚Äôt have problems, and I will say Genshin Impact has its fair share. If you‚Äôve played / are currently playing it you might relate to this, but I find that theres not a lot of content in the game at the moment. When you first start playing the developers introduce you to this fantastic world and story, but after you‚Äôve finished all the quests you‚Äôre left a little empty handed. Nonetheless, this game never fails to be amaze me and keep me entertained for a good while. Do keep in mind it takes quite a toll on your storage space, but if you have enough storage to download it then I highly recommend playing this game.

I started out a month after launch and everything was REALLY fun (exploring, meeting new characters, engaging with the community), but after a certain point it feels like Mihoyo just stopped caring about its playerbase and went completely silent. 

End-game players have been voicing their opinions about how they feel and what they should add since the earlier versions of the game and nothing has been done whatsoever, just some small updates that are so niche. It‚Äôs gotten to the point where I just log in and do commissions because there‚Äôs literally nothing to do after completing abyss, 100% exploring, and waiting for resin recharge. 

I can still voice my opinion without all the Genshin Knights saying to just quit the game. But after all the countless hours and money i‚Äôve put in to this game it‚Äôs only fair that I get to do so. In all honestly i‚Äôll stop supporting this game with my money and if a better game comes out, i‚Äôll drop this one. But for now i‚Äôll keep playing‚Ä¶

Even though I rate this at 5 stars, I don‚Äôt recommend playing it on the phone because it runs at far fewer frames than on PC or a console and the game chews through your phone‚Äôs battery. Go grab Genshin Impact on PC or on the consoles and you would enjoy the game much more. This game is very much like Breath of the Wild in terms of being a sight seeing simulator, which is a good thing if you love exploring and searching for secrets, puzzles or random battles. If you didn‚Äôt like Breath of the Wild, Genshin Impact might not be your cup of tea. The rates for 5 star characters is extremely low but you can probably beat the game with the free characters given to you. So far the game does not have a pity system for 5 star characters so beware of spending any amount of money on the game, you could spend hundreds or thousands and not get a 5 star character. Avoid spending a lot on the game and have fun with what you‚Äôre given.

This game is extremely fun when you play with friends because you can help each other in co-op and just run around doing some exploring. Before I would just pull for a character in the current banner and use them. Now I have 7 characters built with really good damage and did my first triple crown within September! My point is if you don‚Äôt have a lot of time this game isn‚Äôt for you lol. After a while you get burnt out because you‚Äôre running around doing the same thing with each login.

The quests to complete in order to participate for events feels like a chore, a task. 

Genshin Impact is a fun open-world RPG with a creativity and spark like no other that can‚Äôt be replicated so simply but if you take the gameplay, it‚Äôs not all that it plays up to be.

The wishing system is also a major drawback. It seems rigged for the amount of wishing in order to attain a five-star, a top tier, just for better gameplay.

Which seems like a massive pushover, because although the gameplay is enjoyable to an extent, the fact that you‚Äôre practically forced or furthermore pressured into wishing for better characters and weapons to better the gameplay is a grand cinch.

As much as I love the gameplay, the lore, the visuals, the characters, etc. The cons, in my opinion, outweigh the remarkable prospects by too much.

Thus causing a currently former-player to delete itself as a whole. I‚Äôm considering re-downloading because I‚Äôve become to miss the 
gameplay but the constant rubbish this app provides is a weighted score.

Best of luck and wishes to everyone who plays and the team who created such a novelty.

Okay so aside from this one critique (and it‚Äôs a big one) I love the game and it‚Äôs story... WITH THAT SAID; The adventure rank system and story progression system is WAY TOO NERFED. Instead of having a natural story progression block like just your characters levels and them being too weak, they have an outside Adventure rank level that you have to level up to progress the story... THIS IS HARDER THAN THE STORY. And for why? It literally takes you out of the experience and makes you feel like you‚Äôre doing grueling tasks. Why does it take a full week to unlock a mere 4
20 minutes of gameplay. It forces you to explore the world, which... understandable I guess but what‚Äôs going to be the fun in exploring the world if you‚Äôre forced to just so you can... play the game? 

But... other than that, the story, from what I‚Äôve been able to play, is super immersive. The character design is very well executed, and aside from the one huge overarching punishment for actually doing the story, it feels like the game rewards you in other ways :)

Honestly, I had no idea what to expect going into this game, but I am very impressed with what you can do. It plays like Breath of the Wild, in terms of exploration and item creation, but it also throws in elemental effects and statuses. You acquire different characters through the story, each one with an assigned element and fighting style, and by switching your party members you can create various effects both in combat and on the environment. There‚Äôs a huge area to explore, even if you don‚Äôt work on story quests immediately. The only issue I‚Äôve encountered so far is that it does make my phone overheat if I play too long, and then the game crashes. But you can also play on other formats, so if your phone can‚Äôt hack it, switch to PC or console versions. 

All in all, I definitely recommend this game for anyone who like games with a focus on exploration and experimentation.

In all honesty, this game is amazing. Genshin Impact was a favorite of mine for almost an entire year, I joined in April 28th of last year. And the first 7-8 months were amazing. But, almost 2 months ago, the game has felt more like a chore then just something you can do in your free time. I haven‚Äôt played at all. There have been times when I did log in but it was all because of curiosity. And I only spent 15-20 minutes online. The last time I‚Äôve been on was a whole 2 weeks ago. If there was just a change in the daily commissions so they could be quicker but at the same time a fun activity to do while your bored, then it would be nice. I know this is going to sound crazy but I have never played any game like how I have played Genshin Impact before. It‚Äôs so evolved that my approach to game playthrough, play style and strategy for an action rpg have completely changed. I have never set goals like this for a game where it gives you an actual sense of accomplishment for achieving something while still keeping the progressive difficulty realistic enough to keep things spicy. It‚Äôs difficult to put down because once you download it and start to get a grip on things you end up unlocking ANOTHER neat feature that adds to the depth and dynamism of the world of Teyvat. Even if you don‚Äôt fully experience immersion like when reading or listening to something this experience will grip you into something comparable to Infinite Tsukiyomi; a blissful world of beauty  and danger in your wildest anime dreams.

This game is all about exploration and elemental combat. The story is creative and the characters have a ton of charm and detail.  Towards the end you have to use limited resources to farm dungeons for better equipment for your characters. Rewards daily play, so despite the gacha system the most beneficial thing you can do for your account is play frequently. Gacha system requires saving game currency diligently or spending real money to get the best characters with the best designs, abilities, and damage potential.  I have been playing since day 1 and have invested tons of time into the game. I haven‚Äôt spent much money since they give out game currency in events.  I have amassed a lot of good characters due only to my time investment.  New players will have a harder uphill climb to endgame content due to their lack of time investment.  Amazing game, A+. The art is insane.

At first when I heard of Genshin Impact I wasn‚Äôt that interested. But as time went on I started to see it everywhere. For me I‚Äôm not really interested in games that have continuous levels where you do the same thing. So when I found out about Genshin Impact I was honestly super happy. It had a great story, beautiful scenery, unique characters, and many events to take part in. When I start a new game I usually stop playing it within 3 weeks. I‚Äôve been playing Genshin Impact since February and I still haven‚Äôt stopped. And my most favorite part is the characters. They‚Äôre so unique and strong in their own way. I love experimenting and playing around with all the characters and using them to fight enemies. And may I just say Liyue is probably another thing I love about Genshin Impact. It‚Äôs so pretty and I love the whole vibe. It‚Äôs a great game I recommend it to everybody.

For a game that‚Äôs free to play I would 100% recommend. The storyline is well written, and flows greatly with the scenery and characters. The amount of playable characters that were written have been done so well! The amount of descriptions for each, and the immense details that have gone into their outfits amaze me. As an artist it makes me quite jealous. It takes up quite a bit of storage, but it‚Äôs worth it if you don‚Äôt have a PlayStation or PC to play on. For a game that you can play on the phone/tablet, the graphics are wonderful. The Gacha feature can be troubling to understand and deal with for those that really want that 5 star character, but I do hope they come home! If anything is confusing just know that there are plenty of people willing to help you out, log into co-op after reaching AR16 and get to beating those bosses! Have fun traveling!

I have been playing for a year and the banners on this game are terrible! They pry on the addiction of people and have terrible rates. If you are down to spend $400 dollars in order to get the 5* you are after that is what this game truly offers. I had hope that they might make an anniversary banner that would have something better in terms of rates which like every other gacha game does. However to my disappointment they fed us a cheaper version of a previous event which was also not that great in my own opinion. Not only the banners are terrible but once you get to the end of the content the game dries up hard. The required daily tasks are too much for very little reward. In average just I found in one month doing the daily tasks will only reward you a single 10 pull on any banner and 5 pulls on standard banner. If it is your first time playing this game enjoy the open world and story but I highly recommend to protect your wallets while playing this game.

I recently started playing Genshin a few months ago and I love how there is so much to do !! I‚Äôm currently AR 49 and I enjoy fighting in the domains and defeating bosses. 

However, I wish that there was another way to earn more primogems faster for F2P players. I understand there are daily commissions and new upcoming events that distribute some primos when you partake in them, but it is only enough for a few wish pulls.

A 5 star character is guaranteed when you reach 90 pity on a banner, and a lot of primogems are required in order to reach that number. If you have Bennett‚Äôs luck, (like me), it is really difficult to obtain new 5 star characters when you only get one every 80-90 wishes.

It would be nice if the developers can increase the amount of primogems us F2P players get so we have the opportunity to have as many new 5 stars as possible (or at least lower the guaranteed 5 star rate chance when wishing).

Other than that, the graphics are so beautiful and I love how there is little to no lag as a mobile player. Although this game does take up a lot of storage, it‚Äôs really worth it.

Overall, I definitely enjoy everything Genshin has to offer and I am looking forward to more updates in the future !! 

Thank you so much MiHoYo for developing such a wonderful game ! ‚≠êÔ∏è

Genshin Impact is the best game I‚Äôve ever played in my phone, it‚Äôs graphics are astounding for a mobile game, the sound effects are high quality and, unlike most games, the voice actors are impeccable. I KNOW, we ALL know that this company does not care about their fan base at all unless it‚Äôs a ‚Äúgame removal risk‚Äù. During the first anniversary, it was proven that they‚Äôll only listen to their fan base if their game it at risk to be removed from the App Store with the negative review bombing that occurred. 

One of the most anticipated characters, who happened to have the slightest hit of melanin (news flash she isn‚Äôt even that dark, unfortunately) is treated HORRIBLY when it comes to how her play style works and how much damage she‚Äôll do. As an avid breath of the wild player I was so hesitant to play this game, as I'd heard so much controversy. It looked SOOOO similar, but when I picked it up on pc to play it for myself, I can definitely say the devs played botw, then decided to make their own game using the same assets and a semi-different main plot. As you play more, though, you can see how they've grown into their own separate universe, and how they've molded into their own specific game; and not just an anime botw.
You can see and appreciate the changes they've made to go out of their way to say, "Hey, just because we used another game for inspiration doesn't mean we're a bad game." It's not a bad game at all, and it's got a lot of inspiration from other games as well, such as WoW. It's got blatant inspiration, yes, but ultimately it's not a ripoff of any game. Highly recommend, but play it on pc. The fact that it's free boggles my mind.

I started this game from launch and it is by no means perfect. Time gated content, bad end game loop, slow resin regeneration, and more. They are all valid issues but one thing comes to mind. What other mobile game has this good of graphics, story, and gameplay? None that‚Äôs what. If you rush your progress in this game you will run out of things to do, but why rush? This incredible open world RPG is the best on the App Store. And yes just because there is gacha systems this doesn't mean you have to spend money to win at the game. I‚Äôve never dropped a single dollar on this game and have had average luck on pulls and I‚Äôm still beating the hardest content in the game. I recommend to give this game a try if you have 30 minute down times here and there. It‚Äôs definitely not a game to play for 5 minutes like some other mobile games. 

Best wishes,
Mondstat Traveler

Hello Mihoyo, I believe this game of yours is truly fascinating and really addicting. Now, in the game there are many places to transport and I am really grateful for that. It's supposed to be challenging yes, but I think it might be a bit difficult for new players since their stamina wouldn't be as high as a AR. 50 player. And to get to the winery from the statue is a bit far for them. So I was wondering if you could add a teleport waypoint a bit closer to dawn winery but not exactly at it. Like maybe on the cliff behind the winery. That would help with the slime commissions too. Then it's a win-win for everyone. That's just my opinion though, at least think about it if you want. Other than that, great job with your game!

My friends and I were talking and one of them told me to download this game. I looked at it, thought it looked sub par at best, like DDLC visual novel graphics, but 3D, which are good graphics, just not animated, as I thought this should be, but I downloaded it anyway, because my friend was often right about good games. I WAS BLOWN AWAY. The graphics are amazing, the voice acting is good, the game mechanics make me want to cry with how perfect they are, and the characters, even the npcs that never have any big impact are so well written that I almost felt bad for Timmie after using MCs  on his pigeons accidentally, no mad he made me any other time. I‚Äôve been playing it everyday, and the story made me cry, it WAS SO EMOTIONALLY CHARGED. Also, I‚Äôve gotten obsessed with cooking every dish the game had to offer, because they sound amazing.
Download this game, you will never regret it.

Once you get started up it‚Äôs pretty fun, the motive of the game is to defeat monsters, complete quests, participate in events, and get new characters in this vast open world of Tevyat. There is a large number of places you can go to and explore, you can teleport to them once you‚Äôve unlocked waypoints and statues. The statues heal you once you‚Äôre injured. For me personally, this game is very fun for exploring, getting characters, saving for the characters, and getting all the items you need for them! You can spend money on this game but I assure you, you‚Äôll do just fine without money with enough experience and skill. The most you can spend n this game is about a month learning to get the basics down, at least for me that is. I totally recommend it if you like open world exploration, quests, frequent events, and new characters every update!

Overall, Genshin impact is great. The graphics and the sound are amazing, the characters are really well thought out and planned and the quests (for the most part) are interesting.

I still haven‚Äôt unlocked Enkanomiya. Over time my experience has switched from ‚Äú Oh this is so fun! I love playing this. It‚Äôs so fun.‚Äù to a ‚ÄúI have to do this. I have to do this otherwise I‚Äôll miss ___. This quest is so long, I just want to go to *new region*‚Äù

As a free to play player, I‚Äôve been with this game for 5 months now. I love it, used all my free time just to explore and farm and roam around. I love to help out new comers and whoever needs help. It was fun making friends all around Genshin. So many new contents coming out, I‚Äôm so excited, not just for the content but the amount of free primogems that HoYoLAB gives us. As a f2p, I love free primogems. I log on, do daily works then explore. Trust me, if you are bored, feel free to join other‚Äôs world and explore. This game is beautiful in almost every aspect! The visuals are absolutely stunning and the lore is very well written. My favorite part of this game is listening to the amazing soundtrack, which is capable of evoking many emotions. Also, fighting style of the game is quite fun and easy to understand. This game has gotten some bad reviews from players who wanted better chances with the gacha system, however, it‚Äôs important to consider that this is one of the only ways for the company to make some profit. There were also many complaints about poor anniversary rewards, but I don‚Äôt think that will lessen your playing experience with the game. The download and update time may take longer than other games, but it will all be worth it in the end. Hopefully this review will persuade you to download the game. If it did, then happy playing, Traveler!

Genshin Impact is a fun and addicting game, you could possibly spend hours on it if you have the time. The storyline is also well written and I‚Äôve spent almost 2 years playing it, so it does have a ton to offer but the lack of skin diversity is sad. With Sumeru coming out I was hoping they wouldn‚Äôt continue to white wash their characters but I expected too much from Hoyoverse. Having the new Sumeru characters based on real tanned/dark skinned historical figures (as I‚Äôve heard) and be incredibly disrespectful to take high inspiration from them, yet not give the characters the correct skin tones shows a lot about the company already. I love this game and have spent a good amount on it too, but I‚Äôve chosen to stop giving them money (and to those continuing to spend I‚Äôd urge you to also stop). This game is near and dear to my heart but it‚Äôs frustrating to see Hoyoverse coming out with regions that have people with tanned/dark skin and white wash the characters even after multiple complaints from their own community of players.

I love genshin impact a lot. I absolutely love the deep lore and interesting characters there are. But honestly, grinding for primogems in late game is literally impossible. I have near 100 percent exploration everywhere. I have done every single quest, hangout event, etc. the only way I get a significant amount of primogems is by buying welkin and doing commissions. There definitely needs to be more generous rewards in things like spiral abyss. It‚Äôs really annoying that you only get 2,400 primogems IF you 36 star the abyss. However most people do not. And for context, 2,400 primogems gets you ONLY 15 wishes. It‚Äôs a very underwhelming reward for such a hard task. And pity levels in wishing are something else completely. It seems really disgusting that 90 is the max pity but we barely get enough primogems for A SINGLE WISH WITH COMISSIONS ALONE. If you relied on daily commissions only for primogems, then it would take you 4 DAYS TO EVEN AFFORD A SINGLE WISH. It‚Äôs really disheartening to see such a great game become dead because of the lack of proper rewards. So please provide better increased rewards   :(

They‚Äôre just asking for people to quit at this point and honestly I hope a bunch of players quit maybe they‚Äôd get a wake up call.

The couple recent characters that have been released so far (Yoimiya, Raiden Shogun, Sara, and probably more to come) have been underwhelming in terms of their performance and kit design. This is displayed in the case of the Raiden Shogun, who‚Äôs the most hyped character with the new release of the Inazuma region. Her base form at C0 performs terribly compared to other characters within the same element and support role, but becomes viable at C2, which requires players to pull more, resulting in more spending. On the same topic of elements, she is one of the weakest elements in the game, which is electro, which deserves a buff to compete with the top elements. Past characters felt good at C0, and didn‚Äôt require further investment to compete those of the same role, but that has changed in the case of the Raiden Shogun. I do not think that it was a coincidence that a top up bonus reset was aligned with the character‚Äôs release, as if Mihoyo knew that the Raiden Shogun would encourage players to spend even more. This is bad practice overall for the players, especially for F2P and low spenders.

I love Genshin Impact, for too many reasons to count, and I feel that it‚Äôs truly a good game, but with patience. A lot of this game is waiting, waiting for the daily commissions (quests) to reset, waiting for bosses to reset, etc. It‚Äôs not easy to get started on this game when you don‚Äôt have the patience to grind out your adventure rank (player level) and complete long, convoluted quests. I find that playing the game casually is the best way to get started, as opposed to sitting down and doing every single quest and storyline available in a day. Saving Primogems, which allow you to roll for new characters, is also very prevalent if you aren‚Äôt just playing casually or you really really want a specific character. I would recommend not spending primogems at all until a desirable character like Bennett or Sucrose is on a banner to get you started with another four star character.

Honestly ahead of its time. Super smooth gameplay on mobile (as well as on PC - i like to switch between the two). I usually like mmos, rpgs, action/adventure so this ticks allll the boxes for me. The gameplay itself is really fun, and even if you don‚Äôt want to spend a dime, the free characters are plenty. But to be honest, after you‚Äôve spend a dozen hours, what‚Äôs a 5$ monthly card? People are willing to pay 10-20$ for a 2h movie, so spending 5$ a month on extra fun spread across many more hours is definitely justified. Afterall, people creating this game arent volunteering. But that 5$ is absolutely not necessary. I like the game enough to put money on it - but I only did that after I had sunken an easy 30h+ on it. No money? No problem. Fun & some to spare? A bit of extra fun so why not. 
Bit of coop for dungeons, loads of story quests, events & gorgeous graphics!

Most of the 1 Star Reviews are complaints for lag and just saying the game is ‚Äúterrible‚Äù with no reason why. It crashes occasionally for me, but only when I teleport to a town with a lot of graphics to load, the game lags and crashes for people either because their internet cant handle it or their device is out of date. There are also many complaints about it taking up ‚Äútoo much storage‚Äù and using ‚Äútoo much data‚Äù. Genshin Impact is a high quality game, therefore it requires a larger amount than most other mobile games for storage and data. I have also seen complaints saying it takes your money because you have to ‚Äúpay to win‚Äù. I have been playing for 245 hours, and have not spent a single cent, and I have already completed at least 95% of the game. All Im saying is this is a well made and beautiful game.

Firstly I want to start off with primogems. Everyone needs primogems to obtain new characters and weapons. I am having a very hard time obtaining them. However there are quest you can do to get them.. but they are hard. Once you complete a hard quest, you only get at least 20-60 primogems?! Secondly losing a 50/50 to one of the characters from standard banner. I was saving for ayaka I had everything for her, but once I lost 50/50, it got more harder to obtain her. I kept wishing, spending hours, and even becoming a bit antisocial to my friends. This game can become a unhealthy habit of grinding. Sure there are 4 star characters, but spending the money I have spent, I am still not getting the character and if I don‚Äôt or do, I should get my money back. This is unacceptable. It‚Äôs great at the start but once I didn‚Äôt get a character or lose a 50/50 the grind still continues. And everyone is counting on Hoyoverse to create events that you can earn primogems. Im not trying to beg for a character, but my account is kinda weak and without her, I‚Äôll remain weak for god knows how long.

I love Genshin Impact, and have been playing for over a year now. I do sometimes get bored at the end of versions but always come back. The graphics are great, and the character designs visually are stunning. Characters themselves have been a little disappointing as of late, but only when compared to the main damage dealing units. One problem I do have with the game is the storyline. Much of it feels emotionless, and the protagonist always wins so far, making the game feel very much like a Disney show. I think that if the developers made players more connected to them, and made it so that at one point or another, the traveler has to face something different, not just a boss battle, but maybe something more emotional, such as a character in the game dying, and not just super suddenly. Aside from all that, everything about this game is great, and you should definitely give it a try.

First of all, you may see reviews complaining about the devs being racist and not having enough color diversity, this is however only half the story. The game is developed in China which has a racist government and the government is very controlling, because of this it makes it near impossible for the devs to put dark skin characters in the game and the ones they do not being that dark. While it is sad that representation isn‚Äôt present we can‚Äôt fault the devs for that as it‚Äôs not entirely their fault. Over all 9.5/10 game and I highly recommend it but I recommend you play it casually instead of grinding like content creators do. It makes the game more fun to play that way. Also make sure your phone can handle it first. It‚Äôs a very high quality game that older phones may not handle well.

I‚Äôve been playing this game for about a year and a half and I honestly can‚Äôt recommend this game to anyone your life would be so much easier without it. Excellent, immersive gameplay. Frequent updates. Quick and effective hot fixes. Devs respond to feedback. Diverse and unique characters. Drop rates are consistent, yes, but stat rolls are horrid and fixed to grant much higher chance for all the least desirable values. Can‚Äôt ask for more from a gacha game though. It‚Äôs more about the grind and less about the gameplay. Late game is not for elitists set to obtain the perfect sets in a timely fashion. Best be prepared to stick to a character and a dungeon for the long-haul else you will be disappointed.

I havent spent a dollar on this game, and it's very enjoyable. However, the amount of time you have to pour into this game to be able to really enjoy it is suffocating. Most endgame players are pay to win, and don't spend more than 15 minutes on this game a day. With genshin, you either have to pay with money, or with time. A perfect example of this is a free weapon in game called 'The Catch.' It's the best F2P weapon in the game, and it takes hours to get. Obtaining the Catch is boring, and most would much rather just spend money for a better Pay to Win weapon, Engulfing Lightning. You could, of course, get the Engulfing by grinding, but that would most likely take months to get enough in game currency to get it.

Overall, I enjoy this game, I enjoy the grind for better kits for your characters, and the grind to get more characters. But it can be insufferable to farm for hours on end daily.

I‚Äôm not someone who is into anime (TV/movies or games), so when I saw people raving about Genshin Impact and decided to give it a shot, I didn‚Äôt think I‚Äôd be able to get into it... but I did. It doesn‚Äôt feel half-baked or like it was built for mobile; it‚Äôs a real, open-world game that just happens to also be available on mobile - that‚Äôs genuinely impressive to me for a new game.

That being said, my only complaint is the lack of controller support (which it sounds like may already be in the plans for the future). The touch controls are far better than most other adventure games that I‚Äôve played on iPhone, but I‚Äôd still much rather play with a controller personally.

My last bit of praise is for the granular adjustability of graphics settings - that‚Äôs something that I hope to see more of in future games (instead of just ‚ÄúLow‚Äù, ‚ÄúMedium‚Äù, or ‚ÄúHigh‚Äù settings).

I love this game and almost everything about it. I wanted to address an issue I‚Äôve been having regarding the game crashing every time I try to play on my phone. Overall though I love this game as well as many players and hope to see many great updates in the future as I am very excited for version 2.4.

I had a lot of fun playing genshin, and it‚Äôs been a wild ride, but following the latest update I can‚Äôt bring myself to play without feeling mocked in a way. I‚Äôm Afghan, and seeing the total exclusion of people of color in Sumeru honestly hit a little too close to home for me. Upon playing the game I was so surprised to see characters with names like Farod‚Äînames I‚Äôve grown up around‚Äîhaphazardly stitched onto pale skinned characters with European features. I‚Äôm honestly baffled‚Äîthey clearly put so much research into North African and Middle-Eastern culture, but intentionally cherry picked on the most important part of any culture: the PEOPLE. It honestly feels like the company is saying, ‚ÄúWe like your funny clothes and food, but we don‚Äôt want YOU.‚Äù Die-hard fans will sling insults and complain that ‚Äúit‚Äôs not about race‚Äù‚Äîbut they were singing a different tune in defense of Yunjin‚Äôs character during previous updates. I am upset because I really like the game, but I‚Äôm not going to continue to pool my time into something that clearly doesn‚Äôt want to see people like me in this world. :(

I love Genshin, probably my favorite rpg. It‚Äôs amazing! Even though we dont get to many wishes and primos easily, it‚Äôs still fun. The story is engaging, the voice acting is amazing, and all the characters, no matter what rarity, work well. Even Amber, Kaeya, and Lisa (the starters) are awesome to play with if you build them. i‚Äôve played this game since the launch day and i was pretty amazed by it. the launch day rewards were so bountiful. now that it‚Äôs anniversary, i kinda expected more from it. it‚Äôs frustrating, all we get is some primogems and 10 intertwined fates. barely even enough for 20 something pulls. like come on! this is a multi-million dollar company and all they can give is this?! what frustrates me more is that the devs of genshin doesn‚Äôt communicate with the community. it‚Äôs like they throw away the community‚Äôs feedback. the community of a game is like it‚Äôs backbone. once you take that away how will it able to operate? i know that this game isn‚Äôt entirely p2w (pay to win) you can enjoy the game by being f2p (free to play). but it‚Äôs looks like the devs cater more to the people who spend money. well it makes sense since they need our money to pay their bills or something. since the community isn‚Äôt being heard, they‚Äôre finding ways to get the devs‚Äô attention. from giving a 1 star or attacking their sister game honkai impact 3rd. i do want to keep supporting this game, but if the devs don‚Äôt communicate with the community it‚Äôs honestly a lost cause. i know they won‚Äôt see this review, but i just needed to get this off my chest because it really is frustrating. i just hope that they acknowledge this and do better. i‚Äôm not getting my hopes up, but the least they can do is acknowledge this matter.

This is wonderfully developed, the characters are unique, have a backstory, wonderful voice actors, etc. Before downloading, here are some things to consider:
- as this is a large game with demanding graphics, does your device have enough space? Will it have enough space for future updates? How old is your device and do you think it can handle such a game?
- this is a gacha game! The ‚Äúcool‚Äù characters are locked behind a system that is like gambling! While download is free and the content is beatable with the free characters, there IS the option to spend money in game to get the character and/or weapons! Please consider that you may not get what you want!

Now, onto the reason that this game gets 4 stars instead of 5: security! Most of the community lives this game, yet there is no 2 factor authentication! People have spent hundreds or even thousands of dollars on this game, only to get easily hacked! Please fix this small issue!

This is a stunning game and impressive for a phone to run smoothly. The mechanics of the fighting are well thought out and interesting enough to keep playing. I have only one gripe with the game and I‚Äôd be willing to change my rating from 4 to 5 with one change; add Xbox one controller connectivity to the mobile version, also please change the button mapping with B and A for the menus. It really throws me off playing the pc version when I have to hit B to choose an option, I‚Äôd prefer if it was A. I‚Äôd still want A to be jump when actually playing but in the menus A and B should definitely be swapped. The only thing that would make me play more at this point is the fact I hate touch screen controls for action oriented games even though the touch controls aren‚Äôt necessarily bad, but controller connectivity on the mobile version of Genshin and Honkai would seal the deal and land you guys a 5 star rating from me.

Genshin impact is one of the best rpgs out there by far. It has amazing quality, as well as many fun aspects. One of my favorite things about the game is that it has a pity system. A lot of people complain about it but I think it‚Äôs nice. How the pity system works is that the 90th thing you roll will be a five star character. I love this because it tells the players that they will get a five star. It‚Äôs almost encouraging. Also, I love the designs for the characters. They look so cool and are fashionable. Some of the bosses can be annoying and all, but that isn‚Äôt really relevant. One of the few problems that I have with this app is how the game gets more dry in the later ranks. What I mean is there‚Äôs a lot less to do other than roll for characters. But I‚Äôm sure mihoyo it working on fixing that. I think genshin impact is an amazing game and would recommend you play it.

I like the game. I hate that it has a gacha aspect, but honestly, at least in the beginning, they give you enough currency to attempt some of the rare heroes. I got the one I wanted in two tries, so maybe I was lucky or whatever. 

People draw a lot of comparisons between this and Breath of the Wild‚Äîthey‚Äôre not wrong. But that game was never able to hold my attention. I picked it up and put it down within an hour. I‚Äôve been playing this game for the past 3 days and have yet to get bored. The pacing is great, the design is amazing, and the characters are unique. 

The only thing that irked me is the complete and utter lack of diversity. No POC. And I know these areas are based on Japan and China, but this is fantasy. I myself am Black and loved in China for some time. And while I was there I met many MANY Black, Indian, and other POC sooooooo.... ya‚Äôll can do better in this area. That‚Äôs all I‚Äôm saying. If you‚Äôre planning on adding some diversity, please let me know. I‚Äôve tried to convince some of my friends to play and this is one of the major reasons they cite for why they will not. I myself didn‚Äôt try the game until now for that very reason. This is 2020. We exist. We always have. Please let us see some representation in these games. If there can be a Yoruba character in Fire Force, you guys can add some color to your game. 
That‚Äôs the only reason I have this game 3 stars. 

Thanks for taking the time to read.

As a lover of RPGs, I‚Äôve always searched for one that fits all the needs I have and expectations. Interesting story, good battle mechanics, cool characters and a small bit of sandbox playing. Genshin hits all the marks! The story isn‚Äôt the whole game which allows you to just run around and battle if you don‚Äôt feel like doing the next quest yet. I enjoy the battle mechanics of switching characters and building damages. And the way you build characters actually makes you have to think about what you‚Äôre doing. Speaking of characters, their design is cool and I enjoy most of them, I will say, it is aimed at a specific audience, so the female characters outfits and designs are a little too waifiu for me. And the sandbox playing, once you get far enough, you get a home you can customize and take care of! Genshin is a good game, with a few issues, but overall enjoyable and exciting.

I want to begin by saying, this is one of the best games you can play on a mobile device and it is Cross play compatible. Here‚Äôs the downside: once you spend your hard earned money to get the dream build and grind your heart away to get the perfect artifacts for your characters you will have NOTHING TO DO. No matter how far you get in the game. Unlike the stereotypes, most of the people on the game are pretty chill. If you do decide to play the game, make sure you have enough GBs, and patience!

I have been playing this game on and off since October 3, 2020.  At the beginning, problems existed, but I was sure they would be addressed in future updates.  One year later, and there hasn‚Äôt really been anything.  This game has amazing combat, but no reason to fight.  It has a good story, until it stops being good.  The gear progression is great, but it‚Äôs locked behind an ‚Äòenergy bar‚Äô called resin which limits the rewards you get (unless you pay freemium currency).  And speaking of paying the developers, if you do buy the premium currency, you hardly get anything.  I can‚Äôt remember exactly what the number is, but to guarantee getting the character you want, you need to pay well over $100.  And each character has 6 ‚Äòconstellations‚Äô that increase their power, requiring you to obtain that character 7 times total to unlock their full power.  I‚Äôve seen people pay $1,000 and still have constellations left to unlock on a featured character.  You will enjoy the game playing it casually at first, but prepare to ditch it later.

It‚Äôs an amazing game, really, I‚Äôve honestly gotten addicted to it, (Also Yelan is my everything) although earlier today when I was doing a quest there was this one bug I came across, basically everybody keeps referring to my MC as a ‚Äúhe‚Äù although I picked the female MC. They‚Äôve done this many times, like when they mention the MC‚Äôs lost sibling and use ‚Äúsister‚Äù although my MC‚Äôs sibling is a male. It‚Äôs beginning to annoy me somehow. It just gives me some sort of discomfort, please fix this. Also, as I mentioned Yelan earlier in this review, I also hope you can make an Act II to her story quest (Umbrabilis Orchis) reflecting a lot more on her past, Act I was a bit disappointing, I wanted to know more about her, not just about her work and such. I also hope you can make a hangout for her too. I get that her character revolves around being all mysterious, but I really want to know more about her.

I never write reviews, but this game just deserves one. Genshin Impact is an extraordinary game. I‚Äôve always wanted to play a game like this, but I never had a laptop or computer to play with. Thus, I used my iPad to play this. Because it‚Äôs not compatible with my device, the gameplay is rather poor, but do-able. My iPad is a generation 5, and overall in good condition. It has 128 GB, and the game (so far) took up 12 GB. The worst thing that happens is that I crash every time I go into my characters, parties, and sometimes cutscenes. The cutscenes buffer and glitch out, but to fix this is simple: go into your tabs window by either swiping up or double-clicking your home button, depending on your device, (where it shows all your open apps) and then click back into the Genshin Impact tab. Do this every time you buffer or glitch out. It‚Äôs rather annoying though, how I have to always long back into the game and load it up every time I crash. But, it‚Äôs bearable. I hope I get a better device soon so that I can enjoy this game better. Great job, MiHoYo!

The game is great. It‚Äôs one of the best open world mmorpg that is available on mobile. The voice is great, the character designs and other stuffs are all great and I enjoy playing it. However when I was trying this out on mobile, it took around 7gb and it‚Äôs understandable but once I logged in the rendering distance was around 5 yards and the background is just black. When you see a special affect like getting wet or catching on fire, there would be this lighting affect that‚Äôs really bright and will probably make you look away. The cutscenes are laggy. Also when your fighting Storm Terror for the first time, you‚Äôll be blind so it‚Äôs hard to kill it when you can‚Äôt see. If you managed to scare him away then the whole game will just turn black like when your fighting the dragon and you won‚Äôt be able to see anything backgrounds or anything. Reaching AR57 and sinking multiple hundreds of hours across 1 year, this game's engaging gameplay and combat is unparalleled for me. The thing is, the developers have no desire to reward long time players. With no drive to add an endgame, any player who wants to build the strongest characters or wanting to pull on Gacha is completely worthless now. There is no point to try to improve if you can already clear the Spiral Abyss and its super disappointing. I will always suggest players to try out the game because it really is one of the best games I've played, ever. Just pull for characters that you like, thats it. You don't need to have the strongest team cause its not necessary which is very upsetting. I wish they cared more about the game's long-term health. If you like story, you will find a LOT of it in this game, where it is the priority over everything else in the game. Combined with limited-time events, this game pushes a lot of FOMO for players. Beware before you start this game, do NOT get too attached cause the Hoyoverse devs do not care.

I‚Äôve been playing genshin impact since it came out. I couldn‚Äôt stop playing for the longest time and there are still things I‚Äôm discovering as I continue on. I gave it only three stars for right now because when I downloaded it (it finally was downloaded after an hour, not the game it was my wifi) it was working and everything I made an account and stuff but when I tried to play it wouldn‚Äôt load me into the game and kept saying ‚ÄúInsufficient Storage‚Äù I think meaning that i couldn‚Äôt even play the game because of my storage. Last night, I deleted apps, photos and went back to try again and it still wouldn‚Äôt let me in. I‚Äôm gonna try this app again and choose the other option (the one with limited things :/) and see if it works cuz I was really wanting to see the full game without the limited things because it‚Äôs my first time playing and yeah..it would be great if there wasn‚Äôt an options and that it wouldn‚Äôt take up so much storage‚Ä¶Other than this I really want to play this and it looks very cool with the design and characters and everything.

Your first 10-20 hours of this game will be really enjoyable. It‚Äôs challenging at parts, but satisfying to overcome. It‚Äôs beautiful to play and you‚Äôll be hooked.

BUT once you hit AR 30, you‚Äôll want to break something. 

I like hard games, Dark Souls, Hollow Knight, blah blah blah I think they‚Äôre fulfilling. But you will see that some boss battles are designed so poorly that you will actually dread playing. There‚Äôs no satisfaction when you‚Äôre done. Just exhaustion. And yes I‚Äôm mostly talking about OCEANID.

Go ahead and fight every other boss. And then fight Oceanid. You‚Äôll see what I mean. Trying to ascend your hydro characters will literally ruin your day lol

There‚Äôs no other explanation for this super long and drawn out battle full of unavoidable damage, unskippable boss monologue, and unhittable enemies except for really poor design. At the very least, shouldn‚Äôt this kind of ridiculous battle be end-game related? Not something you do as your everyday grind?

Ugh. Obviously I just got done fighting them. Oceanid rant aside, co-op and World Rank are also busted. If you rank up too quickly early on, the bosses will be too strong before you can even ascend your characters. You will be stuck. The game becomes actually impossible. You‚Äôll have to join other people‚Äôs worlds or be carried to get anywhere again.

So many things go beyond challenge and straight into bad design.

I‚Äôve been playing this game for a year or so and every time I take a break I come back, the only thing I don‚Äôt like is the pity for hutao but I‚Äôm sure I‚Äôll get her soon. I‚Äôm a teen with no job for now so I can‚Äôt help but complain about how little primos you can earn but they did deliver on their anniversary and I‚Äôm grateful for that. If you pay for primos it will be easy to get a character but it will still take a lot of money, so that‚Äôs why I‚Äôm thinking. Why not lower the pity for the free to play players because I‚Äôm rank 22 with no five star

i love this game so much! and i‚Äôve made lots of friends! it‚Äôs a great map and i enjoy exploring around it and doing the quests! but there is a few things like, sometimes i‚Äôll be doing a quest and it‚Äôll just tell me that the character is doing a different quest i find it and i do that quest and it tells me the same thing over and over again. also i would like to point out that the game is basically a gacha of Zelda botw(Breath Of The Wild) which i have no problem with but it‚Äôs really similar. one more thing is that it is really hard to obtain actual GOOD characters which is a little upsetting, i‚Äôve been playing for a long time and i only have 4-stars and i‚Äôve been wishing for a 5-star and never receive i think the pity system hates me:‚Äô). other then those things the game is great and really fun!

This game baits you into their world of beautiful artwork and great adventure. BUT you have to spend a lot of money to get 5 star characters and the best weapons to go with that character. They bait you on wishing for characters that don‚Äôt mean anything in the endgame. The endgame for this game is abysmal. There is nothing to do besides daily adventures and they‚Äôre a chore. The company is stingy with their rewards that they give to players, when other companies easily give out 90 wishes to each player. It is terrible how greedy the company is to their player base. Mihoyo is now quickly losing their player base because of their 1 year anniversary rewards. After 1 year of playing, they only give 10 wishes. 10. That‚Äôll get you if you high roll on the .5% chance a 5 star, but if you‚Äôre the majority of the player base you‚Äôll get a really trash 4 star. It‚Äôs terrible how greedy a company can be with this game, and how they give no content or wishes to their player base. It‚Äôs terrible and the company needs to see what they are doing to their player base because they are driving them out.

I have never played anything marvelous as Genshin Impact. I wanted some calm, relaxing game yet thrilling and adventurous, it may take a lot of my storage, but it‚Äôs worth it. Every character is unique and I never get bored of playing it. The real big problem is, it crashes too often. At first I didn‚Äôt really care, because I can alwa just go back and continue, but as time goes, it‚Äôs starting to crash me out even more. For example, let‚Äôs say I played the game for 5 or more minutes, but if I touch Paimon or Character Button (upper right corner) it glitches then immediately crashes me out. I was in love with this game so I just thought it was fine, but things are getting a little too annoying for me.. Although the game is amazing, if you read this, please fix it for me. Thank you, developers.

I‚Äôve played this game everyday for two months straight. It is just an amazing experience that can‚Äôt even be put into words. The graphics are LITERALLY breathtaking. It‚Äôs like cutscene-level graphics, but all the time. I‚Äôve never wanted to jump inside a video game so badly. The music is literally magical, it‚Äôs just so calming and beautiful. Touching stories, entertaining characters, extremely fun fighting, and a landscape that you can spend months exploring before having seen/collected everything. Finding 10 chests from walking around for 5 minutes is so fun. There‚Äôs a perfect mix of challenge and relaxation, and the best part is YOU get to decide what you want your gaming experience to be. You need to play for yourself, seriously just try it. (Also people need to stop complaining about gacha and resin. Stop being entitled)

I absolutely love this game! It has amazing graphics and an exciting plot and almost everything you could want in a game! It really does feel like you are experiencing this game in real life. It is just a magnificent game in general. I will say though, you have to be prepared to face some though challenges or quests in this game, especially the timed ones. I think I have tried to pass one of the challenges almost 10-15 times already, and I still didn‚Äôt pass it. Those kind of challenges are kind of overwhelming to me.... I dunno if that‚Äôs just me or not though. That‚Äôs the only thing for me, so if you guys could maybe increase the time limit so that it‚Äôs a little less overwhelming... that would be great! Besides that, everything else is just incredible, I honestly could play this all week long if I could! PS: Paimon is sooo cute and amazing üòçü•∞!!!!

Since I‚Äôve played a bit more I can give a more earnest review. The dialogue needs a lot of work. When you select a pre-printed response the auto response doesn‚Äôt match what was selected. This may be a glitch. Only pet peeve is the dialogue, please be sure to review and ensure the auto response matches the pre set options. Out of all the games out for mobile players this is by far the best. It lags however early and just for a second. So far the gaming is smooth, everything look great and I can definitely get lost it in. The story line is entertaining and the scenery is breathtaking:)

Hello, 

I think the game is amazing but for me I personally felt that the coop function was lacking. I had joined with another friend and thought we would be able to explore together but it seems that the exploration depending on who‚Äôs leader really only benefits one person when it comes to chests, waypoints and even statues. I can‚Äôt investigate anything on my friends map nor can I help with the specters or tasks, which I did not think would happen. Another friend of mine had explained the devs made it this way so people couldn‚Äôt loot resources on other peoples maps which makes sense! However is there a way you can add a function that allows people to do these things (quests and chests, waypoints or even statues) depending on relationship points? >.< might not be possible and might be asking too much but asides from the coop function I really enjoy everything else there is!

I enjoy playing this game very much so but with that being said there‚Äôs certain things in the game that could definitely be improved and fix such as the way of getting characters it‚Äôs ridiculous that I have to spend so much money to be able to actually get new characters. Because you only get main three characters at the beginning of the story and that‚Äôs it ! And I don‚Äôt really appreciate that not to mention as well the game dialogue talks about all 7 gods and yet we only get 2.Plus throughout the entire game you get to see and meet brand new characters that have a vision with a element on them but there actually not characters for you to unlock in the game! It‚Äôs just like a simple teaser. To the point that The final mission it‚Äôs like a prologue to continue the story furthermore but it doesn‚Äôt and it leaves you with a lot of questions. Plus having only 24 characters it‚Äôs very small amount when the majority amount is just fire type characters !

Sure, the game is indeed fun but once you hit AR30 you‚Äôll come to a realization that the resin system is poorly implemented and doesn‚Äôt even compare to other gacha stamina-like systems. You have to waste more money just to achieve your weekly battle pass objective. The drop rate on the characters you want are lower than any other gacha game I have played and funny enough the pity system only kicks in after 90pulls which is about $200 and you don‚Äôt even obtain your 5-star character you want but a 5-star Weapon instead. They aren‚Äôt even going to do anything till people have complained enough about their bad practices, even the Chinese community have rated this game a 4.7/10, so that should tell you something since the game is created by a Chinese Company. Either way, they aren‚Äôt going to release any updates till Nov 11, so a month of being in a pathetic state till they maybe fix the game. I suggest you stay away from the game for a few major updates and then come back to play it and hopefully the game is in a better state.

My friends and I have been playing this game non stop, I first only downloaded it on my iPhone 8+ not knowing I could also download it on my pc. I‚Äôve had 0 issues with this game and it runs so smoothly on my phone although it does have a tendency to make my phone pretty hot. I like the game a lot. The play style is really fun and smooth, the tutorials make sense, the storyline is really cool, the characters are awesome, etc. The thing I don‚Äôt like is how the events work and how much time you really have to put into it to uncover the storylines. Each day it kinda pressures you to do all these tasks and complete all these events in a short amount of time and unless you want to spend hours playing it it‚Äôs hard to do. Some people like playing video games for hours. I‚Äôm not one of them. It‚Äôs still fun to play but hard to really get into if you‚Äôre busy. And I wish the gacha system was better. More frequent reruns and no 50/50 would be a big improvement. I don‚Äôt really want to compare it to honkai impact 3rd but I do wish it was more like honkai‚Äôs gacha system. Still fun though. If you don‚Äôt wanna spend money you‚Äôll still have a really great time.

I‚Äôve played for about a year and I have loved almost every minute of playing, but I‚Äôm losing interest. I feel like this game is becoming a chore and that is something that needs to be changed. Hoyoverse, please optimize the game or compact the game because I don‚Äôt know how we can continue at this pace.

I‚Äôve been playing genshin forever and I‚Äôve loved every second of it. I‚Äôve done every quest there is to do most my areas are at 100% exploration or at least in the 90s and aside from character trials and events and daily commissions it‚Äôs hard to get a lotta primos or find something really fun to do but I love when events come out and there‚Äôs new stuff I just wish I had more I could do beside raise characters right now but still I love this game and there‚Äôs nothing that could make me stop loving it. I just started playing this a few days ago and it‚Äôs become one of my absolute favorites. The details of the storyline, the graphics, the phenominal voice acting, the beautiful chracter designs (Amber‚Äôs got to be my favorite), everything was well made and overall amazing. However, there are problems with it crashing and lagging. When I first opened the game and it was the first opening cutscene, I had to restart my Ipad four times because it kept lagging and froze to the point where it crashed. Amazing game :)

Genshin Impact is an amazing game, for sure. There are tons of incessantly entertaining quests (which are very interesting, also), beautiful graphics, amazing characters, and not to mention an incredibly interesting fandom that‚Äôll never cease to be creative. I started playing after my friend discovered it, and somewhat reluctantly opened the app. I was immediately dazzled at the graphics, dialogue, and easy gameplay. As time went on, my interest peaked. I‚Äôve never really liked video games, as I‚Äôve always seen them as repetitive and boring, but after Genshin Impact, I now like one video game! A true accomplishment! Anyways, the system in which you obtain supplies is somewhat questionable, up to luck and how much in game currency you pay. But the pros outweigh the cons by about 10,000 tons, so be sure to get it!

Honestly this game has been a good game to play to take up free time. It‚Äôs well animated and the attention to detail is really nice for a free game. Yes you can spend money and get all the characters you ever wanted and build them up but honestly the game gives you a lot of free wishes and chances to get your favorite characters for free. The story has been amazing so far and I‚Äôm really excited to see how much it branches out in the next few updates. I actually wish they would slow down on the new character introductions because I want to get to know they ones all ready out more. But it‚Äôs always nice to see the next big fun character they make. This has been one of the few games that has managed to keep my attention and not be deleted off my phone. I really think you should give it a shot.

Let me start off by saying I‚Äôve been playing Genshin since launch day. It‚Äôs one of my favorite games. The world building is fantastic, the characters are interesting and lovable, and the gameplay is fun and challenging enough to keep you interested. However, the game has a ton of issues. Once you reach the later game stages, the gameplay stagnates. There isn‚Äôt much for returning players to do and daily quests/rewards don‚Äôt scale with your level. The game is built to give you just enough rewards to keep you playing, but never to help you succeed. Five stars are almost guaranteed to be locked behind paywalls when you reach the late game. On top of all this- and the reason I‚Äôm writing this review- is the fact that Genshin and Mihoyo give basically zero rewards to players. I‚Äôve earned more from maintenance rewards than I have from the first year anniversary event. Genshin makes billions of dollars and gives their players next to nothing to encourage them to spend more money on gambling. I honestly can‚Äôt in good faith recommend this game to new players anymore.

This game is one of the best games out there especially for mobile. The graphics are great even on an iPad. It keeps you intrigued with all the stories you could do. And overall, the gacha system is one of the best qualities of the game. It keeps you hooked and gives you a sense of fun to see which character you could get. The people who cry over not getting the character they want should expect that. Giving the game a bad rating just because you didn‚Äôt the character you wanted is so immature. The plot of the game is also good too. How you have the ability to choose which twin to use is fun. One thing I would like to see is being able to see what you‚Äôre typing on mobile. I can‚Äôt wait to see more regions be introduced and for us to slowly be able to get closer to the end of the story.

This is a well made game. It runs smooth on my iPhone se2020.  The environments are rich eye candy, making exploration the most fun part of the game. 

The story is pretty nice, but it is easy to lose focus due to the bordered sandbox style of the game, yet it is easy to get back on track with the menu of quests and the ability to have navigation to lead you to the right point. Fights are not boring, but gets a bit reputations. . .yet the game doesn‚Äôt revolve around fighting all the time and there is a ton of others things in the game to keep it feeling fresh.  

Regarding gotcha. . .I have never spent money on this and never will. I am pretty satisfied with what I have and still have fun! Some of the fights are a bit harder due to not having a plethora of five star everything, but with some patience and ingenuity, you can do what you need to advance in the game.

I was recommended this game by a sweet boy over at GameStop when I was trying to figure out if I should try and purchase a PlayStation (EVENTUALLY).. 
Me; a current iPad user who is fully taking advantage of this beautiful game... and I am consistently speechless. 
Even though I was concerned about not being able to efficiently play the game without an controller. Genshin really did amazing with allowing me to be successful while using the controls via iPad (touchscreen).  
I could not wait to play this game and I am just ultimately shocked with the performance and easy utilization of playing cross platform with touch controls.
Although I feel that using a handheld device may be more difficult to navigate basic foundations of the game (locating quests, using combos, dealing with a small screen). The game is truly converted to a form that makes me.... speechless.
Mihoyo and the team did a beautiful, outstanding job with the cross platform diversity and conversion to held held.
I hope I‚Äôll be able to see this beautiful game on large screen one day...
And keep in mind, they the adventurers run slower so you can see the detail and beauty of the game. 

iPad 5.
Rare lag (only when there is a change in Lands).
Make sure to update. 
Make sure to close all apps before playing.

I have to say... this game is absolutely gorgeous. Everything about it is extremely eye pleasing. There have been minor glitches I‚Äôve experienced, but nothing that effected the quality of the game in any way. I do have a question though...or more of a suggestion. I keep receiving Tons of Mora coins as rewards and such, but I can‚Äôt find anything to spend it on? This could just be because I haven‚Äôt gotten as far as others in the game, but nevertheless it would be cool to be able to do more with them. Otherwise, this game has far exceeded my expectations! It‚Äôs easy to see why this is the second most popular game right now. It‚Äôs like Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild and Attack on Titan clashed. Open, inspired, breathtaking world. Astounding voice acting. Characters that are actually like-able. Storyline that keeps you immersed. The list goes on. The true achievement of this game is the fact that it‚Äôs on mobile. If I wouldn‚Äôt have played it myself I wouldn‚Äôt have thought it were possible. Yes it takes up a lot of space, yes it‚Äôs not worth downloading unless you have a newer generation phone that can handle it, and yes I‚Äôm sure some people will complain that it‚Äôs not an MMO. But if you‚Äôre a fan of the RPG genre with a ton of exploration, collectibles, crafting, lore, etc. this game is a must download. 6 hours in and I can wholeheartedly say that it‚Äôs a masterpiece. Thank you developers for giving us this crowing achievement in mobile gaming.

I‚Äôve been playing Genshin Impact since the day it came out so September 20th 2020 now don‚Äôt get me wrong there are a few things that could and should change like for example the lack of representation of other races, granted a lot of the countries that each nation represents there are only two or three black characters that are playable, keaya, Xinyan, and maybe another and there are well over 48 Genshin characters. When I got the game and read the reviews, it didn‚Äôt seem all that bad, however: I have had to delete more then eleven games/apps off my phone to reduce, not eliminate, the severe lag in imagery and audio. Although the game animations are very well established, it‚Äôs not worth it. It took up so much room in my phone my contacts had to be deleted and my group chats wouldn‚Äôt work. The last straw for me was when I found out my camera and my flashlight didn‚Äôt turn on. Immediately, I deleted the game and wrote a review. Now, I must retrieve all my contacts, apps, chats, etc. It‚Äôs not an online roleplay game, at least, that‚Äôs what I thought I was getting. I only had the app for a few hours so I‚Äôm not sure if you can invite people to your game. Also, though the character art is beautiful, you can only access two characters per gender. It‚Äôd be much more profitable to make custom avatars so people can have the option to complete tasks and roleplay at the same time. Most importantly, please rid of the lag. It is absolutely unnecessary to sacrifice so much for a silly game that‚Äôs not even the slightest addicting.

do i like genshin? yeah, it‚Äôs a great time passer. i‚Äôve been playing since childe‚Äôs first banner, and have enjoyed it so far. however, the game isn‚Äôt exactly f2p friendly, and the game pretty much baits you into spending money. yes it‚Äôs f2p, but only if you want it to be. however, not all characters you own are guaranteed to be the greatest.

however, if i do see any specific flaws with genshin, it‚Äôs would probably be it‚Äôs repetitive writing. all female characters are very similar, being overworked individuals with little time to themselves. the male characters aren‚Äôt much better, but with recent additions of arataki itto, im starting to get my hopes up a bit more. however, with the story behind shenhe‚Ä¶i don‚Äôt have much hope. yun jin seems pretty cool, though! 

the first two nations of mondstat and liyue are pretty neat, and have a good plot surrounding them. however, when we get to inazuma‚Ä¶the writing is‚Ä¶lacking. the plot line was predictable and it didn‚Äôt have many major twists, even after that‚Ä¶the main villain (the raiden shogun) was dumbed down to a dango milk loving innocent woman‚Ä¶seriously? she lead hundreds if not thousands to their deaths, and even killed off signora. i understand that the goal is to meet the seven to find your lost twin, however, inazuma had so much more potential in villains AND characters. 

anyways #liyuestayswinning

Whether we‚Äôre talking about In game rewards or anniversary rewards the game gives barely to nothing. If my calculations are correct that is less than 0.10%, and on top of that, it‚Äôs only going to those with artsy talent. From what I‚Äôve noticed when genshin released they gave humongous awards such as 10 fates (wishes) but, as it started gaining more popularity the rewards seemed to take a serious downfall while in the beginning we would get 1600 primogems, now your lucky to even get 60. As more people began to realize how un-fair this is, people began to leave for other games such as cookie run kingdom, bandori, etc. Quite frankly, I don‚Äôt blame them, for all the genshin community puts into this game we at least deserve a ‚ÄúANNIVERSARY‚Äù reward that measures up.

I love this game from the amazing storyline to the excitement I get while playing. I love that I can co-op with others and make friends and help people do stuff like commissions and other quests, I have met probably one of the best friends I‚Äôll ever make on this game. Sometimes when it‚Äôs late and but I can‚Äôt fall asleep I‚Äôll go on genshin and explore the mountains to sort of calm down and get ready for bed, normally near jueyun karst or somewhere in inazuma, but the point is that just playing the game, even if it‚Äôs not for fighting or getting exp, it still seems to have a positive affect on me and many others. I highly recommend this genshin impact, once you start really playing the game you‚Äôll never want to stop.

The games event giveaways have gotten worse over the time I have played, and even the feedback I and others in the community continuously give has been ignored. The artifact farming is bad, the weapon banner is a HUGE money grab (more than other aspects of the game), and the cost of primogems is crazy expensive. In addition, they had raffles for players who were willing to work for them by drawing artwork or making videos promoting their game. For now, I give it a one star. Let‚Äôs see if they keep their word.
