Genshin Impact is a colorful rip off of Breath of the Wild. It has a main story that lasts a few weeks. After that, you can do boring daily quests, do monthly events you can finish in 3 hours, grind for artifacts a couple of times per day that takes about 30 minutes to complete until you have no more resin. There is NOTHING to DO in this game. Once you finish the main part it‚Äôs 20 minutes a day and you‚Äôre done with everything you can possibly do. 

The characters are great, a lot of fun and interesting ways you can play them. Strong ones will take a few months of saving up free primogems to roll for them so do that WAY in advance. If you‚Äôre spending money to get the characters you want expect to pay $200 per character. It‚Äôs a very very expensive gotcha game. 90 rolls and you got yourself a five star character, maybe not the one on the banner, maybe not the one you want, maybe they‚Äôre not even useful but you can just buy more in game currency for the second round of 90 pulls and then after 180 total pulls you will definitely have the character you were going for. Weapons are different. You can spend $3000 and not get the weapon you want so don‚Äôt even try. 

Genshin Impact is a lot like Final Fantasy 14... the first verson, the one they blew up because it was garbage. And even that had MORE freaking content then this game. 

Beautiful, great characters, occasionally fun, not a damned thing to do with it.

Don‚Äôt get me wrong, this game is amazing with each character‚Äôs unique skills to the layout of the world. Once you get to about AR 30, the game essentially turns into a waiting game.  Each day comes with 160 Resin which will fully replenish after a full 24 hours. It also comes with a daily quest reward of 60 Primogens. These Primogens are your average currency in order to pull or ‚Äúwish‚Äù characters from a randomizer. One pull is a staggering 160 Primogens.  To get a full ten wish stack, you need 1600, and after finishing all the quests, you‚Äôre only way to get continuous PG is through daily quests. It takes a full month just to get ten wishes and you may not even get anything you want. World Chests can sometimes give from 2,5, and 10 Primogens, which in the spectrum of wishes is a low offer. Mihoyo, please do something about Primogens like make the daily quest rewards larger.

Seriously. Are you kidding me? I went to the most critical reviews, and people say this is P2W? Have you seen a real P2W game? This is so stress-relieving, it really gets me hyped whenever someone mentions this game. I started playing right after I pre-ordered it, and I‚Äôve been hooked ever since! This game is definitely F2P, although gacha is addicting, I can easily overcome the temptations and play free. Pity isn‚Äôt hard to get, although would like it a bit lower but it‚Äôs reasonable. The game‚Äôs graphics are amazing, and I started to sightsee on the game. What‚Äôs funny, is that the game just released and there‚Äôs so much more potential to this. The music is amazing, the character design, the art, the sceneries, the fights, virtually everything. This has been the missing key in my life, and I am very grateful for all the happiness it brought me.

Hopefully more to come!

My favorite game of the year so far to be honest. I‚Äôve put a ton of hours into it. You hit a wall at adventure rank 38-40 where materials are near nonexistent and progression comes to a screeching halt. The devs create an absolutely amazing, beautiful world yet there‚Äôs no incentive to go explore when chests don‚Äôt respawn. Rewards for EVERYTHING in the game are too little. Resin required to progress and acquire gear with a super slow timer to get more. The gacha rates are some of the worst in the entire industry. Please please please increase rewards across the board and give us a reason to play the game daily for more than 10 minutes. People will stop playing even if they have the characters they‚Äôve always wanted if there‚Äôs nothing to DO with those characters. Weekly bosses shouldn‚Äôt have resin cost. Multiple active banners should be a thing. I‚Äôm holding on to hundreds of wishes because the banners only showcase new characters and forget older ones. So much love and attention went into this game yet it cripples itself at nearly every turn.

The scenery is amazing, the storyline is interesting, and the characters are so fun and well thought out. There‚Äôs so much personality in every aspect of the game and I highly recommend playing it. I‚Äôve been playing since October 2020. There‚Äôs a LOT of stuff to do when you play for the first time (and all the way till ar54). End game players don‚Äôt have a lot to do, BUT events and other things keep coming in so it‚Äôs never really boring. Just take your time, don‚Äôt speedrun everything, just enjoy the story and everything the game has to offer So a lot of people are spam hating rn because of anniversary event rewards, just ignore them. The game is actually really fun and I‚Äôm f2p(free to play, never spent money). The rewards were better at launch, but that‚Äôs normal

Not f2p anymore but I still highly recommend it

I love this game to bits! I can‚Äôt get enough of it..but there‚Äôs still a few issues tho:

-The monsters...Fighting monsters are entertaining but it gets annoying when the monster leaves you alone at random..then you try and fight it again and guess what? It‚Äôs entire hp is back up. This frustrated me during some quests with difficult bosses..

-The frame rate...Even with strong internet connection, it sometimes crashes due to the graphics. I thought it was my storage at first but no...If I am with many items and I am fighting many creatures and their animations and stuff, as well as fighting animation of the character, can crash the game or if I am talking to npc‚Äôs..the game can bug out before crashing. I apologize if I ramble but this was a main issue I had.

-loading time for cutscenes, areas, etc. can be a bit buggy and force me to restart my game..this too is frustrating since it can reset quests and interactions of characters..And even erase progress I have gotten..also some things don‚Äôt load completely in, example..Investigating a barrel and something pops out but it doesn‚Äôt appear at or it appears later..or it crashes the game, and cause more problems in playing.

I apologize if I am complaining..But thank you for making this wonderful gift of a game! I fell in love with it and I can‚Äôt wait to see what more it holds.

It‚Äôs a good game it really is but there are some issues that I see that is starting to frustrate me and other players , we are starting to feel burnt out and the game is starting to get boring when you don‚Äôt have much to do let alone the rewards aren‚Äôt always the best I‚Äôm not going to complain to much because the app is really amazing the character designs are Beautiful and you get to join other players when you are at lvl 16 I think so the game is over all really amazing it‚Äôs just the fact that we are getting tired of feeling burnt out and we want more and I know more things will come along in the game but I would really like if the rewards got a lil better because there not bad but there just not enough sometimes and that‚Äôs what makes the game so frustrating it‚Äôs not the characters or the players it‚Äôs just the feeling of burnt out and boredom and a lack of better rewards that bothers me

As mentioned in other reviews, the gameplay loop is satisfying. The characters are well designed, aesthetically at least, (let‚Äôs not talk about how unbalanced some of them are gameplay wise) the environments and stories are fun and interesting. The latest issue comes down to the anniversary rewards. Now, of course, this is just the symptom of the overall greater problem. Another symptom is the aforementioned unbalanced nature of some premium characters, releasing in an almost unplayable state, which is honestly unacceptable for how much most have to spend to receive said characters. MiHoyo just doesn‚Äôt care about the players of their game, and the aniversary is the biggest and latest example of this. They are a giant company with no doubt endless resources, and yet they choose to waste them all on stupid things like fishing. 

In conclusion, if you haven‚Äôt played this game before please consider everything I just said. This company cares about one thing and one thing only, money, even at the cost of ripping off their players.

When the game first came out I did not download it because of how much data it took up and because it seemed too ambitious for a free game. However I eventually downloaded it because of one of my friends and I was shocked. The game is an open-world rpg and every bit of it is beautiful. The graphics, the soundtrack, and the storyline which I‚Äôm heavily invested in because there is so much to uncover. Even though it is not complete (new regions/chapters of it have yet to be released) I have not gotten bored of it. This is because even if the main story is not complete there is lore in every aspect of the game (item descriptions, side quests, events, characters). Overall I definitely recommend you to download it or at least try it out because I‚Äôm sure you will also fall in love with it.

So this game is really fun for me and that‚Äôs me talking who is usually playing other kinds of game. I‚Äôve had tons of fun in this game but there is one issue for me (I don‚Äôt know if others are having this issue) every time I try to play the game it logs me out, it‚Äôs so annoying dealing with it when you‚Äôre doing a commission or a quest (I wasn‚Äôt able to write this on feedback because of the glitch logging me out) it first started a few months ago, it only happened every few minutes but then it escalated that it logged me out every few seconds as soon as I enter the game, I uninstalled but a picked up the game again, it stopped logging me out but it started again a month ago and it‚Äôs been annoying because now it logs me out when I use a wave point. For a free game Genshin is actually exceptional. The gacha aspect of the game also isn‚Äôt half bad in my opinion. My only complaint about the game, and this is a common one for players reaching AR 56+, is the lack of endgame content. Nevertheless, lots of love to Genshin and those who share the memory üòåüçµ

I absolutely love this game started playing last year in late November. And been addicted ever since. I‚Äôve been playing for 8 months now, and you should download it as long as you have space. It may take only a few gigabytes to download but it gets up to 20+G. Watch out. Don't play on an old phone (I used to play on an iPhone 6 it was horrible.) You get constantly kicked out, but I'll start talking about the positives. Amazing graphics? Check. Interesting plot? Check. So much to do? Kinda check? It gets a little boring endgame, but they still update every month with new updates!! Interesting characters with backstories? Check. Hidden lore? Check. I love the game I really do but there are some complications, from the stereotypical designs to the lack of representation and not ftp friendly gets me to not fully enjoy the game experience.

Let‚Äôs start out with the little things, yae miko and a few other peoples outfits are extremely stereotypical and disrespectful to the culture. You change the outfits of the women characters to make them more acceptable for men (fan service). Next there are hardly any dark skin characters in this game, and when there are they‚Äôre extremely white washed. The ‚Äúdark skinned‚Äù aren‚Äôt even dark skinned, they‚Äôre just a minuscule amount.

Now we have come into mobile players, mobile players can hardly play your games because of how many files you need. Most of them can‚Äôt even have social media apps because of the amount of files. 

Then we have the ftp (free to play) friendly part. This game REQUIRES you to spend money if you want a good character because the pity system is hard. The pity isn‚Äôt the problem, the primos accessibility are. You would have to play for hours on end every day to even have a chance of getting a 5 star from zero pity, not to mention the chance of losing 50/50‚Äôs comes into play. It‚Äôs really inconvenient over all and I hope hoyoverse will consider fixing these issues.

When I began playing this game I was enamored with the storyline and characters. The play style was fun, and I couldn‚Äôt get enough of it. One of my biggest concerns with it however is that there‚Äôs no representation for darker skinned people. With the various real life places and cultures this game is based off of, I would expect at the least, a few darker skinned characters. Out of the 50+ already released characters, there‚Äôs two darker skinned characters. Even then they‚Äôre only a few shades darker than the pale characters and have been white washed in official art. Heading forward I‚Äôd like to see regions with only / more dark skinned characters. Brown and black people exist! While this may be a fantasy game, Yunjin is proof that the developers can and will sink in time for cultural research. This just doesn‚Äôt seem to apply to darker skins and their cultures. It‚Äôs immensely disappointing and makes it hard to even wish to continue playing Genshin Impact. The lack of diversity is just suffocating!

This game has proven again and again, that it doesn‚Äôt care about representation, taking concepts from other countries, like in Sumeru, and then refuse to have darker skinned characters of a solid culture. Liyue is based off of China, Inazuma is based off of Japan, Mondstadt is based off of Germany, yet when it comes to Sumeru (and possibly Natlan, which is not surprising with this company) it‚Äôs not based off of one country or culture, rather a mix of Persia/India/Middle East?? Then the outfits are stereotypes and poorly designed, there are so many beautiful attires and cultural clothing that could be used, not to mention skin color is important. This stealing of different cultures to fit a stereotype, then making the characters white to top it all off is outrageous, it‚Äôs not hard to do so, out of 50 ish playable characters only 2 have a darker skin, and their skin isn‚Äôt even that dark to begin with. This game gets millions in revenue every single banner, they could hire other artists that are part of the culture or make their own research?? Yet they refuse to do something so bare minimum?

I‚Äôve been completely hooked on this game since I downloaded it almost half a year ago. The art for it was just beautiful so I thought I‚Äôd see how it was. My gaming experience has always been limited to puzzle games and I have terrible hand-eye coordination so I never imagined I would have so much fun with this type of game. I love exploring the map and finding all the little extra pieces that seem like secret discoveries. I really enjoy  the storyline and events as well. It keeps everything interesting. I also like that you can invest as much time in it as you want to.
All in all, I‚Äôd say it‚Äôs a 10/5 stars.

Ive been playing since launch and I cant lie i used to love the game, but I hate to say it but this game isn‚Äôt what you all think it is, you‚Äôve probably read from either reviews ‚Äúamazing open world!‚Äù and other things like ‚Äúf2p friendly!‚Äù its just not true.. i guess the game is enjoyable to alot of people but this game is just so repetitive.. theres not much content after 30 ar and ive gotten to 50.. theres also alot of characters back in the time for example diluc he was way more op than any other character and people just p2w their way to get it i mean f2p 100% have gotten it, but chances are slim.. the open world is cool and all but most of the time all you do is just try to get all the waypoints, wisps and all those stuff which is super time consuming and not at all entertaining. Genshin Impact is a fun game, the woman are dressed, and not looking like Hookers(like in most games the woman have very revealing clothes that don‚Äôt cover or protect them), which is a nice change, getting characters are hard, you should have a banner for just characters and a banner just for weapons. The ost and the graphics of this game are absolutely amazing and breathtaking! I just wish the management let the devs take breaks from updates, since they have to crank out new stuff every month :/ The Inazuma act felt rushed with lots of plot holes, if they took their time, the story would‚Äôve been god-tier! Not to mention it‚Äôs hard for the devs to insert new characters, mobs and events every month since programming this stuff takes time! Patch 2.1 was very rushed and the events didn‚Äôt feel like an anniversary, just another old patch for the Moonchase festival. Speaking of anniversary, the rewards were a little bit underwhelming, the management could‚Äôve done better for their community! Overall, I love Genshin and I won‚Äôt stop playing it until the end. The game has so, so much potential! I just wish it could be brought out by the management more :(

Ok hi I have been playing genshin since it‚Äôs release in September of 2020 and it is a really good game I swear but there are some things I think that need to be fixed. I am ar 57 and play on both pc and mobile and and I gotta say yes the events are super fun but other than that all I have been doing is doing commissions and other than that farming wood for my teapot. I also feel like other late game players agree that the resin system is pretty much well just broken. Daily we get 160 resin. Weekly bosses each take 30 resin. There are 4 weekly bosses. That counts up to 120 resin used for weekly bosses ONLY. And if you need to farm let‚Äôs say weapon ascension materials the most you can retrieve is probably 2 runs in the domain. And this is not counting fragile resin recaps or condensed resin or what. But seriously the resin system is broken and so and so. Other than that the game is amazing and I really enjoy it.

despite being a free game, many have spent hundreds and even thousands of dollars trying to get characters from the gacha, which still has horrendous rates on the banner. i mean, how else would you make money right? i also feel that players deserved more on the anniversary. i remember when there were fewer players, the community rewards were very generous, and now, they‚Äôre not enough to do even a pull; it‚Äôs a death wish for those that are F2P.  the game gets repetitive when you hit late game, only doing comms, daily resin, maybe bp etc. i was expecting more from the Mihoyo marketing team since Genshin has grown exponentially, even becoming one of the most played online games of 2020, despite its age. even though you can still enjoy the game without your favorites, it doesn‚Äôt excuse the problems with Gacha games. the graphics are beautiful, the storyline is great. although, i still think there‚Äôs much to improve on. i would give it a 4.5/5 if it treated their players a bit better and fixed the marketing issues.

Just let this company go back to its own country and earn their people‚Äôs money already.

I‚Äôve been playing mobile titles for about 12 years now. I‚Äôve seen hundreds upon hundreds of them come and go, and there are many that are brilliant. This title is effortlessly among one of my favorite mobile games‚Äîand games in general‚Äîof all time. It proves that a free-to-play title can have a business model that isn‚Äôt aggressive or exploitative, and that the base free experience doesn‚Äôt have to be a struggle. 

The graphics are astounding in how vibrant and crisp they are. The frame rate is silky, and the combat is so responsive. I‚Äôve found myself gleefully running around in random directions, curious about what I‚Äôd find next. All of this, and it fits in my phone. An experience this well-done fitting into a device that can slip in my pocket is mind-blowing.

Thank you. Thank you for proving that the free-to-play mobile space can be a great place to play.

I‚Äôve been a long time fan of Honkai Impact so I was excited when I found out they were developing another game I knew it was gonna be great. Honkai Impact has always blown my mind how far they push mobile gameplay, to see Genshin Impact go even further is unbelievable. This game functions like a full game and has so many tasks to explore and secrets. I‚Äôve only been playing for a few hours and have already collected tons of lore snippets to read. Yes it‚Äôs a gacha game but it‚Äôs also an incredible game to play free and I‚Äôve been happy with my rolls even without spending. Knowing the devs history with Honkai, I don‚Äôt believe the micro transaction system will wind up being too money hungry to enjoy. Obviously it‚Äôll take some consistent game time to keep rolling but with this gameplay I am A-Ok with that! Amazing job guys you really know how to impress

The most amazing game I‚Äôve ever played in my life. It‚Äôs defiantly a grind game, but it‚Äôs not pay to win like many people says. I‚Äôve been playing the game since version 1.3 and never spent any money on it. I‚Äôve also seen a lot of bad reviews because the game takes up a lot space or lags a lot, but it‚Äôs not Genshins fault that you‚Äôre playing it on a potato. 
   The music and scenery in this game are breathtaking, as well the gorgeous character designs and intriguing plot. But with that being said, the game has been lacking a lot in updates, with event reruns and features that no one really wanted. Not to mention the absurd lack of anniversary rewards. But despite this, nothing can deny the unimaginable joy that this game has brought into my life. It has something for everyone, and you will not regret downloading it.

i‚Äôve played this game since before the chasm update, and it was pretty fun. one thing i always liked was the culture within the nations of tayvet. everything was true to life and beautiful. my complaint throughout was the lack of black and brown characters, but i was assured that if i waited for nations based on black and brown countries, this would change. but honestly? the upcoming sumeru update looks nothing like was promised. instead of being mostly based on one culture, it‚Äôs an amalgamation of dozens of cultures. and even then nothing is accurate to the real cultures, only stereotypes. but the worst of all is the blatant whitewashing. npcs from the area are paper white, and upcoming characters appear to be the same, with the exception of one character who looks tan AT MOST. with all the detail put into prior regions, i find it really distasteful that when it comes to a black / brown region, the minimum research is put in in favor of more ‚Äòappealing‚Äô whitewashed culture and characters.
i want to love this game but the complete lack of respect is too much.

This is truly an exceptional game - I would maybe compare it to a mix of Breath of the Wild and old-school WoW, with outdoor scenery, music and breadth similar to the former and a grinding mechanic like the latter, but in most ways better than both games. Grinding more fun than in WoW, and more interesting variety of scenery than BotW, plus the very fun character switching mechanic. As people have said, you really don‚Äôt need to spend money to advance and have fun - I haven‚Äôt spent a dime thru level 70 of my main character, and I‚Äôm actually feeling guilty about it. If there‚Äôs any criticism, it‚Äôs that it is maybe too easy sometimes, but it is an appropriate difficulty level for a casual mobile game that you might only play in 10-20 minute chunks. Special shout-out to the interesting geopolitical perspective that comes through.

For me there is no other word I can use to describe this game other than masterpiece. It truly is one of the best games I‚Äôve ever played and can‚Äôt believe how incredibly well it runs on mobile. The attention to detail is ridiculous, graphics are eye candy, the music is serene and well thought out in terms of placement in the game, the dialog isn‚Äôt boring and there is plenty to do and collect. There is a great mix of missions that range from taking a while to just a few minutes so you can always be progressing even if you can‚Äôt play for very long at a time. This is how in-app-purchases should be, make a great game so I ‚Äúwant‚Äù to spend money, not forced to. These developers deserve IAP because of the sheer quality going on here.

This game is awesome. It‚Äôs aesthetically beautiful, a great story line, and extreme fun. I love that it‚Äôs an open world type of game play as well. So far I‚Äôve been enjoying the game,  it‚Äôs not quite an mmo which is what I was hoping for but honestly an action RPG that is very well done.  The story plot so far is quite entrancing.  The artwork you can tell the developers definitely put a lot of work into it.

On mobile it‚Äôs a bit annoying to move around as the camera continuously zooms back in I do wish there was a way to lock the camera zoom to where you want it.

The attacking is actually one of the best I‚Äôve seen as far as mobiles go.  I‚Äôm sure it‚Äôs a heck of a lot easier on a console/pc.  

***I do wish it was out on the switch or on stadia because using a controller would probably make it a lot easier to move. ***

There is a gacha system but honestly they pack you to the teeth near the start of the games first chapter with enough currency that you can do quite a few summons without spending a dime.  I‚Äôve even pulled a few 5*s. 

Artwork - 5/5
Combat - 4/5 (probably 5/5 on console and pc)
Story - 5/5
Gacha system - 2/5 (you can play without using it)
Bonus - almost fully voiced over - 5/5
Overall - 5/5 because it‚Äôs one of the most wonderfully done games in a long while.  There needed to be a new RPG with a new story and there just hasn‚Äôt been any that grasped my attention.  

Again this is strictly my opinion.

This is a free to play a game that has the most elbow grease put into it that I‚Äôve ever seen. While far from perfect, with a limited number of characters - the gameplay by itself has the most effort I‚Äôve seen put into the core game, to deter from the common monotonous gameplay of other games of its type. MTX are present as well as the common Loot rarities and content-based leveling up ‚Äì but none of this is necessary. In terms of game interaction there are a lot of borrowed elements here, however some of the games design decisions in interface are so well thought through and refined for a F2P game. My one criticism is that you won‚Äôt run into a point where there is legitimately very little to do. I think this is going to round out over time with more characters in weapon types, however they aren‚Äôt here yet. Also the world itself can use more variety.

When I first pre-registered, I honestly didn‚Äôt know what to expect, but I can say for a fact that I am addicted! I‚Äôd visited the Genshin Impact website several times, and even though I missed the beta, I‚Äôm still satisfied that I stuck along to experience it! It has the vibes of an anime Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild, but with the character collection aspect(s) of an anime gacha-style game (i.e. you spend in-game currency that you earn or purchase in order to roll for a chance of obtaining new characters as well as items). The way the music changes when running or in combat is amazing~ Honestly, even though there‚Äôs micro-transactions, if you explore enough, I feel like you could earn anything- Just have to be willing to put in the time for games like this! Also, I have my hopes up regarding controller compatibility for the mobile versions!

I love the game. Genshin Impact is a open-world game meaning it has a lot to explore and that awesome, it definitely needs a long time before you get extremely good at gameplay but it‚Äôs really fun!

The games textures and scenes are beautiful and cinematic. The graphics are extremely high quality and can be adjusted to get a smooth gameplay. There is such a diverse amount of character that you may need to favor everyone! The quest and battle that goes alongside the story is so exciting. You explore new bosses, add new mobs to your archive, encounter new enemies and find ingredients for recipes!

The storyline is awesome with the Traveler being from a different world, and with the Traveler always trying to find clues as to where their lost sibling is, it spikes more excitement!

I love this game, but the more you play the more boring it kind of gets. If I'm being completely honest, the game gets less exciting because when you reach a high AR (45+) you'd have lots of equipment and gears and eventually you‚Äôll get overpowered and thats where the fun is lost, but this is a definite 4/5!!!!

I recommend if you like playing along with storylines, open-world games, characters to collect. I hope any new players enjoy the game and give feedback, it will be very helpful to the developers!

This game has cured my boredom many times and there are too many good things about the game to mention. I am in love with the graphics and the attention to detail in the game. The storyline and plot is perfect, it catches my attention every time. I just want to say that when you‚Äôre a beginner, sometimes people will join your world and help you fight bosses. This always made my day because at the time I was about AR (adventure rank) 18 and it helped me so much to get EXP, artifacts, and other important resources. At first, it may seem overwhelming considering how many options and possibilities you have but one thing that I did was research. This helped me to figure out where I can find things, different battle tactics, how to use something properly, and much more. Thank you so much for making this game:)

Okay let me start off by saying Genshin is a really cool game, the characters and stories are awesome, the graphics are amazing and the fact that it makes you use brain power to get to certain points instead of just buying things makes it even better, but the issues I have with it are 1. It takes up literally my entire phone storage to just download it‚Äî I mean, I deleted every single app I could off my phone to play it one time and it felt like my phone was on fire. I have an iPhone12 and if I‚Äôm correct this isnt an old or outdated phone. And 2. There is hardly any diversity in the game. Other than characters that are extremely problematic, theres about 1-2 people in the game that aren‚Äôt white as snow. Theres a lot of cultural offense in the game and its been getting ignored for the longest time. But other than those two things I dont have that many other problems with it.

The whole game is so good. To the 3D models,story, characters design, and it‚Äôs a open world game that is a mobile game. I‚Äôve been playing this game since November, so I can see the problems. The first problem is recent to 2.0, since the start of it I‚Äôve been crashing more frequently then before. And now as I type I can‚Äôt play the game for a least 5 seconds, I hope you are ready notified about that. Secondly original resin time should be increased and not being resin. And  if you want to keep the time then put 3 or 5 original resin a minute, not 1. The last one is put in better battle pass rewards for people who don‚Äôt buy it. And I don‚Äôt meet food no body needs that it people can make it in game,For example more hero‚Äôs wit. This game is very fun for me and some other‚Äôs I can‚Äôt wait for the following updates to happen.

So far in the game there are 2 poc. Keaya and Xinyan. With over 40 characters there are only 2 people of color. I love this game. Its easily become one of my favorites but it‚Äôs disappointing the majority of characters having white or pale skin tones. For the regions they‚Äôre based on you can make the argument that it makes sense. And you can make the argument that with more regions being added soon we can possibly see more people of color. But with recent leaks of the Sumeru characters all being light skinned while only one of them has darker skin. Not to mention that one of the characters is a harmful stereotype, it makes the company look as if they don‚Äôt care about adding more skin tones and creating diversity in the game. There‚Äôs nothing wrong with having pale characters along as the majority of playable characters (AND NPCS!!!) aren't light skinned. There should definitely be a greater ratio of darker skinned characters then lighter skinned in the Sumeru update. The NPCs should also reflect the region by not all of them being white passing.

The lack of characters with darker skin is absurd. With a whole new nation coming out soon with extremely pale skin doesn‚Äôt make any sense at all. Yes, not all South Asians have darker skin, but when you‚Äôre making a nation that is a mixture of ethnicities you are expected to put in some effort. You cannot highly research nations with predominately pale skin and respect it but disrespect a different nation because of their predominately dark skin. A new leaked character‚Äôs design is extremely orientalist and disrespectful. This company had plenty of time to make a simple change of giving Sumeru characters dark skin and not disrespecting the many cultures it includes, but chose not to. They are disrespecting so many people and should be allowed to get away with it. Do not play this game if you are expecting great representation for POC with dark skin. Their dark skinned characters are filled with stereotypes and they do not know how to properly give good representation. It‚Äôs a shame because of how incredible this game is but the flaws cannot be ignored.

Honestly, everyone is calling Genshin Impact stingy, but to be honest we can‚Äôt say that is true. We are provided with a free game, great graphics, they don‚Äôt charge for voice overs, and overall a great game. So what if OTHER game‚Äôs anniversaries have good rewards. I do think it can  be a problem if they keeping going like this, but they do whatever they want to do. I think it‚Äôs pretty wrong to point out on ONE reward, and say that Genshin is boring, stingy, and a horrible game. If one reward changes people‚Äôs opinion that much, I‚Äôd rather say they are the stingy ones. However I think Genshin should take care of the matter. Everyone is going psycho, and there wasn‚Äôt really any posts to solve the problem. I don‚Äôt know if this is a marketing deal, but I think it would be better to give some type of explanation.

First let me state that there is nothing wrong with Genshin Impact itself. It is a beautiful game. The music, the characters, the regions, and the quests. My problem is with the company who created the game, mihoyo. Today genshin players should be celebrating Genshin Inpacts 1 year anniversary, but instead the focus is on the terrible rewards we got. We got a cute little interactive movie, going through our journey of genshin impact. But the actual rewards where horrible. 10 fates, which you can only fully acquire if you log in every day for the next week (which is also the same rewards we got during lantern rite) 40 primogems and 300 mora. Mihoyo was generous enough to give big streamers 15k primogems for its anniversary, but the other players get absolute garbage. for a multi million dollar company, they fully can afford to spare 1600 primogems to each of their players. I hope mihoyo is actually listening to their players demands and requests because if they continue to treat their players like this, their game will no longer be successful.

First of all, I want to say how funny the one star reviews are. ‚ÄúGive me Klee or die,‚Äù definitely gave me something to laugh about. 

The game is amazing. Even though I‚Äôve done all the Archon Quests currently available, I still find things to do, like exploring parts of the map I previously ignored.

The updates and events have satisfied me, giving me something to look forward to the next day when I log on. The newest event, Midsummer Island Adventure (I think), is great. I love the fact that if you grind a bit, you can get a beautiful Barbara skin. The Echoing Conchs tell many stories, and the quests about the past people who lived there are captivating. 11/10 Job on the event.

I really don‚Äôt think there‚Äôs anything wrong with Genshin Impact. Some people say that it‚Äôs ‚Äúhomophobic‚Äù that they don‚Äôt have a certain character because they are a certain sexuality. It‚Äôs not about your sexuality, it‚Äôs just the rates. You might get a few more of a certain character because that‚Äôs what the random generator gives you. You‚Äôre not special because you get bad artifacts, plenty of people spend hours grinding for artifacts and get many trashy ones (me included).

Overall, great work. I‚Äôve loved this game from the second I picked it up.

Honestly, this is the most amazing game I have ever found for a phone. I need this to have a contract with Nintendo or something so I can play on a larger screen! 

The world is MASSIVE. The gameplay has its complications, but that is to be expected considering it‚Äôs played on a phone screen. Aside from that, it‚Äôs easy to navigate how the game works. Gameplay is smooth (I have had a few freezes but closing and reopening the app brings me right back to where I froze, no lost gameplay!).

This game is stunning! The game graphics and voice acting is beautiful. I play a mobile and the playing experience isn‚Äôt that great sometimes. Whenever I go to see all of my characters the game crashes. It also crashes when I teleport and when I go to quick team setup. Also, when there is a story on screen it lags a little bit and glitches. When it does that I have to leave the game and reopen it for it to work smoothly again. For a mobile phone game, this is phenomenal.

Hell, even for a console or PC game, the open world experience is very immersive and captivating. 

The gameplay is solid, and although it incorporates more traditional gacha-style game progression, it does so in a way that isn‚Äôt too obnoxious. You can easily progress whether you spend real currency or not.

A lot of the fun for me is in the story and the gameplay. It‚Äôs surprisingly good story and character voice-overs will keep you entertained, as an RPG should.

My biggest complaint is probably that is just a bit too open world, and there aren‚Äôt too many activities to keep your interest for more than an hour or two at a time. This is a fine game to help you relax, but as a grind, it can be kind of boring. 

There is a lot of ambition to this game, and I can‚Äôt wait to see just what they plan to release in the upcoming months, especially in terms of multiplayer. For what it‚Äôs worth, there is a lot to do right now, and I recommend diving in now while it is so popular. 

To summarize, it‚Äôs among the top 5 most gorgeous mobile games you can play. Cross-platform, and very little bugs and gameplay issues, but you will spend a lot of time exploring and wandering the big open-world, so be prepared for a lot of silence and atmosphere.

I have been following this game for quite some time now and now that I can finally play it, I can say proudly I am not disappointed. There needs to be some tweak to the gacha system or even increase the rates at this point. Other than the bad gacha rates this game is fun and honestly you don‚Äôt need 5 star characters to beat endgame content, 4 star heroes perform just as well as long you have pulled multiple of them to ascend them.

Genshin Impact is a fun and immersive RPG that features beautiful scenery and extremely detailed characters. The storyline is interesting and deep for once in a gacha RPG, and MiHoYo releases new characters, events, and free rewards fairly often which helps keep the playing experience interesting. There‚Äôs only one problem with the game, and it‚Äôs a fairly large one and that is the sheer size of the thing. On a beefy pc or console, this game is absolutely stunning. Mobile devices, however, simply don‚Äôt contain the processing power or storage to keep up with the constant updates, high graphics, and unbelievably large map. It is definitely not recommended that you get the game on a mobile device, but instead install it on a computer or console via the Epic Games Store. The game itself is great and addictive, even; it just does not have a place in the world of mobile, pocket-sized, less powerful devices.   Basically, get the game and play it; despite its ‚Äúanime/waifu/husbando‚Äù outlook in the gaming world‚Ä¶. just not on a mobile device.

Hoyoverse has disappointed many including myself with the launch of sumeru and it‚Äôs cast of orientalist designs and mostly pale characters. They enjoy using the aesthetics of real southwest Asian and North African cultures, but don‚Äôt bother to represent the real people who live in those regions. I was planning on spending money on this game until I saw what a disappointment sumeru was going to be. Hopefully they‚Äôll have learned their lesson before Natlan. But I doubt it. They‚Äôre extremely colorist, with their darkest character barely tan. Candace, who was based off a real woman, Kandake, is an extreme letdown to fans who were hoping to see a dark skinned woman represented  in game. In summation, hoyoverse is egregiously wrong to inaccurately lump these distinct and beautiful cultures into one mishmashed  amalgamation and then not even represent the people from those cultures. Some may say ‚Äúoh it‚Äôs just a fantasy game!‚Äù Why is it that people of darker skin tones aren‚Äôt allowed in that fantasy then. What is so ‚Äúunrealistic ‚Äú about melanin that characters can‚Äôt be dark skinned?

Okay to start off, i like the game. Im not hating on it for no reason. It is well put together and the stories are okay. But thats not the point. The problem at hand is the constant lack of diversity. Incase you didnt know, teyvat is made up of 7 different nations that are all based on real-life nations. One of the nations is called sumeru, and is based on south asia countries like India, Pakistan, and other countries in or near that region. As you might already know, lots of the people who live there have a daker complexion/skin tone than say someone from the UK. It has been leaked that 99% of the characters have a light skin complexion. Not to mention that in total of all of the current playable characters only 2 of them are a little darker while the rest are pale or slightly tan. Its quite a problem since there is already a lack of diversity in genshins cast. Again, genshin is a great game. It just disappoints the community after we constantly ask Hoyoverse to add more dark skin characters. 

Thats it ciao :')

The play-loop is very engaging, I don‚Äôt feel the need to spend a cent on this game, and I honestly feel overwhelmed by the amount of items I receive and I wish there were less rewards lol the only downside I can think of is the amount of items you receive make all of the menu‚Äôs constantly have notifications lmaoooo it‚Äôs super fun and is super engaging, but if you‚Äôre looking for something to itch the scratch that BOTW left you, this is not the game for you. Look, this game is great. The graphics are‚Ä¶okay on mobile. But we need more content in this game. These updates have been lowkey kind of boring and we need a sort of endgame mechanic or anything that will not make us bored of this game. Also, with the upcoming region Sumeru coming out, I except there to be representation for the culture of where Sumeru is based off of. It‚Äôs not that hard to do, it‚Äôs a simple request. Also, you guys NEED to try and shrink the app size. You will lose more players each patch if you don‚Äôt. Our storages cannot handle that much. Again, this is a request that many people would like to see. Thank you.

Also, when I mean representation I mean not stereotyping characters. I also mean adding more diversity. Yes, there can be white colored skin tones but not everyone should be white skinned. People want representation of their own culture, and you not giving them their representation will force them to not play your game. So please, read this and the many other reviews. This is very disappointing Hoyoverse.

the company, hoyoverse, only cares about money and not their customers satisfaction. they already have billions of dollars yet are thirsty for more. the currency used to pull for characters gets way too hard to get after you reach a certain level. the game has multiple regions, and the upcoming region, sumeru, is supposed to be based off of an area with primarily dark skinned people, yet they‚Äôve only made 3-4 characters that are slightly tanner than paper-white in the whole GAME. they represented other cultures, like china, japan, and germany nearly flawlessly, yet their idea of representation for the middle east and south asia is completely stereotypical. the only tan characters that genshin has included have ALL been 4*s, and it‚Äôs easy to realize that hoyoverse is making these characters a lower tier than the others because they think that they won‚Äôt get as many sales as the light-skinned characters. the company doesn‚Äôt even care about keeping people interested, and more fishing people of their money.

When it comes to mondstadt, Hoyoverse focuses on one country/culture for inspiration. (Germany) When it comes to liyue, Hoyoverse focuses on one country/culture. (China) When it comes to inazuma, Hoyoverse focuses on one country/culture. (Japan) But when it comes to sumeru, all of the sudden the SWANA region (which all have unique and significant cultures) gets meshed together into a single monolith. Not to mention the sumeru characters are all either stereotypes, orientalist, or just straight up have no resemblance to a SWANA culture. Another issue is the fact that there are no dark skinned sumeru characters or NPC‚Äôs. I am well aware that people come in all different shades and some SWANA countries have people that are fair-skinned but that still does not excuse the fact that the majority of people from the SWANA region are tan, brown, black, etc. It‚Äôs really disappointing for Hoyoverse to put love and care into each nation in the game and pay very careful attention to each culture but when it comes to a predominantly brown country/culture they just become lazy and ignorant. Do better.

Hey! ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è
I‚Äôve been playing genshin for almost a year now and throughout my experience I have some things to share: ‚ö°Ô∏è
1. ‚ú®You don‚Äôt have to spend money on the game to have a good time.‚ú® I personally do spend money sparingly on this game, however you do NOT have to to still have a great experience. I understand many people would rather not spend money on a free game or simply cannot and that is perfectly okay!
2. üíñTake your time with the story!üíñ You don‚Äôt have to rush through the gameplay to get to ‚Äúendgame‚Äù because you will soon realize you missed out on a great and enjoyable story. 
3. üéáDon‚Äôt compare your account to other people‚Äôs. üéáLet me explain, Genshin Impact has a team and character building aspect to its gameplay and it is very easy to see other people‚Äôs characters in action and feel not good enough. 
4. ü™©Don‚Äôt play extensively. ü™©This game is very easy to get burnout from. It‚Äôs not a bad game in proportion but if you spend hours upon hours playing it gets a bit boring. I know from experience.

The largest problem of this game in my opinion is the gatcha system implemented and the normalization of this system in the industry as a whole. Genshin impact has been one of the most influential games this past year with everyone being inside and due to the pandemic, and subsequently trying and playing new games, Genshin has thrived in this new gaming industry with a astronomical 2 billion dollars made from mobile platforms through in app purchases. While the game may be free to play, and many of the players being ftp, the effort put into making scummy mechanics and having many of your favorite characters locked behind unrealistic odds of obtaining, limited time availability, on top of the egregious odds of pulling said character or weapon. It‚Äôs just culminates into a horrible system of unlocking new characters, and thereby having ‚Äúfun‚Äù in this game. While I have no qualms with the actual gameplay and the overall world in this, it is largely overshadowed by the gatcha system.

I‚Äôm playing this game on an iPad Pro, and the game is in bad need of controller support.  As it is, the game is difficult to play simply because the on-screen controls are uncomfortable on a large screen.  For a game which involves platforming and aiming and which also has a PC port and a PS4 port, ignoring controller support is inexcusable.  Hopefully, this will be patched in soon -this would warrant a few more stars for this review.

The gacha system for obtaining new allies is brutal - some of the lowest rates you‚Äôll find (0.6% for a 5*).  They don‚Äôt seem to be super generous with currency at the moment, so you should go into the game expecting to be playing with the story-provided characters and one or two other 4* characters unless you commit to whaling.

The game occasionally decides it wants to take several minutes to load (on a white screen), so if that happens to you, you probably just need to wait a few more minutes before trying to restart the game.  It doesn‚Äôt happen EVERY time you load the game, but I‚Äôve encountered this several times so far.  Bug?

Frustrating controls and brutal gacha aside, the game looks very good for a gacha game and is actually fun when you‚Äôre not wrestling with the clunky controls.  To me, the game feels more like Sword Art Online: Lost Song for the PlayStation Vita than anything else - right down to the flying in Lost Song and ‚Äúsingle player MMO-like‚Äù feel that all the Vita SAO games had.

I have been playing this game for 2 years and I just now got a five star character. While my friend has been playing for way less time and has gotten 3 five stars. I think the wish system should be less random, and there should be a wishlist on which character you want so you have a higher chance of getting that character. I also think it should be easier to get primo gems, or make the wishes cost less primo gems. Also, you should be able to get guaranteed characters if you pay. Say five dollars for a four star, and 10 dollars for a five star? I just think the wish system is very flawed and need to be reviewed. Other than that the game is great! Honestly it is my favorite mobile game, and the only problem is the wish system (which is unfortunately a big problem.))

I really like this game. I play it with my friends, the story is great and so are the graphics. Over all a really nice game. The one thing I have to complain about is how much storage it takes upüíÄ. You have to delete almost half the apps you have downloaded on your phone, most of your pictures, and MAYBE you‚Äôll be able to load your resource data after an update. It‚Äôs ridiculous. It takes an hour and a half to update the game and like 30 minutes to load the resources and right at the end it warns you that you don‚Äôt have enough storage!? Storage for what? It‚Äôs not like I‚Äôm storing a missile in my files. Roblox takes like 8 seconds to update and it has more stuff than Genshin Impact ever will.
All I am saying is that Genshin needs to fix how big their games are and how much storage they take up, it‚Äôs a good game I just think that the storage issue is silly.

Dude‚Ä¶ Genshin impact is like if animal crossing, standard battle game, and amazing graphics all had a kid and then enhanced times a thousand. It‚Äôs amazing. BEAUTIFUL graphics, a massive world to explore, a ton of characters, and so much more for FREE makes it an easy best-of-all-time. It‚Äôs not even pay to win, you can ofc pay for primos and things, but it‚Äôs definitely not required or needed to advance. The character designs are immaculate, and the whole concept of the game is just brilliant. I‚Äôm not at a high AR, about 25 or so, so my quests are piled up pretty high at the moment‚Ä¶ I‚Äôve heard that higher ARs don‚Äôt get many quests/things to do though‚Ä¶ but with the new update i think things will get better! If the devs keep up the spectacular work, and use fan input, this game could become even better than it alr is. :)

I had 3 masterless starglitter and got a four star, which is supposed to give you 2 more starglitter,  which would have given me 7, enough to wish again, but I didn‚Äôt get any more starglitter from that wish. To add to that, I was doing the spiral abyss, and got 3 ‚Äú50 primos‚Äù messages after doing floor 9 which would have given me 150. After that, without checking my primo amount, I did floor eight so I could get the one star from chamber two that I hadn‚Äôt gotten yet, and I got 100 primos for that. In total, even if I‚Äôd started from 0 primogems, which I didn‚Äôt, I would have had at the very least 250 primogems, but by the end of that I still only had 179, and I‚Äôd started from 29 primogems. I hope Mihoyo fixes and recompensates us for these problems.

Okay, so I‚Äôm not usually one for mobile games but after a few recommendations thought I‚Äôd give this one a shot. I came in expecting to be disappointed but now I can not stress enough how much fun this game is! The story is fun to play along with, defeating bosses is challenging but not impossible, and the graphics are shockingly good considering it‚Äôs a mobile game. I would have given it five stars were it not so hard to obtain five star characters. The wishing system in this game is designed so that you have to spend real money if you want to get strong playable characters. However, even spending $100 will only get you about 40 wishes which sound fine until you consider that there is a .6 percent chance of actually getting one of those great five star characters. But other than the absurd impossibility of the wishing system, this game is addicting and I would absolutely recommend it.

This game is pretty good! I‚Äôm surprised it‚Äôs free without a bunch of ads and pay-to-win stuff everywhere. Any other app would lock stories, features or characters behind money locks where you must pay, but everything is free and gives you sooo much to do. Very pretty world and nice character design. The mechanics are easy enough on all platforms but I just have 1 complaint: the stamina. It‚Äôs a bit low, youre average human can swim/run/climb for more than 20 seconds. Especially swimming, I drown when Im in the middle of a lake. Also, I dont think there should be stamina while gliding, the glider is doing all the work. Unless different gliders have longer stamina? It‚Äôs not much of a complaint, it doesnt get in the way of gameplay. I dont have much complaints for this. Good job, 10/11

The game is great. Well, at least for the first few weeks of gameplay. Good graphics, interesting story, entertaining characters. So why am I giving it a 1 star review? Terrible updates, painfully annoying gacha system that only works out of pure luck (you could pay hundreds and thousands of dollars and it would never guarantee an item you‚Äôd want to get), and don‚Äôt even get me started on the recent anniversary ‚Äúevents‚Äù. We didn‚Äôt even get a special character or interesting new storyline. There are other things too, such as random glitches, horrible fishing system, overly difficult quests and tasks that give no hints as to what you‚Äôre supposed to do, excruciatingly long amounts of unnecessary and uninteresting dialogue, and unending cycles of spending hours and hours just to buy a single wish, only for it to be another 3 star sword that you already have. So in summary, if you want to have a few weeks of fun, then eventually realize that the game is just not all that great, go for it.

I cannot in good faith recommend new players get addicted to this game for the last two reasons. I will update this review if developers actually listen to feedback. Reasons as follows:

This is game is gorgeous from it‚Äôs art to its music, and it is a technological achievement that it can fit on your phone and still be as expansive and open world as it is. The characters are all memorable and lovable, the combat is very colorful snd fun, and the story and lore are very interesting too. 

The developers will not listen to your suggestions though and will even try to censor you on their social media platforms that allow it, so don‚Äôt expect any improvements. The game will also try to milk you of every penny you‚Äôre worth with tempting mechanics such as getting resources faster, getting characters you want more often, and of course making your characters stronger which can cost you upwards of thousands in USD. But worst of all the studio will use community artists and cosplayers as advertising and pay them little no compensation in exchange. This behavior is a complete 180¬∞ shift from when the game first launched, showing that now that they‚Äôve made money they no longer care about the players.

So once again, I do not recommend this game. It‚Äôs a highly addictive time waster. But if you don‚Äôt care about being mistreated and you have deep pockets to burn, by all means play away. I just think your money can be better spent elsewhere.

The game is amazing. I love it but there are too many things i dont like. I wish that it didnt take up so much room. Every time i want to play i have to delete almost all my apps just to play. Also i dont like how you can only get 5 wishes per month. Its annoying and I wish the app would also give diversity when getting wishes. I keep getting the same items and its annoying, also it crashes sometimes too. Back to the diversity thing, its annoying when i get 5 debate clubs in a row. Also I wish the tasks where easier, as in the instructions. I had to watch a video just to figure out the in the mountains task bc it was so hard to understand what I had to do. I still havent completed the full task bc of how hard it is to stay warm and fight the bosses on a time limit. I do love this game, its fun and has many great adventures but there are too many difficulties to enjoy it too the fullest

The graphics are amazing and the storyline is very entertaining. I used to think that higher drop rates were needed, until I realized that it was easier to get five stars by doing one times wishes. At least for me.  It might take more wishes, but it is much more convenient than saving up and doing one ten roll only to get a very low chance of a five star. Plus, getting 160 primogems is much easier than getting 1,600 primos. I usually just spend the primogems when I get them, unless new characters are making a debut in a new update; for example 1.5. 
Many of the features are like Zelda, but what is most important is always the storyline, and the fact that the rpg game is free. I never paid this game once, and I don‚Äôt think I will need to.

Super fun. I recommend watching a few tips for beginners when you start so you know the best ways to use your resources. If you play a few hours a day you will level up pretty quickly, however never rush! Spend your time focusing on your current characters and how you can make them stronger ‚Äî rather than leveling up higher because you‚Äôll seriously regret it. The higher your AR rank is, the harder your world level will be. The scenery of this game is beautiful as well as the music for each area. A lot of detail was put into making this game and I really love that. Co-oping is available except for when you do the main story quests and a few world quests. Have fun and don‚Äôt feel obligated to spend!! Save your money and don‚Äôt fall into gacha gambling!!!

So I‚Äôm a beginner with the game so I don‚Äôt know much about it, I had just hit adventure rank 35, and then I did the ascension quest because I thought it was something we had to do, but I didn‚Äôt know it was a optional thing, point is my team isn‚Äôt ready for the bosses that are leveled 60+, now I can‚Äôt even complete a quest because the bosses are too hard and so I can‚Äôt fight bosses to get materials for my characters. I can‚Äôt decrease my level either to fix it so Is there anyway for my to fix it, I deleted the game because I can‚Äôt do anything with it, I couldn‚Äôt start over again but that would take up so much time. 

If there‚Äôs no way to fix this then it‚Äôs ok, it was my mistake I just didn‚Äôt know.
But the game overall is fun and addictive I love it.

Everything else in this game is great from the combat to the exploration even the in game events are a blast. None of these excuse the bad, frustrating, and cheap design of enemies in game. Some hide behind shields all day without engaging the player, and others shoot from range constantly disengaging the player if you go near them or are placed in unreachable locations or will raise themselves up to where you can‚Äôt reach them without aimed shot while taking a barrage of missiles to the face. Finally there are the power armor enemies. These enemies will unleash a flurry of attacks, (or spin to win your face) that will stagger and juggle you in the air meanwhile not caring about your normal or charged attacks. Often these enemies will stay just out of your range until you run out of stamina and then wail on you for free. The best part is they can just back away from you outside of your range while you normal attack them.

I am in love with this game! The graphics are amazing and so far I have had zero lag, it runs smoothly. It reminds me of BOTW, but better. I really love the game mechanics, combat, and exploring. I do wish that there were avatar customization options for the traveler, I‚Äôd love to be able to dress them up and really make them ‚Äúmy‚Äù character. Having event outfits and accessories would add a lot of fun, and more things to collect and work towards. Also mounts to earn and collect would be pretty amazing. I really appreciate that I can play it on my phone and the pc, it is really nice being able to play on two systems. If you like BOTW, beautiful open world exploration, cooking and crafting, collecting characters and unlocking interesting lore and stories, get this game!!! I think anyone that enjoys rpgs will enjoy Genshin Impact.

I would have given this a four and a half star review, but unfortunately thats not possible. I love this game, and realy, I‚Äôve fallen for the undeniably amzing graphics. There are, however, prices to pay for that. While the graphics are wonderful, fully downloading the game takes up about a sixth of my current storage. I‚Äôm unable to download more than a few games at a time in order to keep myself in the range of my overall storage. I believe this is due to the high quality graphics and voicovers.

Other than that, my only complaint is that there is no trade system between non-npc players. I would love to trade characters and food, as well as barter and sell things for in game currency. 

The game also, while having a wonderful friend and co-op system, does not save quest progress in co-op, which is arguably the reason most people quickly obtain it. I know that I worked twice as hard to unlock adventure rank 16 just so I could get help on some of my quests, which ended up being for nearly nothing.

The quests are amazing and captivating, rewarding and fun. I have fun runninv theough temples and solving puzzels in my free time. This game is extremely rewarding, addictive, and fun. From wishing for new characters, to making mushroom skewers, this game has much to offer.

This is honestly the best game ever. The graphics are insane, the Gacha system is perfect, the fighting and combat is amazing, the characters are Fire, and the story and Lore are the best! Many people say this is the rip off version of Zelda, Breath of the Wild, sure, it took some ideas. But then again, fortnight took ideas from Minecraft to! This game is amazing, took a few ideas and made them better! What‚Äôs wrong with that? Anyways, I‚Äôm addicted! I just started Yesterday, and it‚Äôs amazing! I recommend it to someone like me who has nothing to do and enjoys binge playing games, your boredom will be solved, but as we all know ‚ÄúItS nOt GoOd fOr yUo‚Äù So ye. I love this game, I‚Äôm amazed that it‚Äôs free and you can play it on mobile! I have no problems with this game at all! 100% recommend!
(Although it take up a LOT of storage)

Ok so I‚Äôm writing this review out of sheer boredom as the update for 3.1 (i think i lost track tbh) is loading. I‚Äôve been playing ever since last December

I wasnt gonna write this but some stuff has been really bothering me. Genshin used to be fun but lately its so incredibly boring. All the fans are super toxic and there isnt any good content. Awful costumer service and so much white washing. All of the events are repeats and its just not the same for old players. This game is trash. After 2 full years of trying to love this game, it‚Äôs only failed me miserably. The developers don‚Äôt fix issues other than nerfing characters that you worked hard/paid for. Whats the point in nerfing a single player game? Idk‚Ä¶They don‚Äôt value your time or money. You get half a pull per day doing dailies and your drops are still terrible at the latest of the stages of the game. There is hardly any coop and quests simply don‚Äôt work in Coop mode. Additionally, enemies get scaled to become much more difficult without any increase in loot in coop. Save your life and money. I‚Äôm considered a pretty moderate whale because I‚Äôve invested my time and money into getting the things I‚Äôve wanted in this game In hopes for more. However,  after all these countless hours and honestly money invested, I can finally say that the developers are greedy and only want you to spend, spend, and spend. If they ban me for this review, I will charge back my card as it was false advertising.

Genshin impact is a great game. It‚Äôs pretty good for people that has gambling addiction hahah. I am very grateful for the free rewards and how it‚Äôs f2p (free to play) friendly. 
Why not a five star rating review? It‚Äôs because sometimes the game can be frustrating. 
The artifact and wishing system is great and all, but I have a little complaint. 
Artifact system: it‚Äôs good and makes perfect sense, but why not give the players a gadget (that we can get from an event) that lets us have better rolls? For example, I want an artifact to roll into crit damage. I will equip the gadget, then the screen will be my inventory. I will need to click on the artifact that I want to roll into crit damage. After I click the artifact then press ‚Äúconfirm‚Äù, the next roll will roll into crit damage. 
Wishing system: sometimes it can be really disappointing‚Ä¶ like losing the 50/50. I lost the 50/50 with every character. Why not lower the hard pity to 80? It can be easier (because we free to plays don‚Äôt have much primogems haha) and more exciting to roll. The weapon banner system is really‚Ä¶ not free to play friendly. How about make the weapon banner‚Äôs system just like the character banner‚Äôs system? 
Sorry for the long review. I recommend you play this game if you have lots of free time or want something to motivate you.

Listen. Genshin Impact is a great game. The devs made it possible so everyone could play this game for free. IMAGINE if it were a paid game and cost money.  I‚Äôm not saying that Genshin Anniversary rewards are bad (10 fate yayy), I am a F2P player and I appreciate everything they have done for the players. So, anyone who‚Äôs saying that the anniversary rewards are bad, JUST PLS STOP IK THE REWARDS ARE STINGY BUT MIHOYO DOESNT HAVE TO GIVE US ANYTHING. So, there you have it, all players can enjoy the open world with any character and even the 4 star characters are good if you level them up. So, personally I think everyone should stop complaining and appreciate what they have (and what they are getting). MIHOYO, thanks for creating Genshin Impact, but if you skimp too much on anniversary rewards, it will affect the players point of view and give them the wrong idea. Pls take this into consideration.

FIRST, i am a paying player.
very generous and very happy to support good developers.

MUCH about this game is simply amazing...
next gen AAA title for tablets and phones.
graphics 10
audio 10
combat 10
characters and voice acting 10
design and polish 10 
controls 8 (need controller support on tablets)
story and events 8 (lots to do, much repetitive)
crafting 6 (simple, but useful)

game is ideal for those that just want to explore!
VERY large world, good story, cool characters!
...
Sadly, the shine does wear off soon...
the 'oh look... found another tree' gets old quick.
customization 0 (does not exist)
loot 0 (100% of loot is ingredient, no useful equipment)
armor 0 (does not exist)
weapons 0 (100% of weapons looted are junk... ingredients)
skills 4 (each character only 2 skills, no skill trees. 6 perks to unlock but require duplicate characters.)
...
for me, after a while the lack of loot and meaningful rewards hurts ... 
LOTS to explore, NOTHING worth finding. 
virtually everything you get as loot is either trash or ingredients... there is no real 'loot'. 
game DESPERATELY needs better loot/rewards.
SPECIALLY at mid to high levels.
make exploration FUN and REWARDING... not pointless.
add some randomized "useful" loot in the world. (ie 4 star min).
add weapons with 'effects' or bonus stats to the world.
add some minor cosmetic items to earn or find.

It‚Äôs a great game with good graphics, but it‚Äôs disappointing. Incredibly hard for F2P (free to play) players to get enough Primogems to get characters. The rewards for reaching AR 50 and up are incredibly unfair considering how long it takes to level up. The resin system is slow and it takes way too long to raise characters and weapons due to that. Daily commissions and the Welkin pass don‚Äôt even equal one wish a day. The company is also terrible at communicating with their players and community. The most recent story for the new region Inazuma seemed rushed and boring. They made it out to be much more than it was going to be. Most recently is the one year anniversary rewards, they are like a slap in the face. Players have spent millions of dollars, and hundreds of hours on this game. They deserve more. The company doesn‚Äôt take criticism and doesn‚Äôt listen to players valid complaints. Overall this game used to be fun but now the company seems to be money hungry and seems to have completely disregarded their players and the community.

By far one of the greediest gotchas I have ever played with its low rates, lack of primos (end game), no daily log in rewards, a stamina system (resin)that is so bad, and content that is not only temporary but also time gated, so even when you do have time to play you cannot complete the event in one sitting ( I can see a couple reasons why they do this, but as a person who doesn‚Äôt have so much free time it is a huge inconvenience)   I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this game to almost any just due to the amount of time you would have to invest and how lucky you would need to be, you are better off playing a different game or reading a book or doing literally anything else.

P.S a word of advice for if you do decide to get the game because it looks great or you like the characters and the story please do not spend money on this game you would have to spend 300$+ to get anything guaranteed and if you are playing on mobile not only will this take up over half of your phones space it will also melt your phone.

This game is so fun, there are so many things you can do daily even after you finish the storyline that's out so far. The gacha system seems somewhat fairer than some other games, except for how you buy wishes. On your second buy of the most expensive primogems, you don't get enough gems for 90 wishes, which guarantees you a 5* character. Also, you can't earn enough primogems in ONE DAY for one wish. you usually earn like, 60 primogems just from daily quests when you need 100 more for one wish. If the price was lowered, a LITTLE bit more, like instead of 160 it was like, 100, that would be better. but yeah, the way is to get you to buy things. so if you're as peeved about this as me, toss in your hat and buy the moon blessing and get 90 primos extra a day.

first of all, the game graphics are great. i've been playing on mobile (iOS) and the only problems i've had with graphics have been when the internet was unstable. the scenery and landforms presented in the game are beautiful as well. the art style has grown on me and i can almost recognize it anywhere. the representation of diversity and cultures are nice as well, but skin colors are not represented enough. hoyoverse is a chinese-based game so i understand that the area most of the developers are from doesn't have many poc. but, i believe that isn't a good excuse. poc should be represented in nearly everything, including chinese-based games like this. as an example, what candace was based off of is MUCH darker than how she is represented in the game, and it's pathetic that the developers can't go any darker than a small tan.

I am I‚Äôm love with this game as someone who always is looking for a new game that‚Äôs exciting has great animation and that has a compelling story that makes me want to follow it and played more to find outWhat was gonna happen this is the game this is a game of been waiting for for years like I have no words for how beautifully it‚Äôs animated the voice actors that are in it like some other voice actors also voiced in some of the best animes out there and that‚Äôs not even it just everything flow so smoothly my only complaint would be is that lag sometimes is if you‚Äôre in like a bottle with more than like three or four like Hillitrils or creatures like that but other than that it‚Äôs really beautiful there‚Äôs a lot of really cute character is a lot of really relatable story lines the jokes are pretty funny and all the characters look amazing

This game is so much better than I ever thought a mobile game could be. My fianc√© and I are obsessed. I‚Äôve played 60 dollar games that weren‚Äôt so well made. Absolutely amazing.

Edit.

Once you get to about adventure rank 30 (took my fianc√© about a week and I‚Äôm almost there) the game time gates you hard with the energy system in the game known as resin. You will get to a point where you login and use your resin and do your dailies and you won‚Äôt be able to grind end game content until your energy refills (and it‚Äôs very slow). I still think this is an incredible game that I would recommend checking out but unless changes are made to that system I think a lot of people will lose interest because they literally keep you from playing the game.

In my opinion, Genshin is a very visually pleasing game. There are many cool-looking places to take a screenshot, or to just sit and look at. The devs did a very good job on the music and visuals. But, the places to explore are pretty boring. There are basically only 3 things to explore throughout the entire world, a flat grassland, a forest, and a mountain. The game feels very repetitive and copy-pasted. The puzzles are pretty bad too. The puzzles don‚Äôt feel like puzzles, they feel like annoying chores you have to do to progress in the game.

The enemies are also repetitive. It‚Äôs fun to fight a boss the first time, but it gets very annoying to fight the same boss throughout the entire game, but with a longer kill time. You could fight any boss in the game at level 1. Doing less damage or having worse gear doesn‚Äôt make the bosses harder, it just makes them take longer to defeat.
The crappy combat doesn‚Äôt help the game either.
The combat is very spammy. All you have to do is attack and dodge, and it gets very boring. 

This game is a very obvious copy of Breath of the Wild, but worse in terms of gameplay. In BOTW you had many ways to kill enemies, but in Genshin, there‚Äôs occasionally a barrel to avoid spamming through a whole fight, but that‚Äôs it.

Gameplay deserves 2 stars, but the visuals bring it up to a 3.

This game I downloaded since 2020 has been the light of my day every time. I love the riddles and the exploration and how many plot lines there are and how they make so much sense. Exploration has been my things since I don‚Äôt know how long and being able to play this game is everything I need. The music, the scenery is all so beautiful. The creativity they must‚Äôve had to make a game this well developed and entertaining but able to make you figure out stuff on your own and understand difficult situations is even better. This game has its own style and it‚Äôs beautiful. No matter what people say this game will always be beautiful and fun. With the exploration or the small little funny things they put in there as Paimon is not emergency food or the 4 katherines.

I love this game. It always puts a smile on my face just doing daily commissions because the game is so fun to play. I truly love how beautiful the game is, I sometimes get lost in the beauty of the world around me. My favorite spot for sightseeing has got to by Liyue harbor, I sometimes like to switch to characters from Liyue and do a photo shoot there because it is so breathtaking. The quests are almost endless and even though I am AR 55 I still have not finished every major quest in the game. I also love how you can get so invested in characters, just learning about them and discovering which ones you like best. It is breathtaking and I appreciate it so much. If you are still considering downloading the game after reading this review, what are you waiting for? Go for it! You will not regret it.

This game had so much potential to be amazing when it first came out. But all of that potential was squandered and isn‚Äôt being used anymore by hoyoverse. If they care about anxiety then they should remove 50/50 from the limited banners because it gives players anxiety or they should have system to where they add a way to get the character(s) you want without going through 50/50 like how they have the chart course thing for the weapons, they should do that with the characters as well. I am annoyed with the lack of black/dark skin characters since I am Blasian and it infuriates me that there are only 4 characters that barley even look like my skin tone, with closest one being Xinyan who is called ‚Äúscary‚Äù for her rock star theme attire by the people of Liyue harbor. It‚Äôs seriously not worth the play time anymore‚Ä¶ Genshin is a great game if you‚Äôre into exploring and leveling up like some Isekai anime. The best part however is it‚Äôs combat system which requires the player to clear certain domains and bosses to
acquire the appropriate artifacts and then level those artifacts to improve the general strength of the chosen character. This system would be ideal if the game had endgame combat content so veteran players and even newer players could test out good teams and improve on the artifact quality of characters. The only thing we get is an abyss with just 12 Floors, which once cleared, your done with basically anything concerning combat in the game. Developer have shown no interest in this and have even come out to say they won‚Äôt adding any endgame content which just makes the game boring. It‚Äôs frankly a huge slap in the face which can be changed if developers cared about the player base and not just money it brings. I would‚Äôve given zero stars if I could. BUT ITS NOT WORTH IT

The game is awesome! I started yesterday and I have fallen in love with it. The art is amazing, the voice acting is great, and the fighting style is fun.
