If the creators are reading this, I really want you to fix this. I‚Äôm giving it four stars because of the glitches. This game would be awesome If you would fix it. Thank you.

i don‚Äôt know how anyone can give this game less than 5 stars. i‚Äôve been craving a good mobile game that is console-like & genshin impact delivers. open world, main quests, side quests, combat, puzzles, backstory, graphics/scenery, for goodness sake even the soundtrack is amazing. the best part? unlike most console games, the developers keep adding more gameplay. i‚Äôm talking whole chunks of land with new characters, enemies, mechanisms & of course quests! oh & it's free! absolutely no ads & no need to spend $1. i honestly want to give the devs money just bc lol. if i was forced to criticize, i wish all doors could be opened. atm, it‚Äôs rare to be able to go inside a building. it doesn‚Äôt need to be over the top with chests & NPCs. it just make the gamers feel more immersed & adds more to exploration.

I‚Äôve been playing Genshin Impact since the release of the game back in 2020 and was always defending the company whenever people had issues with Hoyoverse, but after the 1st anniversary it was obvious they didn‚Äôt really care for their international fanbase outside of China. Although the game itself is high quality and fun, to me it‚Äôs distasteful when sumeru is coming up and is clearly influenced by South Asia or Middle Eastern regions but the characters are as pale as paper, while this itself isn‚Äôt a huge issue if you look at it alone since some people from those regions do have pale skin; the issue is that when you look at almost all the characters there are only 2 out of 50+ characters are tanned or dark skinned while the majority is fairly pale. Many POC‚Äôs are just asking for some representation and accuracy especially when majority of the characters have at least some cultural significance in their outfit designs. I hope they will listen to the fanbase soon and fix this issue.

Genshin Impact is the first and only game I‚Äôve ever gotten truly addicted to. I‚Äôve spent hours upon hours playing and have even spent a fair share of money in game and I hate to leave a one star for a game I‚Äôve enjoyed so much.. However as Genshin Impact releases more and more nations the racial issues become more relevant. I‚Äôm not leaving a one star simply because the game doesn‚Äôt include enough darker skinned characters, but because they use real life culture for inspiration for their nations.. They cherry pick real life culture and represent it in a poor manner.  It is no secret that the beauty standard in China is pale, and the fact that hoyoverse is a Chinese company. At the end of the day they only care about their Chinese fan base and refuse to listen to any of their other players. Are they that allergic to darker skin? Who knows, but it‚Äôs disappointing. Me and many others will no longer be supporting this game and if you‚Äôre reading this I suggest you consider it as well.  

Some other major points
- all their nations have a specific country that they‚Äôre inspired from aside from the ones where you‚Äôd find darker skin people. 
- their only darker character is barely shown in any events or lore, not to mention a stereotype. Loud, seen as an outcast by others. 
- in their other game honkai, one of their character says she dislikes her dark skin which isn‚Äôt even on the dark side. 

Do you want to continue supporting this game or stand up against it?

This game is very fun. I cant lie, it very detailed, the quests are fun, co-op with your friends is also fun. But there a lots of things that MUST be worked on. I‚Äôm playing on PC, which is identical to the mobile game, and so far it‚Äôs pretty great. The story is engaging and there‚Äôs tons to do outside the story. I downloaded genshin to just see what it was about and now I just can‚Äôt put it down. I often find that it‚Äôs 2 am and I just can‚Äôt stop playing. I love the amount of info on everything it makes it so you don‚Äôt have to look at a wiki page half of the time, also the leveling up seems really polished it is made so you don‚Äôt have to pay for a single level up. I also enjoy the art style it reminds of breath of the wild which I think it‚Äôs inspired from. Okay, I love this game, I freaking love this game. The graphics are great, the lore is great, the characters are great, but right now everyone in the community is a little aggravated. A lot of us were expecting more for Genshin‚Äôs one year anniversary, and I gotta say I‚Äôm really disappointed. I myself have stuck around for in the game for more than a hundred days and artifact farming is the worst! Typically, after so much grinding I would loose interest in the game, but Genshin has something special that has made me stick around. I can‚Äôt stress how good this game is. The mechanics are amazing and I have yet to find a noticeable flaw in any part of it. This games open world concept and diversity of characters and powers reminds me a lot of Skyrim or Fable. The voice acting is enjoyable and I like the plot that has been given. Of course something I notice over and over again that I absolutely love is how the characters don‚Äôt necessarily run out of materials. Like how Amber doesn‚Äôt need to stack up on arrows because she materializes them with no usage of stamina. This game is easy going and very beautiful and detailed. I also haven‚Äôt come across a point where I get tired of playing, everything about this game is addicting and entrances me every second. By far has become my favorite game I have ever played on a mobile device even if it‚Äôs a large app.

You‚Äôll start this game out thinking it‚Äôs just a good looking game that borrowed breath of the wild‚Äôs mechanics, but once you get into it, you‚Äôll realize how stupefyingly amazing this game is. This masterpiece has tons of great voice acting, an in depth intriguing story, and a well made combat system. This game is jam packed with spectacular locations, beautiful architecture, and interesting quests. The map may very well be as big as breath of the wild. Character movement is fluid and combat feels perfect. So many different towns that put breath of the wild‚Äôs four tiny villages to shame. With different architecture types and so many interesting places to visit. This game kills my battery but it‚Äôs worth it. Even just the landscapes are spectacular. I really can‚Äôt heap enough praise onto this game. Definitely the best mobile game I‚Äôve ever seen.

Ok so I‚Äôd normally play mobile games but as I was searching for game to play with a friend came across this one. Ended up playing for 4 hours when I was on way to snooze town. Now it‚Äôs a game I‚Äôm gonna be playing in between mmorpgs I play on my pc. 

So what makes this game really great is anyone who into Zelda will instantly get nostalgic feelings as it will remind any Zelda fans about Zelda. Then once your through the first couple introduction quests you get your first combat companion, what is a fire elemental archer. But unlike traditional games were they out in the open world there not around. Because you got to switch to said character to use them in combat. Personally think it‚Äôs unique but honestly don‚Äôt like it but it is unique so whatever. 

Personally hope it comes to either steam or epic game store because being able to play on pc or even on my Xbox. Would make playing the game 10x easier as I‚Äôm not accustomed to mobile games but do enjoy checking them out.

Genshin Impact is a super fun and adventurous game to play. You can explore, wish for characters, do commissions, play co-op, defeat enemies, do quests, and more! I absolutely love this game, the only downfall for me would be artifact farming. Artifacts help make your characters stronger, and can give them more hp, crit damage/crit rate, def, em, and atk. Crit damage/rate are the most useful. they make your characters much stronger, and you can achieve goals the way. though artifact farming isn‚Äôt the easiest, you can also do it in co-op with other people, and it definitely makes it so much easier. Lots of people say Genshin Impact is P2W, though it‚Äôs not. You can be completely F2P and still do great damage. In fact, one of the most powerful teams are with beginner friendly characters. That‚Äôs all for me, enjoy your travels!

I‚Äôve played genshin for a while and have seen how events and updates are managed and while things will naturally get stale at a later point in the game, there is a lot that can‚Äôt be solved through events. To my knowledge there are around 50 unique playable characters in genshin however only two of the cast have a different skin tone from the majority. This issue is also incredibly apparent within npc design as well, where no one has a complexion that varies from pale. For a game with such a massive audience and focus on culture, lack of representation and diversity seriously drains the life from the game. Obviously none of the countries are replicas of real ones however seeing places like Mondstadt, Liyue, and Inazuma take inspiration from actual places on earth makes it even more disappointing for events to have no diversity in skin tone when they have npcs from Sumeru. This can easily be added

1. The ability to block incoming attacks there is a meter/gauge for how many attacks you can block before the enemy breaks the guard and if you block at the right time you can parry the attack and deal the same amount of damage that your enemy was about to deal. 

2. The ability to dodge incoming attacks instead of having to dash/run to avoid the attack there can be perfect dodging that slows down time (just like it was in Honkai Impact). 

3. The ability to interact with things such as boats so you can conserve stamina and using specific characters ability‚Äôs to move around like how the traveler (you the player) can make a tornado the tornado can be used to fly up in the air or maybe even be thrown around but the you can only do that when you‚Äôre not in a battle.

i feel like corporate side of this game is especially ungrateful to their fan base- taking a look at anniversary rewards makes that evident. but the devs have tried and successfully made one of the best games of the decade- the lore and stories to easy gameplay, easily one of the best free experiences you can have when starting the game. but if you‚Äôre a person who loved completing everything in a game like BOTW or skyrim, paying feels necessary to succeed, and the gacha system can be wholly unforgiving. when the game is this widely loved, the tiny details like the serenitea pot load or the raidens functionality in a team seem like huge issues, but as a whole this game has literally been life changing as it‚Äôs provided some stability in my life as well as a community. amazing job devs, community and corp. teams step it up!

This game is really fun. I love everything down to the characters, the graphics, and I‚Äôve been addicted to it for a few months now. It‚Äôs literally perfect! The only issue I have is sometimes it gets frustrating when a character is involved in another quest so you can‚Äôt do a different quest. So you‚Äôd think it‚Äôs better to get the other quest out of the way first, right? But sometimes the quest can be difficult and is a quest that needs more than one person. That gets a little frustrating because you can‚Äôt find people to help with it and then you can‚Äôt really do the desired quest until that quest gets solved. And especially if it‚Äôs a limited quest like an event quest, that gets pretty annoying. But overall the game is really fun and it‚Äôs really great.

I don't normally write reviews but for Genshin, I will, because it has done so much for me and they deserve it! Genshin is one of the best games I have ever played. I've been on a hiatus for a long time from games and when I went back to gaming, Genshin was the first one I picked up. Because of this game, I've handled my anxiety better. Along the way, I've met some new friends from different parts of the world as well. I love that it is a live game and I played it everyday since launch! The game developers work so hard in making the game really good. They release new updates every 6 weeks, and new characters almost every month! I am very much grateful to be able to play this game. It has done so much for my life. THANK YOU MIHOYO!

PS - Ignore the 1-star reviews cause those are just salty ungrateful fans.

Genshin Impact is probably one of, if not the most stunning mobile game. I can‚Äôt think of a game that is bigger‚Äîgameplay wise and storage size‚Äîand it‚Äôs quite incredible. However, on mobile, the problem is simply hardware.

Gameplay:
The story and gameplay are fun, with easy controls and mechanics that are fun to master. The story is pretty long with maybe ~10-20 hours as of now, and more story is always being released. The characters are unique and fun to use. The gacha system is a little painful as a F2P player, as it takes a significant amount of time to get the currency needed to start wishing, but since it‚Äôs a free game, it‚Äôs more or less understandable.

Visuals:
Even with all the graphic settings turned down, the game still looks very good. It has a distinct art style that flows quite well. It‚Äôs always fun playing with the hot guys and the cute waifusüò≥

Performance:
This is where the main problem is. Even with a gen 7 iPad, overheating‚Äîeven with every graphical setting turned to the lowest setting and the brightness down all the way‚Äîwas still very common. The large amount of storage the game took also was somewhat of an issue. Being around 14 GB large, it took a very large chunk, no matter what amount of storage you had.

So I liked the game and it has a huge open world to explore. The story and character development is also nice. Your character is not stuck in a lobby with 2d graphics which is nice. My next comment is personal. The problem is the worship of statues in order to gain stamina. I know that it is not real and I am not really worshiping a statue. However, games developers should consider the Jewish and Muslim community that likes to play games but would be turned off by idol worship. They could use terms like ‚Äúclean statue‚Äù or ‚Äúupgrade rock‚Äù in order to allow others to play the game so not to offend possible players. If you guys could change ‚Äúworship statue‚Äù to ‚Äúclean statue‚Äù or ‚Äúupgrade rock‚Äù it would be greatly appreciated. But I know you won‚Äôt do it. But I had to try because I want to share a mutual opinion people have about it. Have a nice day.

okay so let me start off, amazing game. great graphics, great lore, great everything. maybe mihoyo should get some better voice actors though, but that‚Äôs off topic ;). there is no amount of words to describe how great this game is! this game is hella addictive, and can cause, like the title suggests, a gambling addiction. i am ar 50, almost 51, so i‚Äôve been playing the game for quite i while. all through my playing time, it has been so fun. in co-op, you can meet new, amazing people. the events are fun at most times, but even if they aren‚Äôt really the funnest, they can count as a way to pass time. i used to have a huge obsession with this game, but now that i am ar 50+, i must admit it seems to have worn off on me. i still love every bit of it though! keep it up, mihoyo :)

So the game itself is really amazing. So far I love the characters, the storyline, everything. But, lately, I've been having issues when I'm fighting. If I stray too far from the original point of the fight, the monster I am fighting will stop fighting me and walk away, and when i chase after it, all its hp will suddenly regenerate. This is a huge problem when it comes to fighting the lawachurls or the ruin hunters. Second, lately there's been a glitch when i try to play any domains. After a certain point, monsters stop appearing. Even though they won't appear, the timer will not stop and the monster count won't tell me I'm done. So I end up failing the challenges. This happened while I was in the Midsummer Courtyard and while I was in the Spiral Abyss.

I‚Äôve been playing this game for a while now, and it‚Äôs been amazing. I‚Äôm ar40 (adventure rank 40) and it‚Äôs still fun to play and farm. first of all, the lack of inconsistency with reruns and character release, yoimiya gets a rerun already? what about hutao, it has been a year. also, with getting character materials, and primogems. I play on pc but hop on my phone from time to time. This game is addicting, the world is beautiful and amazing. The game is still in the works but gosh is it amazing. Always something to do and isn‚Äôt promoting its stuff to say (HEY BUY THIS BUY THAT) like other obnoxious mobile games. I recommend playing on pc since the graphics and control is more interactive and visually pleasing if you have a pc.

Let me start by saying that this is a great game, possibly one of the best ever made.  The visuals are stunning, the combat system is very well executed, and the voice acting has true emotion in it.  This game truly deserves perfect reviews.  All those people who say that this game is pay to win are wrong.  If you know how the game works, you can use the four starting characters for quite a long time.  But there is one thing to consider before you get this game on mobile.  The download file is approximately 4 gigabytes.  If it is available, I would absolutely recommend getting the game on a console.  It lags a bit on any phone, and you may need to delete some things to be able to download the game.  Keep that in mind before getting the game.

this game is honestly really good overall. the graphics, lore, and gameplay are really cool along with the cutscenes. probably my favorite game, but i feel like there is one problem with this game. in the recent updates, there have been so many mobile players (myself included) that have had to delete the game because of how much storage it takes up. when i last played it took up about 16-20 GB alone. i feel like this is a problem for most mobile players especially for ppl who can‚Äôt afford a pc or a laptop of some sort. currently, i play on my Ipad since it has much more storage than my phone but it‚Äôs much easier to play on my phone other than my ipad. other than this storage problem, i would give this game a 10/10 recommend esp if you‚Äôre into the ‚Äòfairytale‚Äô like plot of games kinda. c:

Genshin Impact is a super fun game. It is fairly easily to earn primogems (what is needed in order to wish) to get new weapons and characters. Speaking of characters, each character is different. They have different appearance styles that applies to their region and vision element. They also have diverse personalities, ways of speaking, elements, etc. You can clearly tell that the creators of Genshin Impact put a lot of thought into their game. Each region‚Äôs theme is very different. This includes there agriculture, architecture, geographical location, and so much more. The creators also put a lot of thought into the instrumentals for each region. If you‚Äôre thinking of getting Genshin Impact, you should definitely get it. Thank you to Genshin Impact‚Äôs creators for giving players such an awesome experience! üòä

This game is quite amazing. From its amazing views, to its fluent combat. This game is probably my number one, favorite open world game of all time. Although the game itself is very time consuming, its not at all too much of a grind in my opinion, if at all. The combat is super fluent compared to most games like this that i have played. It feels like there is more freedom when your fighting enemies. I love the views, they are very beautiful. The characters are unique, although im not great with constellations. The map is huge, and is still growing. The story is well made, and there are plenty of side quests to do if your not in the mood to progress the story sometimes. Over time the quests get longer and more time consuming which is a bother sometimes, but its a great game 11/10.

The game is really fun to play. Great Graphics, Great Storylines, Amazing characters you can get but the way the company treats their players is wrong. I absolutely love this game. I like it even more than Skyrim. The characters are all so unique and well written. I‚Äôve been playing it nonstop for the last year. I got my brother and girlfriend to start playing it too. The co-op with my internet is a bit glitchy but still really fun to play with my girlfriend especially since we can‚Äôt see each other IRL. The game is fun even without buying any of the real money things. My girlfriend as spent a good deal of money on it and I‚Äôve spent nothing on it. We‚Äôre about the same level and are having equal amounts of fun. It of course has its flaws like every game does but it‚Äôs constantly changing and improving. I haven‚Äôt gotten bored yet because of all the new characters they are constantly adding.

I‚Äôve been playing Genshin since Eula‚Äôs first banner, and since the beginning the game has been fun. The story is quite fun and intriguing, and I haven‚Äôt been able to put my phone down since I‚Äôve downloaded. The game itself runs smoothly (even on mobile with decently detailed graphics). There are a few things that annoy me, like the lack of end game content, but it takes a while to get to the end, so you‚Äôll be set for a while. There are also events that can keep you entertained, and my favorite has been the Midsummer Island Adventure. On multiple occasions I cried while playing it, the soundtrack alone is enough to make me tear up. There was not a moment I was bored while playing, and the only thing that makes me sad is that it was temporary.

This game is one I hold dear to my heart, amazing story, characters and so much more. Like many others I really enjoy playing this game! However Genshin Impact just isn‚Äôt fit for mobile. This issue I will talk about it seems to be one many players experience and I don‚Äôt see it being talked about enough. It takes far too much space, I constantly find myself struggling to find space on my phone. The lag is also a big issue when playing. This is truly a great game, it‚Äôs a bummer not everyone had the best experience. Having it available on other platforms or narrowing down the size could improve the storage issue!! Im aware this isn‚Äôt an easy issue to fix but it is a problem. Otherwise Genshin Impact has so much potential , I just hope I can see what it has to offer in the future.

This game is incredibly fun. I‚Äôve played for about 3 months, and a decently hardcore player. The story and quests are great, but they don‚Äôt last very long. Once you finish those, you are free to explore this amazing and vast world. I love exploring, opening chests, and fighting enemies. Once you are decently far in the game, it becomes quite a grind to level up and build your characters. The limit on what you‚Äôre able to do per day (known as original resin) is a shame, but I really enjoy building my characters. This is a gacha game, but you can beat all content with relative ease as a free to play player. Wishing/pulling is quite thrilling as well. Overall, this game is incredible. The mobile experience is much worse than on PC or console, but it‚Äôs still very fun on a mobile device.

For a ha ha game , it has risen far above the standards. The graphics themselves are beautiful and even more, can run on mobile-for the most part. From colors to lighting, it rains beautifully down on characters and surroundings. To top it off, the background music is phenomenally appealing. Each piece suits the environment it is in, ranging from the calming exploration to intense combat. Mechanics-wise it is definitely something unique, even for an RPG. The 3D movements of characters and the play style of their abilities are unique to each spectrum of obtainable characters. It truly feels like an interactive game. Moreover, the amount of lore set into each character is literally the most in depth story I have ever seen considering that there is a lengthy text for each character. 10/10 would play again.

Genshin in general is an amazing game! From the storyline to the characters I love it all. I do agree that there could be more daily things to do but, not to just get primos. For higher levels it helps to get experience so, just a few more daily commissions for experience would be lovely! I say that if you are only looking for rewards then, don't leave bad reviews for them not giving lots of primos. The reviews had gone from 4.7 to 1.7 to 4.5 in a span of a few hours because people are leaving bad reviews since miHoYo isn't giving away many primos. This is only the 1st year anniversary for this game so remember that. Anywho, if you're someone who is leaving bad reviews for them not handing out primos please think of the reason you loved genshin to begin with. Thank you.

The game overall is really good and runs smoothly on my phone, ive never really had anything to complain about gameplay wise aside from the oceanide boss battle, and the final act in tatara tales. The oceanide boss fight is incredibly linear and annoying as you cant attack the boss itself but only its summons. As for the last act in tatara tales, the fight is too difficult as the cryo fatui agent rarely aggros onto and goes straight for the purification device which has no health, the hydro fatui agent takes absolutely no damage, and in the second half, the two pyro agents kill you nearly instantly, this quest is too hard for those who are free to play. This could easily be fixed if you gave the characters a few buffs or immunities, or you could remove some of the agents or make them weaker

This has to be by far the best mobile game I have ever played. I like it so much that I even downloaded it a second time on PC to play on a bigger screen. It runs flawlessly at max settings on an iPhone 12, can‚Äôt speak for anything slightly older but I‚Äôm sure tuning the settings will help with anyone having performance issues. 

Some things I really like about this game‚Ä¶

- Fun combat
- Beautiful art style
- Gorgeous open world
- Fun characters 
- Engaging story (for a free game)

Here are a few things I think could use some work or that I wish were slightly different‚Ä¶

- Lack of mounts 
- Currencies in the game are a little confusing, not hard to get by any means, it‚Äôs just overly complicated for no good reason
- leveling in this particular instance is not my cup of tea, I‚Äôm new to Gacha style games so I probably just need to get used to it

Overall my complaints are more nit picks and things I can easily look past. Over time I‚Äôll get use to the leveling and currency so it‚Äôs whatever. On top of that mounts are something that can be added later in development plus traveling by foot isn‚Äôt even that bad. 

Overall this is a great FREE game that anyone should at least give a try.

Genshin is a game that requires dedication and time, but rest assured, it is well spent. Genshin is easily one of the most beautiful and detailed games I have seen in my life. Its many creative concepts that are mostly easy to grasp, and every little puzzle from lighting up Elemental Monuments to the most complex of Inazuma‚Äôs new Electro puzzles are fun to do (except some. I would love to personally smash those dumb electro pillar laser mirror thingies.) You can get many traveling companions, like the new and upcoming characters of this update, Ayaka and Yoimiya. I haven‚Äôt even mentioned how big this game is. Its vast world now has 4 massive regions to explore, with lots of fun to be had along the way.

So I beg you, please at least TRY this great game.

Oh, and P.S. I haven‚Äôt even talked about how addicting the gacha system is.

This is a game that surprises me at the beginning. However, with the increase of playing time, you will find that the speed of content production cannot keep up with the needs of the players. It is a long-term updated game, and the version is updated almost every month. However, the new content produced in half a year is only enough for players to play for two or three weeks. Although his music and picture style are still very good, because of the lack of game content and special attention to income, the players who have been playing for a long time are doing some repetitive boring things with low return every day. Perhaps the game planners are not mature, and they need to often imitate the content of other excellent games to design themselves. I hope they can make progress and do not focus too much on making money.

Genshin is a really fun game but my problem is the little representation/research genshin does and or has. They show that they can show culture correctly in regions, but when it comes to the characters, it‚Äôs not. Inazuma has a sexualised maiden outfit (yae miko) and sumeru, even tho it‚Äôs based on an area with a lot of dark skinned people, has only light or white skinned characters. Cyro is not dark skinned and neither is Candace. And talking about Candace, she based of kandake, who was a DARK skinned woman. Candace isn‚Äôt even close to kandakes color. Candace is just a white washed version of kandake. And dori, who is another white skinned characters, is just a stereotype! The outfit, the whole genie theme she has, and the fact she‚Äôs a thief is an Arab stereotype. Genshin can obviously make a cultural character right (yun jin) but they decided(?) To not do correct research for sumeru?  Genshin is a great game, but apart from this, it‚Äôs also had past actions that were racist (especially white washing) I feel like it could start trying at a more diverse cast, but I doubt it.

While this game may be beautiful and filled with interesting characters with a wide range of personalities, there is one major flaw that will change your perspective on Hoyoverse and Genshin Impact.

 Out of around 50 characters, there are only 2 characters that have a dark shade. And in multiple official artworks, those characters have been white washed. This problem has been around ever since the game was released, except it‚Äôs now becoming more apparent during the arrival of the new region, Sumeru.

Sumeru is a nation that is based off countries home to darker skinned citizens. You would believe that Sumeru would have dark skinned characters, but the reality is that there are only 3 slightly tan characters. It‚Äôs even more problematic when you learn that those characters are based off historical figures with much darker skinned tones. Take Candace, for example. She is based off a Nubian Queen named Kandake. Her skin tone is my color, and I am white. If you search up Kandake, you will see that she has a very dark skin tone. It is incredibly disrespectful to directly reference on historical figures, but not take the most crucial and impactful part.

It is even worse that Hoyoverse does not acknowledge their fans during this very pressing and important issue. It shows how unprofessional and terrible their company is. If you want to make a difference, don‚Äôt download the game before you start to enjoy it too much.

i‚Äôve been playing genshin since november 2020, a month after release. i can tell you every aspect of this game like the back of my hand. i enjoy the main story line, the hidden lore, the characters overall designs, however, what we are lacking is general representation of more body types or even more basic‚Ä¶.SKIN COLORS !!!! as of right now (7/4/22) there are 3 characters that are even remotely tan. that‚Äôs out of like forty or fifty characters btw. i also get the feeling that with every new character they release the characters significantly downgrade in terms of lore and character design. the dendro archon is said to come out soon but her design looks that of a four star.. she is incredibly underwhelming and her color palette is very bland. i do love the game but if this persists i can see a LOT of the fans having issues with it. don‚Äôt even bother wasting your time to get to AR 60 if this is gonna be the kind of characters you get.

me and my friends all played around 2020 and from there it was just super fun. i played for hours everyday, i spent money, and was excited for new content. but overtime, the game got extremely repetitive, and i lost interest in any of the main story and the objectives of the game. this game slowly felt like a chore. i used to only get on to do my commissions, but now i never get on. its extremely upsetting too because i told my friends i would come back when sumeru comes ‚Äî sumeru is a region based off of the south asian areas ‚Äî because i was excited to see the mix of tan characters and diversity. sadly, there wasnt a single ounce of tan characters except one that isn‚Äôt even considered a five star ‚Äî the rarest in game ‚Äî and was only considered a four star ‚Äî the lowest rank an obtainable character could be. it‚Äôs upsetting. as a tan asian, it feels horrible to be putting so much into this game, hoping to see representation of tan characters in the game because of one region that gave you hope, but it just didn‚Äôt. can you believe that out of 48+ characters in genshin impact, only two so far are dark skin? it‚Äôs funny how the game also switched to hoyoverse to go international and bring representation yet they arent doing that for a nation that should be consisting of dark skin characters. this is just upsetting and im already planning on uninstalling after playing for over a year. im ashamed how much i put in this game just for it to be a waste.

I love the game! It‚Äôs so fun and I never get bored while playing it. While it does have a lot of benefits, it does also have some drawbacks to it as well. The game for me kind of started making me go all over the place while I was doing a simple quest that would‚Äôve taken only a few minutes to complete, but as I said, it kept making me go everywhere and so it took me longer to complete the quest than I anticipated it would be. But besides that, the game is absolutely amazing and outstanding. The game runs smoothly and it‚Äôs high quality. If you haven‚Äôt ever played the game yet, I would 100% recommend you to. Though, I‚Äôm sure almost everyone has at this point or at least heard of it. There‚Äôs no way they haven‚Äôt at least heard of it.

Honestly this is one of the saddest companies I‚Äôve seen in my entire life. I am truly sorry for everyone who has wasted more than 30 dollars on this depressing company. Their greediness is beyond frustrating and their lack of understanding or trying to understand their player base makes it worse. For their FIRST (1st, number one!!) anniversary gift to the player base, the people who can give them MILLIONS a month for pixels that won‚Äôt matter in real life, they give us 40 primos (not even enough for a single pull) and a WEEK LONG event where you can receive only one 10 pull‚Ä¶ It‚Äôs not even close to being greedy it‚Äôs plain robbery. It‚Äôs disgusting for a company to take advantage of their fan base like this and I am outraged with what we‚Äôre receiving. What makes this worse is that they had the audacity to waste 40 MILLION DOLLARS on Twitter hashtags <3 . Unbelievable and gross. Until there is a change in the way management handles things don‚Äôt even bother attempting to get into the game.

So first off wow this game is amazing! I love how you can focus on adventuring and storylines or if that‚Äôs not your thing it can also be a fighting game! The versatility is really nice and I love the complex backstories too!! But I‚Äôve noticed as the game goes on there‚Äôs less and less things to do, this isn‚Äôt that much of a problem for me but what is is how hard it is to get five star characters you want without spending money in late game. Another thing is the resin system, it takes so long to refresh just one resin which leads to not being able to do much once your resin runs out, and it‚Äôs frustrating how little there is to spend each day especially since there‚Äôs multiple domains which contents change each day. Overall i love the game but I think the gameplay of people who have been playing for a while should be taken more into consideration.

I honestly loved this game more than I thought I would. I had only heard mixed reviews about the game some of my friends said it was good some said it was okay and some said it was too glitchy to enjoy. But I couldn‚Äôt get the game until I got my iPhone 11 because storage on an iPhone 6s is terrible. But I personally never got glitches maybe other than it takes a while to load and actually download the whole game. And the one thing I think I love about this game the most is that it reminds me a LOT of Breath Of The Wild which is my favorite video game of all time. It‚Äôs open world, there‚Äôs treasure, you can become Gordon Ramsay by cooking so many meals, and tons of different missions and places to explore. The story line is beautiful and this game is a 10/10 for me

This is one of the best mobile games out there. I realize its on PC and Console as well. However to play it on mobile is phenomenal. The amount of quests and content in this game has me hooked. I‚Äôve only been playing the game for about 4 days and im already AR 20. Stunning graphics, Great story, and fun to play for hours.

The only suggestion i would make is improving the gliding system. It would be nice to be able to fly rather than to just glide downwards. Or at least glide faster. It is the only method of transportation other than on foot when exploring new areas. It would make the game exciting if players are able to enjoy their wings and fly like the first birds. It seems a bit disappointing how gliding works. 

Other than that fantastic game. Keep up the good work!

It has the things you hate, it has the things you love. It‚Äôs F2P and P2W either choice is viable.  They are constantly updating and introducing QoL things. My major gripe is the quest dialog that isn‚Äôt 100% skippable and they are changing that, so I can‚Äôt really gripe too much.  There are currently (1.1) two zones and even though I‚Äôve explored all over and done everything, my achievement book says otherwise. I hope this company continues on the track they are on. The ‚Äúenergy‚Äù isn‚Äôt really energy. It doesn‚Äôt keep you from playing the game, it‚Äôs more like lock outs in wow or timers in other games.  I can still go farm mobs and bosses outside in the world, cook food, gather other mats and search for chests. Being able to go into my friends world and collect loot from their world and vise versa is another great thing.

I first downloaded this game because I beat Breath of the Wild and my good friend recommended it. I was hoping to start it before remote work but I wasn‚Äôt able to....it takes up SO much of your data! I have a lot of pictures and school related things on my phone I can‚Äôt delete, so if it comes down to it the app is the first to go. My game started after about 5 hours, when I opened it....it‚Äôs the anime knock-off of Breath of the Wild. The plot is a little different, but having your main character lose their memory and need to travel across the open-world to fight monsters and visit shrines/statues is LITERALLY the same. Even some of the monsters look similar to Nintendo‚Äôs design. I think the app is great for someone who wants a fun open-world game and unlimited data, but I would consider spending money on a different game that doesn‚Äôt require in-game purchases for a better experience!

The story is surprisingly good and the gameplay is pretty enjoyable. I was expecting to really enjoy this game. 

However, a normal part of playing an RPG is progression- you become stronger and are able to face stronger enemies. But because of the gacha mechanics, that‚Äôs just not there. I can be 10 or so levels higher than the enemies that I‚Äôm fighting but because I haven‚Äôt gotten a 5 star character with a 5 star weapon, combat takes an inordinately long time. You‚Äôll find yourself needing to use 2 or more full weapon combos on low level trash enemies. Never mind the 10 minute fights for larger enemies well below my level. You have enough HP to survive their attacks, so it's not challenging, its just tedious. 

As a sidenote, there are fairly long periods of the game where you have to do dailies to get your account level up to the point where you can continue the story missions. It's not the worst thing in the world but it is kinda grindy.

Okay so the reason I‚Äôm rating 4 stars is because I‚Äôm into the second chapter, the one you need to be Adventure Rank 10 in order to access, and the kick outs have worsened. By this I mean I‚Äôm just getting to the part I have to track down Venti, and whenever I try to progress it kicks me out and starts my progress over in terms of tracking.
This isn‚Äôt the first time I‚Äôve been kicked out repeatedly, I know this game is fairly new on mobile however I can‚Äôt even play for 10 minutes without being forced out. Earlier on the most I could play is maybe, 30 minutes? And that‚Äôs with my little tricks I‚Äôd use. I really enjoy the characters and the storyline, however I can‚Äôt progress because it keeps kicking me out. I don‚Äôt want to stop playing this game, I just got one of my favorite characters too.
Thank you, I hope you have an amazing day :)

I previously said, "I would absolutely love to play this game as it looks very entertaining, however, I am completely unable to open it; it's the only app on my phone that crashes every time I try to open it."

I realize now that this is the fault of my phone and not the game. I wanted to try the game so I downloaded it onto my phone, thinking that it would be fee to play on my ps4 as many mobile to console games are. When I found that this wasn't the case, I was beyond delighted and have so far throughly enjoyed playing it! The art is gorgeous and the fighting is very unique! It really feels like a free to play done right and I hope it does well to set a better precedent for other games that claim micro transactions or a $60 price tag are absolutely necessary to make a sustainable game!

Great  visuals, great characters, and a well thought out and enjoyable story. The combat system is well done and the cutscenes are spot on. I have been enjoying the game thus far and plan to continue to play for some time. The only issue is in a game like this the drop rates should be better. Getting one and if your are lucky two 4 stars per ten pull is not enough. This will irritate people and they will stop pulling even if they don‚Äôt stop playing. That is my only complaint. I would also like a way to drop a pin and navigate to a specific location of my choice, so I don‚Äôt have to look back at the map so often.

Excellent work devs. Excellent works to the voice actors and everyone who helped bring this gem to life. I wish you success and healthy profits.

No ads, that‚Äôs perfect! I am able to play freely without any ads. I love this game so much and definitely recommend. It‚Äôs literally the only thing that keeps me enjoyed on my iPad. It‚Äôs great for iPad and pc. I have deleted this game thinking that it was too hard for me when I was younger. I remembered this game and realized that it was pretty easy! I just die a lot with my character. It saves your progress automatically, and if you want to log in on a different device you can! If you forget your password you can change it right back! Kind of like roblox, exept for the fact that there isn‚Äôt random people walking up to you asking to be friends and it‚Äôs just one game. I play this with my friends, I‚Äôll invite more to play with me!

I personally love this game, it looks really nice and can be quite fun at times. But I have 2 big issues, one: storage, it takes up so much storage to me at least. I myself am a high school student with no job, both my iPad and phone only have 32gb of storage. My iPad is just fine and has no reason to be replaced. I have genshin and normally 2-5 other apps I can actually delete. Storage is becoming a big issue. I‚Äôd like to update but even with just 2 other apps my iPad still doesn‚Äôt have the storage to do so. Bringing me to my second issue, I‚Äôd like to keep it on my iPad for the reason of it‚Äôs where I started playing so if I delete it, I can‚Äôt buy anything. If Mihoyo could make it so you can make purchases from other devices, like both mobile and pc that‚Äôd be great. But last I tried nope, not possible.

I decided to download this game after I saw others playing it and it was so worth it! The game is free and the in app purchases are optional. It‚Äôs a open world game full of very well designed characters and regions. You can use wishes to try to add new characters to your team with different elements! The elements have different reactions with each other and with the different characters, they can become very powerful. One small thing is that in the tutorial they to not talk about talents, which is something you can upgrade to get your characters more powerful. But otherwise, this is an amazing game that you should totally download! Their are constant updates and new quests coming out, that are fun and entertaining to play through.

I was really looking forward to Sumeru!! But Hoyoverse dropped the ball. Hoping things change quickly. 
Since Hoyoverse has been good in the past about doing their research and respectfully representing the cultures they draw upon, I expected them to do the same for Sumeru. So far this has not been the case. Sumeru‚Äôs character designs play into horrible and overdone stereotypes. Also, it makes absolutely no sense for everyone in Sumeru to be printer paper white ‚Äî the region is based on Southwest Asia and Northern Africa, a pretty diverse area of the world as far as skin tone goes! It is pretty apparent that colorism and orientalism influenced these character designs for the worse. Generally lazy and uninteresting design work.
Also, I know these were all leaked designs, but I‚Äôm still seriously disappointed ‚Äî if things don‚Äôt improve by the time Sumeru is officially released, I will be considering dropping the game. And I definitely won‚Äôt be spending money to get any of the boring and lazily-designed characters.

So I‚Äôve been playing Genshin for a while now, and I have to say that this is such a good game! The graphics, story, characters, and everything else are really good! I really recommend getting it. However, I have just one tiny suggestion. Whenever I go the camera in the Paimon menu, it takes a while for an idle animation to start to get the right shot. Sometimes, when it does play one, it‚Äôs not the one I really want. So all I want to ask is: Can you maybe add a feature where you can choose which idle animation to play for the character? It‚Äôs just because I like taking pictures but it‚Äôs a but too long to wait for one to play out. Sorry if it‚Äôs too much to ask, but it‚Äôs just a suggestion! Again, really recommend playing this game!

My name is Yoshikage Kira. I‚Äôm 33 years old. My house is in the northeast section of Morioh, where all the villas are, and I am not married. I work as an employee for the Kame Yu department stores, and I get home every day by 8 PM at the latest. I don‚Äôt smoke, but I occasionally drink. I‚Äôm in bed by 11 PM, and make sure I get eight hours of sleep, no matter what. After having a glass of warm milk and doing about twenty minutes of stretches before going to bed, I usually have no problems sleeping until morning. Just like a baby, I wake up without any fatigue or stress in the morning.

I was told there were no issues at my last check-up. I‚Äôm trying to explain that I‚Äôm a person who wishes to live a very quiet life. I take care not to trouble myself with any enemies, like winning and losing, that would cause me to lose sleep at night. That is how I deal with society, and I know that is what brings me happiness. Although, if I were to fight I wouldn‚Äôt lose to anyone.

I am loving this game this far and truly enjoy it but I saw that in the latest update it was given supposed controller support for devices on iOS/iPadOS 14 or above and that amongst those supposed supported controllers was to be the Backbone One for iPhones and yet it seems I am unable to utilize this controller for my gameplay of this game via my Backbone One Controller iPhone attachment using my iPhone 12 Pro Max on the latest 14.4 software release from Apple. Not sure if you all are having bugs with your release of support for this feature or what but this game would greatly improve from having this feature in a stable format. This game would be the exact kind of game the Backbone One was meant to help exacerbate in enjoyment and mechanical efficiency for comprehensive and wide gameplay such as this title. Great game just needs some fine-tuning and tweaking here and there.

I‚Äôve played this game since it‚Äôs release almost, and I have spent hundreds upon hundreds if not thousands of hours and around $600 on it. While I understand that might not be much by some of the community standards, it is a substantial sum. Core gameplay is fun enough, the characters are phenomenal in design even if sometimes their abilities may be lackluster, but Mihoyo ruined their game for me. I have left feedback in every survey they ask, and very few times have I felt any positive, significant changes from them added to the game. The game becomes stale and content less for what feels like months at a time, and the in game events are a stopgap at best. Some of them can be fun, but often times they are repetitive and boring. Primos are very difficult to come by, so it is kind of disappointing that their anniversary rewards were so few. There didn‚Äôt even feel like much content for the anniversary itself. I won‚Äôt ever put another dollar into this game, if I even bother to play again. :(

Ehh so I wrote a complaint to Mihoyo about security system issue, and they added 2fa ! !(2 step verification). That was the only complaint I had. About the racist and homophobic reviews‚Ä¶ I been playing this game for a long time, probably longer than most of these people here XD and there are absolutely no racist or any homophobic contents in this game. About losing the 50/50 and not characters you want. Bro, we all experience this. It‚Äôs not because Mihoyo doesn‚Äôt like your skin color or your sexuality so they did this to you, everyone suffer the same things. To be honest, I can‚Äôt tell if people saying this game is homophobic or racist is trolling or being serious hahaha. Also yes, if you have a terrible device to play this on, Genshin can be a bit glitchy.

This is a very well thought out and well made game. A lot of love went into every nook and cranny of its gameplay and world. Unfortunately... it‚Äôs a gacha, and not exactly a generous one at that. The early summon gift is kind but a bit frustrating to be rolling weapons that feel more like gear level fodder than meaningful results. I‚Äôm glad to support a game that has more direct ways of doing so- whether that be cosmetic purchases or an outright cost to play- but it feels frustrating knowing that others have very different and possibly better gameplay experiences not based on meaningful RPG choice but because they paid and rolled better.

As a game, it‚Äôs competent and gorgeous to look at. I never thought Breath of the Wild mixed with a more traditional RPG would work, but this is clear proof that it does. If you can look past the gacha elements- then give this game a try.

So every time I try to play Genshin Impact I get kicked out of the game and I don‚Äôt know why. I have checked that my device is compatible with the game so I really don‚Äôt know. I usually get kicked off the game when I play the game for a long time, use the waypoints and statues to teleport across the map, talk to characters that have voice lines like Childe and Zhongli, when I try to open anything like trying to cook or the gachpon, and when the game is lagging so it does lag sometimes so if you could fix those problems it would be great. So besides being kicked out of the game and the lagging Genshin Impact is great with the events, story‚Äôs, diverse characters, and unique surroundings and every thing else in it so great work and I look for forward to the new updates and thank you for making this game :).

I rarely leave reviews on apps, and never play mobile games, they‚Äôre just not my thing. I started playing Genshin Impact reluctantly on PC as I‚Äôm apt to spend lots of money on these types of games (gacha). 

I can gladly say that the mobile version of the game is very easy to use and almost as good as the PC version! This is the only game I enjoy on mobile, and I love that I can pick up where I left off on PC and vice versa.

The games soundtrack, world, and art style are all very well done. It drags you into the world and it feels fresh. Although the developers say that Breath of the Wild wasn‚Äôt an influence in its creation (probably to avoid lawsuit), one can easily see it at play here. And let me just say, that‚Äôs not a bad thing.

As far as micro transactions go, most people say you can get through the whole game without paying a penny. Those that want all 5* characters and weapons will of course spend, but it‚Äôs not necessary by any means. I willfully spent $30 my first day, and got 3 characters I‚Äôm happy with, but by no means was I forced to or needed to do progress. The only complaint I see around is the resin system, which was put in play to keep addiction in Chinese culture down. 

Overall, great game on mobile AND pc, I‚Äôm really enjoying it.

Genshin Impact is a ‚Äògatcha‚Äô game at heart. It entices you with an interesting gameplay loop and quick progression at the beginning of your adventure, but quickly devolves into ‚Äúpay money in order to have fun.‚Äù The content is locked behind a timed ‚Äòresin‚Äô mechanic, (which can be solved by paying. See the racket?) limiting you to only so many actions per day. This leaves you fairly bored and without much to do save for play for around 20 minutes or so to do daily quests each day. Playable characters, usable weapons, and further upgrades for them are also locked behind payment, meaning that should you have any specific play style in mind you will end up having to pay for it. All in all, the prices are cutthroat, the rates are awful, and the developer knows and preys upon these facts. Become invested at your caution. I give it a 3/5 because the game itself is fun, except the makers are using that fact to prey upon your wallet.

After playing for a week I still cannot believe this is a mobile game! This game is so well made, so much fun, and oh so beautiful! I played both on the PS4 and iOS and I still can't get my head around how fast it loads on iOS after teleporting. On my iPad, it only takes a few seconds but it takes close to a minute or more on the PS4. The story so far is engaging like a well-made triple-A title and the voice acting in all language is top-notch. The world only has two regions so far but it is already gigantic, there are so many details and everywhere you look is very picturistic, you can see lots of devotions went into this game. The music is really soothing, sometimes I just let it play in the background. Lastly, Piamon so funny, some dialogue really cracks me up, please keep up the good work.

This is a free open world RPG better in some ways than Breath of the Wild, though worse in others of course due to mobile restrictions, and it‚Äôs free.

Free. Like, really. What? I spent some money in the gacha because of retail therapy(help me) but honestly you don‚Äôt need to spend any money to get all of the characters. It‚Äôs just pay to progress faster, you can progress just fine though through normal gameplay.

Story is decent, better than a lot of mobile games. Paiman is annoying as heck but you get used to her eventually... think of how annoying Navi is in the original OOT. It‚Äôs like that but worse. The English dub is mediocre but like... you can switch from it to Japanese, Chinese, Korean... the only downside, you miss out on some additional lines that aren‚Äôt subbed so... try to deal with English if you can? If not, it‚Äôs not a huge deal.

Combat is pretty tight, but it can be pretty boring on some characters/elements. However, luckily you get to unlock more skills later, so it‚Äôs probably far more interesting later down the line. Some enemies are very difficult, and you should hold off before fighting them, while others are cake.

Overall I‚Äôd give the game a 7/10 if it were a console game... but this? This is a mobile game. 10/10

Hello Genshin Impact creator!

I was wondering around monstat (sorry If I didn‚Äôt spell it correctly) because I didn‚Äôt know what to do. I didn‚Äôt want to complete two quest, so I was just running around trying to figure out what I can do and see if I can get another quest, and then I run into a 

dog. Hear me out!! Where do we live in monstat? Do we not have a home where we can lie down for the night or customize in our free time? We don‚Äôt have to customize it or anything or even have a house but please let me pet the dog, or the cats and maybe

 let me keep them! I may not have a home to put them anywhere but why do you just not let us pet them and put a barrier. The dog follows you and it‚Äôs so adorable that I decided to stop what I was doing and write a review. It‚Äôs a good game so far, but I just really want

 to keep the dog or the cat! Maybe make a pet store.. or something. 

If we can‚Äôt keep the pets why not let us pet them? The pets are so adorable!

I put spaces to act like it‚Äôs a cliff hanger, so then you go and read the next paragraph so you don‚Äôt leave my review. Sorry! I just wanted to say that to make sure nobody was confused why I kept putting space. I just wanted the Genshin creator to read all of my paragraphs. Sorry!

The anti consumer practices of this game are largely unnoticed because most people who play this game are kids who don‚Äôt know better or casuals who don‚Äôt expect better. For many this is their first real ‚Äúgame‚Äù and they don‚Äôt realize the lack of communication on the company‚Äôs part is unacceptable. Play it if you want, but I wouldn‚Äôt suggest spending money on it. The companies decisions are clearly motivated by money to the point the games balance and health take a major back seat. It‚Äôs not that it isn‚Äôt fun, but if you can get to AR 57 or so and not spend money then I advise you to do so. The game won‚Äôt change so what you see is what you get. If you are ok with that then feel free to spend, but just know their entire business model is built on FOMO (Fear of Missing Out) and you should attempt not to be pulled in. There are other good games that exist and are on the horizon 2023 onward that are more respectful toward their audience.

Genshin is effectively a live service game that doesn‚Äôt really offer much at all in terms of meaningful content. Once you‚Äôve finished all the quests, the game play loop essentially boils downs down to logging in for 10 minutes a day to complete the same 4 tedious quests over and over again.

The main attraction in the updates to this game are the newly released characters. At a certain point you come to realize that there‚Äôs no real point in pulling for new characters and leveling them up when the developers have said that they don‚Äôt intend to add endgame content. Even casual unit collection games like Pok√©mon at the very least offer battle modes and PvP content to keep you interested after completing the storyline.

Honestly this is really only the tip of the iceberg, the game feels very predatory by virtue of being a gacha. I mean $100 doesn‚Äôt even guarantee you the currently featured character. For all these reasons I cannot recommend the game to anyone.

After playing for a year, I can say that Genshin Impact is truly one of a kind. Whilst there are games that try to mimic it, the original will forever hold its place. The story, the feelings and emotions, it all is what makes Genshin so special and intriguing. When I first started playing, it had me hooked. To when I got my first 5-Star to when I finally reached Sumeru. I started in the summer of 2021 and I am excited to stick around to see the future of this game. I would recommend this game to anyone who finds joy and interest in games that while they have fighting, they have a lore-ridden story. And while some may disagree, this game really can be F2P friendly. It all depends on you. If you do play this game, I wish you the best on your travel, Adventurer.

I‚Äôve been playing this game since September 2020, and while I have to admit there is a lot to enjoy about this game, Hoyoverse‚Äôs dedication to making all their released characters white is not one of them.  Their latest decision to design a country very blatantly inspired by a hodgepodge of Egyptian, Middle Eastern, and South Asian cultures, while intentionally making every one of the characters white is‚Ä¶ well, it‚Äôs going to save me a lot of money, I guess, because I am never spending a cent on this game again.  I‚Äôm not rolling for the new characters either.  After all the loving attention to detail and authenticity Hoyoverse spent on its Japanese and Chinese-inspired countries (while still making all but one of the characters white even though people of darker skin tones live in those countries too), the difference is pretty yikes-worthy.  Not looking forward to when they make their Africa-inspired country full of white people too.  Not a good look, Hoyoverse, not good at all.

Genshin Impact is a very fun game that doesn‚Äôt cost a dime, and it also has plenty of stuff to keep the game fun to a certain extent. You can do quests, build characters, play with other and so much more, but the fun only lasts for a while. I‚Äôve been playing for over a year and am ar 52 there‚Äôs not much to do now other than do domains to get artifacts to make you stronger, wait for resin to replenish, and wish. I‚Äôve done almost all the quests and find it quite boring while waiting for the next big update like Sumero, there‚Äôs still plenty of stuff I can do its just not as fun as getting to explore something new. It‚Äôd be amazing if another quest similar to the golden archipelago came out to keep us occupied and so we can get ready for when Sumero comes. Overall it‚Äôs a an amazing game with lots of stuff to do for lower ar.

So this review is based off of my experiences with the game (I have yet to complete the game). So far this game has been very entertaining with its RPG aspects and Open World. This game can keep you busy for hours on end with a thrilling story, fun quests, puzzles and hard fights. My only problem so far has been with the gacha system and leveling system. So far the gacha system has been extremely disappointing with terrible rates for characters. For example I spent $40 and got duplicates characters, nothing new. The leveling system has also been a pain with it being too hard to get Adventurer XP and Character XP being too low on the World Bosses. Final thing to note, Primogems are way too hard to get. If you want to get a new character like Venti you‚Äôd have to get 1600 Primogems just to have a good chance.

This game as a whole is really good. I‚Äôve played for a long time and enjoyed it. However there‚Äôs 1 aspect of the new area that‚Äôs recently been released that makes this game extremely unenjoyable. It‚Äôs the inazuma puzzles. Once you get to a high enough rank in the game and complete certain missions, you‚Äôre able to freely travel about the new area called inazuma. I won‚Äôt go into too much detail about inazuma itself, but the puzzles that were required to complete are absolutely horrendous. The more complex level puzzles (relay stones; electric seelie puzzles;etc.) are poorly thought out, and almost impossible to complete. If we‚Äôre going to be required to do puzzles in order to obtain objects needed for leveling up in the game ( i.e. electroculous; quest items; chests) then we should either get more assistance with the puzzles or not have them be over the top for absolutely no reason. Other then that I‚Äôm content with the gameplay.

I‚Äôm a dedicated player, who has spent money and plays almost every day. I am AR 55. For almost every game I have ever played that is like genshin impact or even just games in general give good and generous anniversary awards. We as the players have made genshin an extremely popular game, as well as earned the company billions of dollars. For them to treat their player base like this is abysmal. Why would people want to continue supporting a game were it is so clear and obvious the company doesn‚Äôt care about their player base? Especially when without us, they wouldn‚Äôt have the revenue and clout they have now. I think it is so ridiculous and sad. I really love this game it has so many good things, but this treatment has changed my overall opinion and feelings a bit. Mihoyo is driving away their loyal fan base and they don‚Äôt have the decency to acknowledge it or fix it. It makes me very sad. I will continue playing, but unless I see some change in this behavior they will never get another dime from me.

The game is really fun and entertaining to play. It has a good storyline, immersive characters with their own backstory, has good and difficult bosses, and there is so much to say about the game. I‚Äôve been playing for around 5 months and I can say this is one of the best mobile games on the store. Since it is a demanding game, You will need to have a slightly good iPhone or iPad to enjoy the game. I personally play on the XR and 4th generation iPad Air, and they work flawlessly with no lag. The guaranteed number to get a ‚Äú5-star‚Äù character or weapon is a bit high, but each character or weapon you get can be used to its max potential. I love the art and music. When I first played it, I was supposed to talk to this fairy thing. But I didn't see it around, so I just picked an interesting direction and walked. I saw a city of windmills in the distance so I decided to go check it out. I explored it, battled some monsters, gathered herbs, killed harmful wild boars and used their meat, learned how to cook(!) and learned to glide from high places to lower ones, gained some levels and eventually got a little bored.

Then I remembered the fairy, so I teleported back to where I started and found her. She then proceeded to teach me how to play the game. Except I'd already learned what she was saying. In fact she told me to kill some monsters and open their treasure chest... and I already had. They weren't there before and the chest lay empty. I chuckled at that.

After that, I played the game as designed, and the quests are fun and beautiful. Except I was a much higher level due to my exploring so the quests were easier than they should be.

The combat takes actual thought. I've defeated foes way too difficult for me by tricking them and using my characters in just the right way. Unlike other iPhone games where you can just turn on auto-combat and your strategy is uneeded.

I started right when 2.8 started. At first, I loved every part of it and ate everything up. Also, Sumeru also made everything fun as well! But, the content stopped abruptly when I was AR 53 l. Now, the only content I had was to finish those few boring world quests, get your reputation up, farm, farm, and the teapot. I think this was partly my fault because I played this game almost everyday. However, Genshin is getting better with the content and balancing it a bit better. So, take it from me. Genshin was made to be a game so that you don‚Äôt need to rush it. Please don‚Äôt rush it. You don‚Äôt need to play everyday. Just be one of those few people who actually touches grass. Despite all of this though, Genshin Impact is a great game to play with friends or just yourself. Have a good day wherever you are.

The game is amazing in how it draws you in with its open world style, quests, gorgeous art, and seemingly endless supply of things to grind. Then you get gated by their resin system. Ascension mats, weapon mats, gold, exp, talent mats all need resin to collect and you will begin to hit a wall around AR25. It just becomes 10 min of dailies and log off. Co op is incredibly buggy and has little value still. The storyline ends at AR29 and you will be almost done with all content by there. The next update is in 5 weeks(verified by mihoyo), but it isn‚Äôt even a big content patch. The first big one is scheduled for 12/23, so be prepared for very little things to do compared to your first week. Lastly, the gacha rate is 0.6% for a 5 star, the lowest rate of any big gacha out there. They also stop giving you free rolls pretty soon so it‚Äôs not f2p friendly at all. 
Unless Mihoyo makes some big changes in the coming updates or adds in some small frequent patches, there is very little content later on and not much to do.

Primogems need to be easier to get for free to play players. However, it is still a great game.

Gameplay is not locked behind a paywall. Music and graphics are probably the best thing from this game, the quality is incredible. Gameplay is high quality and smooth. The open world environment is beautiful. 

Game currency for wishing is more on the generous side IF you play everyday and participate in all events. 

Cons are lack of ‚Äúend game‚Äù mechanics. Once you‚Äôve exhausted the world and story you‚Äôre left waiting days/weeks for little events. Major updates come around every patch which is about 6 weeks. That‚Äôs pretty fast for development, but when there‚Äôs nothing to do but log in and play for 15 minutes everyday in between, those patch updates feel like they take forever.

Honestly, this game has every right to be known as the best game starting from its release up until now, but there are a few problems. First off is the playability on mobile. I mostly play Genshin on PC now since it has better RAM and CPU. I am pretty sure that you try your best to compress most of your resources for mobile players, but this game gets more and more unplayable on my phone as time goes by. Second is the server lag. I triple-checked the Server Ping on my PC and on my phone and I noticed that the ping on my phone fluctuates more often at 150 ms and even reaching up to 290 ms, while my PC is doing fine. If you truly wish to promote this game as a mobile game then these are the things you need to do.

I really love this game and I would appeciate it very much to have these fixed.

I really recommend this game for people who get bored often. Genshin Impact changes my lack of boredom. Not to mention how great the games is within its designs graphics and story lines! I was extremely skeptical about downloading this game, for the reason that I felt it directly copied off of Nintendo‚Äôs hit open world RPG game Breath of the Wild. I am an avid fan of the Zelda franchise, so the idea that there was an ‚Äúanime ripoff‚Äù of the game really rubbed me the wrong way. But I was glad I finally decided to give it a go. I never thought i‚Äôd be able to play a game like this. i was wary of a character collection system and worried it was another overrated team game, but it‚Äôs not at all like that! i‚Äôve never seen anything like this before and i love it. my iphone 7 plus is below the recommended and i do have to take breaks every once in a while due to overheating but it‚Äôs honestly not that bad considering my phone is pretty old. i‚Äôm on the lowest settings and it‚Äôs still absolutely gorgeous. the world is unbelievably beautiful and everything i‚Äôve ever dreamed of in a game. you can play immersively running around everywhere yourself AND you can teleport places for efficiency. i‚Äôm absolutely in love and so grateful to the devs. i 100% want to live in the world and i‚Äôm excited to see what gets added in the future and explore everything!

The game is good, especially for a free to play game. You can easily get 40-50 hours out of this. 

The biggest issue is that the game is a gacha game, which wouldn‚Äôt be an issue if it was fair but the pull rate for a 5* is 1 per 90 or 0.6% whichever comes first, Which more often than not you will hit the 90 first. Other games in this same category have a 7.0% pull rate. Meaning you are more than 10 times more likely with this games competitors. 

There is no free daily summons, no daily log in rewards, no rewards monthly calendar, and the rewards run dry after the first few hours of leveling. The game makes you trial hero‚Äôs so you will see how much better than yours they are. 

If you do all the content to level 25 in less than a month there is no more game left. You become a trash collector trying to find all the trash chests in the world for just a little bit more exp / money / artifacts / weapons / books so you can progress. But that runs dry around level 30. 
There is nothing to do after the main story quests. And the things that are available are tied to a ticket system called resin which holds you back even more because of the random low drop rate and random rolls on gear. 

The resin system allows you to do 2-6 ‚Äúdungeons‚Äù daily depending on which you do. These have low drop rate on resources or items of a useable tier. So progression is locked behind months to years of daily play.

I‚Äôve been playing genshin impact for about half a year now. In the beginning, it was fun and relatively easy- it was also easier to get primogems - I think you all know where this is going. In genshin impact there is a character named Xinyan. At first she seems like a perfect example of representation. But when you actually get her in the game she‚Äôs a walking talking stereotype. Her favorite dish is Spicy chicken, she‚Äôs seen as ‚Äúloud‚Äù and ‚Äúannoying‚Äù by people in Liyue. People are often afraid of her because of what she looks like. This isn‚Äôt the first time Hoyoverse has made a stereotypical black character. In their other game called Honkai there is another stereotypical character named Carol. She doesn‚Äôt like going out because she‚Äôs afraid of getting darker(as in skin tone) . Also in the webtoon for this game Carols mother makes an appearance. Carols mother is a dark skinned woman who is very stereotypical and a prime example of the SBW stereotype. As a black person who plays genshin impact, seeing how hoyoverse portrays people that look like me makes me feel uncomfortable. The game could go with out all of these stereotypes. The game could also go without slavery. But that‚Äôs a entirely different subject.

Like the title says, every in-game aspect is absolutely wonderful, down to the smallest details like the grass, fire, and ice.
 Naturally from a free mobile app that offers so much, you‚Äôd expect the most generous of rewards from doing your daily commissions or even important world quests. But no, 10 primogems per commission, and 20 for completing all 4. Even with the $5.00 Welkin‚Äôs Moon, which gives you 90 gems each day for a month, will only tally you up to 150 primogems. Not even enough for one wish. 
Maybe they‚Äôll be more generous on their one year anniversary! Nope. A cute reward, sure, but we want gameplay rewards! Speaking of which, there actually is an‚Ä¶ ok daily reward for the anniversary. One wish for day one and random rewards afterwards, totaling up to ONE TEN PULL. One! And for that ten pull, we have to wait 7 days. 
About wishes and the gacha system‚Äî not even THAT is generous. With soft pity beginning at 65-70 and hard pity at 80-90+, it‚Äôs almost impossible for a free-to-play player to get even ONE five star on an event banner! Not to mention the chances of getting a four star weapon and the rest being three stars. Yeah, not even a guranteed chance if gettting a character on each pull. 

Do better MiHoYo.

This game is beautiful in every way especially the quality but when it comes to gacha its just unfair, every update they gives few primogems that it isnt enough to get the character we want to enjoy. The 50/50 makes it more worse. It will be easy to get primogems at first but as you reach higher ranking you get less and less. The only way to get the charcter you want is either you save and skip or spend money. This game is basically a gambling addiction. Even the domains like the artifact domain luck is bad.
