If i had to choose a gacha game between genshin and cookie run, i would choose cookie run since its more considerate and theres always things you can do. Theres so much drama to the community bc of this, that this game is hardly even fun n enjoyable. So please, mihoyo atleast be more be fair to us especially the fyps.

I‚Äôve been playing Genshin Impact since it‚Äôs release in September of last year, I‚Äôve dedicated myself to the lore and quests and i‚Äôve had so much playing this game and can tell the artists and developers worked really hard on the story and plots.  I‚Äôve bought for Mihoyo many times, i‚Äôve spent hours upon hours on this game because it really is a fandom I enjoy being in. 

Yet now we have the anniversary and Mihoyo doesn‚Äôt reciprocate their player‚Äôs kindness. New players are granted ‚Äú free 20 pulls‚Äù and supposedly a guaranteed 5 star, when old players get thrown a bone and just deal with it. Mihoyo do better really, i‚Äôve never written reviews but even i‚Äôm upset about this. Millions of people have dedicated themselves to your games and even support your new releases, but we can‚Äôt get free primogems? It‚Äôs all we ask and you get money every single day, yet you‚Äôre throwing concerts (In the middle of Covid-19) and making music videos advertising your game when you don‚Äôt even respect what you have. 

This is obviously my opinion and if any new players are researching this i do advise you think about it before playing, sometimes even why you play you can lose interest and thats ok! But really think about devoting yourself to the game, because after a years worth of playing and progress ive made along the way doesn‚Äôt even seem worth it now.
I need to see better Mihoyo, really.

-Sunny :)

Genshin is amazing don‚Äôt get me wrong, but there is one minor problem I have. That is that it takes up a lot of space on my device. I play on an I pad, and it runs great, yes. I have multiple other games on my I pad to so whenever I try to update genshin to fir the newest update AND to keep playing it, I end up getting a notification that I do not have enough space on my device. So then I end up having to delete a lot of other games and things I have in my I pad just to keep playing genshin, and most of the time I end up having to delete more important things on my I pad because I still will not have enough space. It‚Äôs a real bummer that I have to clean up a lot of space just to keep playing genshin. Yes I know it‚Äôs a great game and has great graphics yet its a real bummer having to do that.

The game is fun when you sink a lot of money into it, and I think that's the purpose.

The story takes too long to get through, then when you do get through it, you're stuck walking around the entire map trying to find chests or fighting the same boss for the tenth time that day to get materials to level up your character and/or weapons. (Items you can conveniently buy in the store)

The event menus get confusing because they put lock symbols over both parts that will come in a few days and parts that need a requisite mission (however if you've seen the message of "available in 2 days" before clicking on an event that needs a requisite mission, you often assume it's just gonna be available in a few days)

The characters started out pretty strong, you can remember them. However, newer characters? They don't feel as though they have unique personalities, they feel as though they've reskinned beloved characters hoping to get people to throw their money at the new ones too. It would be more preferable if they focused on the characters they literally don't put into the storyline (like the One black character) than releasing the 10th polearm user.

Overall, I've sunk too much time into this game that I feel like I can't stop or it would've all been wasted. Don't fall into the same trap.

Updated for current patch 2.1 ‚Äî‚Äî
From 1.0 to 1.2 was the greatest time period of Genshin. Everything fell starting with Lantern Rite if you ask me‚Ä¶ The items we received for that event are the same as our current one year celebration, which is sad. I played for a whole year, sat through things I did mot want to play, in hopes that MiHoYo would get better. They did not, and this especially proves it. Get out while you can, since I can only see this game being used as a cash grab for them and their other projects. Want something to change? Quit and watch other people play instead. For me the turning point was the TL being changed to represent the Dendro Archon as using female pronouns. While it could be the English TL team being pepega, if it is real, it just proves how much of a cash grab this game is. Why have a male archon and make little money compared to the 2.8 million Raiden made in 2 days? All in all, only play this game if you won‚Äôt spend any money. They simply do not deserve it.

This game- you have no idea how much its done for me. I used to be sitting around at home doing nothing, bored. And when i started Genshin Impact, everything just became better. There is a MULTITUDE of things to do. People might say ‚Äúoh, finding treasure is to hard, puzzles are too hard, getting good artifacts is too hard‚Äù that‚Äôs exactly what makes this game fun. Alright, so I pre-ordered this game a few months back, and now that I‚Äôm playing it, I‚Äôve noticed a few things. It feels, and plays, like a retextured version, of Zelda Breath Of The Wild! I‚Äôll list a couple of things I noticed...

1. The stamina bar, works exactly like the Zelda games‚Äô stamina bar, and when you climb something, it‚Äôs undoubtedly similar.

2. The storyline is even similar, a person who is close to the protagonist, gets captured by this godlike being, and it‚Äôs your job to rescue that person.

3. The game has gliders, literally gliders, they function the exact way the gliders in Zelda do.

4. When you switch over to a different character, such as someone with a bow, it works the same way as in Zelda, and with a tank class, if you hold down the attack button, it will send you spinning as a special attack, and eats up your stamina, oh, and guess what? It works the same way as Zelda.

5. The enemies? They almost aren‚Äôt even retextured, they just all look the same as the enemies from Zelda.

6. The game, is fun, and has an engaging storyline nevertheless, but it only has so little unique features to not get a lawsuit from Nintendo. Overall, fun game, but a little sus on the original side. 
 
-Your friend,
  Grimm

I write this on the game‚Äôs first anniversary, during the midst of that public relations debacle. I have played every day for over 6 months, and have in doing so completed every bit of content in the game, spending a little along the way to support the developer. Playing free is definitely doable, and would still grant a rewarding experience to anyone that does so - until you reach the nonexistent end game.

Yes the game is still in persistent development, and new content is being added regularly. However, there are many missing elements that are basics in modern games of this type, and has almost a complete lack of end game content! I submit ideas and changes regularly as feedback. With the resources the developer has accrued from their first year I sincerely hope they begin addressing content problems instead of continuing their marketing blitz.

I‚Äôve got to say this game has taken most of my time in the past couple days since launch. The graphics and quality of this game is incredible. Genshin Impact is a wonderful game, and is wonderfully put together. The gameplay is amazing and the graphics are stunning. However, after reading these reviews I‚Äôve noticed one very common thread: After AR 45 it gets boring and repetitive. As someone who is now Adventure Rank 54 I can say that at one point this was partially true. However as of recently, I‚Äôve found myself drowning in quests and storylines that I need to do and having no Idea where to start. This is not mean negatively at all, by the way. Although I‚Äôm also a player that doesn‚Äôt have to much free time to play the game, but I do think that as of recently genshin has been putting a lot of effort into keeping the game from getting boring and repetitive.

I started playing Genshin back in February and been obsessed ever since! I really wish there was more customization tho. Kinda like Tower of Fantasy. Like maybe an event where you make an artificial human (similar to Albedo) and then you get to customize it. You also have a few attacking presets for that character to use depending on what weapon they use. You also get to choose the weapon like bow, sword, etc. It would be realllllly cool if Hoyoverse adds more customization. But it would also be nice if they had better endgame content, more chances of getting better artifacts, more resin, more primogems (like a login thing in game), and more chances of getting the character you want. But overall, it‚Äôs a good game.

I love this game a ton, and have been playing for a few months. I am absolutely astonished by the graphics and details this game has in stock, and the plot and characters are super interesting. The only things that i would say aren't exactly satisfactory are, 1: getting characters. getting characters that are less rare (4*) is easy, but when it comes to getting a limited character (5*), the gacha rates are t e r r i b l e. If you do your daily commissions for a year, you still have only ONE five star character guaranteed. 2: The artifact system. This is a good system, but it is really hard to get anything you want with it, sometimes taking hours to get even one good artifact. Other than these, the game is amazing, with tons of interesting plot lines and amazing character designs. Overall an amazing game! :)

Genshin Impact has been one of my favorite games to play in the past year. The characters, lore, story, and gameplay are all 10/10. The combat and exploration are insane and it is hard to believe this can be played on an iPhone. With that being said, I do feel that us players deserve more rewards in game, especially for the 1st year anniversary. Miuhoyo can spare us a free five star and a couple of Multis but I digress. This game is an amazing ride and I highly recommend anyone to pick it up if you‚Äôre looking for a game to put a lot of time into. Make sure you don‚Äôt over spend because it can be tempting. My favorite character so far is Tartaglia and every character is different and super interesting. Again, I highly recommend it.

Genshin impact is a exciting and relaxing game to play don‚Äôt get me wrong, but I just feel like it doesn‚Äôt hurt to give out better rewards. It is Genshin Impact 1st anniversary and it only got this far thanks to all the players even if they are free to play. Personally for me what I enjoy from Genshin the most is grinding and getting new characters that is what motivating me to keep playing, but how stingy Mihoyo is with their rewards it is making me tired of playing because there is no motivation to keep playing. Endgame for me is getting boring, I mostly get on to spend resin and do commissions and go, it almost feel like chores to login and play. I hate to admit it but it is the truth for me and many other players I know. I still have hope for Mihoyo and I hope that they take players opinions and suggestions into their consideration. Genshin still have lots to improve on.

Have loved Genshin Impact since I started playing a few weeks ago! Great graphics, fun story, excellent voice acting, and challenging mechanics.  And it doesn‚Äôt seem to be P2W (pay to win). The gachas are, at least, clearly explained. And the translations are done with cultural sensitivity so they make sense and are often quite eloquent. 

My only gripe is the controller interface. I‚Äôve played a number of these style of games on my phone and the joystick on Genshin is incredibly frustrating. I‚Äôm really hoping the devs read these reviews and fix it. It prevents any sort of accuracy in your movements and is often so frustrating I stop playing or avoid certain quests. 

But the game has been enjoyable enough to keep playing despite that rather large issue. Highly recommend.

Wow. Just wow. I'm not at all a fan of Anime/Japanese style RPGs, but this game is incredible! Graphics are gorgeous. Movement and combat are well polished. Story and writing are good, and the English is perfect. And the attention to detail throughout the game is superb! Being able to really go anywhere - climb walls to the tops of buildings (and then glide down from them!), get on top of tree stumps, sit on benches, climb cliffsides, swim in rivers, anything - is awesome! And being able to attack and damage many things in the world too, not just barrels üòù.

And no auto quest completion, movement, combat (that I've seen so far anyway)!! üòÄ

This is how you do an RPG!

I think the only complaint I have so far is being able to level up from items - to me, coming from an old school RPG background, that's just a cheap way to do it. Doesn't require any skill or thought (unless they make it so the items can only be acquired through combat, completing quests, exploring, and character interaction/diplomacy, but so far I've seen the items delivered in mail as gifts). I know that's how games are done these days to keep the kiddies hooked, but really, this game already has so much in it to keep you interested, I don't think that element is necessary.

It‚Äôs free to play, but it‚Äôs also pay to win.  If you wanted to get the character you desire and max its level and constellations, it would cost you $1,500 worth of primogems.  That doesn‚Äôt even include a top tier weapon or the best artifacts to make the character powerful.  Of course you get free currency as you play, but you‚Äôd have to play for years to significantly gain. It‚Äôs quite sickening how little you get for the money they charge, but apparently enough people fall for it.  You can‚Äôt customize characters and not every character has an alternate costume, either.  

Nevertheless, it‚Äôs a fun game with great graphics and stories that never end. There‚Äôs no ‚Äúwinning‚Äù the game, only the battles and challenges, but then what happens to all your assets when the game finally comes to the end of its lifespan? You never really own anything.  It‚Äôs a game.

I‚Äôve been playing the game since launch and have consistently bought gnostic chorus every time it was available, every time I would get a name card, special weapons only accessible when buying the chorus, and some other stuff.  Along with it came an additional 20 levels boost for the battle pass. 

I would always finish up my battle pass around lvl 30 and buy the chorus and it would finish the battle pass at max level (50). I recently bought the chorus and didn‚Äôt check on the update and notice that they were only giving out a 10 level boost instead of 20, but they still charged me about $20 in USD. 

I‚Äôve spent a good amount of money on the game and I kinda expect my money to be worth my while, but as of late it‚Äôs been really disheartening to see that the Genshin branch,  is starting to prioritize money instead of their players. 

I wouldn‚Äôt be writing a review if it was only about them charging me more for less than before, but it has become more about the Genshin branch and their questionable decisions.

P. S. The same can‚Äôt be said about Honkai, a game by mihoyo that I‚Äôve also been playing since launch.

There is a lack of consistency in production quality. It is clear the company cares greatly for the finer qualities such as artistic design, music production, and lore writing of this game. However, there is such an apparent neglect for the meat-and-potatoes portion of this game such as quality-of-life features, replayable content, meaningful co-op features, and end-game entertainment. There has been virtually no meaningful attempt to improve these aspects of the game for the past year. Many others have expressed frustration about the lack of anniversary pomp or rewards, but I personally don‚Äôt care about that. The company can make their own decisions. However ,the frustrating part is the lack of communication from the developers to address and acknowledge the community‚Äôs gripes. I regret having spent thousands on this game to support a company that appears to care more about milking money than fostering the goodwill of its player base.

Amazing gameplay and I love the world and character designs, but at the end of the day it‚Äôs much more fit for PC. The game also claims to be 4GB but in reality is over 12GB on my phone, since the 4GB doesn‚Äôt include all the ‚ÄúDocuments & Data‚Äù. Storage-wise this is a nightmare for me since I only have 64GB to start with and I have photos and messages that I would like not to have to delete just to make space. Good news though is that you can switch to playing with your mobile account on a PC, though this doesn‚Äôt work with PS4.

Get the game, just get it on a PC and not another platform!

This game has the best graphics I‚Äôve ever seen on a MOBLIE game, and it‚Äôs even more surprising because it‚Äôs a open world RPG.
I first played Genshin on PC and wanted to see what it was like on mobile, so I could play it on the go and I was surprised by the performance. Genshin impact is a high GB game, I know‚Ä¶ but it‚Äôs worth the space! I have a 128 GB phone with 6 other high GB games and my phone still runs perfectly fine; even though it may make my phone extremely hot and is a battery-depleting game. The space is worth it, and did I mention it is 100% free to play!?!?

 Even if people spend money and look like they progress far, don‚Äôt take that on you to spend and get addicted into the gacha (yes, this is a gacha game‚Ä¶).

 The characters are so relatable and funny and the voice actors are really good, not to mention the language(s) are well managed! Customer service isn‚Äôt the best, and if you get hacked it‚Äôs hard to get your account back, but it‚Äôs in your possession to do two-step verification.
 All in all, great game, little cons more pros and you have a perfectly well managed time-wasting game at your disposal!

Thank you for reading this lengthy review !!

For starters, I love Genshin Impact. I love the characters, the lore, the play styles, almost everything about it is so incredible. However, there are a few flaws that make playing a bit of a pain. For starters, the resin system. With a single resin replenishing every twelve minutes, twenty being needed for artifact and material domains, fourth for boss fights, and thirty or sixty on weekly bosses, it all is just a bit to slow. Secondly, the artifact rolling. When a person wishes to farm artifacts, chances are they are going to get a hp or defense one, or perhaps something different in a domain where hp or defense ARE what you want, the algorithm is poised against it. The chances of rolling into crit rate/crit damage is also quite low and it‚Äôs just a royal pain to have to do the same domain over and over again.

I have been playing Genshin Impact since update 1.1. From the moment I loaded into the world, I knew the experience was going to be unlike any other game I have played on mobile. The is SO MUCH CONTENT and the world is filled to the brim with quests and lore for you to experience. 

Characters in the game unique, quirky and surprisingly balanced (except for Bennett, everyone loves Bennett). 4-Star characters are monstrous when built properly (Nigguang, Razor, Rosaria).  Combat is addicting and rewarding. The elemental resonance system encourages players to use unorthodox play-styles and experiment. Did I mention artifacts? Which allow you to customize each individual aspect of your character‚Äôs stats? Like I said before, SO MUCH. 

The micro-transactions are there for those who do not want to grind their life away. Yes, constellations are pay-to-win-ish and make every character infinitely better. But, the rerun banners exist so that free-to-plays can earn them over time too. The game is co-op, buying things only makes you win harder. 

If you are looking for a nearly endless, open-world, beautifully designed action-RPG, definitely give this game a shot!

I love this game so far. I‚Äôve put in probably 5 hours, and it hasn‚Äôt tried to burden me with micro-transactions. The art style is beautiful, and the story is good. Like others have said, it‚Äôs reminiscent of Breath of the Wild, but is far from a copy cat. It manages to stand on its own without relying on the ideas of others.
The only thing I can complain about is the lack of controller support. For a game that has controller mapping on the PC and console versions, it‚Äôs strange to me that the IOS version doesn‚Äôt support it. I have a Steel Series Nimbus controller (along with Xbox controllers) that I could use if the game featured controller support.
With that said, the in-game touch controls aren‚Äôt bad, and the combat feels intuitive. I would still love to see controller support, however.

Thanks so much to the developers for creating this piece of art!

This game is so awesome and fun! But I do have a few complaints.. First of all the pity in the game is insane, 90 wishes just to only get a 50/50 chance for a character ??? Also the rewards in the game are not enough, especially for players that can‚Äôt pay (me). Like most games give you a free 10 pulls for the gacha every update but this game gives you like 300 mora (coins for the game) for a survey and that‚Äôs it- I will say if you just want to have fun download this game but if you want all the characters you‚Äôll be spending a lot of $$ and time on this game. This game will take up all of your storage, like I‚Äôve deleted so many good games for this game and it‚Äôs still not enough. Although the details are so beautiful and there‚Äôs a interesting story to the game it lags sooo much. Overall I‚Äôm surprised how good this game is it just needs some touch ups.

This is by far the best Mobile RPG I've ever played, and the fact that it is cross platform with PC is really amazing.
The history is good, but it seems to go nowhere so far. 
The characters awesome but they are not customizable, you gotta pay to have skins.
I've spent some money on it just to be able to level up quicker and get some extra rolls, but I'm not planning to spend any more on it because the chances of pulling what I need are too low and what you can get spending real money is not that good.
By the amount of surveys they send every month it seems that the devs are trying to listen to the fans, and that's good for the development of the game and Mihoyo's reputation nobody wants another EA Games around.

I absolutely love this game. The characters, the weapons, the story, everything! I think it's a wonderful game filled with breathtaking art and adventures. It's perfect, and my heart belongs to many of the characters. 
 
But one thing. It's very hard for F2P players to get decent characters and weapons. I myself am not F2P, but the fact that it takes 3 days for a F2P player to get enough primogems for one wish is ridiculous. The fact that the pity for a guaranteed 5 star (doesn't count if featured or not) is 90 is absurd, especially since it's so hard for F2P players to get primogems. 

I don't really have any other complaints. The game itself is wonderful. But another fun suggestion would be to add more poses for the Kamera, such as sitting, laying down, etc.

Genshin impact is amazing in my opinion! There‚Äôs a lot for you to do and how much details the characters have in them is unbelievable! But some of the quests that they want you do kinda  is hard if your character isn‚Äôt leveled up enough. And the game takes alot of storage inside of your device your playing on so I think you should play on ps4, Xbox or computer. And getting some of the characters are hard to get but it‚Äôs still a good game. I enjoy wishing! When you wish get characters you can get 4 stars or if your luck.. even 5 stars! And there‚Äôs a lot of area‚Äôs to explore! And the higher the adventure level the more you can do! But in my overall opinion I thing genshin impact is a reall good game!

Okay, I have seen a lot of reviews and I want to put my opinion out. 1. A lot of reviews seem to be saying, ‚Äúthey are sexualizing the girls‚Äù sure some skin is showing but it‚Äôs nothing bad. It‚Äôs mostly fan art of people sexualizing them. 2. A lot of reviews state the game is laggy and takes up space. That could be your phone because it never lags for me. The graphics are really nice and the game makes you feel like your in a wonderland full of magic and creativity (which I love!) honestly the stories are fun, and it‚Äôs a great game. Also all the baddies have it so you should get it to üòºüíÖüèª‚ú® if you don‚Äôt get this go die in a ditch bestie.

Dont get me wrong, I love this game a lot and i play it a lot, but one thing that is super duper annoying is the abyss mages shields, and what makes them more annoying is when u have to fight multiple of them in a set amount of time, the most annoying part is when you have to fight 3 cryo abyss mages in 60 seconds, like wth thats too little time and the mages just spam their ice at you continuously freezing all of your characters. It would be nice if they could give their shields less hp and make them easier to break and also if they make the cryo effect of your character removable with fire because I hate the fact that it slows u down and u cant remove it until it goes out on its own, another annoying thing is having cryo and then walking into water and just freezing causing monsters nearby to deal heavy damage for the duration of the feeeze. So relaxing, and a masterpiece from the graphics and character design. Time simply flies playing this game. Running around on the grass is so peaceful and keep reminding me of sword art online. I see so much potential like the possibility of adding online play with players around the world when technology allows it. A few suggestions would be to not let the game be so easily stopped just by eating food, because every time i eat during a fight, it feels like i‚Äôve already lost. I wish there‚Äôs a little more interactive elements like cutting would and building your own lodge. 
This game already has the graphics potential to evolve to sword art online game, i just want more interactive elements with the open world even if that means it‚Äôs gonna eat my storage.

If I could give it 10 stars I would. I played games for years and never left a review. Genshin deserves a review. After more than a year of playing, this is it: The scene, open world - AMAZING, the music is breathtaking, the characters, the story, beautiful and interesting. The grind can take some time, end game is still out there, but frequent events, updates and new zones, especially this last one, Sumeru, is what keeps me coming back. I am absolutely in love with Sumeru, its story, the characters, I log in and get lost in this world, for me its therapy. I play on my iphone since I don't have time for other consoles and it runs great. Also I never payed a dime on ingame currency, all this totally free. 
Devs keep it up, big fan of your work!

So i was going on to one of the temples where you can use Lisa as a fighting character. And I was trying to fight the red flame blobs. I love this game, but I‚Äôm probably going to uninstall. I keep getting stuck because the combat (which I don‚Äôt much enjoy in the first place) is too hard with the basic characters and the gatcha system mostly gives you the same character over and over and dozens of low-level weapons. If I want to progress, I‚Äôm going to have to spend hundreds of dollars for a tiny chance at a good character. I‚Äôm what they call a casual gamer. I want to explore and do quests and maybe do a little bit of battle here and there. This game is gorgeous and the world is amazing and I wish I could spend longer in it. Summary: 
I‚Äôm a semi-old player who will highly recommend this game but watch out for primogems, they can dominate your experience sometimes. Also the storage is a lie. 
‚Äî
As somebody who‚Äôs been a player since the original Venti banner, I‚Äôm addicted to this game hands down. It‚Äôs a unique and creative rpg game with a immersive world which really grips you into the game even more than it already would have with the characters, voice acting, story, scenery, fanbase, events, etc... .

 I can‚Äôt help but feel like a lot of the gameplay revolves around finding primogems at the point where I get excited to get even 2 from a chest after scavenging for an hour. I understand primogems are an important part of the game especially when it comes to getting characters you want, my friends who don‚Äôt spend money on this game complain all the time about how they feel pressured into investing money into the game when they clearly don‚Äôt want to. 

If you‚Äôre considering downloading this game watch out for primogems, don‚Äôt let them take over your experience with the game.  (also the game takes up *way* more storage than it says it does, it claims like 3GB but it‚Äôs really like 11GB)

I‚Äôm not too good with words just read other reviews for issues. This game has got a chokehold on me, I love it i really do. Genshin was amazing in the beginning I feel because it was something new to the mobile experience, and was similar to BoTW. It began as a great open-world game and was fun to explore until the exploration ends. Like sure, they are adding more content and you could get your exploration to 100%, but it‚Äôs pure desperation at that point. All you have left to do after completing the mediocre story and boring side quests is to grind endlessly for artifacts and materials for your character to become stronger‚Ä¶ and for what? The content doesn‚Äôt get any more challenging once you‚Äôre at a good point with a few characters which does take a while, but not long enough, because you‚Äôll eventually catch up with the content eventually. 
As a former whale, I definitely ask that you proceed with caution when you want to spend on this game because in the end, it just isn‚Äôt worth it. It feels like there‚Äôs no love put into this game at all.

I love this game it‚Äôs very cool but..
The full version takes to many GB , but I still think the game is good I have the full version but it took until 10:46 , I had to restart my whole iPad and my phone just to download the full version it only took an minute that‚Äôs why I love it it only takes a little minutes so I think you all should download the app but delete all of your apps , if you want the apps you already have you can like restall the app delete it and then download the app after your done downloading genshin after pls make sure to make an picture if you forget and if you have a lot of photos delete them all and if you want some just keep them or take an picture of it so..!<3

overall, i absolutely adore this game. while i do have some frustrations‚Ä¶mainly regarding the absence of playable characters in your world (how fun would it be to be able to chat with klee or thoma everyday?!!) and also the slightly disappointing end to the inazuma archon quest (it‚Äôs not bad by any means, it just wasn‚Äôt entirely on par with the liyue quest‚Ä¶..), i couldn‚Äôt honestly give this game anywhere below a 5 star rating. i‚Äôve totally fallen in love with it, spending countless hours playing. not only is the story pretty fantastic, but the game itself is really beautiful and quite often i find myself running around like an idiot (still perfectly entertained). there is so much to do and so many characters to meet and fall in love with‚Ä¶the vast majority of them have touching backstories and are truly a joy to interact with (my favorite has got to be kazuha). 
i may be slightly biased, as this game is one of few things that got me through one of the more difficult periods of my life, but i will say this: to anyone questioning whether to get this game or not, i absolutely recommend. give it a try, and maybe you‚Äôll fall in love with it as i have!!

Honestly, I wanted to like this game. My friends talked about it a lot and seemed really into it. They described it as a Breath of the Wild meets Waifu gacha and, as someone into gacha games and BotW, I was interested. But I played about ten minutes and was immediately bored of the gameplay. It felt like there was simultaneously too much and too little to do. Overwhelming in visuals yet underwhelming in actual substance. A stunning world that just felt so empty. 

The constellation/upgrade system didn‚Äôt make any sense, the controls were finicky (archery is impossible), running the game tanked my battery, and, like I said, the world ‚Äî while beautiful ‚Äî was just boring. Playing on PlayStation didn‚Äôt make it any better. I get more entertainment scrolling my Twitter for fanart than I do playing the actual game. It‚Äôs a pretty package with nothing filling it. And that‚Äôs not even mentioning the questionable practices of the dev company. Save yourself time and money and just search the Twitter tag for pretty fanart.

I loved this game from day one, it never really gets boring because of the new content that I look forward to! I always recommend this game to everyone I know, and so far, everyone loves it! Co-op is fun because it always bring me and my friends joy. The open-world is so much fun to explore and brings me joy when there is a new region available. Even once you‚Äôre out of resin, you can always find something else to do with friends or just by yourself. This game sits in a special part of my heart as it has brought me happiness and newly formed friends. I hope this game continues running in the future and eventually comes to an end with a storyline that gets your blood pumping! Happy 1st Anniversary, Genshin Impact!

The app is really addicting and I love it but theres problems ruining my experience. The game can crash sometimes I would have to turn off my phone, Freezes randomly when I click on the menu button and talk to a certain character, It also lags even when I put the graphic on low. The new housing system is beautiful but there are some problems that I hope could possibly be fixed in the next update (and ive seen other people complain about this too). 

Many players have reached the maximum ‚Äúload value‚Äù for their house. The game only allows users to place 40 items sometimes even 30 and then we can‚Äôt put anything anymore when our houses are not even 1/4 done... please fix this.. i think the housing system would be a LOT better if the items we could place weren‚Äôt so restricted. Minecraft allows us to put as much as we want so i really think genshin should do the same as it would be more fun and would let us have more creativity.

I stopped gaming a few years back because I couldn't find any games that could grab my attention like they did when I was younger. The last time I played a game this much was back in 2013, when FreeRealms was still a thing. My boyfriend introduced me to this game back in February and I have absolutely fallen in love with everything about it. Sure, the dailies might be a little repetitive, but that just might be the only complaint I really have. I've put so much of my time and money into this game and haven't regretted it for a second. The characters and their abilities are amazing, the stories are amazing, and the art is incredible. I'm so excited for all the new content to come!! Would absolutely recommend this game :)

This game is one of my favorites because of the great graphics and the variety of things to do. My main problem with this game is the extremely low rates of getting anything, not to mention how expensive it is to farm domains and bosses.  I mean, I get it‚Äôs necessary for companies to make money but they could up the rate so that it doesn‚Äôt take 90 wishes to get a five star character or item. Also what happens when you get C6 on a character but keep getting their constellations, there should be something that allows one to exchange constellations for another character or something... because they are just wasted primogems that sit around in your inventory. Other than that, great game and I can‚Äôt wait to see the other areas!

I was very impressed by this app! It is extremely fun yet gives a challenge to people. All the characters are unique. It also takes a lot of combos and power-up which makes this game even more in depth. This would have been 5 stars except for the character policy. So you get 6 free characters and the rest are earned by spending primo gems (special currency) that they give you for little things such as opening chests and completing quests. However NONE ( except for the 6 free characters) of the the characters are guaranteed. In fact I spent 20 dollars to get one character and I still didn‚Äôt get him. And it‚Äôs not really worth spending 20 bucks on reruns or characters that you‚Äôll never use. Even though they do have a pity system, it takes 100 wishes (which is really expensive) to come into effect for a 5 star character.

I love this game and the lagging/ technical issues don't really bother me like some people. It deserves 5 stars really but I only gave it 4 because the excessive downloading and updates. Every time I get on, there's new content to download. It's great they constantly work on the game and try to improve it but when I can't play it anywhere but my home because it drains all my data downloading half the internet and won't let me play without it, it gets annoying af. I can't stand games that force new gigantic updates instantaneously with no way to play otherwise. Some people don't have the memory or the data and are completely deterred from playing all together when that becomes a CONSTANT issue. I've heard it's better on the pc so maybe the mobile app just isn't for me.

this game is really beautiful and really fun. there are so much good and hard work that is put in. i came through some troubles where pulling characters were really unfair. all of us players work really hard to earn all these materials to pull wishes but it is really really hard to get what we want that is simple. i saw that there were players that got so much amazing things but there are also people that can't even get anything so simple. so mainly, maybe something that can be fix is fairness or as in having the receive rate actually even. the results of the 4 star characrter rates were not balanced. also one more thing, using primogems to buy wishes is kind of expensive since we don't earn so much fast without the money. if these were fixed, I would definitely play way more often.

I absolutely love this game for its music graphics and for its really fun gameplay but the only reason I do unfortunately have to dock some points is of course the Gacha now I‚Äôm aware that this game isn‚Äôt pay 2 win since I‚Äôm a F2P and I‚Äôve still gotten two 5 stars in my first 2 months of playing the game however I do understand why some people really dislike the gacha since it can be pretty annoying to either A. Grind the primogems for so long for some really bad rolls or B. Taking too long or too much for pity only suggestion I would have is to lower the pity a bit so more F2P get the 5 stars they want and people who do spend money can get their characters maxed out quicker. Anyways keep out the great work very excited for the next updates

-1 star for having one of the worst gacha systems I‚Äôve ever seen in any mobile game - on par with FGO and DX2 in terms of pure greed - in a game that‚Äôs probably meant to compete with console titles (otherwise why else would they give it crossplay and market it towards a non-gacha audience?) and doesn‚Äôt need to be anywhere near as stingy as it is. Cut the greed out.
Other than that, the game is quite interesting - a major open-world 3D game that can be played on-the-go - that manages to add dignity to the mobile gaming market, which is mostly filled with garbage apps that are clearly meant to pander to casuals with large wallets and minimal scruples. If companies won‚Äôt make high quality games like this of their own volition, then consumers need to vote with their wallets and make it happen - Genshin Impact should be the start of a new rule, rather than just a footnote.

Aside from the gacha system for characters it‚Äôs a good game and I hope it gets better with more content and story. 

Despite the backlash of it being a ‚ÄúBOTW‚Äù ripoff it really isn‚Äôt. There are aspects of BOTW in the game like climbing, gliding, graphics, etc. However the story and gameplay is different. So to the people who dislike it for being a clone, play first.

Overall I am very happy about this game. The need to use money is optional and the game gives you a decent lineup of characters at the start to handle every encounter. My only hope for the gacha system is the occasional gift or event for players to use it from time to time.

I would highly recommend this game to my friends and I can‚Äôt wait to play more.
‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî
Current minor bug that‚Äôs bothering me comes from the voice dialogue.

I downloaded the game today and have been playing ALL DAY LONG. I honestly love these types of games and can never get enough. When they said open world, they really meant it. I spent hours simply just exploring and grinding. I usually hate to grind but this game changes each monster battle every time. I love the flying aspect of the game as well.

I love this game. I really do. It‚Äôs fun and There‚Äôs tons of things you can do to entertain you. But one thing I think can be more useful is to have an option to un- level characters or really reset them. Over time from wishing I‚Äôve gotten characters that has proven to make me stronger, but I have other characters that have been leveled up so much all the resources are wasted. And over time as you level up, getting materials becomes very difficult which makes it harder to get stronger and personally enjoy the game overall. I hope this idea is considered eventually

The story is good and all but the character skills are terrible.  Almost all the skills of new characters are copy paste from an existing one.  With the last character they added, they tried something new and created the most dysfunctional kit I've ever seen.  This character was shown in their stream saying that it worked for some reactions, when in reality it didn't.  She doesn't even work for what they said on their own stream!  She is a 5 star (more expensive) that does not even compete with 4 stars.  And above all this, the company does absolutely nothing even when everyone is on social media asking for a fix, not even an announcement.  This company does not listen to its players at all unless they are a threat for them.  And this is just using one character as an example, there are more cases like this and they have NOT done anything, just ignoring their playerbase.

Dehya has so many glaring problems with her kit in terms of gameplay and numbers. And instead of fixing those issues, Hoyoverse would rather make her a standard character and move on as if that validates their decision. Very scummy and unfair to all the players who‚Äôve been looking forward to this character. If they do this to Dehya, they‚Äôll do it to more future characters as well. 

Please buff Dehya. It doesn‚Äôt even take that much effort. Either rework her kit so she‚Äôll actually have a role somewhere or simply give her better numbers. Who cares if she ends up being OP? It‚Äôs a casual PVE game, not a competitive PVP one. The characters that we spend money for SHOULD at the very least be good. How can a multi million dollar company come up with something this bad? It‚Äôs almost like you hate money, you hate the people who play your game, you hate your own game and characters and just want some of them to be trash for no reason. 

Please buff Dehya and fix her.

I love this game so much. I absolutely love this game. I‚Äôm currently AR 41 and have still yet to run out of things to do. I typically play on PC more often but when I‚Äôm out of the house and have time I like to play on mobile as well. 

I was reading through some reviews while the latest version updates on my phone and I realized a lot of people compare this game to Zelda BOTW which I can understand to a point. But Genshin Impact is so unique in its own ways. I personally love BOTW as well but Genshin Impact is constantly evolving and making this game absolutely amazing. 

I also noticed many people upset over the summoning system to get new characters and such. Must be their first gacha game lol. That‚Äôs typically how these kind of games work. It takes a lot of patience. If you take the time and do all the quests and find as many chests as possible, you‚Äôll easily be able to have enough gems to get yourself a 5 star character or more. It is absolutely not a pay to play game. On the contrary if you are interested in paying to play it most definitely speeds up the process.

With all that being said, I adore this game. I am so happy I get to play this game as it continues to grow and expand. Keep up the great work Mihoyo!

I really like Genshin Impact, I‚Äôve had it since preorder. I‚Äôve stuck with for a long time and my friend picked it up as well. The music and the world layout is stunning. The only problem I have with this game is the rates for summons. Right now, I have failed pity with Xiao and gotten Jean, didn‚Äôt get Albedo, both Venti banners, and I am at 67 summons on the Tartaglia banner. I have 15 days to get to pity which is basically impossibe since I‚Äôm free to play. My friend I mentioned earlier however has gotten way better luck than me. He‚Äôs pulled Diluc, Wolf‚Äôs Gravestone, Hutao 20 summons later, and a skyward sword(possibly some others) while I really haven‚Äôt had the best of luck in the same amount of time. I just wish that the odds for everyone were truly the same and this didn‚Äôt happen as often.

The world is lush and colorful with a serene sound track. However, outside of that the combat is monotonous. The only thing to do is farm material drops once a day until minions respawn. Any other ways to progress your team are locked behind pay/time gates or gacha systems. The way they progress the story is about as exciting as watching paint dry. It‚Äôs a lot and I mean A LOT of reading while the camera pans or jumps around to try and keep you engaged. On top of all of that the developers do not communicate with the community. They rarely fix any bugs/broken characters and spend all their time making newer stronger characters to sell you. For which the odds of receiving any 5 star is 1% or lower that is including a guaranteed pull for a 5 star after 90 pulls. So the odds are actually far worse than that. 

TLDR; don‚Äôt waste your time here you will only end up frustrated and with less money than when you started.

Many games I‚Äôve played before this one at the start allowed people to play and enjoy the time put into it without feeling like you have to put money into it to get the fullest experience 
 Only to soon make it next to impossible to get enjoyment without feeling like you have to pay once in awhile 
 But in genshin you never have to pay anything and your never locked out of things. There‚Äôs a character you want and didn‚Äôt get them they will come back and you can try again or there will be a plethora of others you can get and you don‚Äôt have to spend a dime. Sure it may take longer but it‚Äôs possible to get what you want with just the resources in game and I appreciate that.

Amazing Amazing game I have been playing it since it first launched and I plan on playing for much longer. It‚Äôs a free game when other games (like Zelda) that have a similar gameplay cost $50ish. I will always thrive about this game and the characters and designs and gameplay. However, it does sometimes seem like the makers of the game take advantage of the fanbase and don‚Äôt give all they could to show the gratitude to people who have made this game as popular as it is by playing it since the beginning and bringing friends to play it. The anniversary award was a joke and getting characters and weapons seems to be a lot harder than usual. Would like them to maybe respect us as people like they did in the beginning.

The gacha system is really unforgiving. 90 wishes for a guaranteed character and then you have to win that 50/50 chance of getting the character on the banner or not. I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs fair at all and it‚Äôs a total cash grab but that‚Äôs only if you care about getting 5* characters. (I personally spent way too much. Don‚Äôt get sucked in.) Otherwise the game is pretty fun. There‚Äôs plenty of quests to do and it has a very interesting storyline. It does make my phone hot. Before I upgraded, my iPhone 7 was basically overheating and it made my game lag. Now that I have the 10 it‚Äôs much better. Oh and lastly yes it is similar to breath of the wild however since I‚Äôve played both I can tell you that they give off a completely different vibe. Both games are amazing and even though they have a few similarities playing them is completely different. Don‚Äôt listen to people who say it‚Äôs a rip off botw lol. (Yo fix the anniversary rewards)

They really hit it out of the park with its breath taking clips, story, and scenery. The voice actors did an amazing job and the characters look spectacular. I‚Äôve been playing ever since the beginning of the month when it was first launched and have never gotten bored of it. Every single update release also have something both interesting and amazing especially the new events, areas, bosses, and just all round new content (Don‚Äôt forget the new characters too those are important). Genshin is also better than most open world games out there because the story ark doesn‚Äôt get boring nor is it overwhelming, it‚Äôs just the right amount to satisfy the community as this is just the beginning.

For the first 15-20 hours of playing this game, I had an amazing time with it. The gacha rates were predatory, sure, but I was able to have fun with what little the game gave me and made it through the main story loving every part of it. As you begin to get to the end however, there is nothing left to do. Chests do not come back, so there‚Äôs no point reexploring the world. Resin recharge is too slow, so obtaining items to level up characters or getting good artifacts is mostly just a case of waiting for your resin to come back. The new events really don‚Äôt fix anything. They‚Äôre too short, offer too little rewards, and don‚Äôt add any good repeatable content to the game.

So overall, I wouldn‚Äôt bother with this game. It‚Äôs fun for a while, but there‚Äôs nothing to do anymore other than wait for more updates that continue the main story. Overall, this game felt very disappointing after the initial honeymoon phase. Save your time and look elsewhere.

Overall the story is nice the characters are good the game runs very smooth. Though playing this game does drain your battery extremely quickly. Sometimes the fighting can get extremely annoying, for instance when there is a mob on top of a mountain, if they fall or you push them off instead of dying most of the time they just respawn with full health. Which is extremely annoying if you‚Äôve spent the past 5 minutes taking down their health. Another problem is if you push them too far from their spawn they start walking back and then immediately regain full health even if you follow them and attack. This is extremely infuriating especially when you just pull them from dodging or via their own attacks. You don‚Äôt have to be far AT ALL in order for this to trigger.

However, it takes up too much space. I already deleted five different apps and it still isn‚Äôt enough storage. This is the best mobile game premise I‚Äôve ever seen. Open-word MMORPG with anime visuals, just awesome. The gameplay is excellent and entertaining, and the story in actually very well-though. However, there is currently too little to do, since the story and side quests are very few and the update rate is horrendous. 

But my biggest complaint is the broken gacha system. F2P players get barely any premium currency from quests and events, there is no permanent log in bonus, and the banners are extremely expensive. Also, the rates to get the characters you want are too small, and you need 90 pulls to get a mercy character, which might not even be the one you want. Very disappointing. Seriously, if this game wasn‚Äôt gacha I would say it is one of the best games ever made, mobile or otherwise. Please Mihoyo, make Genshin Impact more F2P-friendly. I really want this to give this game a 5-star review

I‚Äôm very disappointed at hoyoverse‚Äôs lack of diversity within the skin tones. Time and time again, fans have made it clear that they want more variety in skin tones. They want the characters from regions where dark skinned people live, to be represented within the game (especially if genshin is taking inspiration from those regions). 

The absolute refusal to add any character that is darker than the in-game characters (xinyan and Kaeya- the only two tan playable characters) is unacceptable. If you are to create a region that is based off of the Middle East and parts of Africa, then make the characters reflect that. Pale/tan are not the only skin tone in these regions and, if anything, darker skin tones ARE MORE COMMON in these areas. There is no reason that some non-African people are DARKER than these African inspired characters.

This amount of disrespect is unfathomable. Please do better to represent the real human beings that play this game. Otherwise, you‚Äôre telling them that you outright hate them and will ultimately loose money from them. 

Do better.

When I first started playing Genshin Impact, it was arguably the best game I‚Äôve ever played to the point I would abandon other games just to play Genshin Impact. However after about 2 months, I got to AR 50, the content of the game became repetitive and boring and resin really became a problem, especially when farming the artifacts. I could literally be stuck farming artifacts for weeks spending over thousands of resins just to get a decent set for my characters while also having to also spend resin on talents, mora, experience, weapon/character ascension materials. The developers must either increase resin regeneration rate/decrease resin cost, or rework the artifact domain to guarantee good artifacts in some way possible.

A simple ‚Äúwe‚Äôre looking into it‚Äù or even ‚Äúno‚Äù would give many players a peace of mind and closure. Great game, I love the open world style and that the game is free(which is why this isn‚Äôt 3-stars). The only problems I have with the game are as follows:
1. No controller support at the moment. This would solve SOOOO many control issues I have with the game.
2. Enemies regenerate life when returning to camp. Sounds ok right? Well not if you happen to cross the threshold that their dog chain allows them quite frequently. You could be battling a harder enemy only to be flung out of it‚Äôs reach and lose interest in you, making you lose your progress in the battle.
3. Climbing and gliding controls are odd. This could be in part to the camera angle, but the controls themselves are finicky. Sometimes I jump off of something and expect to glide only to tumble to the ground. Sometimes I want to climb something to escape but the character won‚Äôt even grab onto the thing I am trying to climb. This could possibly be fixed with future controller support added.

Anyway, I don‚Äôt want to come off as a hater, I really do enjoy the game and look forward to them adding more content later this month, perhaps even something listed above. I want to see this game succeed and would recommend trying it out.

This is a very fun game, but I think there are some problems that I wanted to address whether or not it is fixed, my apologies.

just like you‚Äôd think. mihoyo is the most incredible studio- i loved honkai but oh my god this is the best game i have ever played. considering it‚Äôs a massive, extremely graphics heavy, quest based open world game, you‚Äôd think it‚Äôd be super slow, but my iPad runs it flawlessly. the story is compelling and well written, the character design is GORGEOUS and i love that every character is well rounded, fully voiced, and has their own battle style, and the world itself is HUGE and super immersive. there‚Äôs always little things to discover and play with, and with the added fun of foraging and cooking it‚Äôs super nice to go through the wilds of teyvat and find yourself some food and ore! i am overall SO enamored with this game. there‚Äôs nothing else like it.

I never would have thought that I‚Äôd ever be able to enjoy a Gacha game, but Genshin impact is out of this world. The world is massive and gorgeous and every character is fun to play. The best and worst part about this game is the combat. It‚Äôs fluid, flashy and fun, but it‚Äôs far from challenging. Enemies don‚Äôt bother dodging your attacks and you can just rank most of the enemy attacks, the pve system is built around trying to kill a certain amount of enemies in a certain amount of time and it takes a lot of fun away knowing that the only good way to build your characters is damage upon damage. Being a tank for your co op teammates is useless because you can just have someone heal the health back while dishing out crazy amounts. There should be another Meta other than just stacking crit damage and crit chance on every character.

i started genshin about 4 months ago, and i‚Äôm ar50 rn. the amount of detail and effort put into the game is shown every single day i play, from the connection of characters (one of ambers voice lines is connected to eulas special dish, chongyun and xingqiu have similar vision designs) the beautiful music transitions, from idle to combat to boss music, the voice lines of characters when the environment changes (changes when it‚Äôs raining, sunny, windy, morning, evening, etc). early game may seem boring, but after you reach adventure rank (ar) 12, daily commissions start and it‚Äôs easy to see how this game is so appealing. the open world system of genshin lets the player get lost in the world, discovering beautiful scenery and fun puzzles. the game can be played casually, without the character caring about damage or bosses, just running around and finding chests. although the wishing system may seem unfair, the player can easily rely on starter characters to get through ar25, and beyond that if the player is still continuing through the game, they probably have dedicated some time to it. genshin is an extremely fun and immersive game, and i love it.

This game takes all the cake for mobile games. I, a mobile gamer, am exposed to a lot of low tier gacha games considering that most of the amazing ones are on either pc or console. When Genshin Impact came out, I just knew I had to try it out! Once I saw the short cut scene in the beginning, I knew I would fall in love. That, I did. The story is amazing, the character designs and storyline are on point, the graphics are spot on, and the storyline is high class! I couldn‚Äôt believe that this game was free. As I played it everyday, I learned to understand it more and grow to love it with my understanding. Alongside my understanding, my connection with the characters simply began to grew, and made me not want to ever leave the game. Thank you, mihoyo, for bringing this wonderful masterpiece for us mobile gamers.

Sumeru is based on a couple regions and those regions do have tan and darker skinned individuals in them. We love the game but there is a lack of diversity in skin tones and we need a change. Please listen to this, you will profit more if you make characters that match the current region at the time. I know that‚Äôs important to your company.

This game might just be the best mobile RPG I‚Äôve played. EVER. Hands down. I‚Äôve not encountered any sort of pay to win type junk which is probably good because this game just happens to be more addictive than I had first anticipated (please though dear developers, don‚Äôt make pay to win a thing) Takes up some hefty space but when you get a game that could easily compare to that of a console game, well, you won‚Äôt be disappointed. Worth the space, worth your time...I just really love this game...although one thing I‚Äôm a little upset about is I saw an ad on this game, it showed the character Gigi. And I‚Äôve been trying to wish her into my game from the second I found out how that was possible. However I will continue to try.

The thing I liked most about this game is that I was able to play it day in and day out (for free) without a single ad, and it wasn‚Äôt until I hit a certain level that I decided to throw some cash at them to support how wonderful of a game this is. I love all the loot and the mass bag space to hold it all. The combat is creative and immersive, as well as the world with something to kill or collect around every corner. There‚Äôs a lot of lore too if you‚Äôre into that sorta thing xD. 

A few complaints...some sort of healer in town would be nice. Getting food to heal is a chore, on top of the ‚Äúbeing full‚Äù mechanic, which is a pain if you‚Äôre trying to take down a boss. Healing in an RPG should not be this difficult. There‚Äôs Alchemy, but no Health Potions? This makes zero sense.

If you‚Äôre not familiar with gacha games then this is where you might start to get bored, but IMO the game is still well worth your time. Not the most generous gacha game in terms of free gems and not the greatest rates either, but don‚Äôt let that scare you away from experiencing this game. Once you reach high AR, I‚Äôd say around 50, the ways to get primogems are ver limited, in daily commissions, events, and a few other ways. Gave a 1 star review because mainly of account security issues. The company has had two security vulnerabilities exposed in the past few months already (mind you, this is a company founded in 2012 and has had lots of experience in these types of games). First one was how easily hackers could grab your phone number if you linked it, and the second was your email. And now, apparently, there‚Äôs a way for hackers to get your name from your linked social media accounts (especially Facebook) very easily as long as they know your password.

The community‚Äôs been trying to push for 2FA because security is important. Imagine spending a hundred or so on an account and that it can easily be hacked through brute force. They don‚Äôt notify you if your email/phone number gets unlinked either. And what‚Äôs more, they‚Äôre most likely aware of these, but haven‚Äôt fixed them. And they haven‚Äôt made an announcement addressing these issues.

At this point, making an account is all at-your-own-risk. Until they fix the vulnerabilities and start listening to the players more often, only then will I change this review.

Yes, it‚Äôs a great game with great characters, amazing design, wonderful music and a fun rpg element to it. But that all comes at a cost that your account can be taken out of nowhere.

First time leaving a review because I‚Äôm frustrated to a point that I want to delete the game even though I spent quite a lot of money on this game already. However, a simple task such as unlinking your PSN account is nearly impossible (that‚Äôs what I‚Äôm having problem with) because first of all, you have to email them in a specific format. I‚Äôve been playing for a month or two now and I love this game! I used to play on mobile and it felt almost impossible to do anything with the controls! As soon as I got a good enough computer I switched. but I know some people here might not be able to do that. I never had a problem with it crashing, and dialogue skipping. I really think they should make it easier to play on a phone/tablet by adding a controller. Have several months experience playing on mobile since launch. Runs alright on iPhone 10x but after a short amount of time it gradually heats up to the point of almost burning the hands IRL even on poor settings. As well as draining battery rapidly it also takes a lot of storage and will definitely take up more as areas are released. 

For a Mobile Game (or gacha, for that matter) it requires a lot of time to farm materials or do dailies/weeklies as there is no way to auto stages or teleport straight to dailies. You also constantly switch host instances to farm. Gacha has good pity but actually getting rolls is a real chore and devs are stingy with rolls such as Anniversary having pitiful rewards.

The game has good gameplay and interesting characters but from a technical point and as a mobile game it has shortcomings that made me have to drop it until I get a proper PC.

The game is so beautiful. The graphics are amazing and the music is insanely good for a game. There are a lot of quests and places to explore when you start the game, but once you get to a higher rank, there isn‚Äôt a lot to do. I am adventure rank 58 right now and have had 100% exploration since adventure rank 57. I also have no more quests to do and wait tediously for new regions and characters to be released. I often get bored and stop playing for a while because there is nothing to do, but I always come back when a new region/character is released. I‚Äôm just now trying to download it on the phone. It requires a high-quality device and a lot of storage, but that is because of how much content is included for free. This sounds mean, but really.. you guys are a bit harsh lol

I love this game and the graphics. I don‚Äôt mind some of the bugs and they seem to be ironing those out more and more. 

I even so far don‚Äôt mind how much of a grind leveling is because it‚Äôs sort of fun, but I think like other reviews the pay to win aspect will come out the longer it‚Äôs played. I also would rather monetization focus on customizing, skins, clothes, avatar hair options and how you look, and open up a little more of the nice weapons and characters drops from wishing. 

My largest issue isn‚Äôt one everyone would share, and I think I might even get made fun of for how I feel about it, but I wish in the story I wouldn‚Äôt be forced to ‚Äúworship‚Äù the statues in order to progress. Maybe it‚Äôs just the wording. I don‚Äôt mind leaving orbs but I don‚Äôt like being forced to participate in a game religion even if the game is focused on it. I didn‚Äôt have an issue with the story at all until I realized leveling the statues requires ‚Äúworshipping‚Äù them and that‚Äôs not ok with me. 

I might stop playing entirely because of that but will see if I can still progress if I choose not to do that part. 

Suggestion: change the words from ‚Äúworship‚Äù to ‚Äúleave an offering‚Äù 

I think that would help a little to be honest, and might help other people like me be more interested in the game.

Only been playing 24 hours, but this game plays like final fantasy on psp, or Zelda on the switch...I love the elements and how they all react together in this game, whether it be environmental or during combat, makes for customizable fighting styles and various team set ups to keep combat interesting!The puzzles are seemingly easy so far but I expect them to get more complicated as the game escalates. Complete open world, wish there were more side quests early game to level quicker as I just hit level 15 I was able to ascend some characters but I was stuck at 13 with max capped characters pre ascension (lvl 20). Overall pretty decent story line and great feel with mobility and gliding and climbing. Definitely worth checking out if you‚Äôre looking for a mobile rpg

The game is literally 12 and up on the App Store. I started playing this game when I was 13, and I was heavily addicted. At first, I thought this game was cute and really well made for a mobile app. But quickly, I fell down a slippery slope of spending mostly all my allowance on this game. I would spend at least 50 bucks on each banner. It wasn‚Äôt healthy, and before long it ruined my mental health. I couldn‚Äôt take breaks from the game, because if I did I would miss out on a bunch of content. Again, I was only 13 this was quite literally an addiction. This game should at least be 18 plus, at the end of the day it‚Äôs a form of gambling. I would get sort of a rush from wishing, then when I actually got the character I wanted, I would feel empty. Then I would do it again for almost every banner. Miyoho should be more upfront about this instead of letting minors basically gain gambling addictions.

Genshin impact is great game but the way it‚Äôs handled can be really bad, mihoyo already had two big scandals in less than 2 months, first not letting the character that have sold the most work with a really great support that its already in game and even giving fake advertising of a character to then just change it based on a ‚Äútranslation error‚Äù and second after 1 year making billions the anniversary rewards and just nonexistent just 10 wishes when it takes 75-90 wishes to get a 5* and running some art/cosplaying event for $5 dollars price, i don't think a cosplay is worth just $5. Mostly every gacha have really good rewards for anniversary, Genshin is not one of those. The game is really good until you get to the point you run out of content and i would advise to not spend a single dollar on it just be a F2P and you will have more fun and you wont feel as robbed.

everything about genshin impact is just a solid 10/10. but, when it comes to quests, it can make you almost uninstall the game.
what quest am i talking about?
the trails of tianqiu valley quest. the fact that you're stuck in singleplayer until you defeat it has made SO MANY players (including me) furious. most people were about to just restart their game, trade accs, etc. it's almost impossible. many people just want it removed or atleast let you have access to co-op mode (like with the lost book quest or the guili plains quest). the main problem is the tower to the left. it's easy when you're 5 levels higher than the opponents, but on world level 5,,,, it's almost impossible.

Please note that this is a review specifically for the iOS version of Genshin Impact. I usually play on PC via Epic Games and absolutely love it (I‚Äôd rate 4.5ish). I decided to clear out the 3.5ish gigs on my iPhone to download Genshin here so I could play when I can‚Äôt use my PC. However, what they fail to mention anywhere that I can see is that the iOS version is a demo. After downloading and playing through the very limited amount of content, you must additionally download over 15GB of additional content to continue playing. This prevents me from using the app, as I am at AR45 and have long since played through all of the demo content available, and I cannot afford to sacrifice 1/4 of my phone‚Äôs storage to a game I already play on another platform. As a side note, while in the LOADING SCREEN, my phone heated up quite a bit, which is extremely unusual for it.

I have tried many times to use this game as an escape for reality and a fun fantasy adventure, but the lack of representation in the models truly astounds me. Dark skin is not represented nearly enough in any of the characters or regions. I am under the impression that the pyro nation to be introduced later in the game is supposed to represent indigenous Americans (my people) and from the comic involving Vennessa we have seen that they are‚Ä¶ almost all pale and redheaded? The Sumeru region that is coming to the game soon, supposedly taking influence from South Asian and North African cultures, has been represented by NPC characters who share the same extremely pale skintone as 99% of the rest of the characters. I fear that this problem I have with the game will only get worse as more updates are released. I and many others who feel misrepresented by this game will not continue to play it if this keeps up in the future.

The anniversary rewards only made the end game players quit. As an AR57 at the moment, I was actually looking forward for the rewards but the rewards ended up trash. Even the lantern rite event rewards are better than this whatever ‚Äúanniversary‚Äù rewards you call it.

There‚Äôs also nothing to do as an end game player. Most people just log on, do resins, dailies, and log off. And this repeats everyday for most end game players. I‚Äôve been repeating this cycle for more than 4 months now and I‚Äôm extremely burnt out. There‚Äôs barely any content and barely anything to do when you‚Äôre at the end game stage. Even the story quests seems extremely rushed on the 2.1 update. 

As a player that started playing two days after the release, this game is starting to go downhill. It‚Äôs not even that bad to just give us better rewards, especially when there are low spenders and f2p players struggling to keep saving.

The game has so much potential but it‚Äôs just a gacha game they don‚Äôt care about anything but you paying them. The resin system holds you back from playing and makes co-op play practically useless. The rate on characters is super low so even if they give away 50 wishes good luck getting anything useful. Honestly I would love the game if it was an actual game and not a cash grab. You‚Äôll log in do your dailies maybe use your resin if you still even care at this point and then log off. Tbh I wouldn‚Äôt spend any money on this game because it‚Äôs basically just gambling with a very low chance of winning and the ‚Äúendgame‚Äù is highly dependent on you having good option of characters and a lot of resin spent which you only get so much per day after that you have to pay to play more basically, once resin is gone the game is just running around attacking random enemies.

Genshin Impact has been an amazing game since release with stunning graphics on a cross platform game for mobile, PC, and later on Playstation. Music is amazing. I have been waiting for a game just like this to appear on mobile. I have spent a good amount of money and time on this game. I have started nearly a year ago.

I will give my opinion and thoughts on the situation in regards to the one year anniversary. Yes, people should have high expectations for rewards but don‚Äôt be going overboard with the complaining when it does not meet your expectations. I expected more but was not surprised and I am content with what we got plus the extras. 

Looking at other gacha games especially Honkai Impact, their one year anniversary rewards were underwhelming too. Each year did improve or get better so we can expect next year rewards to improve as well as going forward. 

Again Mihoyo keep up the good work in developing the game forward. Looking forward to the adventure in the other regions yet to be released. I hope to continue to be playing this game years down the road as I love all aspects of the game.

As a game depending on new story elements, Genshin could do well to focus on complementing each game chapter with actual effort put into its banners, a lottery system that updates with desirable characters related to the story. Instead, the developers at miHoYo put out very slim percentages for the chance to actually get those characters. In addition, they keep railroading its community engagement through forced PR narratives that do not address players‚Äô concerns with actual content and gameplay quality issues, instead preferring to talk only about its shiny new content that does not address the underlying concerns. Lastly, the latest anniversary update has incensed many with paltry offerings and little acknowledgment of the community support that has taken miHoYo this far since a year ago. They have essentially ignored any and all feedback in favor of promoting a long marketing scheme, and for that it was inevitable that there be pushback critique.

I started playing this game a little over a year ago for about five months, until I deleted it for storage. I re-downloaded it about three weeks ago and fell in love all over again. Genshin Impact's plots and character dialogues are beautifully written, coming from a writer. The tiniest details from the landscapes and animals, etc., are breathtaking. From the whoosh of the characters' dresses to the movement of the grass as your character walk, it's amazing. Now, I'm still just a teenager but this is hands-down one of the best games I've played. I do have a few suggestions, but I would still love the game even if you guys don't add them.

1. Maybe a clothes shop? That sounds immature and childish but I would love it if I could dress Amber, Lisa, Kaeya, etc., in customized outfits. 

2. Customized storylines? It would be amazing to be able to have my character have a romance or rivalry or strong friendship with another character in the game, such as Kaeya or Venti. 

Those are all the suggestions I have, keep up the great work! To anyone who likes fantasy, adventure, mystery and dystopian role playing games, I would highly recommend this game.

I've been playing genshin since the beginning and i love it but, the lack of character representation is heartbreaking, before sumeru character leaks, characters were extremely pale, yes being pale is fine but for characters who work on a boat for hours a day to be as pale as paper, is extremely colorist and unrealistic. the sumeru characters completely lack representation. yes, pale people exist in the swana region but not every single person. most people for multiple reasons are tan and it's stupid how characters like kusanali, al haitham, and tighnari are paler than the characters in mondstat. this company makes millions of dollars, it's not hard for darker skin tones. the few times characters have been tan, xinyan for example, you made her extremely stereotypical, southern, plays guitar, described as loud and scary. in your other game honkai impact, the character carol and canon black woman, says that she hates her skin tone. that is extremely colorist. please fix this.

i, as an addicted player have to say that genshin for sure needs improvement. events are able to be cleared (for more experienced players) in a day. there needs to be more events, or at least if there isn‚Äôt more events added they need to be spread out more. sumeru, a region that is supposed to be based off of middle eastern and south asian cultures/areas, had from what i‚Äôve seen all light colored npcs. it‚Äôs disgusting. i know that genshin impact is a game based in china, and people there haven‚Äôt seen much of darker skin tones, but this simple fact shouldn‚Äôt excuse the lack of representation. there are only two darker colored people in genshin. sure, it‚Äôs some representation. but those areas are based in germany and china. there isn‚Äôt even a darker toned person in inazuma. 

also, new players suffer with genshin. for example, a banner out for a character from inazuma is running and a new played wants them. they only can get that character to level 20 and then from there can‚Äôt level them up more until they go through the long story, and about the time they get to inazuma they probably don‚Äôt care anymore.

i hope genshin actually listens to their community, especially when it comes to more variety. i really hope that hoyoverse isn‚Äôt just some money hungry app, and actually cares about their fan base.
