Genshin is an amazing open world rpg with great graphics and an interesting storyline. At first, I really enjoyed the game and it‚Äôs gameplay, but I‚Äôve been playing for almost a year and I‚Äôve grown to strongly dislike it. 
The gacha system is horrid, even if you pay to win you have to waste over 100 dollars to get enough pulls to reach pity (since the 5 star chance is so low) and if you‚Äôre free to play you don‚Äôt even get one wish a day through daily commissions. You have to grind chests and play events that honestly have gotten repetitive and boring. The only good thing about the game is the characters but since the gacha is so awful you can‚Äôt even enjoy that.
Also, the anniversary rewards were absolute garbage.

As someone whos been playing genshin impact for 9 months, I‚Äôm extremely disappointed in Mihoyo. This game is absolutely amazing and I used to spend 5+ hours a day AT LEAST. I‚Äôve spent over $500 dollars (which isnt much compared to whales and content creators, but its still a lot as a teen being payed minimum wage) and I feel incredibly let down. Mihoyo doesnt owe players an anniversary reward, but it would be nice to be shown appreciation since they made it where they are due to the players time and money. The game is unbalanced. It‚Äôs amazing, by far the most visually amazing game I‚Äôve played so far. It‚Äôs astounding how far mobile gaming has come. The game is relatively high spec, but that‚Äôs completely understandable. It‚Äôs a breath of the wild clone with gacha team building, the game needs more horses and less teleporting. The combat is fun, first few missions are really boring, though it gets better over time. But that dog. It makes this game... Completely unplayable.

I‚Äôve been playing for 2 years, and I can safely say this game is great. The world is beautiful, the character designs are great, and the combat is great. Though the story can feel a bit monotonous in the beginning, and sometimes a bit rushed, it gets a lot better the more you progress. The wishing system is also nice, including a pity system. If you‚Äôre familiar with the genre of gacha games and are really looking for one to invest your time in, genshin is the one!

Something that you should know is that every update is about 2gbs big. There is an update about every 42 days, excluding one version which had a delay, so just make sure your storage is prepared!

Genshin Impact is a great game to play alone and with friends. For new players it‚Äôs an endless world of exploration and characters and storyline. However, the game is way to big for its own good, Mobile players struggle with downloading the game and I find myself constantly having to delete and reinstall it before a big update (a trick I use to trick my storage into thinking it‚Äôs less than it is) Half the time before a big update I can‚Äôt enjoy the game for a few days because I need to clear up storage. It‚Äôs honestly so annoying but I‚Äôm willing to put up with it for how good of a game it is. It‚Äôs a great game but updates such as letting players delete files from older updates that they don‚Äôt need anymore would be nice.

This game is good. Great, even. I spend a lot of time on it and enjoy the open world aspect, storyline, and even the ability to build characters and make them do loads of damage. But it‚Äôs taken a downhill plunge with the release of Sumeru, a nation based on the Middle East. The environment, music, and even the recipes are amazing! But the time and effort gone into these characters is highly disappointing. Even Candace / Kandake, Dehya, Cyno, and Nilou are disappointing. They are our ‚Äòdarker skin‚Äô rep and as a paler person I am a lot tanner than they are.

Middle Easterners can be pale, but when a game is filled with already pale individuals it‚Äôs less of adding inclusivity and more of being intolerant. I‚Äôm scared for Natlan, as that‚Äôs a region I‚Äôll be able to relate to because my family‚Äôs culture is from the countries it‚Äôs based off of. I hope Hoyo can actually improve on the designs for Sumeru in the upcoming updates and go above and beyond for Natlan and their culture.

My cousin has told me such great things about this game, but I downloaded it yesterday and everything was going smoothly until it started downloading data, and it‚Äôs been two in a half days and it‚Äôs barely at 12.0 and I‚Äôve been waiting since 12:15pm (yesterday) for this thing to finish, my sisters has gone so much faster than mine it‚Äôs probably finished but she downloaded hers at 4:30 pm (yesterday) and it started going faster and faster without the app being open. We all know the game was created in China, that‚Äôs where the magic happens. One thing about China is the beauty standard is pale skin, Very colorist and overall strange. We get that‚Äôs what you guys love and find attractive, but that isn‚Äôt the same for the fans. We enjoy genshin gameplay and lore. Another thing is skin tones and areas the map is based on. Of course, Sumeru is based of Southeast Asia, and south Africa. The skin tones there are darker, not white enough that they are glowing. Out of the entirety of Sumeru, there is ONE tan character and of course, as expected, she is a four star like the other tan characters. Would it really hurt you to make more realistic skin tones? Especially in Sumeru because of where it‚Äôs based off of. Though the beauty standard in China is extremely pale almost, white, Most of your fans see the beauty in darker skin tones and would love to embrace it. Do better Hoyoverse.

This game promised me a great diversity of characters to interact with, but so far I have hardly met anyone that resembles me. I have seen the videos with the devs talking about all the extensive research they have done on different regions in the world to base Teyvat off of, but despite all this they are seriously lacking in any actual skin diversity. It feels unfair to advertise as a diverse world when only a fraction of people are represented. And this upcoming land of Sumeru, from what I‚Äôve seen is supposed to be based off of SWANA culture but all the npcs we have so far have only fair to pale skin. I know there is a lot of color diversity within the SWANA region but to not have at the very least a single npc who is colored feels discriminatory and colorist. Until Hoyoverse fixes their colorism problem I strongly cannot recommend this game to anyone. This is a shame because the story and music is wonderful, but without any of that promised diversity the story falls flat.

Honestly, the gameplay, music, plot, and characters are all very unique and intricate. The two major issues I have for this game are the size and the lack of rewards. This game, currently, is 20gb in size. A lot of mobile users do not have that type of space! Secondly, as hard as players work to receive their rewards, they do not get much. My interests jump from one thing to another almost every month, but one thing that has been consistent is playing Genshin Impact. I have been playing this game since May 2021. the game entices you in as an early player by lots of rewards, but as you progress onwards you realize that you get little to no meaningful rewards after your initial download. endgame content is nonexistent, and long term players suffer. big spenders, low spenders, and free to play are all rewarded the same way: not at all. truly the one people who benefit from spending money on the game are streamers and content creators. the anniversary rewards were a slap in the face. instead of mihoyo listening to their worldwide fanbase, they censor us, ban us, and delete any negative opinions about them. i have played this game for an entire year, and the way they handled the anniversary has severely impacted my view on the game. instead of giving us rewards, they had us COMPETE to get a measly 100 primos. the game does not care about players. if you were considering playing: don't. it's not worth getting addicted. it is not rewarding.

Look, it‚Äôs pretty fun at first but once the shininess wears off it ends up just making you feel jaded about time and any money you may have put in. The end game is non existent. The story writing was never great but the pacing also takes a nosedive after the first few chapters. The world feels shallow and empty once explored. Artifacts are basically an impossible and unsatisfying grind. Multiplayer is poorly implemented. It seems that most of the developer time is spent on temporary events which is why the game has failed to significantly improve in the year since it‚Äôs launch. 

It‚Äôs not NOT worth your time, but guard your heart and don‚Äôt get too invested. If you‚Äôre tempted to spend money to ‚Äúprogress‚Äù your account - don‚Äôt. You‚Äôre just rushing towards feeling like there‚Äôs no game left. On top of this I‚Äôve just lost all my faith in this company so I personally don‚Äôt feel comfortable spending anything more here.

So co op.... it‚Äôs very limited. You can‚Äôt do quests, open chests, or do certain dungeons. Like the Temple of the Lion, Temple of the Wolf, and things like that. You can‚Äôt even do quests with other people nor can you open the chests. Even if the person who works you joined open a chest, you don‚Äôt get any loot.

 Also, there should be something like a gifting system or perhaps a trading system. For example, when you have too much of an item and have no need for it, you can always trade it with someone for something you actually need. 

However, the graphics of the game is on point! It‚Äôs so breathtaking, like the graphics and gameplay are so well put together!! The characters are nice as well and I really love the game. 

The anime aesthetic plus the open world adventure is so also well designed. Another feature that I (and probably many other players as well) like is the fact that you can mark places. It‚Äôs so convenient and easy to use. The only reason i put 4 stars instead of 5 is because of the co op being limited but other than that I‚Äôm in love with this game!

I know a lot of times you see reviews and wonder if they are paid. I promise you this one isn‚Äôt. This is the most fleshed out mobile game I have ever played and that‚Äôs AMAZING considering it‚Äôs Free to Play. The game has a slightly smaller region than BoTW but plays pretty much the same. The difficulty isn‚Äôt too crazy which is kind of a shame, but it has a really cool world to explore and some puzzles to handle along the way which aren‚Äôt crazy in difficulty but decent enough for, again, a free game. Now obv, it has micro transactions but the great thing is that they all basically feel cosmetic. The game gives you 5 characters for free through the story missions and never makes you feel like you need to purchase something to eliminate the grind. All in all, great game. Kudos to the developers.

At first I wasn‚Äôt even going to get this game especially on iPhone. I saw it pop up on the store and though ‚Äúwhat the heck, let‚Äôs give it a shot,‚Äù and I am truly happy I did. The game plays extremely well and I love that the mechanics are similar to BOTW. I am extremely shocked that a game that looks this good plays that well on iPhone. I was looking up comparisons on the pc version and phone version graphics wise, and phone version is lighter color wise while the pc version is a little darker, and that‚Äôs it! This just goes to show that a phone game can have good graphics and run well. I also love all the quests, being able to cook, collect characters and to be able to climb. Super excited for version 1.1!

This is honestly one of the best iOS games I‚Äôve ever played. The graphics are smooth and visually appealing, the musical score is very peaceful and easy to listen to for long periods of time, the world is large and filled with plenty to do, and the game doesn‚Äôt have some ridiculous tutorial that takes an hour to explain very basic mechanics.

The battle system is fun and engaging, and actually allows the player to use some timing and tactics to liven up the fights, unlike so many games these days which just have auto battle, defeating the whole purpose of playing. This game is really well done, and has been very difficult to put down. It also doesn‚Äôt bombard you with ads or in-app purchases. Really outstanding!

The game overall is stunning, beautiful music and scenery and just amazing lore within the game. The only main problem is just how you can‚Äôt say that you will be basing one of the regions of Egypt or India and just make all of the characters white or pale. If you want to make good representation of every region, go further and expand your horizons. Adding more skin tones and more diversity in the game will not only bring more attention to it, but more people to relate to a certain character. Candace was based of a *black* goddess, and she is simply tan in her game design. It doesn‚Äôt make sense, seeing how this is such an amazing company, you all can do better. Not to mention the amount of beauty Indian culture has and with the art style and animations you as a company, you could‚Äôve expressed the beauty of cultures in a new way

This game is absolutely wonderful, the graphics and cutscenes are stunning with the graphics, however the amount of Primogems you can get monthly normally is kind of low which equals to maybe 7 or so wishes if commissions alone and considering the banners go 2 or 3 weeks makes you unable to quickly save any wishes if you want to get the character AND a good weapon from the weapon banner and this being a huge problem for late game players who done everything and unfortunately lose all their 50/50‚Äôs. The way to help this are more primogems from commissions like 15 and 20 when done atleast for unlucky and F2P players like myself. I love Genshin! I remember how excited I was when I first started playing, exploring Mondstadt and Liyue. The Inazuma update was as stunning and beautiful as the other regions, and I was really looking forward to Sumeru. However, I noticed that many characters were extremely pale and white. Now, why is that a problem? Sumeru is the region based off the middle east/desert. The people who live there should have dark and tanned skin. Making them pale is erasure of what could have been good representation. Also, their outfits contained many themes of orientalism and therefore do not respect the real-life cultures of the middle east/north africa. Genshin was such a wonderful game before this update- I hope that Hoyoverse will at least consider changing things about the characters to be more respectful to the irl people and cultures.

I started playing about a month ago and the game is absolutely STUNNING. Visuals, soundtrack and character designs are all top notch in my opinion! Right now I‚Äôm struggling to kill the pyro/cryo regisvines and the Oceanids because my characters are about +10 levels lower than the bosses. It‚Äôs only been a month in and I‚Äôm already thinking about putting the game down or requesting to start over because I can barely progress like I am. My advice, be sure you know how the game works before picking it up.

I started playing this game almost a year ago and in this time I have experience varying eras of this game. At first it was actually really quite pleasant. Each patch they added something the community had asked for, they buffed a character that felt underwhelming to the community, and they even had a road map at the start of the game. 

Now a year later a lot has changed and not all of it was for the better. We no longer have a general idea of the game‚Äôs direction and what new characters are upcoming in a timely manner. The log In rewards we had at the start of every new patch slowly went away, and now even when we ask for minor fixes to characters (not even buffs) we go ignored. 

It‚Äôs a crying shame to see that this is the path this game went after showing so much promise, but I cannot in good faith recommend this game to anyone. It has a predatory gacha system much worse then traditional gachas, and their marketing ploy is to get people to have buyers remorse/ regret not pulling for a character. 

And to top it all off to reward players who have been playing for a long time they give us absolutely nothing, and  then try to silence us. I will be deleting this game off my devices once if gotten my money‚Äôs worth off the welkin moon and will not be returning unless there are some serious changes.

I‚Äôve put about 8 hours in this game, and so far I‚Äôve enjoyed every minute of it. Whether it‚Äôs the beautiful graphics of the open world, the fluid-like gameplay similar to BotW, or the Gacha system, it has been a pretty awesome experience! People complain about the probability rates of the Gacha system but that‚Äôs how RnG works. 

Now to the part I wanted to complain about, Co-op mode. The main reason I wanted to play this game was to enjoy it with my friends as we progress through the story, however that was all put to a stop once we got to rank 16 (the rank requirement to start co-op). The options were so limited for my friends that I thought they should‚Äôve just left this as a single player game. The only thing they can do is participate in my dungeons, loot materials such as iron chunks, and explore the world with their story progression being halted. I was hoping we would be able to progress through the game together, but that hope sure did get squashed. In the future, I am anticipating some major improvements to the co-op feature to make this game more enjoyable for the player and their friends.

Other than that this game has been a delightful experience

Thank you!

I don‚Äôt usually write reviews but I‚Äôm writing one to contrast those that say this game doesn‚Äôt have enough content. I‚Äôve played this game since launch and while I will admit that at launch this game didn‚Äôt have enough content, that is no longer the case. The game currently has 4 major zones, each with their own side quests and zone story to play alongside the main story. During and in-between story arcs, they also have countless events that are usually staggered to be back-to-back with other events. If you‚Äôre getting into the game now, you have an enormous amount of content to choose from and probably won‚Äôt be bored any time soon.

genshin impact is an amazing game. fun mechanics, many characters, a whole bun  vc of places to explore, etc. as a higher leveled player, the only thing i can really do anymore is log in, do commissions, then log off. basically - if you‚Äôre new, don‚Äôt rush the game. it gets a lot less fun when you run out of content. another thing - of course, hoyoverse gets this a lot, but there needs to be more representation for people of color. i love to see rep but in this game we get two characters who have little to no lore. of course this isn‚Äôt TOO big of a deal, but with these things + more, genshin is hanging by a thread on my home screen. i hope this helps newer players get an understanding of how this game is, and i do hope for genshin to grow, since it is a great game. :)

and another note, the wishing system is horrible. if youve played this game you know how frustrating it is to wish. for those that dont know, its most definitely not free to play. you have a 50% chance of getting the limited 5* on the banner within the first 90 wishes but if you lose to a standard character, then you will get that limited 5* character guaranteed. so if you have bad luck, you will get that limited character within 180 wishes. primogems that can be converted to wishes are really time consuming to farm for bc they dont give that much primos in events or rewards. and considering my luck, ive wished on 10 different character banners and i lost on half of them, thus most of them were guaranteed.

I have spent over $1000 on this game. I look back at some of my purchases and I do reflect on how my journey has been amazing. HOWEVER, this most recent sequence of events regarding greed by the company has shown to us that there is a current lack of organization within the company. There is an even greater lack of communication between the player base and management team. Community managers seem absent and content creators are the only liaison between the players and the developers. I will only invest a $5 welkins pass from this point on forward rather than my previous investments of gem packs in hopes that maybe our voices will be heard. We miss the OLD Genshin impact that promotes this game and acted in a generous and communicative way.

I loved this game and it saddens me to see the direction it‚Äôs going in, hopefully mihoyo learns from the current outrage and actually throws the players a bone for once.

When the game is going well it‚Äôs so enjoyable! There‚Äôs a ton to do and the style is beautiful! I genuinely enjoy this game but there are major flaws to the point that I‚Äôm considering quitting. 

For instance, the secrets of tianquin quest is a random quest that is almost impossible for people to beat unless your world level is still low (look online and see for yourself). That wouldn‚Äôt normally be an issue but it will lock you out of coop mode indefinitely until you beat it. Unfortunately, there‚Äôs no way to back out of the quest if you accidentally start it. This isn‚Äôt a new issue, it‚Äôs been reported to mihiyo well over a year ago and they‚Äôve done nothing to help, leaving a ridiculous amount of people locked out of coop mode. 

Btw, before you say to yourself ‚Äújust git gud‚Äù, this quest I mentioned is notably harder than any boss fight I‚Äôve experienced in the game. It wasn‚Äôt play tested enough.

Genshin Impact is one of the most fun rpg games I‚Äôve played in a very long while. The variety of characters and their abilities is extensive (though the gacha system is as dangerous as ever), combat is fast paced- generally what you‚Äôd expect to sum it up. I love the story, and playing through it is thrilling... when the game lets me play. One of the most frustrating things for me in ANY game is a level block. After you finish a story quest, you can‚Äôt progress further until you reach a certain level, and the slow level progression is aggravating. The game is fun enough for me to keep playing despite having to grind after every quest, but if you have little patience and prefer speed-runs, this is not the game for you.

Honestly, at first I thought it was a BOTW copy, but once you get past the first bit, the story completely changes! I love to play and it combines many different types of games. For example, it has a collecting part to it (with the characters), an adventure theme, it also has a Battle Pass, and soon they‚Äôll be a housing part of the game to it in the 1.5 update! There‚Äôs so much to do in this game, and still not a lot of the actual game is out! Plus, it‚Äôs free! There‚Äôs also co-op mode, which makes it TWICE AS BETTER! You can team up against bosses, explore together, or just mess around and have fun! There‚Äôs also SO many other small quests! Please get it, I‚Äôm sure you won‚Äôt regret it.

This game is quite literally everything I‚Äôve wanted in an RPG for ages. It has the potential to set the standard for years to come. Graphics, combat, soundtrack, story, everything is spot on. That said, if you don‚Äôt, you WILL miss out on any number of things, and regardless of what you‚Äôve heard that‚Äôs OK. I‚Äôm not even sure where to start. I started playing Genshin Impact shortly after it came out. I play everyday and it‚Äôs easily my favorite game. It‚Äôs known that Genshin Impact‚Äôs regions are based on countries in the real world. Mondstadt is based on German culture, Liyue is based on Chinese culture, and Inazuma is based on Japanese culture. The upcoming nation, Sumeru, is rumored to be based on Middle Eastern, Southeast Asian, and North African cultures, yet rumors, leaks, and speculations about the game have shown that there are a lack of darker toned characters. In my opinion, to have a game based on real-life countries and yet only have not even a variety of skin tones is completely outrageous and unrealistic to the real world. The lack thereof doesn‚Äôt only make the people (npcs & playable characters) have limited designs and seem repetitive, it also causes an increase of anti-
blackness and colorism within the fandom. Change needs to be made, characters need to be more diverse for many more reasons than I have stated. To be a multi-million dollar company and yet not listen to the fan base is completely wrong.

The first few hours are nice. There are some very well done mechanics and it is a very good open world for a mobile game.
Then the gacha gets you.
At higher levels every aspect of the game forces you towards spending money.
At Adventure Level 45, there is maybe 20 minutes of content a day, while loot is meager. 
The resin system limits all aspects of player and gear improvement. Spending money or not playing are the only options. Spending a LOT of money. 
You are forced to only level a character or two at a time because it will take months to level all of them, or you can spend money.
Rolling for characters is deceptive. To actually get all of the features, you must successfully roll for a specific character 7 times (6 for the free ones). A couple recent characters were not great until you rolled them a couple times. 
The combination of all the intentional limits on loot and character progression turns this from a good game to a horrible money grab. 
The character banner events successfully use ‚Äúfear of missing out‚Äù to coerce spending because normal drop rate for anything but low level junk weapons miniscule. 
It was probably an early sign that this game was predatory when many people started and abandoned accounts when their free initial rolls failed to produce the first good characters.

I deleted the app. Immediately my phone went down to 100GB worth of space. I was looking forward to playing this game but it‚Äôs unrealistic and sad for it to burn my iPhone XS like this üò¢. If there is a further update that fixes this feature I will reconsider.

This game features gameplay that you'd see on a $60 Console/PC game, but it's a free-to-play mobile game. The combat system is very smooth, intuitive, and just feels really good to play. On top of that, the game has beautiful, stylistic graphics and effects, as well as beautifully animated cutscenes. 

If you are the story type, you will find satisfaction in the depth of the story this game features- but you will find that you can also go off explore the large, open world to your heart's content, your curiosity constantly rewarded with hidden chests and challenges that make the detour worthwhile. 

This game has a little bit for everyone, and I think once you pick it up, you'll have trouble putting it down.

Addictive, fun, massive map, amazing combat system, decent story, and amazing characters. The only thing from this game you could ask for is consistant content to binge. It is a lot like destiny in that aspect which is nice for some players who are more casual who don‚Äôt want to feel like they are missing out like they would in other games like WoW. 
I have been playing for around a year and a half and I have loved every second (aside from losing 50/50 of course) 

I would recommend to anyone looking for a casual single player game.

I‚Äôve been playing this game since 1.5, and it was really fun to play, but after Sumeru‚Äôs release, all I‚Äôve got to say is I‚Äôm utterly disappointed. The new cast of characters is almost all whitewashed. Sumeru is supposed to be a region based on Middle Eastern cultures and countries, which has a very big population of tan people, so would it really be that hard to make some more playable characters more tan? Yun Jin is a perfect example of how Hoyoverse was able to represent Chinese culture appropriately in the game, so is it really that much more of a hassle to represent other cultures other than their own? They‚Äôve claimed to have done their research on the region and the Sumerian landscape and environment is amazing, but the characters are terribly executed. Would it be a problem if the workers needed to put a little more thought into their designs? Something has to change if I‚Äôm going to continue playing this game.

im just gonna say now, this game takes up to like 12 gb of storage at the full game but its worth it. some parts of the game are more difficult than others but thats what makes it fun. you have to change up your strategy, maybe your party. this game has a gorgeous open world that you can explore, puzzles you have to solve to get rewards and so much more. genshin is a bit complicated but imo thats what makes it fun, its a lot to learn but once you get the hang of it, it becomes easier to remember and follow the pattern.

Genshin Impact is a beautiful game with unique characters, a wonderful open world map, and interesting story line. (No I am not a bot) I give this game 5 stars for those reasons and I love playing the game. However, while I am pretty apathetic towards the anniversary rewards (I have never really been one to hype myself up too much), I can understand the backlash from the community. I think MiHoyo could do more in terms of listening to their community and I hope they will make these improvements in the future. However I think it goes to say hate the creator, not the game. The game truly lives up to most of its hype and I am looking forward to continuing my adventure in the future.

I was introduced to the game a while ago. I‚Äôve been playing non-stop ever since. I have become attached to the game. It is a HUGE comfort game for me with all the amazing characters with endless lore. It‚Äôs always fun watching and reading theories. The quests are so in depth and so fun. It‚Äôs actually a challenge and I adore that. But, the game can‚Äôt be physically speed-ran. You need to put in time and effort, so if you have time in your hands, Genshin Impact is a great recommendation. The action and cutscenes are beautiful. The animation is even better, trust me on that. The characters themselves are so in detail and so beautiful, you might even get attached! Try it out if you have time! Stay safe and have fun :) <3

As a PC/Console game on mobile it's pretty good. Great visuals, music despite its lack of originality. Gameplay loop at its core is fun. However the extremely predatory monetization is just awful. Terrible rates and stamina system. It's like they don't want hardcore people to play yet try and force them to stay. Disappointing considering all the feedback they received during closed beta and the more fair & sustainable system in their previous game Honkai Impact 3rd. Baffling considering they reduced the amount of currency you can earn in Abyss from the beta considering the atrocious rates. Well below industry standards. Sad to see that they pushed monetization to the limit for launch, damaging dedicated long term investment in the process. Story is also unimportant with unskippable cutscenes. Let the players decide if they want to pay attention to that annoying cringe. Please do better.

I do really hope they add it to xbox, it‚Äôs so sad that everywhere else gets it except the console i play :( i‚Äôll have to be grateful for mobile for now

Game was a lot of fun but the direction of their design is poor now. They will create a problem and then ‚Äúsell‚Äù you the solution. 

A lot of their new characters are designed around potentially being viable in the future (cyno and dehya) instead of with current content. Using in game currency or real money hoping something might be usable in the future is bad and developers shouldn‚Äôt be rewarded for such poor design.

Likewise, a great number of character base kits are balanced around the user having multiple copies (constellations) to boost their base kit. This makes having the base kit clunky and not user friendly. This was not really seen in the older units and is a newer trend to encourage people to spend real money.

Overall, the game was fun when the company could take user feedback and admit they messed up (like with Zhongli) but with new characters such as Faruzan and Dehya they have ignored the community and have deliberately given these characters (products) clunky and poorly designed kits that require months of in game saving or hundreds of dollars to ‚Äúfix.‚Äù

TLDR: company was good at launch but has been shifting to focusing on creating problems and selling their users the ‚Äúfix.‚Äù 

As always, this is my opinion based on my experience with the game and your mileage might vary.

for starters, genshin isn‚Äôt the worst game ever. it can be fun when you make it fun but that isn‚Äôt what i‚Äôm talking about today. my problem with genshin is the skin tone issue there is for sumeru. sumeru is based off regions irl where the common skin gone you would see is brown, i‚Äôm not from that area so i might be wrong i‚Äôm just going off of videos/info that was told to me. for it to be based off that region and having the playable characters being pale is really saddening imo. the fact that the player base was excited over npcs being slightly darker than most says a lot. not to mention the leaked enemies, who are also brown. i‚Äôm not sure but if hoyoverse can make npcs and enemies brown they can make playable characters brown. dehya, who is leaked to be lighter than xinyan is a problem. i do wanna say again that i am not from the regions that sumeru is based off, but if this is the ‚Äúrep‚Äù that they‚Äôre getting then it gives me an insight on how natlan will be, which is leaked to be based off latin america i think. i really do hope hoyoverse will listen to us when we complain about their skin tone issue, but until money is thrown into the table it‚Äôs highly unlikely.

although genshin impact is a very fun and enjoyable game, with many interesting features and quests, along with a well thought out plot, hoyoverse needs to STEP UP there game. literally. we see 0 representation in the game. sumeru is the newest region as of now, and is based off south asia, but we see no proper representation of their culture and people. so far, out of the 45+ characters, we have ONE character with dark skin. but thats not the only issue. we can see that hoyoverse is getting lazy and greedy. the gaming experience has downgraded and their thirst for money has multiplied as the game has progressed. there is also no content for endgame players, and a lot of new players really struggle with the game. there‚Äôs a lack of entertainment and overwhelming demand for money, skill, time, and attention. 

overall, hoyoverse needs to improve their work, or the game is going to fail. we need change.

Wow, to think that‚Äôs it‚Äôs already been a full year since the game has fully released(or maybe longer I dunno it‚Äôs been awhile) the combat is fun and fluid. The world is beautiful, and the character design is colorful and fun. I didn‚Äôt know what I was getting into when I downloaded the game, but I am glad I did. The game is very thorough and it plays like any other big platform action-RPGs out there. The character design is beautiful, the battle mechanics are easy to understand and the game plays beautifully as well being exciting every time you play. I have been playing for over a year now and I enter every day to complete challenges and quests Because of how fun and fresh it is. My only issue thus far has been the lack of controller support on the latest update (2.2) and the regular game crashes on previous devices. I think the co-op experience is a bit clunky but there is definitely room to grow in that sense.

Genshin is a beautiful game. From world design to character details they do a brilliant job of making the world feel alive and fun to wander. The story is a bit slow in the beginning but as you go on the story fully invests you to the point you can‚Äôt put it down.

Huge problem though, if you‚Äôre f2p it‚Äôs pretty rough, especially later game. The game is based off a gacha system which means you only have a slim chance at getting the characters or weapons you want. Those chances don‚Äôt come very often if you‚Äôre f2p. It can take a f2p user a month to get you a 10 pull which will get you something decent, not great. 

As a result it‚Äôs better to avoid thinking of it as a f2p game. The best price in the game is for a monthly pass called Welkin. You spend  5$ USD and gets you a solid sum of gems per day, cutting down the amount of time for a 10 pull to about 10 days. 

Still, if you want to get the characters you want, even with Welkin, it‚Äôs either an investment of time and patience or your wallet. Mihoyo knows what they‚Äôve developed is addictive and fun to play and they make sure to drain their users for it.

Quit complaining about the anniversary rewards. Mihoyo is a company that‚Äôs focused on profits and you‚Äôre not entitled to rewards because you decided to spend most of your time on their video game. Even if you spent money, you already received what they owed you. This community is so childish, especially those writing negative reviews on other games created by Mihoyo. My sympathy goes to the honkai players, they don‚Äôt deserve their game getting slandered because entitled genshin players want to throw a tantrum over rewards. Seriously you guys are playing for rewards over the actual game at this point.

This game is awesome. Has some slight graphics requirements so u can‚Äôt run it on below average PCs on good setting, but even tho I play on the lowest possible, the graphics are still awesome. The story and lore and backstories and great, and the foreshadowing for the plot lines is great. The quests are fun and the combat is diverse.

Now for some of the issues. Once you get to late game, around AR 55+, there is a severe lack of content to the point where I myself only play for 20 minutes a day because the dailies are all there is to do. Mihoyo does a good job of pumping out fun events so that is mitigated sometimes. 

Overall, I recommend this game highly. Be careful with ur money tho.

So while yes you can explore and have fun with the story once you get to level between 40-60 the content drought becomes more apparent. They give you a lot of quests and progressing for early game to keep the player engaged and focused. However as far as late game goes you pretty much have to plan what you want to do as you have limited resin per day.
Which is just another way of pressuring you in buying the loot boxes which contain character/heroes  and weapons.

I have been able to play to the first city. The game looks wonderful, but it does not run well on my older iPad Pro. The starting white screen takes a minute to load the title (which is a terrible sign), and nothing renders after that except for instructions on how to start the game.

In game, the cinematics are incredibly laggy and stutter. When I‚Äôm able to move the character, I can only see within a few feet of my character. The entire background is black/void. Water is black/void. Lowering the settings does nothing for render distance except make the graphics more blurry. Eventually, you will get to a forced encounter, where the game does not render anything, and you cannot continue.

This seems to be the problem with anything but iPhone 8 and up and the newest iPads. If you have an older device, don‚Äôt bother downloading it until they fix these performance issues/bugs.

First started this game with an open mind and was not disappointed at all. Although this type of game was not the first of its kind, key characteristics such as: aesthetics, the gameplay, and even the functionality of things were impressive. To make the game even better, I believe that controller support for mobile devices should be implemented. Hear me out, in this day and age, many gamers have moved on to mobile gaming. By adding controller support, you are essentially letting the community know that you care about their opinions while it simultaneously attracts more audiences to the game. Thank you and looking forward to the future of this game.

The game is great and the animations and attention to detail is phenomenal. One big setback however is their lack of variety and depth when it comes to some characters. There are only 5 tanned/darker playable characters (one of which doesn‚Äôt even have any in-game story appearance outside of events) and there are over 50+ characters‚Ä¶ There‚Äôs more skin tone variety with human enemies than actual playable characters and that‚Äôs extremely disappointing to say the least. I stared playing about two years ago and I truly love this game. I absolutely love this game. So, I‚Äôve been playing genshin since it launched and I think I‚Äôm ready to finally give a review. Let me make this short and sweet for those with short attention spans. No shame to other games out there. There are plenty of other incredible games out there. It‚Äôs just that Genshin Impact is the one game that has stayed with me. Despite all the other games that I‚Äôve been playing for years, this game has been my absolute favorite amongst all those other games. This is one of my favorite games so far because the graphics are phenomenal, the voice actors suit each character‚Äôs personality, and you can play as any character you want and work with your friends in the same map! One major flaw that I hope that the game developers would fix is the crashing problem. Every time the character pauses or there‚Äôs too many things going on at once, the app closes on me (especially during battle) and I would have to go back and fight the same enemy as its health restarted while my character has some health missing. If this was fixed, I‚Äôd certainly give it 5 stars because this game is addicting but the crashes are the only thing that‚Äôs bothersome.

This GACHA game is an absolute waste of your time. At first, you'll be sucked into a game that promises open world, beautiful graphics, amazing music. It‚Äôs true, the game has all of that. However, the more you play, the more you find glaring flaws in this game and just how greedy the company owning this game really is. 

So many characters come out with scuffed kits, which is terrible since you need to save for a long time or pay money to get them. The balance team is nonexistent. There is absolutely no end game content aside from spiral which resets every two weeks and takes an hour at most. Resin is a huge limiting factor and a lot of your character progression is linked to rng of artifacts, since they make or break your character. The story telling for this game has turned into a dating sim with horribly written storylines and terrible rushed pacing. 

Also, this game has a problem is censoring anyone who doesn‚Äôt agree with them. They are truly following the ideals of their motherland. 

Anniversary was an absolute joke and just goes to show that the company views us as nothing but promotion bots. The rewards are abysmal and there‚Äôs no communication from mhy about anything. 

Do not play this game and do not give the company any money. They do not deserve it.

If you are a player who wants to get decent anniversary rewards or in general this game isn‚Äôt for you. Genshin Impact is a game that barely gives primos to players for free. Most of the time you need good characters to do certain things. If you have bad luck too bad. The gameplay get repetitive after getting to a certain point. You have you unlock ar rankings to go do certain things and that limits what you can do. The pity system is pretty bad considering the fact you can lose the character you wanted in a certain banner but get a  guaranteed to the next banner or the current. Some of the bosses are also a pain in the but when you need to grind materials which is only from those bosses. My experience might not be the same as others considering the fact I was ar 32 but I hope this gives you a idea of the game.

I love this game.  It is a lovely open world exploration rpg.  Very f2p friendly (but chip in and buy the $5 subscription if you like it).  My one criticism is that the game crashes all. The. Time.  Particularly when accessing any menu.  I once had it crash 12 times in 20 minutes while upgrading weapons and such.  Other than that, great art, fun gameplay, and engaging, amusing story.  

As you progress in Adventure Rank, there is a point where it gets grindy because world level automatically increases.  So if you are just running around having fun, the world gets too tough for you to live in.  You have to make sure to spend your resin every day to keep up.  Still, though, quite fun.

This is such a visually beautiful game that i truly enjoy, which it‚Äôs pretty rare because normally I just get tired of different games that I‚Äôve played. But with Genshin there‚Äôs always some thing to do whether it be a commission, World quest, or even just a part of the main storyline. it‚Äôs a game that really can immerse you into the story and get you emotionally attached to really any of the characters because that‚Äôs just how moving some of it is. I would highly recommend this game to anybody no matter what you‚Äôre playing it on it is a great game. It‚Äôs also highly addicting so be careful because I know many times I‚Äôve stayed up until 3 AM playing it. :))

I love this game, I play it every single day (usually for about 4+ hours). There‚Äôs only really one complaint that I have, and that‚Äôs that Mihoyo is kind of stingy with primogems. The rewards are sometimes just super lackluster, and it can be a bit disappointing. This isn‚Äôt holding me back from playing, but it can be a downer sometimes. Anyways, love the game, and I‚Äôm excited for the next update. If you‚Äôre wondering if you should start playing, I definitely recommend you give it a try.

When I first started this game I thought it was simply a Zelda copycat, which isn‚Äôt exactly a bad thing, but this game has a ton of depth and support. There is a ton of content available, even to those who play for free. Plus you aren‚Äôt bombarded with ads every few minutes to ruin the immersion. 
The fighting aspect is very responsive and with the different elements coming into play, switching out team members and using strategy vs. just wailing away at the enemies is recommended, not to mention very fun! 
Whether you want to free play just to pass the time or want to dive deep and pay to get the most out of the experience, this game is great!

First week of playing is fun and afterwards it gets super repetitive and boring. You literally do the same stuff over and over everyday and fighting gets super dull after a long play through. Also is it just me or is the Gacha super unforgiving? Rates are ridiculous in my opinion and when you farm primogems at such a slow pace, that hustle to get to 80 rolls is such a nightmare. Plus when you fight it hardly feels rewarding at all when the loot isn‚Äôt exciting in the slightest, this goes for finding chests and exploration as well. Don‚Äôt play the game, it‚Äôs fun at first but gets dull fast, play when there is more content and let me explain why... Have you ever heard the definition of insanity? Insanity is doing the same thing over and over expecting an outcome. This game will define insanity for you just as it had for me.

My phone overheats enough that I have to ice it to play, but oh my is this a game. Graphics are beautiful, character stories are captivating, and missions are unique and challenging. The open world has endless areas to explore, and updates keep bringing us more. The main plot is a fun story that has kept me playing for hours.
I would love to see more character stories that we can interact with in the open world in future updates, like you did with the intro to Razor, and maybe a way to work toward collecting characters I want rather than solely the random draw, but even still, this is an incredible game. None of its flaws are large enough to interrupt gameplay. Keep it up, I‚Äôd love to see more!

A pvp option would definitely liven up the game for end game users and everyone else.

Genshin is an amazing game honestly. The world is big, there are many characters, and the gameplay is solid. Fighting is nice and fluid, but banner reruns are slow. The game is gacha game so be prepared for high investment and time. With the most recent addition to the game being Dehya, I am very disappointed with the game. All throughout Sumeru none of the characters impressed me as much as Dehya, yet Mihoyo released her in a state where she brings no value to your team. How could they miss the mark so much? The characters are the reason people play this game, so to have one release in such a poor state is very disheartening. I fully understand that not every character should be op, but this is downright sad. I am thankful that powercreep has been left to a minimal though. I hope Mihoyo rethinks their balancing of Dehya in the near future.

Genshin Impact is a very unique game with very interesting storylines and I cannot explain how addicted I am to this game. Honestly, this would be five stars if it weren‚Äôt for co-op mode. Overall, Genshin Impact is keeping most of my friendships, well, friendships. It‚Äôs really beautiful, and the characters, um, you well get the point. 

I literally love everything about this game‚Ä¶well almost everything.

Let‚Äôs start with co-op mode. 

It‚Äôs really bad, not gonna lie.

Need some primogems? Wanna do a primogem domain with your friend? Nope, sorry!

You want to do a world quest? Nope!

You want to do that one really annoying commission where you have to give that dude radish veggie soup? Hint: Can‚Äôt submit item in co-op mode!

Do you want help with an event? No way! f2p loser.

Need help with a story/archon quest? Try again.

Do you see what I‚Äôm getting at? You really cannot do anything in co-op mode but artifact domains and material domains. You can‚Äôt even do every commission!

Next- primogems

After ar 40, (I‚Äôm ar 43) if you do your quests and actually do things in Genshin, you really can‚Äôt get primogems anymore, it‚Äôs really hard.

Glad I don‚Äôt do my quests I guess.

You can really only get them from commissions after that.

I‚Äôve been playing Genshin for almost a year now and loved playing it, it‚Äôs immersive and the storyline is great. However, I am becoming worried and a bit disappointed in the upcoming region of Sumeru. Due to the homogenous appearances in native Sumeru NPC‚Äôs with pale skin, I am becoming increasingly worried that the playable characters in Sumeru will also be pale skinned. Sumeru, based off lore and NPC clothes, seems to be based off the Middle East, South Asia, and other countries where majority of people are not white/have pale skin. It‚Äôs so disappointing to think that this region will not be correctly represented the way the regions of Mondstadt (Germany), Liyue (China), and Inazuma (Japan) are. I‚Äôve spent a lot of money on this game, but if the playable Sumeru characters released are all pale with no respectable representation of the countries it is modeled after, I don‚Äôt think I will spending any more of money or even playing at all.

Genshin Impact. The first thing you think when you first enter the game, is that this is not your everyday mobile open world rpg. And let me tell you. This game really does impact you! (Pun not intended.) There is a lot to say about the game, and a lot to there as well. From decorating a teapot you call home, to cooking meals, and battling monsters, this game is really immersive. The scenery and the soundtrack is beautiful, and the game has multiple characters with different stories, making them lovable in their own ways! I have already gotten attached to Kazuha. This game will really sweep you off your feet, so I recommend you try it!

Co-op mode is very useful when you first unlock it because you can have stronger players join your world and defeat bosses that you can‚Äôt beat alone. I don‚Äôt see myself ever getting bored of this game because there is so much to do and explore in this game. There is no actual ending to this game as far as I know from research. If your looking for a action packing adventure game I highly suggest downloading Genshin Impact!

I‚Äôve played this game since it came out last year, and don‚Äôt get me wrong, it was really fun‚Ä¶at first. Then the developers, MiHoYo, earned a lot of money with each new character that came out, and slowly stopped interacting with us, the consumers. Broken characters on release (in the bad sense) and no remarks on the first year anniversary of the game. It just feels too much like they are taking our money and running. Furthermore, I‚Äôve been unable to update the game on my phone due to how large the update size is. I close off this review by saying the game is fun to play up until level 40 and then all that‚Äôs left is grinding the game. There‚Äôs no good end-game content. So play at your own risk. the game is only going to keep getting bigger and if nothing happens, the developers will keep getting away with being stingy and pumping out incomplete new characters.

I come here to address an issue because while I think it‚Äôs talked about a lot I don‚Äôt think a lot of people take it seriously. I started playing Genshin Impact almost 2 years ago. The storyline is great, but I wish they added more drama and excitement to the stories. Building the characters is pretty annoying (because it takes months to make them useful), but it‚Äôs also fun. Another annoying thing is trying to get the 5 star character that I want. For me, it takes a very long time to save up enough wishes, and when I use those wishes on the banner, I usually don‚Äôt get the character I want. Spending a whole lot of your time and effort on a game, just to get nothing is pretty bad. Mihoyo should increase the probability of winning the banner.

I like the game overall, but you really can't look past something like how they portray Sumeru's characters. Sumeru is a nation based off the Achaemenid Empire, a region with diverse cultures and skin tones.

The region isn't even out yet and it's already unbelievably disappointing to me as a south asian person. All the NPC's from Sumeru are pale and so are the confirmed Sumerian characters (Collei, Cyno). Pale people from the SWANA/South asia region exist, but not everyone from there is pale. The fact that every single one of the MANY Sumeru NPCs are paper white, many with light hair aswell, isn't because they want to represent pale people from that region. It is a matter of colorism, and it's frankly disgusting and disappointing.

Not to mention the fact that every single nation is based off one real life nation. Except Sumeru and Natlan, the only nations based off of black and brown cultures. They are said to be based off a mashup of different, completely separate cultures. It seems to me that Hoyoverse finds our cultures interchangeable, which is not okay at all. It's textbook orientalist.

It's a great game besides the racist and colorist issues at its core. If Sumeru comes out and is as disappointing as I'm lead to believe, I doubt I'll continue playing or recommending Genshin Impact to others as I have in the past.

I used to genuinely love this game and the world it‚Äôs in but after playing for a year and a half I‚Äôm just tired of the lack of representation in the game. The gacha system and grinding system are already bad enough and I learned to tolerate that but the fact that the game is covering a country based on the Middle East and still can‚Äôt add a smidge of melanin to any of its characters is just sad. Out of all the characters there are only two darker skinned ones and even then they get white washed all of the time. It‚Äôs gotten to the point where one of the characters, Kaeya, whose dark skinned, is barely ever seen as Indian anymore. They whitewash him in game too over the updates. In a Game where magic, witches, slimes, hilichurls, and monsters exist the team behind it should not be actively avoiding representation for the bipoc community. Racism doesn‚Äôt even exist in tevyat so why should racism Influence the game?

I'm going to be completely honest, this game has gotten me through a lot in the past year. (I started in early June 2021) So, I might be leaning into my favor of the game, but I love it.  It's engaging and there is a constant stream of new content to engage with.  For the most part, the game is very relaxed.  The over-world exploration is always fun, and even today I find new things I missed in prior run arounds.  The characters are all given fairly well developed stories that are pretty fun to play through.  Of course, the game has it's problems, and I've gained a lot of restraint with not spending too much money through the gatcha system...  Very fun game though!

Genshin Impact is probably the most fun and entertaining game I‚Äôve ever played. Not to mention, I have to take the SHSAT (test to get into a specialized high school) and I am extremely nervous. I got this game last night and have not stopped playing since.

Although it earns the max of five stars from me, I think it could get some criticism!

1. Quests often take a long time to appear for me, and sometimes quests that aren‚Äôt even at my level challenge me to complete it.

2. Controls in the game are often confusing for me as a beginner, and I find it difficult to navigate with all the buttons and requirements.

3. Last but not least, I‚Äôve had a glitch happen multiple times where I try to attack a humanoid/monster and even when it says they took damage from my attack, their HP are still at the max. It‚Äôs annoying but not a problem as it only happened a few times!

Overall, Genshin Impact is an absolute masterpiece, with beautiful scenery and amazing characters, it deserves to be named the best game ever to be created!

The game isn‚Äôt too bad, rather fun to play with an amazing story, amazing characters, and some beautiful scenery. I enjoy playing it, and the events they have at times aren‚Äôt too shabby. Granted they sometimes have their hiccups, but overall their pretty good. I hope to continue playing this game for a long time as well as seeing what new things come out as well as how the story progresses. Mihoyo, your doing really good so far. Please keep up the good work as well as the voice actors as I hope to see where you take this game and how far it can go and sorry for those of us who have treated you and the voice actors so rudely.

Also I apologize for all the used to be fans leaving for cookie run, it is completely unfair how they changed so quickly. I am not trying to send any hate towards the game. Overall great game, the rewards could use some work though!!

I cannot believe this game is able to play on my mobile phone. It‚Äôs the most beautiful and addictive game I‚Äôve played. It‚Äôs Breath of the Wild meets Dragon Age Inquisition. Solid soundtrack. Fighting system is amazing. Lore and world exploration is the best outside of a console or computer game. This blows all other mobile rpg games away. This is a Gacha game though. For those that don‚Äôt understand, it‚Äôs a mechanic in the game that allows you to gamble for better characters/items through purchases. This doesn‚Äôt mean you have to spend to win, but if you want the best stuff and you want it fast then yeah, it pretty much is. But so worth playing

the characters, the maps, the events, everything is just so charming. the hefty size is understandable because the game is so high quality. they put amazing detail into everything and make all the characters so unique and interesting. it‚Äôs not just all looks, either, because the combat system is quite engaging as well. even how the hilichurls and other enemies make different sounds, all of the details are so well put in and made. the artifact system is incredibly helpful as well, and I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôve seen anything like it in a long time. all in all, amazing game, 10/10 recommend.

There is no sense of appreciation from mhy and no substantial rewards. Overall game is a 3 or 4 because they refuse to buff or fix any problems with chars, communicate with players in general, and the prices for primogems are way too expensive. Spent about $350 so far but will be going back to being f2p because there‚Äôs too much corporate greed to support them. I feel bad for the players that spent thousands or even tens of thousands. Also for all players in general because everyone loved the game and played the game religiously for them to be absolutely spit on.

This game is simply okay. The characters are cute, the art, music and backgrounds are nice, but the company can be pretty crappy, and the game can get confusing. In order to get good character stats and deal a decent amount of damage you have to understand how to deal with the artifacts.

On top of that, Genshin Impact is what made Mihoyo rich, it‚Äôs their main source of income.. but they treat us very poorly. It‚Äôs been a wonderful year with them, their sales skyrocketing, but they can‚Äôt even give us enough gifts to get a guaranteed five star? They purposefully make their gacha system a bit tricky to maneuver, but then give us a simple 10 pull ‚Äî which 9/10 times wouldn‚Äôt even get us our wanted 5* character.

Please learn treat your players right, or else you will lose them.

These reviews are incredible. I wonder how many people actually don‚Äôt realize that this game is a copy of breath of the wild. Yes of course it is a good game. I feel kind of sad for those who have not experienced breath of the wild first, which, is a beautiful game by the way.

I rarely write reviews, as I find most games to be barely worth the time. However Mihoyo has outdone itself a second time. Honkai Impact 3rd was and is one of my top games, but this edged itself ahead. Beautiful graphics, breathtaking music, fun and simple combat (yet challenging to master), engaging characters and storyline all play to its strengths. There is no sense of pay to win or pay to play.

If I were to call out a weakness, it would be that the dailies are a bit too time consuming with the ‚Äòspend original resin‚Äô aspect, which I struggle to complete.

I am thankful for Mihoyo games as I have been under extra social distancing due to cancer, they have made the time much less difficult. Thank you!

If the Resin system isn't significantly improved by the 1.1 patch, this game is going to fall off very quickly. We need more ways of obtaining Resin by playing in-game, so that we can progress at our own pace instead of being throttled and cut off after our first 20 minutes of gameplay. I'm not joking when I say the only significant portion of progression you gain from playing each day is at the first 10-20 minutes of gameplay when you do your daily commissions and spend your Resin, and after that you get hardly anything worthwhile. Making all of the chests respawn each week would also help with this, as the open world feels completely empty after you've gone through each area once or twice, and it doesn't require any Resin. This game has a ton of potential but if MiHoYo doesn't bring change to things like Resin soon then they're going to lose their playerbase fast.

This game is overall great with the anime aesthetics, quality characters, and has great potential. However, once you get through the honeymoon phase and get to a certain Adventure rank, you hit a wall that is mainly caused by the resin system. This severely limits your progress in the later parts of the game. I know this is a gatcha game, so that includes some energy system. However, the game does not give much options to recharge your resin besides having you spend money. I would be happier if they added other ways to recharge resin. Such as when you rank up your Adventure Rank, complete all your daily commissions, and allow us to go over the cap. Also the 5 star rates are waaay to low. if they added ways for f2p players to obtain 4 and 5 star characters easier, it would be amazing.

Amazing game, with hours of content, dynamic characters, great story, beautiful music, and an engaging story. Adding keyboard & mouse support to iOS & iPadOS would be huge quality of life improvement for some of us who are not always able to get behind a PC for longer gaming sessions. The touch controls are fine, just limited in terms of the level of control you have. You only have so much space to pan the camera with one finger, press the buttons with the other, and manipulate the virtual joystick with another. The controller setup works well also, but keyboard and mouse would be amazing.

This game is fantastic, but there‚Äôs two huge issues that I have with it. The first is that it crashes or becomes unresponsive (requiring a full restart) every 8-12 minutes. This is extremely frustrating. The second is how unforgiving the gacha system is in the game; I.E. the combat is balanced so that if you‚Äôre not paying a lot of money, you‚Äôll always feel behind and underpowered.

That being said, I love the exploration aspect of the game, and the combat is fun and interesting. The character progression could use some work, and the story could use better writers. But the voice acting (where present) is really good.

My final verdict is don‚Äôt play it here on your mobile device. Get it on a platform they care about, like PC or Xbox or (when they release it) on Switch. The crashes here are nearly unbearable, and it very much ruins the experience.

As a person who is not new to GACHA games, the resin (aka energy) system in this game is horrible. This game wants to be an open world MMO, and for the first 20 ranks feels exactly like it. Once you finish the story content though get ready for a serious drop in things to complete thanks to the lack of content and resin system. End game type items are dropped by bosses and domains but the only way to actually get the drops is to have enough resin to ‚Äúreceive drops‚Äù, if you don‚Äôt- you can waste time fighting them and will receive nothing as a result.

Not only that but unlike other GACHA games, your resin doesn‚Äôt increase with rank ups, so you‚Äôre severely limited to how many battles you can actually do. The only 2 ways to replenish this are with items that are sparsely given out (which don‚Äôt even fully replenish resin) or canibalize primo gems (used for summons for characters) which means you can‚Äôt summon as many times to try and get hero‚Äôs you want. Another thing tied to the resin system: experience books to level up your heroes. What does that mean? 

You either have to spend money to play the game, or sit by idle and spend 20 minutes a day on the game and then log off while you wait for resin to replenish. 

This game will get a 1 star for as long as paying to actually play is required.

The controls feel fluid, the story is engaging and well written, the open world is truly open and the map is huge and gives a real sense of adventure. This game is unlike anything I'v played on mobile before and I'v had more fun with this than any AAA game I'v played in awhile. I know that this review is constant praise but it is genuinely impressive and FREE. Not since Warframe has there been such a well made free to play game that doesnt feel restricted by paywall. I don't feel like i need to pay a cent for the game, but i will anyways because i support this kind of care and love from a development team, and i feel as though I'm easily getting my moneys worth from the money spent.

Overall if you don‚Äôt mind your iPhone being turned into a frying pan, give this a try and it‚Äôll make your mind explode from how good the game actually is.

Mihoyos previous game Honkai Impact is nowhere near the scope of this one, respectively. Genshin contains a vast, beautiful open world with plenty of puzzles, secrets and treasure, packed neatly in a gorgeous triple A-like polished ribbon. 
However, 
it is a gacha game, like Honkai impact. You must farm currency to get characters. This is not inherently a bad thing, but.. when the characters are not fully polished, and when there is no roadmap to know what's coming next, so you save aimlessly, not knowing if you'll even want the next character, or the one after..
topped with anniversary rewards comparable to one singular piece of meat while an entire chicken is dangled in front of you.. and it becomes draining. Mihoyo has made over one billion dollars, marked in March 2021, the game come out in October 2020.
And they give us... 100 "primogems". 100 primogems is not even ONE pull. It takes a max of 90 to get a 5 star character or weapon.

Sometimes a character we may not even want.
I love this game, its gorgeous, the story has SO MUCH potential, please, flesh out your characters, show us their good and bad sides, and please, understand this game is nothing without the playerbase.

I think Genshin is a great game, very fun to play, and worth most of your time. I‚Äôm just gonna cut to the chase and get to the pros and cons.
Pros:
-fun to play (for most players)
-very interesting and deep storyline with hundreds of mysteries yet to be solved, mentioned or not mentioned
-collect characters
-talk to people similar to you/make friends
-battle bosses
-be a potato
Cons:
-very whitewashed characters, not very much diversity, but the game is originated in Asia, which whitewashing is VERY common, but it does bother me and other people
-expensive. it is a gacha game (meaning it‚Äôs supposed to make profit) but sometimes things can get out of hand. a single c6 5 star is usually $1200. 
-eventually gets harder, but that‚Äôs how it is. if your more experienced, things will get harder. don‚Äôt know why 1-star reviews are complaining about this
-some people get banned for no reason
-LOADS of storage for mobile players
-lots of people climbing with Lisa (basically just means sexualizing them)

it‚Äôs mid. I like it. I think you should download it but if you have a problem with whitewashing DO NOT get it!

This has been an interesting 3 months. I was told by my friends that this game was great and I joined them in the adventure. They have all quit and I‚Äôm playing alone now.
 The game has been boring. Getting a new character and making a team around them is fun. But the content you use them in is so lame. The enemies are just so drab. The fighting mechanics are not engaging. Their is such insane disparity in the power of characters that makes it just annoying. While the game does have wonderful landscapes and the lore behind them is pretty cool. The characters and the main story is just stupid, overly convoluted and pointless.
The events and ends game are so lame and requires little too no effort.
This game has so much potential but I too, like my friends, will probably be leaving soon. Just just to see something that could of been amazing just fade away because developers get sloppy and rest on their laurels instead of innovating. Shame on them.
If you want a game to play once in a while is fine. If you want a game you can play for hours with something to do‚Ä¶this games is not for you.
P.S. I‚Äôm AR 56 and 36* abyss of people are wondering what my perspective is based on.
Cheers!

Beautiful graphics, I love the open world concept and I feel the game helps direct you through the story without forcing you down it, or making the world feel too open and hard to navigate. All the character designs are unique and they all come with their own stories that you can play through like quests.

A friend recommended this to me so i tried it, and now i‚Äôm hooked. For anyone interested in Genshin, here‚Äôs a personal lists of pros and cons

Pros -
 - Easy to follow along story and navigating really helps with people like me with a bad sense of direction
 - Interesting characters to drag you back into genshin
 - really big open world, like huge
 - unique characters for different playstyles
 - cool features like cooking and fishing, which i personally enjoy

Cons -
 - laggy on mobile, and prone to crashes a lot
 - F2P have a harder time getting primogems
 - personal con, but there‚Äôs no mac support, kinda wish there was as a mac user
 - takes a lot of battery and space, so you have to constantly be around a charger, even if your screen light is at the lowest setting

Overall thoughts: I love it (as stated,) but i wish some fixes were made for mobile. Some of the 1 stars are inaccurate too (complaining about gacha/event,) so take them with a grain of salt. Try it out if you have the battery and storage space!

Ok so the game is great yeah, 
But there‚Äôs a lot of things wrong with it too
For a guaranteed 5star event banner character that you want you could either get lucky in 10-30 pulls or unlucky where it‚Äôll be 90 pulls which could still lead to a character you didn‚Äôt want. Then you can either grind and hope you don‚Äôt have to hit 90 pulls for a character again OR what this game thrives on, spend money. 

Whales (people who spend lots of cash) do help this game go around sure, they practically fund this game whenever a new/cool 5 star comes out, however if you‚Äôre F2P (free to play) you will have a harder time than they do with getting primo gems for characters. Especially if you hit that point late game where your main income of primos is from daily‚Äôs and events. I‚Äôm considered a dolphin (spent some money but not enough to be considered a whale) and even then it can be a struggle.

Idk if you just wanna chill-ish game and don‚Äôt care about character pulling then you‚Äôll enjoy this, but if you‚Äôre one of those ‚Äúgotta catch ‚Äòem all types‚Äù of players this could be a struggle for you.

Although I very much enjoy the game and its cast of characters it has two major issues. The lack of diversity, and the amount of storage it consumes. Regarding diversity there are many characters with many different backgrounds, but out of all of the cast only two (as of now at least) are tan. And those two characters, being Kaeya and Xinyan, are just 4 stars who hardly show up in the story. Even with their new designs being ‚Äúsupposedly‚Äù based around the middle east they are extremely pale. And while the current regions such as Mondstadt, Liyue, and Inazuma are very much based on real world countries Sumeru seems to be a messy mush. Not to mention it takes an insane amount of storage (half of my phone as of now) to the point soon I will no longer be able to play this game.

I love this this game but every single npc and character being pale with the exception of Kaeya and Xinyan is so weird and frankly getting a bit boring. I know not everyone has darker skin but not everyone has pale skin too, and I think the game experience would be much more better if the characters ingame reflected our world. Not every Japanese, Chinese, and White person is going to be as pale as the Genshin characters and I think the game could benefit from actually having a few tanned characters. Someone that spends all their time outdoors like Beidou and Bennett, for example, probably wouldn‚Äôt be that pale. And with Sumeru on the way, I‚Äôm worried that Hoyoverse will continue this pattern despite the cultures they are using for inspiration. If it happens, I‚Äôll probably quit playing and encourage my friends to do so as well, or at least stop spending on the game.

this game has been a HUGE comfort for me for over a year and a half. to start, this game provides so many great stories, a few fantastic events and unique characters that are easy to get attached to. with this is in mind, im honestly so disappointed in the new region, sumeru. sumeru is based off of south asia, yet they are all pale. genshin lacks so much representation and diversity of characters, even though the regions in the game are based on cultures all around the world. this problem was already there in the first three regions, as kaeya and xinyan are still the only playable characters who aren‚Äôt as pale as paper, and there‚Äôs over 50 playable characters. it‚Äôs honestly so disappointing seeing a game that i‚Äôve made so many fond memories of fail this badly. do better hoyoverse, please

Hoyoverse,
I love this game, I have spent a lot of time and money on it. I love the well thought out designs of the characters however, with the recently released characters from Sumeru, I as well as many others, notice a lack of diversity despite characters having ethnic names, outfits, or styles. If you are basing a nation off of a region where the majority of people are brown, (Middle East and South Asia) you should make the characters darker as well. The community wants you all to change for the better, yet we haven‚Äôt seen any change or feedback from the company. Please listen to your fans! Genshin Impact has been my favorite game for years now, and it has a special place in my heart. As a player who's sat through huge updates and events, I can say that I wish rewards were actually rewards. I'm currently AR 55 and when I can finally hit 56, my reward will be a single wish on the standard banner. Other then the sad amount of rewards we get, the diversity in the game is naught. At the time of this review, the Sumeru cast has been announced (Tighnari, Collei, Dori). They're all pale. A nation based on a real life area where there's plenty of sun to create a diverse palette of skin tones, and yet everyone is glowing bright white. It's disappointing, and I don't want to drop the world of Teyvat, but as a POC, I've been told to "wait" for my representation for too long. I hope Hoyoverse makes the right decisions to please and protect their audience.
