From the title you can probably guess where I am on the level bracket. I absolutely adore the game and fell in love with the lore that came along with it. The aspect that you could also get a bunch of enjoyment just from the gameplay also drew me in quite a bit, to the point I‚Äôve put up with playing on mobile all the way to AR55.

Even so, I‚Äôd say my biggest gripe lies with being a high AR. There‚Äôs simply nothing to do anymore aside from logging on, doing commissions, spending your resin, and repeat every day. There isn‚Äôt any late game content that high AR players are rewarded with. When you compare it to other games such as WOW(it‚Äôs an mmo, not a open world rpg, I know) and it‚Äôs late game content you can be fairly disappointed.

Even so, Genshin Impact is one of my favorite games. Coop with people is fun if you find the right people, and at the very least you get one event and story update every month or so. Because of this, and how vast and fun the early gameplay is Genshin Impact is on my top recommended list for games.

Just don‚Äôt become a gambling addict, <3

I‚Äôve been playing this game since it released, and the extra materials in my inventory are really stacking up. Especially berries. I have way too many of those. I enjoy the combat and travel, and the story is good. I am having my own issues with finding the last few books and fully upgrading both statues, nothing glitch-related, just bad memory. That was a tangent, but anyway, I wish that you could sell a limited amount of materials to the shops, because I have extra, and I use my mora almost as soon as I get it. The graphics are amazing though, and I like the weather and day/night cycle actually affecting things.

The game is really fun when you‚Äôre first starting out with a large world to explore and story to enjoy, but once you reach higher levels (around AR 50) and you‚Äôre able to beat the Spiral Abyss, you realize that there‚Äôs nothing else to do except wait absurd amounts of time for your Resin to recharge and spend your Resin on bad artifacts or other domains to try and min max your characters. It feels like the only content left to do is make your characters better or build new characters, but the resources feel so scarce and the RNG is so bad that it‚Äôs painful to try and get every character functioning. This game needs some kind of repeatable end game content that doesn‚Äôt take 2 weeks to reset and can be beaten in 30 minutes.

for context, I started playing in november last year, and continued consistently playing every day til around june this year. the game‚Äôs visuals, voice acting, and combat are fantastic. far better than most free mobile games.

 however, it‚Äôs so difficult to actually experience it for so many reasons. the resin refills so slow, and you clear it so fast, to where there‚Äôs only 20ish minutes of content a day. events are either as boring as possible, or give little rewards. some events are even only on their website(which only ever gives minuscule rewards). 

what has transpired as of late is the final straw for me with this game. i‚Äôve spent ~70$ on it but i‚Äôm exhausted. the team does not listen to any criticism that fans give. trying to cover this up with hastily made and unplanned replacement events won‚Äôt work. good day to you all.

Yes every game has it‚Äôs problems, but the fact that Mihoyo knows that all these problems exist but deliberately chose to ignore them at the expense of the community is incredibly scummy and wrong. Good for you, you are among the 80% of people that didn‚Äôt get her/him. 

Claim 2: no primo gems to do anything

If you actually worked in the game you would earn them f2p (spiral abyss, dailies, events, quests, etc) I have 6 5 stars as a f2p

Claim 3: 2FA 

I agree actually, however they said they would implement in the next update so yeah

Claim 4: lag

It‚Äôs meant for a pc, so on phone it will lag a lot. Don‚Äôt give a game up and write a 1 star review BC of lag.

Claim 5: too hard

Once you start playing and get used to it, it is hard to find challenges in this game. I can easily clear some bosses in under a minute.

Claim 6: botw copy
While a lot of this game is from botw (taken or inspired) they each have their own different aspects that sets them apart. For example, the combat, the puzzles, the areas, etc.

Overall great game, but resin is a big problem that prevents us from progressing much. I think 1 resin per 6 minutes is fair enough.

I‚Äôm a fan of botw. (Breath of the wild). so when my sister recommended this because of that, I downloaded it and tried it. Not the best game, but the best FREE game. A botw youtuber tried it, spent 6 hours, then I saw a comment that said he barely even made a dent in this game. I believe it. I kinda wanna play as I‚Äôm writing this. The thing that everyone loves, is that:

No crappy graphics or lag, what most free games have.

It‚Äôs huge, and free, and doesn‚Äôt take much to download.

The characters are adorable. I love their clothing.

It‚Äôs addicting and easy to play because of no lag. I haven‚Äôt had any slowing of my game.

No ads. The thing that cheezes people off the most. The thing that most game companies screwed up on.
 
The story. It‚Äôs epic. And large. And so much to explore.

The far away mountains and buildings are literal art.

This list could go on and on and on. But, I‚Äôm going to save your time of the day where you could be playing this.

Ps, this took a little while to write. I hope you enjoy the game, and the rest of your day. Byee

Amazing... I am speechless at the size of this game... this game is absolutely huge, the map is insane comparable to the size of large console games and with good graphics too. The reason I gave it 4 stars is because all though everything is great... it took me awhile to get the hang of it and my progress has been a little slow. I wish the mainstory wasnt so heavilty spaced out between levels. I just got my first story in awhile after i spent all day getting to level 15 then after 20 minutes its over and ill have to do side tasks until level 26.... This is an amazing game that you will not want to put down. Literally you will spend all day playing and not even know it.
 
The graphics, amazing. Combat, amazing. Story, amazing. 

There are only a couple issues.

#1) not enough content, it‚Äôs been only 5 days since release and I have already finished almost everything. I am Adventure rank 33 and now all there is to do is search for chests, I have literally finished everything else. 

#2) the co-op leaves much to be desired. No real incentive to do co-op. Want to see more multiplayer options & benefits. Things you can only achieve by co-op (for example really hard large raids or bosses)

#3) there should be a way to extract materials. There is a set amount of materials in the game (mostly through chests & quests). Once those are completed, it‚Äôs extremely hard to find weapons or accessories. You then upgrade your current gear, to find better gear later.... but you have already spent most of your resources on those precious weapons. Need to have a resource extraction system.

Other than these 3, game is amazing! More work to do though!

The game has a lot of content, and a lot of it is fun. Going into it as the mindset of open world first, gacha second helps a lot with the constant new 5 star units at admittedly very low rates. They are a luxury and can be forgone, so it‚Äôs recommended against pulling for units until you have a guarantee saved up The issue is once that content is done, all that‚Äôs left is rolling for equipment with your daily energy, essentially a lottery. The events are more than generous, despite what you hear; the model is that the events happen frequently with constant rewards surrounding them. Between collectables and constant drops, there‚Äôs always something to do, just at the moment a hollow endgame.

Yeah, I‚Äôm AR60 and still playing this game. I got successfully addicted and every time I‚Äôm thinking about quitting, the devs roll out another update that makes me stick around for a bit more. 

That being said, I spent literally $0.00 on this game. Never gambled for pulls or bought the Moon pass, so I‚Äôm happy to let everyone know that I‚Äôve spent more money on useless loot boxes in Overwatch than on fictional characters in a gacha game. If you believe you can‚Äôt stop yourself from making bad financial decisions, then that‚Äôs on you. 

There‚Äôs enough content. It rolls out pretty often with new quests and events but if you want to spend 2-3 hours a day every day on a game, then once you reach the endgame, take a break.

This game has an amazing storyline if there was a word that could describe it better than amazing I would use it the character designs are great and each character has their own unique abilities and weapons it's a very pretty open world game and the lands are so beautiful my favorite being sumeru so far. I really recommend anyone who loves a good story to play this.

I haven‚Äôt been part of the Fanbase, and I haven‚Äôt been playing the game for a while, but there is a lot of skin color issues + diversity issues in the game, specifically the Sumeru update. As someone who is WHITE from levantine, almost ALL of the characters are based off harmful sterotypes, have lack of melanin, etc. I KNOW this company can properly represent the characteristics of someone based off a certain region GREATLY. For example, Yun Jin has great cultural rep. and she is overall a great character. I KNOW you guys can do the same for Sumeru, AND I KNOW you guys can give the characters more melanin especially if you already made characters with accurate representation. It‚Äôs never too late for a re-design, so please consider!

But there are a lot of issues with how they design new characters. I‚Äôve been playing this
game for almost two years and I‚Äôve sunk hundreds of hours farming artifacts, Primogems, and character materials. I reached ar58 like two days ago. But after seeing the new characters drip marketed for Sumeru, I‚Äôm legitimately disgusted by Hoyoverse. The fact that they can get away with representing a South Asian/Middle East/North African culture through pale, stereotypical designs is disgusting. Not to mention throwing in many diverse cultures into one pot, stirring it around, and spitting it out as one extremely orientalist culture is repulsive considering the SPECIFIC design elements that they used in Inazuma, Liyue, and Mondstadt. I‚Äôm extremely disappointed in Hoyoverse, and I hope this reaches the right people so it can fix some of these problems

The lack of representation for characters over the shade of paper is absolutely appalling. No matter how good gameplay is or storyline, in this year, I cannot accept a game with I believe currently 51 playable characters, only having two with darker skin tones. This is unacceptable in all honesty. The colorism this game has shown, especially with recent leaks for Sumeru, is so beyond disappointing. The new characters meant to drop within the next few updates are so disappointingly pale given that they are meant to be of Arabic/middle eastern descent. While I understand that there are people of all different shades in those regions in real life, I don‚Äôt believe that ALL the newer characters coming in currently should be pale, it is clear that this is due to prejudice against people of other colors and upholds views of white supremacy.

Dont let the fact that there is a gacha-like system scare you off. I got this game yesterday and havent been able to put it down. Its inventive combat system is both complex and easily grasped. All the game needs is ports to xbox and switch and cross saves across all versions (currently no ps4 cross saves cause sony....) and it could easily beat out some of the more popular jrpgs.

Also on steam for you pc users. Use this for playing on the go though.

So let‚Äôs start with the positives. Take the BOTW formula and make it faster and you have Genshin! This games quality is insane and I recommend it to anyone looking for a new game to get lost in! The combat is great and the world is full of puzzles to solve and the new co op event has blown my mind. As for the negatives: unlocking new characters requires the in game currency ‚Äú primogems‚Äù. I normally wouldn‚Äôt have a problem paying for add on characters but this game locks characters behind a lottery system! This is questionable game design and on top of that the chance to get a 5 star character is 0.6%  yes you read that right! Any regular person seeing these odds is sure not to spend a dime. If you‚Äôre looking for something fun to play you‚Äôve found it, just don‚Äôt open your wallet!

So I‚Äôve been playing this since day 1. Let me start from the beginning. I‚Äôve immense myself into playing this new game and fully experienced the excitement and fun in this game! It‚Äôs unbelievable how beautiful this game is.  I get totally consumed by the environment and story.  The controls are solid.  Gliding is amazing. This game is such an excellent game that it should be called an experience and a must play if you want to be part of the new generation of gaming. I never thought id get to this point on leaving a negative review. Dont get me wrong, the lore is well thought out, the characters and visuals are breathtaking, the mechanics are awesome, and much more. However, the way they are treating newer characters(namely the ones with darker skin tones, like dehya, cyno, xinyan, and candace), is horrible. I believe this is mainly on the kit creators part, but hoyo is also in the wrong for not doing anything about this. Dehya, the most recent character, has one of the biggest parts of the story, relatable background, great design, etc, has a VERY bad kit. We‚Äôve all seen the issues, from the multipliers, the intervals between the attacks, the cooldowns and downtime, and even the way you cant jump during her burst or it will cancel the burst. Seems like hoyo is waiting for this to die down and move on like nothing happened.

This game is amazing! From the breathtaking art style to the interactive open-world design, this game truly had everything anyone would want, for both casual and competitive players! The characters are not two dimensional, with most having captivating backstories, and many of their backstories linking together, which really adds to the attention-grabbing atmosphere to the game. 

Anyone can succeed when it comes to the fighting layout, even if you have no videogame experience! The gacha aspect of the game is really addicting, and has me crossing my fingers every time! It really makes me be on the edge of my seat, and I can find myself playing this for hours on end. 

One complaint is how long the app takes to load, and how much space it takes on my phone, but thats fine since its easily the only game I need! Overall, its an amazingly well-thought out action adventure, for all ages and preferences!

Ps:  Please re add Chongyun to the gacha feature, he is my favorite character!

Let me explain what I mean by well set up gacha. They really take the whole ‚Äúgacha‚Äù aspect the max like never before. A whole 35 levels before you actually realize it‚Äôs a very gacha oriented game where you will have to spend money to do end game stuff, otherwise you will be grinding for years. And even if you do the end game bosses, that‚Äôs really all there is to this game after the quests is bossing. There‚Äôs no pvp to keep it fresh, no raids, no losing your items if you die. Nothing exciting once you get past the flashy combat and first 35 levels. This company is very clever, they‚Äôre also trying to drag the main story out for years to come to make you feel like it‚Äôs more than just a gacha game and that it‚Äôs really building toward something. If you like bossing only, I highly recommend playing Monster Hunter instead.

Come on Mihoyo I just wanted a free Keqing is that too much to ask?

Also I Win To Lose (youtuber) did the math and Mihoyo would lose around 17k from the web events (where you submit art or cosplay or smth)

And I did the math (with a few assumptions here and there) and giving out a free 5* would lose Mihoyo near nothing:

1. Let‚Äôs say Mihoyo have a free 5* and someone picked Mona because they don‚Äôt have her. This would save that person from wishing on a hypothetical Mona banner that could happen one day (similar to the Keqing banner in 1.3) because even if I chose Mona then, I‚Äôd still lose the 50/50 and still maybe get Mona.

2. If they did this, this would reduce sales on a future Keqing, Jean, Diluc, Mona, or Qiqi banner. However, the Keqing banner back in 1.3 sold terribly and was meant as a filler banner due to cultural reasons and likely wouldn‚Äôt happen again anyways.

3. The Keqing banner sold less than 1 million in China I think (which is the only region Mihoyo cares about). This means Mihoyo would lose near nothing in the grand scheme of things since they‚Äôre a billionaire company by now.

So Mihoyo please just give me a free Keqing that‚Äôs all I ask.

Also if there‚Äôs anything left to trust in the Mihoyo company it‚Äôs Yu-Peng Chen to produce absolute fire tracks

One of the most successful gacha games thanks to its fans who, in turn, are shown zero appreciation on its own anniversary and are exploited for works of art and other promotions for crumbs and pennies instead. 

Aside from very greedy business practices, the game itself and experience could be so much more. While very fun in the beginning and full of charming characters, you will start noticing the tedious grind, lack of multiplayer features, and poor mechanics that guilt you for skipping a day of play. Eventually, you‚Äôll come to a point and ask yourself ‚ÄúWhat am I doing this for?‚Äù 

Be careful of how much money and time you invest into this game. It‚Äôs a gacha game in the end, and it will entice you to give more and more. As a long time player since October 2020, it‚Äôs a love hate experience at the moment. I‚Äôd recommend new players to pass on this game.

The game still gives you the resources to be able to try and get the characters and weapons you want, albeit not guaranteed, it‚Äôs still fun and challenging. Spending money for the chance to get certain characters and weapons are OPTIONAL if you really want it. Recommend this game to anyone and everyone!

I was so excited when I started playing Genshin. The art is incredible, the stories are engaging, and the characters are lovable. However, I‚Äôm extremely dissatisfied with the pricing and wishing system. You have to pay for a CHANCE to get a character you want. Call me crazy, but if I‚Äôm spending real money I want to actually get that character. You can‚Äôt get anything good from one single wish and that alone costs about $3. Usually, to get a five star character you have to do about 20 wishes, which will cost you about $60. Oh, but remember, you might not actually get the character you want. So essentially, you‚Äôre just gambling. My advice if you want to play the game? Don‚Äôt give them a single cent, stay free to play. If you pay, you‚Äôre wasting money.

TL;DR at the bottom. The story and characters are rich, the world vast and wonderful, and hidden gems are plentiful until level 30 where it suddenly becomes a constant grind. And this grind is not a finite one as one might believe, an entire week will get you next to nowhere unless you're willing to pay, gacha game and all that. To be quite frank, the game is amazing and then falls flat on it's face, confronting you with a Sisyphean task just to get the next bit of story, and that's not even mentioning the tens of hours one would have to put in to ascend (rank up, different from a level up) a single character once. TL;DR: Great game of near AAA quality if you love to grind or pay to win, otherwise I wouldn't really recommend it.

... it‚Äôs hard to navigate with a black screen.

Now, let me be clear. I love, love, love the set up of this game and I‚Äôm having a blast with the open world play. It‚Äôs not overly complex and I like the random side quests that pop up. The cooking feature is  fun too.

I can navigate about 1/2 the map with a spotlight surrounding the character, which works fine most of the time. And even when the screen goes completely black (aside from the controls) it isn‚Äôt impossible to move around provided you‚Äôve unlocked the map for that area. Which is ALSO possible to do with a black screen lol. The rain seems to trigger it in Liyue and surrounding areas.

However completing certain quests are nigh impossible. The Gliding Test and Stormterrors Lair: Empty Abode have ground my gameplay to a near stop. Since I can‚Äôt make any leeway on those I‚Äôve just been focusing on level grinding, which isn‚Äôt nearly as satisfying.

The only place I‚Äôve found that shows the full sky is near the Cryo Regisvine, south-east of the Temple of Wolf. Which is quite lucky really, because the view is lovely.

This game really is addicting, even if you are a free to play player. The consistent quests/grinding and the imagination of what you can do with the characters is endless! It really keeps the player engaged. This is hands down, one of the best games of 2020. The characters all have their unique personalities and backgrounds, it‚Äôs an open world that involves co-op, which also involves npc shops! Though the co-op isn‚Äôt necessarily beating the campaign with others, but beating the side quests others. Looking past that, I really enjoy this game and if I could spend money on this game, I definitely would. I look forward to all of the features and events that miHoYo gives us!

It‚Äôd be essay material to go into detail how how horrible this game is once past the honeymoon phase of early exploration and levels so instead short and concise. 
Minimal gameplay with gated resin (stamina) that refreshes slowly. The plus 40 to the cap does nothing except change time to cap resin from 16h to 20 hours. 
So much tied to this resin currency that even if you have luck in the rng Gatcha element, you need to use all you have to have them be mediocre on your team. Or just pay more money. Also pay money to roll another rng element of artifacts. Just roll roll roll and open those wallets! 
But yeah, could also just dedicate a months worth of log in dailies use up resin and repeat to get one character leveled and geared.  Considering there‚Äôs what? 24 characters? Guess you got two years of content to do on repeat then! 
Wasted potential.

I honestly expected this game to be like every other RPG on the app store--boring and money hungry--but I was pleased surprised with this one. This game is absolutely phenomenal, let me start off with one suggestion, after this one critique, the latter will all be on a positive note. Now that I have made my one and only suggestion, I can start to tell my true, transparent, deep love for this game so far.  I have played it every day since it‚Äôs release. If anyone is looking for a fulfilling game that will keep you up until 3 am, this is it right here. Don‚Äôt think about it, don‚Äôt hesitate. Just download it, you will not regret it.

i love genshin so much. i‚Äôve been playing since august of 2020 and it has been a blast. i‚Äôve definitely fallen out of it several times, but that is because of my busy schedule and not because the game is boring. most of the characters (especially female) are very stereotypical but they‚Äôre all quite interesting in their own ways. i do wish there was some variety (they have like three female base models for both npcs and playable characters), like maybe plus-size women or women with more proportionate sizing. despite all this, the characters‚Äô body types do not take away from the incredible gameplay. i do hope that hoyoverse/mihoyo adds a better primogem/gacha experience, as it is very hard to farm for primogems sometimes. i also hope that, in future lands, the chests have some variety and are not all common. i feel like since inazuma came out, mihoyo has limited the contents of chests by a lot. i do still love the game, despite its small annoyances. play genshin!

ive been playing genshin since release, played for an entire year but then took breaks inbetween for about 1-3 months(?). it got repetitive and boring since i kinda feel like the story isn't going anywhere and the event/content isn't really progressive. the events are kinda repetitive and similar to the old ones, so it's pretty boring for an old player. there isn't anything that's NEW NEW. not only that, it's so difficult getting primogems as well. i feel like genshin is turning into "play to win" now. not only that, since genshins regions are gigantic, and how much you'll have to farm and explore to catch up with the og players if you're new.. tbh i feel like genshins time has run out, everything's kinda repetitive and boring now, esp if you're f2p.

Genshin Impact is is a beautiful, breathtaking, and addicting game. It's so addictive that I sometimes have to stop myself from playing before I get burnt out. These characters are starting to feel less like characters with actual kits and then constellations as buffs and more like characters who were released half down with constellations as the rest of their kit.

Do yourself a favor? Skip downloading this hollow experience with zero story, foolish dialogue, weak characters, repetitive combat, pointless quests, boring crafting, and terrible voice acting. Anything good here is stolen directly from Breath of the Wild. The game‚Äôs popularity relies solely on players who either 1) miss playing Zelda so much that they‚Äôll accept a cheap facsimile or 2) have no experience with the vastly superior Zelda title so they think all the innovations of open world, combat, crafting, score, etc. originate here. I played over a hundred hours of Genshin, but yesterday I overheard *ten seconds* of the Zelda score and was instantly reminded that game is vastly superior on every level. I deleted Genshin immediately. It‚Äôs a neverending slog that eats your time, brain, and money. Instead of gambling $300 for an annoying child-boy character in a stupid green suit, spend that same money to buy a Switch + Zelda?

This game is insanely good, no matter what genre you enjoy playing. Story? Genshin has it. Puzzle? Genshin has it. Fighting? Genshin has it. Adventure? Genshin has it. Thanks for the beautiful free game mihoyo !

Firstly I would like to say that Genshin Impact is by far the best RPG that I have played, at least on an iOS Device, but the frustrating fact about the game, at leas to me is that it seems to like to kick me out of the game when I am in the middle of a quest, but one saving grace is that when I re-enter the game it usually doesn‚Äôt lose all of my progress within the quest, and it is not linked to one specific quest. Genshin has such a vast open-world with tons of little hidden spots to find. I love exploring nature in real life, but it was hard to go anywhere during quarantine. A lot of people will be quick to solely call this a gacha game and only value it as such, but it really is one of the best open-world games I have ever played. It‚Äôs also relatively easy for beginners at combat games to pick up. There is a lot more to it than gacha addicts care to talk about.

First off I‚Äôd like to say I gave 4 stars only because there is room for improvement like most games. But I currently don‚Äôt have any complaints besides more ‚Äúin game‚Äù shop option.

I am playing this on an iPhone 11 Pro Max currently.

-Graphics are really great! Colors are vibrant and details are well thought out.

-The option of 60 FPS is awesome! Hopefully even higher FPS in the next updates!

-Seems to be many character choices with various specialties. Such as Pyro type hero using spell book or a Pyro hero using a physical weapon.

-Open world seems to be decently vast, and your character can scale many different objects. 

I have played/play other games where you have a team of characters and a fairly open world realm. But this one tops those so far in many ways.

This game isn‚Äôt cluttered with an infinite stream of random chats popping up. It also doesn‚Äôt have a ton of ads for in shop items available to purchase all over the screen. 
So the screen stays fairly clean and visible. That‚Äôs a huge plus in my opinion.

Definitely worth trying it out!

I‚Äôm disappointed in how certain regions like Liyue and Inazuma are carefully researched and put a lot of effort to accurately and respectfully represent (mostly Han) Chinese and Japanese culture, but with Sumeru - a singular nation that turns Middle Eastern and South Asian cultures into a monolith - the characters from NPCs to other upcoming characters are not only shown to not show any sign of the cultures the region is based off of, but the bare minimum of showing darker skinned characters implicates that Hoyoverse can take the culture and aesthetics of South Asian and Middle Eastern culture while spitting at its people, messaging that darker skin isn‚Äôt valuable to them. 

With Hoyoverse pledging that they want to expand to global audiences, they need to understand that if they are to base elements of their game of cultures from other parts of the world, they need to treat those cultures and people with respect.

At first the game draws you in with its beautiful music, world exploration, and interesting characters. Then the hooks of the gacha system sink in at the end game, and the veil of something beautiful is torn away to reveal something toxic, greedy, and grabbing for your wallet. Mihoyo does not take any criticism and implement fixes in their game, they drip feed content, there‚Äôs no roadmap, and the end game is non-existent. This game has won multiple awards, the community has given so much to this game, yet Mihoyo gives back the bare minimum after becoming one of the most successful mobile games on the market. I‚Äôve dedicated too much time and money to this game, but with the lack of communication and transparency from its own developer it‚Äôs all a complete waste where the player is left feeling like just another number in their analytics and sales.

Mihoyo does not care about its player base only their profit. They do not care for player feedback. They release characters with broken interactions and don‚Äôt bother to fix it, they just change the tooltip to fit the broken interaction. Some old characters are very overpowered but they have been releasing characters that are comparatively average. How does that feel good as a player? Characters only become powerful when you spend $200 or more to upgrade them. Story also shows a lack of effort/rushed decisions. There are many issues with this developer and you should play something else before diving into it. It is sad because this game had a lot of potential, but after so many let downs the game is not going into a great direction. The player base is collectively frustrated

Minhoyo if a whole device platform isn‚Äôt able to play your game then why is it accessible to Apple? If all were going to get is this? I‚Äôm disappointed.

Genshin Impact completely raises the bar when it comes to mobile games.  While also launching on PlayStation 4, Nintendo Switch, and Windows, the mobile release provides the same, full experience.

The lovingly detailed graphics can be cranked to max on an iPhone 10 (other experiences may be different), and the music is extremely well done throughout.  Surprisingly enough, the English voiceovers are also quite competent (something that‚Äôs almost unheard of when it comes to anime style games).

Impressively, progression is stored in real-time.  Regardless of when the game is closed (aside from cutscenes), it will always resume at that exact location (along with every carried item) the next time it‚Äôs launched.

The vast, magical world features a massive amount of content already.  Exploring it is a joy, and I genuinely look forward to how it will continue to grow from here.

(Side note: Once the controller mapping and full screen resolution are fixed for the PC, I‚Äôll be continuing my adventures on there as well.)

Hi! I have been playing Genshin Impact for around a year now and it is my go to game when I am bored. For a quick way to sum it up, Genshin is an open world rpg that revolves both around story and combat alike. If you are a quick learner and financially responsible, 100% must download. It is very accessible to play, even for a person who doesn't spend money on games. I have spent around 100 dollars on this game, and I gotta say, that I don't regret a single dollar of that. The only way I would say that you SHOULDNT download is if you don't want to spend money but you are also easily influenced by things telling you to spend money.

I have this game installed on both my iPhone and my PC, and I gotta say, the experience feels native on both versions. The UI is easily transferred from mobile to desktop and the gameplay itself is nearly perfect. I would be hard pressed to say I wasn‚Äôt impressed with the quality. This isn‚Äôt just a port of a pc game on mobile, or vice-versa. This is a gaming experience built for each device it‚Äôs released on, and it‚Äôs stunning to boot. From the quests, to the world design, this game could very well be mistaken as the product of AAA development. Oh, and I love how I can play on my PC, and pick up where I left off on-the-go.

Yet there are a few cons to the game. you have to have a large Gigabyte iPhone, tablet, any device or you cannot play. it takes up 3GB once u download it. but once you do the whole thing it takes up about 15-30GB and it‚Äôs super annoying. Hoyoverse, please listen to your players. I love your game and i don‚Äôt want to leave but this has been such a disappointment. Do better

Overall, Genshin impact is an amazing game with great fighting mechanics and a great story. I absolutely love the characters and the ability to change them while in combat, or whenever else. I‚Äôve been playing Genshin since day 1. In the whole year I‚Äôve been playing, I‚Äôve missed 2 days. I really enjoy this game. But between working, and life in general, its getting harder to make it through content. Which means I‚Äôm missing out on events. I‚Äôm not the only one, new players are experiencing this as well. Please don‚Äôt lock events behind completing world quests. It makes it hard to really enjoy the game when you feel like you‚Äôre having to rush things in your spare time. This game isn‚Äôt meant to be rushed, you should be able to experience it at your own pace, and not miss out on rewards and materials. Please reconsider how events are done in the future.

I‚Äôd like to preface this by saying that I play the game every day, and I no longer play on mobile because the PC version is objectively better. I rerolled my account fifty times in March to get Hu Tao, and I‚Äôve played every day since. I haven‚Äôt spent any money on the game, so this will be from a F2P player‚Äôs standpoint.

Genshin Impact is the best gacha game that currently exists. It‚Äôs disguised as an open-world RPG, and for people who pull good characters, it‚Äôs just that. I was fortunate enough to pull Xingqiu and Zhongli, Hu Tao‚Äôs best supports, within two months of playing the game. If I didn‚Äôt have them, I probably wouldn‚Äôt still be playing. Without a good team, it‚Äôs unbelievably hard to progress quickly. And unless you spend money, you  basically need to play the game daily and do every event in order to get a good team.

And that isn‚Äôt all. The newer, non-rerun banners contain characters that you can‚Äôt even build until you progress through the story. In other words, it‚Äôs really hard to get into the game.

Take it from a gacha veteran. There are better ways to get entertainment than a daily grind, gamble-heavy, fake RPG. I‚Äôll continue to play, though. What a hypocrite I am.

The game it‚Äôs is AMAZING and really enjoyable. The graphics and controls are so good, hard to believe it‚Äôs on mobile. The story is great, and so is the combat system. Although‚Ä¶ the game doesn‚Äôt feel complete. I‚Äôd say some pvp or duel mode would be great since it could get a bit boring here and there. Everything else is perfect, Keep up the good work!! The game is great. You will have fun playing it unless you are someone that expects to be given everything. Those those are the ones that recently gave one star. 

The game gives free roaming around the world. You can do just the dailies and use your resin in about an hour however you can also get lost in the world for hours of gameplay. 

The game also can be multi player after Adventure rank 16. Up to 3 other players can join your world or you can join other worlds. There is no pvp which is a relief because not everyone wants that. 

You can easily play this game for free. The grind is not bad at all. With that being said this game is worth at least a normal game price with the content provided.

Genshin Impact is one of the funnest and most favorite games I‚Äôve ever played. The story is fun (and depending on your choices can be funny too) and the gameplay and controls are good. Don‚Äôt get me wrong, Genshin is a great game. It‚Äôs gorgeous, exciting, and fun. But some of the fun goes away after you reach a certain level. If you are a fan of anime products or anime games, this is a must-play. If you are a fan of open-world games with beautiful graphics, landscapes and music, this is a must-play. If you are a fan of RPGs, this is a must-play. Hell, if you are even a casual video game player, you NEED to try Genshin Impact. Excellent graphics, music, gameplay, and progression makes for a top-5 game of 2020, whether you play it on mobile, PS4, Windows, or otherwise. It helps to have good storytelling and co-op, too. If I had to nitpick, the game does drop frames at times, especially during drastic lighting changes, but I could hardly justify giving a 4/5 for something like that.

Genshin is one of my best games I‚Äôve ever played.

Genshin Impact is probably one of the best RPG games I've ever played. You can unlock new characters without having to spend money, there are new updates every few months with something brand new added to the game, like the Inazuma region or the new Fishing system, and the attention to detail is AMAZING. I have a few problems with it though, such as the anniversary rewards aren't what we(the players) wish it was, there are perks to playing on the PlayStation network that you don't get if you play on PC or mobile, and you can't purchase Genesis Crystals with a Visa gift card on PC. All in all, it's a great game, and I highly recommend it.

Genshin Impact offers good music, story, and for the most part characters (with the exception of recent characters such as Yoimiya that are underwhelming). However, to get access to many of these, it is required that the player spends at least an hour a day playing the game. While this would be fine if the rewards for it were worth it, they unfortunately aren‚Äôt most of the time. Pennies worth of in game currency are given for what is days of in game play time at times. Additionally, after playing for one year (>365 days) no notable rewards were given to players outside of what is normally provided in events. This is a greedy game in many ways and the company behind it does not seem to be trying to improve it. For either pay to play or f2p players.

There is a GUARANTEED legendary after 90 rolls‚Äî most gacha games don‚Äôt have a guarantee.

Also, you aren‚Äôt limited as F2P since this is an open world PvE game. People who spend money on the game will not affect you at all. Plus, the game gives you lots of opportunities to obtain characters! As long as you can control your own spending habits, you‚Äôll be fineee.

Hey! I played this game since near the start but quit after a while due to rl work and issues and other stuff to do. I came back and been playing I believe 8 months and so. Now I am nearing endgame and stuff. This game is pretty boring, I can‚Äôt lie. It just a repetition of doing commission and wasting to your resin and maybe doing battle pass and hop off. But also due to the recent news of china‚Äôs ccp, genshin might get censored a lot which is bad for a game with lots of potential and ideas. But also mihoyo honestly just doesn‚Äôt care anymore‚Ä¶ the anniversary was trash and they won‚Äôt even listen to the community based. I‚Äôll try to keep it short. The game is a lot of fun and can keep you busy for hundreds of hours. The gacha odds are punishing and the rolls are pricey but generally the characters feel worth it. I‚Äôve thoroughly enjoyed the game. 

All that said, don‚Äôt expect the developers to care much for you or the community. They‚Äôve demonstrated time and time again that they really don‚Äôt value their player base. The anniversary event was a joke and there are still glaring flaws in the game (resin, end game content, etc) that they won‚Äôt even comment on. 

Download the game if you need a fun side distraction but I wouldn‚Äôt spend money on it to support these developers.

I‚Äôve played since the game released last year, and I have loved it. The world building is beautiful, even on mobile, exploring the world of teyvat is an awe-inspiring experience. This world has been a refuge for me during the pandemic, and I‚Äôve made friends through a shared love of genshin. 

However, I am one of many players who feel a bit slighted by the lack of anniversary awards. With all the time, money, and energy that we‚Äôve put into this game, not getting anything as an anniversary reward feels really stingy. Mihoyo made BILLIONS on this game in a year, they can‚Äôt give us a single standard 5*? I‚Äôll update this review in the future if they step it up, but it is a good reminder that corporations don‚Äôt care about their customer base, even when the corporation created such a beautiful world for us to digitally enjoy.

Probably wait a few months for them to fix the worst bugs. Beautiful game, has a ton of potential to be even comparable to Zelda BOTW, however because it is so wildly incomplete some things become very frustrating. Here are just a few:
1. Bosses will sometimes disappear. You can‚Äôt see them and you can‚Äôt do damage to them until they glitch back in. When they do glitch back in, it is sometimes with a refilled health bar. 
2. The story is incomplete, so in order to make it seem like it is enough content, progressing through is painfully slow and barred by your ‚Äúadventure rank‚Äù stat that you can only upgrade quickly through hours and hours of gameplay or money. 
3. Free to play is heavily punished. I understand they need to make a profit, but if that‚Äôs true then put some cost up front. Don‚Äôt ever count on getting a five star character. 
4. Aiming arrow shots is broken, completely useless. Don‚Äôt aim yourself, rely on the auto-aim. 
5. You‚Äôll sometimes get stuck in the terrain which is especially frustrating mid combat.
Other than these main ones, the rest is ok.
Wait for the bugs.

So I‚Äôve played this for a few days. Good and fun game overall, characters are interesting and the mobs are fun to fight while also giving a good challenge. Why 4 stars? Myself and many other players suffer from a bug/glitch that hinders how far we can see, we can only see about 10-20 feet away from us and everything else is a dark abyss staring into your soul... and even worse, whenever you get wet, the water turns into ginormous black cubes that clings to your body which makes it really annoying. So good game, but Mihoyo needs to fix some stuff.

I stared playing Genshin about a year ago. I was almost immediately addicted to it. I have a huge problem particularly with the representation of skin tones in Genshin Impact.  Genshin Impact is a game that pulls a lot of inspiration from real world cultures and regions.  And yet, in a game with 48 characters currently and more upcoming, 46 of them are white skinned.  2 are mid toned.  There is zero black representation entirely. It is unacceptable. In leaks from the upcoming Egypt-inspired region, there will /maybe/ be two more mid toned characters coming.  All the others we know about are white skinned.  In a game as global as this that takes so much inspiration and makes so much profit from real people and cultures, it is not okay at all to have 99% of the characters white skinned.  I hope the devs will address this ASAP and change the designs of upcoming characters to give us many more mid and dark toned characters.

The sumeru characters are also extremely orientalist and have stereotypical and inaccurate designs, as if their main inspo was the ALADDIN movie..

And even if you dont care about the diversity, hoyoverse still refuses to listen to their community and doesn‚Äôt have anything to do once you‚Äôve basically beaten the game. WE NEED MORE END GAME CONTENT!!!! I‚Äôll change this to a 5* rating once they finally fix the diversity and actually does something about the stereotypes.

Currently, there are only 2 dark skinned characters in the entire game. Kaeya and Xinyan. There are only 2 out of 50 playable characters in the game. This is honestly extremely sad and disheartening, especially when the people of Sumeru are all extremely pale except for Cyno and Dehya. This is extremely sickening, especially since Sumeru is based off of Egypt, where a lot of darker skinned people are. It‚Äôs also sickening that the dendro archon looks like a whiter version of Paimon. There is also extreme inaccuracy with cultural clothes, etc. Hoyoverse, please listen to what your fans want. Everyone is upset with Tighnari being white, as well as every other white character in Sumeru. We all want representation for darker skinned people. Listen to what your consumers want before you start losing money.

Let me just say, Genshin Impact is a great game. With many characters to choose from, an amazing storyline, and it‚Äôs vast world and exploration, it‚Äôs hard to not like this game! However, there is a flaw that need to be acknowledged. 
In Genshin, there is a factor that allows you to ‚Äúwish‚Äù for weapons and characters depending on which banner you decide to wish on. However, a frustrating part of this factor is that there is a chance that you get the same character you have already. Just a recommendation, maybe lower the chances of getting a character you already own for more opportunities for new ones? This way you still have a chance to get the same character, it‚Äôs just not as likely. 
I don‚Äôt mean to hate on Genshin, it really is a beautiful game with amazing graphics. I was just bringing attention to a certain issue so it could possibly get fixed
Thank you for reading my review!

-Sophie ü§ç

I‚Äôve been playing this game since roughy March, and it was fun at first. But the more I play the more boring and chore-like it becomes.
In late game, the only ways to earn Primogems or Wishes are from things like Commissions, AR level ups, and exploring. And that is extremely discouraging.
One wish/pull is 160 primogems, daily commissions give you 60. You have to do three days worth of commissions to afford a SINGLE pull. And most of the time, you won‚Äôt even get anything good.
Not to mention their disappointing anniversary gifts. One event banner 10 pull and what? Some primos? Not to mention the contests where you submit your hard work for a SLIM chance at 100 primos. Like really? Less than a pull? I‚Äôd be better off doing commissions.
In short, the game is not at all rewarding, the company behind it is extremely stingy, and the player base does NOT deserve getting treated like interns when they‚Äôre the ONLY reason people actually want to play this game.
I can guarantee that the ads showcasing characters getting annihilated by Hilichurls aren‚Äôt enticing anyone.
Mihoyo, do better.

When starting the game is great overall. Wonderful characters music and a lot of stuff to do and explore. Design is also amazing. But unfortunately this is a gacha and the amount of summoning currency given out feels like its drip fed. Late game content is also barren and left wanting. Also 1 year anniversary rewards are basically non existent, which is disappointing to see since the community provides so much for this developer and they dont give much or anything for special events such as Christmas or easter or even their own anniversary. Other gacha games like Dragalia lost give out so many rewards for their anniversary like 380 free pulls, and they even have a much higher 5* drop rate. Mihoyo just feels like theyre sucking all of the good will out of their community with these latest anniversary ‚Äúrewards‚Äù.

An amazing game from start to right before 2.0, great characters, phenomenal music, the lore is unique and great. What went wrong? Poor writing, horribly designed limited event characters, and overall greed since 2.0‚Äôs release of Inazuma has led me to dread playing this game. The anniversary rewards are next to nothing for the continued support that made miHoYo into a billion dollar company. This as well as an overall lack of endgame content has led myself and many others to leave reviews like these on Genshin Impact. As someone who has played since launch it pains me to do this, but miHoYo won‚Äôt listen any other way. Overall their quality for new content related to writing has had a sudden nosedive and makes the environment, music score, and aestheic of the new area go to waste.

This fame definitely deserves 4 stars and higher. Great graphics, audio, quality, story, characters. Or add more ways to level up faster.

I own an iphone 8 so I‚Äôm limited to a short few minutes (<40 minutes sometime <30 min) before app closes by itself and the overheating issue even on the lowest graphical setting possible is annoying.

Battery drains significantly on my end.

Mats are grind-y and takes a while to gather for both weapons and chars leveling.

Resin locked loot is a bit of a hassle but deters from people playing ALL day to get a certain loot...unless they are a whale who‚Äôll throw down for resins.

Primogems for random weapons and charas you probably do(n‚Äôt) want. Can be used for reset/gain max resin.

Enemies become tougher when world level increase. Watch your adventure rank (AR) and lvl up wisely.

Bounties and the other newly added quest seems forceful to complete imo.

No controller support for iphone.

Everything else is fantastic.

tl/dr:
 iphone 8 force close and overheats still.
Battery drains fast. 
Resin is okay but restricted.
 Primos, primos, primos.
World lvl = enemy toughness.
Bounties and newer quest seems forceful imo.
No controller support as of yet.

Edit: finally there‚Äôs controller support but game still overheats and force close on Iphone 8

This game has many flaws, from the community to the overall experience.

First, limited time events. I know the concept is so people play during a certain time but come on. Most limited time events give more information about a character than in their actual story quest. Like for example, Albedo. Other than his story quest, we never see him and if you wanted to learn more about him, you‚Äôd have to have been playing during 1.2 or 2.3. There are also characters who only appear and are relevant in limited events (Xinyan and Fischl). 

Secondly, the thing raiding most reviews nowadays, lack of diversity. I think it‚Äôs pretty much self-explanatory, if you look at the characters.

Which leads to my final thing, the voice actors being verbally abused because of the characters they voice. This one is not exactly about the game itself but about the community (how do you even get this bad of a community in the first place?) the VAs have been sent threats because of characters play-styles and designs.

Although there might be people who dislike this game because of the rewards, I think it‚Äôs better they keep it like that. I mean, they have been putting effort into this game and trying to make it fun for players. I kinda wish that there isn‚Äôt a lot of toxic people and disgusting artists because it makes me uncomfortable whenever I see them in game, messages, and/or fanarts. I really hope this game has some form of fun so that new players will be able to experience them.    -An old player

This game is super fun, the characters are cool, however this game has serval problems with it. 
1. Mihoyo does not give enough premium currency for player to proper pull. This has been a problem for a while now.  Putting player in a bind to spend actual money to get the character they want. 
2. Characters who came out in early version are outdated and super weak compared to the newer characters. Amber and qiqi are on top of that list
3. The anniversary event is horrible. They did a web event where you get primos that aren‚Äôt even enough for a single pull and art competition where 10% of player could actually win something and it was $5 worth of primos or a new phone.

In general, this game largely starts out extremely compelling due to amazing exploration, and is visually one of the greatest games to ever grace mobile, but its gameplay loop becomes extraordinarily repetitive and grindy - which does not make a compelling or fun experience. 

To try to compensate, the developers went full Skinner‚Äôs Box on the situation, which admittedly is how a lot of gacha games work, but if you‚Äôre expecting anything more than a prettier gacha game, look somewhere else.

The combat is‚Ä¶acceptable, but deliberately limited to encourage the player base to pull more and more on the gacha, which makes the game feel very cheap and classless - its a bit like going on a 8 hour plane ride, and the flight attendants then come around asking for $5 for a set of peanuts.

The story definitely starts out fantastic, but it becomes apparent that the developers have no idea where they‚Äôre going or how to pace it, and probably weren‚Äôt prepared for the unexpected success they had.

A shame, really, because its obvious the developers have talent, but they don‚Äôt have the discipline to make an actually good game.

Seriously? They spend millions of dollars on hash flags on Twitter for flair and personal promotion. But they couldn‚Äôt spend nothing and let everyone pick one‚Ä¶ just one free 5 star character or weapon? I don‚Äôt even mind the logging in every day and putting effort into playing to get goals but the rewards is just one 10 pull that if you‚Äôre not in pity you‚Äôre going to get something you don‚Äôt need or want. If it was working to get a free 5 star it would be worth it. Right now? Nah. And the community raffles is just a joke for more promotion. The game doesn‚Äôt need more promotion. It‚Äôs got plenty already. Do better next time. I won‚Äôt be throwing any more money into this game unless there‚Äôs an apology or something is done about this joke of a one year.

There is some minor things I would like to suggest about.

 Multiplayer is great too, though I wish you can have more people join over.  I understand though if you can‚Äôt.

The pity system is kind of not balanced, getting a 5 star is difficult.  Then there‚Äôs the 50/50 chance to even get your desired 5 star.  I do wish it was a little easier to get characters or more primogems, or even make the pulls cheaper.

Lagging occurs, but of course in every game it happens, so I‚Äôll be lenient about it, high graphics and all.

I do wish this game the best, and I‚Äôll gladly continue playing!

Genshin impact is absolutely stunning with its plot line, music, and design for all of Teyvat and its characters. I think Genshin Impact is amazing and does deserve five stars for the review. If that would change, then I would have no other concern with Genshin Impact and the experience I get from it. I would recommend this game for anyone who wants a fantastic experience in the gaming world.

The only real flaw I see in this game is how the company dedicates each nation in the game to a place on earth, yet there is still a lack of diversity among playable characters. So many people have asked for darker skinned characters but instead we‚Äôre greeted with very pale skin. Whiter than paper. If a company can put so much effort into characters like Yunjin, do the same with the Sumeru characters. Also, some of the Sumeru character designs depict harmful stereotypes. It is not hard to give melanin to characters especially if enemies have much darker skin than playable characters. If this doesn‚Äôt change, there won‚Äôt be a lot of people playing this game. The ones that are won‚Äôt be good people and they‚Äôll just give this game a bad rep.

After playing this game for over a year, I am incredibly disappointed in the lack of diversity as more characters and regions continue to be introduced. As of now, there are over 40 characters and yet only 2 are confirmed to have ‚Äútan‚Äù skin. Hoyoverse has continued to show that they value profit over representation and is using the cultures of predominantly brown cultures at the expense of depicting their people accurately. Currently, in-game NPCs from the country based off of the middle east and africa (also possibly SE asia) are entirely white in skin color and the company appears to be continuing this trend with the region‚Äôs characters. This is unacceptable from a company that explicitly stated that it valued diversity and representation. Seems they‚Äôre just too scared to do so properly when it involves non-white characters.

I used to love the game but now, I despise it. Its very addictive, and if I didn't stop myself, there would probably be many problems regarding to in real life. This is a good game. I enjoy my time while playing (mostly on PC) and the characters and controls are quite fun. It has support for Bluetooth controllers like Xbox, which is really nice. That being said, it does have its issues. 

It feels like acquiring 5-star characters is unnecessarily difficult. The cost is just too much to reach pity. Being able to earn a character through another type of grind would be nice. And likely increase engagement with the game. 

End game content is kind of dry. Which again, lowers engagement. I want more to do when the story content is finished until the next story update. But it's just not there. 

Some functionality could be fixed. I shouldn't have to be logged in on my phone to make purchases in-game. My account is still the same. So why do I have to remain on the platform I purchased the game on just to buy something?

Again, the game is good. But I think addressing these problems would make it great.

it has amazing visuals and effects even when the settings are turned down really low! it has a great story line and characters and ive gotten emotionally attached to quite a few now- the monsters and bosses are really fun to fight, especially when figuring out elemental reactions. my phone struggles with running the game so sometimes it crashes, but its a really big game and the crashing doesn‚Äôt bother me that much. i can honestly stay up for hours just playing this game if i didn‚Äôt have anything to do. definitely get it if youre able to!

This is one of the best games to come out in a very long time, the graphics, items, dungeons and music are amazing. The open world adventure with treasure around every corner and battles to be fought in every camp, cave or dungeon‚Äîlove it! 

The resin system moderates the progress of some players in the community who want to skip to god mode and burn worlds down. But the resin system, as annoying as it is sometimes, is the best answer in a game of chapters. 

This game just hit chapter two, players can now access Inazuma and learn more about Raiden Shogun, Sangonomiya Kokomi, Koju Sara and the vision decree. There are more than 10 chapters planned and it took a year to get through the first two chapters! 

Large file size game but best in genre, the developers have a knack for hitting the players with surprising content out of the blue. A lot of people were upset with them at the one year anniversary, but that‚Äôs our world, greedy and entitled for no reason‚Ä¶

Other people at this time are leaving genshin for cookie run and leaving bad reviews, but those people are just greedy for rewards. They just want characters. I‚Äôve spent some money on the game already, so I‚Äôm not leaving this game any time soon. I think the anniversary rewards are actually decent. And I hope people know that you can do perfectly fine without any other characters. I challenged myself once to make a team with the four starter characters and use that for a week. It went really well. And I love exploring the world of genshin impact.

Pros: 
1. Music - the score perfectly captures the chill, open world adventuring spirit 
2. Huge open world to explore 
3. Graphics are nice 

Cons: 
1. Combat - crowd control from elemental reactions usually goes against the player as you are constantly smashing your space bar to be unfrozen or free from yourself from a bubble, flying across the battlefield off the end of an enemy shield, and electricity stopping you from getting a single attack in. On top of crowd control, you need certain characters in order to get past enemy shields, and those characters can be hard to get unless you spend an arm and a leg. 
2. Your NPC companion ‚ÄúPaimon‚Äù is 100 times more annoying that Navi. She has an incredibly high pitch voice, tracks about herself in the 3rd person, and has the maturity level of a 5 year old. 
3. The rewards are a joke.
4. Characters are incredibly hard to get, as the reward system is crap and every new character is only available for a limited time. Once their banner is done you can‚Äôt get that character again.
  
TLDR: bad combat + Annoying companion + greedy devs = bad game

The world is super huge and there‚Äôs so much content to find for free. Not to mention, they release new content every month or so with small events in between.

There‚Äôs no pvp elements, so it isn‚Äôt pay to win. You can pay money to progress faster or get characters easier, but you can get by with the starters, and the story quests give you premium currency to spend on characters.

I highly recommend. It takes patience to progress, but there‚Äôs also ways to spend time grinding to keep you busy between releases.

Mihoyo has made an amazing game, but Is extremely greedy. After doing story quests, things can get a bit boring quite fast. Sure grinding in the game can be fun, but I also want more content to play and do. And things like commissions and events don‚Äôt give you as many primo gems as they should. 
The anniversary rewards are also EXTREMELY disappointing. Many players I club ding me have spent 100+ on this game, and we get 10 wishes?? That‚Äôs it?? For bearing through the boring content, and paying money towards YOUR game, YOU are being EXTREMELY HREEDY AND RUDE. Mihoyo no longer cared for their fan base, they only care fir money, even though they have ALL THE MONEY THEY NEED. Giving away something such as a free five standard star is NOT going to ruin your money and sales, if anything it‚Äôll bring more people TOWARDS YOUR GAME.

first off, it's important for me to mention: i love genshin impact. i've been playing it since launch and have invested a lot of time & money into it. however, this is no longer a matter of liking the game or not. the devs behind it are extremely money-hungry and ungrateful to the players who have brought this game so much success. we as a fanbase are reaching the end of our ropes. we're sick of having our feedback ignored, sick of watching the devs grow more and more money-hungry with each update, and sick of back-to-back underpowered 5-stars who are extremely hard to obtain without spending money. those who pay for the game are no longer getting their money's worth, and free-to-play users are no longer getting their time and effort's worth. i've seen multiple genshin content creators quit the game within the past few weeks alone, and this trend will only continue if we continue to be sidelined and ignored. i need this company to do better, and i feel the only way they will listen is if we hit them in the wallet or app store rating. don't give this game your valuable time unless the devs step up and start caring about their community.

The way you unlock characters is through random selection pay wall. There is no way to actually buy certain characters. This practice should be illegal. While there are certainly good aspects about the game, MiHoYo seems to have shown they care very little about player feedback.  The most minimal of changes have been made to the resin system, and primogems are still very hard to acquire as a f2p player.  Furthermore, the newest character released ZhongLi is vary aggressively mediocre to outright bad in the current meta and has 4 different mechanics gated behind obtaining duplicates of his character.  When a limited time character costing $360 requires 6 copies to be passable and the developers aren‚Äôt even willing to buff him despite many many parts of the fan base complaining, there is clearly something wrong with the game.  I am only leaving this review because I really hope this game will become more generous and respectful to the fan base.

10. So many options! (Cooking, recipe collecting, artifact hunting, dungeon grinding, playing through the story quest, meeting people, or just exploring. The real mvp is the guide, 10/10.

I see a lot of people having 2 main complaints here.
1. Takes up too much storage
2. Breath of the Wild ripoff 
Firstly, LOOK AT THIS GAME. It‚Äôs so gorgeous and beautiful and over all well-made what do you expect??? I‚Äôm pretty sure there‚Äôs some way you can deleted packages though, like if you downloaded multiple voice-overs you can delete the ones that you don‚Äôt use, which saves a lot of storage. The graphics are clean, the music is just a collection of masterpieces, and the voice acting is amazing. Taking up a lot of storage is expected!
Secondly, do you know what a ripoff is?? Do you see traced images of Zelda characters in the game? Do they have the same plot-line and lore? Do they have a similar art style? Does Zelda have a gacha system? No. Even Genshin is obviously inspired by BOTW, it‚Äôs NOT a ripoff. I love both Genshin and Zelda and I hope people can stop pitting the games against each other.
Anyway, love Genshin. The end :D

This game is truly amazing words cant even describe how much enjoyment and content is packed into this game. Recommended for anyone who likes fantasy, anime, and/or open-world games. Two things need to be known 
for this review to make sense.
1. I also play Honkai Impact and have for a while now. The game runs relatively smoothly and has settings that drastically drop the quality of graphics allowing my phone to run it without crashes or significant lag.
2. I have an IPhone SE. The first gen. 

My issues with this game come from 1 thing. The lag. I have the game at the lowest custom settings yet it still crashes. I experience lag whenever I open a new menu, or move to a new area. I closed everything else, am on a good network, and even turn Bluetooth off. It still is absolutely abysmal. I think it would be nice if there was a way to stop my phone from trying to load all the grass and other stuff which doesn‚Äôt impact the plot or questing aspect of the game. Copying your other games ability to lower character quality would be nice as well. I would rather have the game run smoothly and look worse than look perfect but barley run.

preface: pros definitely outweigh cons, but i‚Äôm gonna be gearing more towards criticism in this review 

pros first: 
-it always manages to reveal and pleasantly surprise me with so much more content right when i think im almost done exploring the game, and ive been playing for a while 
-constant big updates 
-characters!
-visuals are amazing, especially at watatsumi island. i was blown away
-it‚Äôs a huge game with so much attention to the little things
-there are sweet heartfelt moments but also unexpectedly dark elements; i love it
-it‚Äôs a free to play that still gives players the whole game experience without needing to empty your wallet to get somewhere 
-much more?? 

cons:

- i think there‚Äôs a drastic increase in difficulty from world level 3 to world level 4. there are some quests that are literally impossible without spending weeks on the game just to get your characters strong enough to beat them 
-new update is not rewarding enough. although the chests have more primo gems, if you do pull anything with primogems from the gacha system theyre essentially useless if you have less to upgrade them with. i can get much better rewards in monstadt and liyue with 2x less difficulty 
-needs better clues on quests
-  this is small but i find really weird; boars just running into objects/obstructions and then fading out

-last but not least: anniversary rewards.. please compensate

As a genshin player, i have played many other gacha games. so many different gacha games have amazing anniversary awards‚Ä¶ genshin giving us 10 rolls only and they didn‚Äôt even call it the genshin anniversary. the company that has made over a billion within half a year still refuses to give players a decent reward for enjoying and supporting the game. i have spent at least $200 on genshin and the lack of new content is creating a burnout for me and many other players. But the main issue is the anniversary and the lack of rewards for their loyal players. the lander rite festival event had better rewards than the anniversary itself somehow. mihoyo needs to up their game to keep their player base because a lot of players are gonna stop playing from the lack of anniversary rewards itself.

This is an absolutely fantastic free to play game that serves up a dynamic and fulfilling experience whether you have zero or hundreds of dollars to spend each month.

The sweet spot is about 15 dollars a month, by buying the blessing of the elkin moon (5 dollars for a daily dose of the in game premium currency), and 10 dollars every 6 weeks for the premium battle pass rewards.  You can spend more than this, but if you don‚Äôt care about collecting every character, there‚Äôs really no need to do so.

In the late game, be prepared to grind if you want to max everything out, but personally I find the gameplay loop to be so enjoyable that the grind feels more like a feature.

Currently, the game has an incredibly active schedule of events that keeps even maxed out endgame players like me busy and engaged, and hungry for more.

Whether you have the occasional 15 minutes or hours of daily playtime available, this is a must play.

I really enjoy playing Genshin. It scratches that RPG itch i‚Äôve been trying to get for years. The only thing that keeps turning me off from actually achieving things is the arbitrarily suffocating, quite pointless and frankly disgusting amount of unskippable dialogue throughout every aspect of the game. You can‚Äôt escape it. Its around every turn, with every quest. The conversations drone on for punishingly long durations, to the point where I‚Äôd rather be getting 30 second Mesothelioma ads. I spend more time sitting here tapping away skipping cutscenes and character conversations that lead nowhere, than I do actually playing the game.

Everything going fine until I hit AR40 and they increase the World Level to 5 (with no warning, otherwise I would have changed my strategy)and all the monsters go up to like level 70+ while my characters are stuck in the 60s, which has made everything practically impossible to complete, which means I can‚Äôt even build up the materials to level up my characters, because everything kills me. So I‚Äôm basically stuck after investing so much time and money into this game, which is really not cool.

I recommend this game highly, especially if you are a fan of rpg, anime, and free roaming games. It‚Äôs styled a lot like Breath Of The Wild to be real, but takes its own twist in the mix. I enjoy how it‚Äôs laid back, and not super grindy. One thing I wish they‚Äôd add was some sort of animal to ride and tame. It would make traveling a lot easier, especially with what little stamina you can have and make it a little more of an easier process. Over all, this is my favorite game at the moment, and will definitely be getting it on Switch if it ever gets on. üíõ

I‚Äôm not even talking about the summoning system, I‚Äôm talking about just the general gear and upgrade material system. And if you actually manage to get the pieces you need with the right sub stats, if they don‚Äôt roll correctly you are out all of your resources- mora and artifacts. Other hero collector games like Epic Seven make it easy to grind and gear many characters while Genshin is an absolute nightmare in this department. It is massively un-user friendly when it comes to gearing units for a game with no real end game content other then‚Ä¶ gearing units. Epic FAIL.

I dont care what anyone says, Genshin Impact can do better. The colourism in the game is showing. Sumeru, based on south asia, where it tends to have a better skin tone variety. There are only two characters with some pigment. The character ‚ÄúCandance‚Äù is supposed to be based on a African queen and shes lighter than Xinyan, a character mixed with black and asian. Candance should be many shades darker. Hoyoverse obviously has the time and work to research cultures and put in effort, but it seems they only do it for characters with a lighter complexion. The game is greatly animated and the story is semi unique dont get me wrong. But at this point the racism is blatant. Be mad over this review or dont, but they can do better.

As a persian, I hate how Sumeru is based off of the middle-east but somehow the people who design the characters fail to put any representation for darker skinned characters. Out of the 51 characters in genshin currently, 2 of them have slightly darker skin. Nilou‚Äôs design was a good idea but you drastically stereotyped her. You maybe put the slightest bit of effort to research Persian culture and their language to design Nilou but it‚Äôs still a stereotype when you put her in traditional clothes and she doesn‚Äôt even look like she‚Äôs Persian. I don‚Äôt see why you couldn‚Äôt make her skin the slightest bit darker? I know some middle-Easterns are pale but there is darker skinned ones too. Also, why is there no darker skinned npcs? Hoyoverse, you better start being more representative if you intend to include different cultures.

I‚Äôm extremely disappointed with some of the character‚Äôs design. As Sumeru leaks are coming out all of the new characters are a pale pasty white. Sumeru is based off Egypt, and it disappoints me that the characters are super pale, rather than at least tan or brown. What disappoints me even more is that even the darkest characters we have, Xinyan and Kaeya, get white washed in official art and have racist stereotypes played onto them as their character. What confuses me is that Hoyoverse can do a great job at representing the cultures that the Nations are based off of (for an example, characters like Yun Jin) but they can‚Äôt make a few characters darker? It makes me sad to see that they prefer the  light skin on EGYPTIAN characters üòï I‚Äôm just not excited to play this game anymore

I have a love/hate relationship with Genshin impact  at this point. On the one hand, I am absolutely enthralled with the exploration, characters, and story of this beautiful game. On the other, there has been no endgame development since launch, a good portion last few characters have been disappointing, and almost all decisions made since the release of inazuma have been for the negative. It feels like Mihoyo has stopped listening to the cries of their player base which is disappointing considering their previous attention to meticulous game balancing and reward distribution. Sadly, it seems that this trend will continue if nothing is done. I truly do want this to be a game I‚Äôm able to enjoy for years to come, and I hope that the talented devs at mihoyo can realize what‚Äôs going wrong. Cheers

There are so many great aspects of Genshin, and what few downsides there are I barely notice. The Dev team seems to take feedback seriously, and the 1.2 update addresses lots of the issues the player base has had. The world and art is beautiful, the combat flows smoothly and each character feels different to play, the stories are funny and compelling, and even the most common enemies are unique instead of the bog standard giant spiders every other fantasy world has. At Adventure Rank 42 I‚Äôm still loving the game and motivated to keep exploring. Come join us in Teyvat!

This is by far one of the most visually captivating games- their attention to detail is amazing! Characters are interesting, story is interesting, weapons are cool. There are only two gripes I have:

1. It takes a ridiculous amount of time and effort to level up in rank. It gets really cumbersome and makes gameplay more of a chore than an enjoyable experience. 

2. They‚Äôre not always clear on rules or limitations. I bought a Battle Pass thinking it would stay for the rest of my gameplay and the countdown was for the available weapons. Nope, the $20 and the countdown was for helping reach rank but after the countdown you would start from scratch and need to pay $20 again if you wanted a boost. Idk if that was clear, but it was pretty lame. But even on some of the newer side quests, they‚Äôre not always very clear on what is expected.

All that said, I would STILL highly recommend the game. :)

Put simply, this is what I expected when I played Honkai Impact 3, and what it tried to accomplish is some regards

The world is so expansive, I nearly got lost during the tutorial, and that's a good thing! It shows how much effort was put into making this game as open world as possible. 

My only complaint is that, at least in the early game, there's no mid ground in traversing the landscape. You are either doing a leasurly jog or teleporting across the map with way points, but the game is so beautiful and full of extra content that there's always something to do while you explore and travel

I love genshin,  played it for a few years at this point,  but the pity system failed me.  I was on 55 pity as I‚Äôve counted. The weapon banners pity can only go 80,  right? Well,  minus 45 and I only need about 35 more wishes till I‚Äôd get my 5 star weapon,  right? Thank you so much HoYoVerse, for developing this wonderful game! ‚ò∫Ô∏èüíï

I‚Äôve been playing this game on and off since October of 2020, and honestly seeing how this game turned out really upsets me.

I think I‚Äôll start with a more personal, smaller gripe of mine; travel. Why is the only two modes of travel (not including swimming/boats) walking or waypoints? This game isn‚Äôt the funniest to explore and I think things like horses or mounts would be really beneficial to this game and I can take everything in a lot better!

Genshin offers an open world exploration that I can‚Äôt find in any other mobile game.
