This game is a blast, great graphics, great combat system, and a pretty great story to go with it. 

The two biggest problems (at least in my opinion) are the gacha system and the amount of storage the game takes up. 

The gacha system makes it very challenging for free to play players to get the character they want. With only around a .06% chance of getting a 5 star character the game basically forces you to make 90 wishes and get the soft pity where it gives you one of the 5 star characters you want. And even then, if you get the one you don‚Äôt want you need to make another 90 wishes before getting another pity. With how long it takes to grin wishes you‚Äôre pretty much required to pay money to get a character. 

The other problem is the storage. The game itself is 3.42 GB. That‚Äôs not too much for how great of a game it is. But currently, the game takes another 14 GB of space in data. I‚Äôm not even super far into the game yet but it‚Äôs still taking up almost a third of my available storage.

I‚Äôm not at that stage yet, but I can already tell since the world got really empty once I completed the Mondstadt Archon Quest. Also, certain bosses like the Oceanid has too many ‚Äúhit you no matter what you try‚Äù attacks, which is incredibly frustrating if there‚Äôs a bunch of crows keeping you in stun-lock. I hope this game gets major improvement, it‚Äôs so good, but seems too against the player sometimes.

I‚Äôve played almost every mobile RPG there is and this is the first one that is indistinguishable from a console or PC game.

Genshin Impact made the smart move to avoid auto play features. I have deleted every game that uses auto play.

Also, there is no pay to play. I am enjoying the full version of the game entirely for free. I would happily pay $5 or more for this game.

I am leveling up based on game xp and not paying them. I love that they avoid micro transactions and p2p.

The controls are great as well. A bit rigid at times, but nothing that effects the game play too much.

The story and graphics are next to none. Incredible voice acting and a vast in depth story. 

It‚Äôs challenging as well. I‚Äôve died multiple times before figuring out how to fight certain bosses and it forces you to do the side quests to level up or some bosses are too much. 

If you like fantasy RPGs, this is the best mobile game you can possibly download and it‚Äôs entirely free.

i loooove the story of Genshin Impact. It feels like a complete anime story. I like the assortment of characters, and they way the story makes you feel fall in love with them. 

that said, i haaaate the fighting control. the control limits my view on where i am going, and if the battle is happening near trees, it obscures the view. i guess that‚Äôs why they made healing really easy by letting the player pause and get food.

another thing that i hate is the archers controls. i try to aim, but then when i adjust the aim, i accidentally press the aim button so i lose the aim mode. this has gotten me into trouble several times especially in boss fights.

but the story is soooo good, and the graphics even at low setting is fantastic. i also love the glide mode and some small puzzles where you try to figure out what should be done in one situation, then later you find put that you did this before, ie time warp. Thank you so much for making this available as free to play!

Zhongli was advertised as a shield builder that could also dish out ‚Äúenormous damage‚Äù according to one of their trailers.  Sounded fun to me, so I spent money and got the character (pity, of course).  After many people tested out the character it was found that his damage dealing was lacking, and people complained en mass.  Mihoyo then released a statement that the character was intended to be a tank.  I felt cheated out of my money and will not spend anymore on this game.  Also, be careful of your account, the games security is very poor, despite the company making record profits, they have not acknowledged this problem, and have not released a statement about plans to upgrade.  Such mismanagement of a potentially great game.  Stay away!

this game is good obviously, but theyre treating sumeru like one sick joke. obviously its a fictional game, but each area is based off of the actual earth. its no secret that sumeru was suppost to be in parallels with south asia/middle eastern area. still having a couple white characters is fine, since not all natives are dark, but the entire cast is pale white except for a FOUR STAR that is ‚Äúlightly tanned‚Äù. the archon especially shouldn‚Äôt be white, and the game creators/developers know that. even the dori girl that was leaked, not only is she extremely white (lighter than diona) but she is a stereotype against south asians (her leaked idles revealing that she is a ‚Äúscammer‚Äù type character) and has an orientalist design. this company is big enough to push back the release of sumeru and at LEAST fix some of the characters skin tones.

I have played this game for over a year and I‚Äôm still not bored of it, very fun and great story quests and characters, however what the heck mihoyo. With the new region coming out, Sumeru (based on culture from the middle east) I simply cannot stress enough that they are whitewashing the characters to the point that they are whiter than some of the actual Europeans in this game (from Mondstadt). Adding on to this, one of the new characters leaked (by reliable sources) Dori, has a stereotypical genie theme, being as she is one of the first characters coming from Sumeru, Mihoyo really glanced at the middle east and thought, ‚Äúgenie.‚Äù Not to mention she‚Äôs whiter than snow. The representation of middle eastern countries and culture needs to be FIXED. Please do more research.

As we all know each of the regions are based off different places in real life. Sumeru specifically is based off of Southern Asia and the Middle East both of these areas have people with more darker skin colors. So it would only make sense for characters from Sumeru to have darker skin colors. Yet, based off the information we have (leaks, npcs, the comics etc.) the characters from Sumeru are pale. I‚Äôm honestly so disappointed in this game. The amount of research and detail put into places like Inazuma and Japan and Liyue and China only for Sumeru to be completely stereotyped and inaccurate. Of course when it comes to creating fantasy nations it doesn‚Äôt need to be 100% accurate but when its something as big as inaccurate Skin colors it becomes a problem.

Before I begin, I love Genshin. I love the graphics, the story, the characters, and the inclusion of real world cultures like Mondstat-Germany and Liyue-China. The thing that holds this game back is the gacha. I understand that the gacha is how Mihoyo makes money, but the rates are horrendous and the amount of primogems given out is hilariously low. Many other gacha games out there have sparking mechanics which can guarantee a character after a certain amount of summon. Other gachas are much less stingy, giving out lots of free summons. Other gachas have better rates than Genshin. Examples included like Fire Emblem Heroes. I love the game, but the gacha is disappointing.

This game is flawless in almost every way. Unfortunately even making millions in its first year, they give us a anniversary that is worse than the start up rewards. Lack of true endgame content, once you hit AR 55 be prepared to grind exp for months between AR rank to receive one measly wish. The only "endgame" is abyss and even once you are able to 36* it leaves nothing of value to do. Theres nothing to co op with your friends for since everything is already pathetically easy to beat by urself (or even faster on your own because of how co op enemy HP/DEF scaling works). No, I'm not a whale either, I've simply played this game for nearly a year and all my characters are overpowered at this point. Also on top of that the company is stingy and has a lack of gratitude towards the people who do free promo in the form of artwork, cosplays, fanfiction, or even simply discussing the game.  They need to do better.

Everything in regards to the game itself is at least fine or great for a gatcha game. It‚Äôs best played in short durations of about half an hour toward the end game. Do that and you‚Äôll enjoy the game itself. 

But, I wrote this review mainly because of how the managers of Genshin is handling the game. So many issues, so many complaints, and at this point I don‚Äôt think people care about the anniversary rewards or if those things get fixed. It‚Äôs just the lack of respect toward the community by refusing to acknowledge any of the problems, some of which have been plaguing the game for a year. 

The radio silence between the management team and the community really kills any enthusiasm to play. It seems like a PR disaster and I can‚Äôt imagine who or why they insist on ignoring every problem.

I‚Äôve played several gachas and this anniv‚Äôs rewards pale in comparison to the others. It honestly feels like Mihoyo doesn‚Äôt listen to community anymore. Lately, the quality of the game has been going downhill and somewhere along the way, they seem to have lost their magic with this game. Several characters have issues with their kits that the community has expressed but Mihoyo has turned a blind eye to. The story-telling has fallen hard in quality, this Inazuma patch felt so rushed. I‚Äôm sure Mihoyo is aware of the community‚Äôs frustrations and displeasure with the 1st anniversary rewards, but they insist to stand their ground. Nothing really feels special about this anniversary, nothing to commemorate for. Everything has to be shared for rewards which is not right

If Mihoyo had more timely and in depth announcements, players wouldn't have to turn to leakers in order to keep their interest in the game. I just wish Mihoyo would learn to be less greedy and more generous toward the community. I truly do wish I could give the game 5 stars, but until Mihoyo address their greed, my review will have to stay at 1 star.

Words cannot describe how much I enjoy this game! I just cannot stop playing it, every bit of it is so exciting. It definitely has that ‚ÄúBreath of the Wild‚Äù style feel to it, but with a more variety of characters to choose from. Along with a great story, loads of side quests, and plenty of monsters to fight to keep players on their toes, the possibilities are endless.

The game also has this anime-like feel in my opinion! I can almost imagine them making an animation like series, if it keeps going well.

For a free game (yes there are IAPs), the amount of open and accessible content is absolutely mind-blowing.  The graphics are stunning.  The world has a ton of depth.  The storylines are interesting.  Hours and hours of fun.  There are enough leveling subsystems in the game to feel like you have choices in how to progress (weapons, characters, gear, talents) but not so much it‚Äôs overwhelming.  Travel markers make it quick and easy to get around as you explore the map, which is a really nice quality of life feature for completing things in different areas of the (expansive) map. Highly recommend this game.

There are two major things that made me quit this game.

The first one is that the higher you level up, the harder it is to do really anything. I understand that‚Äôs the point, but it simply isn‚Äôt the same experience anymore from when I first started and enjoyed everything.

I love everything about this game. The story, the characters, and the beautiful environments are of a consistent quality you can‚Äôt find in other games! The community is also a lot of fun because Hoyoverse puts a lot of effort into their Hoyolab app, promoting artists, etc. Now that I‚Äôve been playing for over a year and I‚Äôm still excited for every new event and update, I‚Äôm convinced I‚Äôll be playing until the end!

Hoyoverse communicates poorly with their players and hardly makes any changes based on the players feedback unless it‚Äôs affecting them negatively (monetarily). One of the changes they refuse to make is adding more skin tones and culturally appropriate attire for their POC characters. There shouldn‚Äôt be 3 tan skin characters out of 50 if the newest region, Sumeru, is based on the Middle East and SWANA cultures. (All the NPCS are pale too. ) Not to mention all the tan skin characters are only four stars (lower in rarity) compared to their paler counterparts. Hoyoverse does also have a track history of bad darker skinned representation such as Carol and her mom from Honkai impact. And as a POC person, I am uncomfortable playing knowing majority of the characters that share my skin tone are egregious stereotypes or created shallowly.

I am writing this review in the midst of the first anniversary uproar. The developer is making a strong effort to recruit new players with multiple hashtag icons on Twitter and numerous paid advertisements on different platforms, but all they are offering to the players who have supported this game for a year is ten free wishes. This ‚Äúreward‚Äù is a pittance, especially when they gave more generous rewards for the Lantern Rite Festival event. They give more generous rewards in the other two primary games they are running. Where is the motivation for older players to continue to support the game? Where is the effort to retain older supporters? I spent money on this game, and I don‚Äôt feel like they care. All they want are more users. They don‚Äôt care about the ones they already have.

This game is SOOOOOOO stingy with their rewards. They have about 30+ MILLION active players and for the anniversary they give us 3k mora and 100 primogems. Those aren‚Äôt even enough for a SINGLE WISH. The players give mihoyo free advertisement, cosplaying, promotions, etc‚Ä¶ and get virtually NOTHING in return. If you want a good game similar to this one, I recommend Cookie Run. They give you so many free gems and you‚Äôre able to get so many new characters just from logging in for a day. Genshin impact is by far one of the worst if not THE worst game I‚Äôve ever played in the apple store. Mihoyo made over 3 MILLION DOLLARS in Ei‚Äôs banner ALONE, yet they STILL refuse to give us at least at free 10 pull? It wouldn‚Äôt cost mihoyo ANYTHING to give the players a free ten pull or 5* character. Genshin impact is the WORST STINGY GAME EVER. DO NOT PLAY IT.

All gacha games are predatory by nature but this one takes the cake. When compared to other gacha games, the in game currency is expensive and does not go nearly as far. This game is also no where near as generous for holidays and events as others despite their profits.  Overall, this aspect is extremely disappointing but is not the only reason for the 1 star. 

The game started out with a strong and interesting plot and characters that somewhat made up for the gacha aspect but their recent content is rushed at best and full of holes. The new characters are shallow and lack any sort of rich or really any back story unlike earlier characters. It leaves you wondering what exactly happened at the company to see such a drastic change in quality.

So, this game looks amazing and I really want to play it. I can excuse the elephant in the room (BotW rip-off much?), because the game would be amazing. If I could play it. Why on earth is this even in the AppStore?! The info says the game is only 2.6 GB (already kinda big), but it‚Äôs not. Once you download the app and make an account, you have to download the rest of the game from within the app. I looked it up, and the game takes up 30 GB !!!!!!!! That‚Äôs almost twice the amount of storage my phone would have if genshin impact was the only data on it PERIOD. My phone has a total of 16GB. Why would you say on the AppStore that it is compatible with iPhone 6 if it‚Äôs not?! I would definitely give this five stars if I could actually play it.

So the first time I downloaded Genshin Impact it told me that there was a insufficient storage error, and that would pop up every time I tapped to begin. I eventually deleted the game and reinstalled it. The second time it says that the connection timed out, and many downloads later nothing is changing. I tried to look up the solutions for both of the errors but could only find the answer for the insufficient storage error. It says to go to settings, go to storage, click Genshin Impact, and tap clear cache and data. I don‚Äôt have a cache and data button so I don‚Äôt know what to do.

When I first began playing Genshin Impact, it was amazing. Everything was a new experience. The character designs were lovely, and everywhere I looked I saw breathtaking scenery. The storyline was engaging, and I enjoyed interacting with characters. However, a couple of months after playing Genshin Impact, I began to get bored of the game. Logging on every day felt more like a chore, rather than a relaxing escapism from the real world. As you progress further in the game there is a larger need to grind for materials and characters. However, it is still a solid game, and I recommend playing it.

The graphics are flawless even if you get it on mobile! I adore the storyline, characters, quests etc. I noticed some people have been complaining it has been laggy on their mobile device, but it depends on internet and how good your phone or iPad is. So far, Genshin Impact has been a masterpiece of a game. It‚Äôs been amazing. The score and art are beautiful, and the gameplay and attention to detail are amazing. You even included motion blur! The game is *not* a Breath of the Wild clone, despite what people have been saying. It reminds me of Breath of the Wild, yes, but it also reminds me of The Elder Scrolls: Blades and anime. (Between you and me, though, the cooking mechanic is a lot better and more fun in this than it is in Breath of the Wild.) So far, I‚Äôve enjoyed this game a lot, and I like all of the mechanics. (Cryo freezing the rivers is one of my favorites, though. [super useful for preserving stamina!])

I‚Äôve been searching for games like Genshin for a very long time. I‚Äôve played a variety of mmo/dungeon crawler, but i‚Äôve gotten bored due to styles that didn‚Äôt fit my expectations especially on the mobile. When I discovered Genshin, I was amazed of how amazing these graphics were and how much potential it can have. If they listen to the community and continue to update and fix bugs, I could see this game with a huge community!

1. It called itself a open world game. But you cannot proceed the storyline until you reach certain adventure level.
2. You can only find junks in the chest around the map. Because all good weapons and characters are in the pool.
3. Stupid pooling chance. Characters and weapons are in the same pool. 0.6% chance for 5 star characters and 5 star weapon. 1.6% chance for 4 star characters and 4 star weapon. 
4. Expensive in game purchase. It took you approximately 20 dollars for 10 draws. 4 star is Guaranteed every 10 draws. It can be characters and weapon. 5 star is guaranteed every 90 draws. But with my experience, the chance you spend 100 dollars on the pool, there will be 99% of chance of drawing a weapon.
5. Hollow world. Once you reached adventure level 29, there is no more main story. All left in the game is grinding for gears.
6. You can only farm 6 dungeons per day if you do not use your dollar. Running 6 dungeons will take you about 8 mins. And you have 4 daily quest per day taking you 10 mins. And that‚Äôs all. Nothing else for you to play. All you can do is go offline and enjoy your normal life.
7. Summary. It‚Äôs A game will just waste your time.

The touch d-pad has a fixed position which is an awful decision. I used to play Diablo immortal and it has perfect natural movement  controls, I just don‚Äôt need a game pad at all with it. genshin Impact is just unplayable, I always move back instead of moving forward. I deleted the game because of that at the game release. I decided to give it another try several years later, same awful controls... deleting again. Why they can‚Äôt make the virtual dpad work as camera controls. Just divide the screen on 2 half‚Äôs the left half is for movement, the right is for the camera.  Now the camera takes the space even above the virtual joystick, so if I miss it I control the camera by the Left thumb. Awful.

The recent adjustment to Yae Miko‚Äôs target priority system has had a significant negative effect on her gameplay. The change from random to closest on her targeting has made her C2 nearly useless, with the increased range being meaningless if it will not target farther enemies. If an enemy is immune to electro or shielded the Sesshou Sakura will still target the enemy that is unable to be damaged. This has greatly reduced her damage, flexibility and fun. Personally I and many others used Yae Miko for attacking enemies all across the field, with her taking down the farther enemies, so the active character could focus on the immune, shielded or more threatening enemies, rather than being distracted by the support enemies, such as samachurls.

I got both pros and cons. For pros, It is a great open world rpg with engaging storyline and graphics. There are a lot of choices for team composition and play style. For cons, comparing this to other games I played. The energy system in this game is probably the worst. It cost way too much to run a single dungeon and with max energy. Some fairly easy group content can only be ran three to four times a day. Lacks the perspective of multiplayer because of this. It is extremely hard to get new items and the refresh time is extremely long. The gacha rate is one of the lowest in current gaming market. Overall, I‚Äôm kind of disappointed considered that I spent quite a fortune on this too.

The open world loads itself seamlessly, and a combination of enemies makes for a good challenge of your know-how of the elements and their weaknesses. The lore and character interactions are abundant and meaningful. The gacha system in Genshin Impact is an afterthought. What makes the game more unique than other gachas is the pity currency and how its dupe system improves characters and weapons significantly - not their stats, but their passive abilities, making them much more effective in a combat system that relies on environmental mechanics more than numbers.
One major weakness is the game's lack of free currency, or rather, the amount of Primogems being limited to the world. Genshin Impact can retain more players if there's a login bonus everyday, and not just the 1 week event it's holding right now.

Genshin Impact is amazing as a free mobile game.  The exploration and story are as full as some console titles.  Unfortunately it adheres to mobile gacha strategy (gacha pulls, lots of grinding, pay to win aspects, daily stamina limits, etc.) but as a regular player I feel like I never run out of stuff to do. I have had this game since it‚Äôs release and I can honestly say that this is the most immersive and enjoyable game I have played in a while. As a person who started out playing Skyrim and listening to a lot of twenty one pilots and K-pop: it has lore, it has interactive elements such as books and quest to keep you entertained. 

I love the gatcha feature and how the characters add to the rich storyline and all have a part to play in the ever continuing story. 

The game also has that element of farming if you have no more quest to do or if you get too far into the quest and you want to take a break. 

There is a manga series as well to go along with the game and even extra videos to watch outside of the game that have bits of lore as well. 

Whether you want a game to pass the time or love learning about fictional worlds as much as me, this game has something for everyone!!

As more and more leaks of the new region ‚ÄúSumeru‚Äù are coming out, i saw something. If Sumeru is based of India, or South Asia, why are none of the leaked characters (excluding Collei) brown or dark skinned? And there are only 2 characters with dark skin and that is Kaeya and Xinyan. And that is 2 of of 50+ characters in the whole game and you‚Äôve managed to whitewash both of them in character art that YOU, the CREATORS OF THOSE CHARACTERS have made. Although i love this game as a whole and have made many many memories within the game, the fact is that you need to do better with skin colors and also some representation(which i wont list). So please Hoyoverse, do better with the 3.0 Sumeru characters and NPCs!

This game takes inspiration from real world events and countries, yet fails to do the basics of accurately depicting characters that are from these inspired nations. There are over 40 characters in the game, and out of all of these, there is currently only two that have what is barely considered a tan. Sumeru and Natlan are the only nations that are based off of multiple, smushed cultures and countries (these two nations do not have pale skinned folks), which is extremely disrespectful in itself. These nations already have characters being depicted in a stereotypical manner. The lack of different body types in this game make the characters feel repetitive. This game has so much potential, but it is severely lacking in the diversity department, making it unenjoyable.

Game looks good, has a decent story, and fills that need to explore/fight monsters.

Outside of that, that‚Äôs all there is. The endgame is non existent. You just continue to grind using resin (basically stamina that allows you to collect rewards) for new items that may or may not have the stats you want (it‚Äôs random). And even when you‚Äôre trying to grind for better gear, the resin cap is so limiting that it‚Äôs hard to do. 

Also, it‚Äôs not new player friendly. The game lines to advertise new characters. As of writing this, Kokomi is the current banner, but even if a new player obtains her they have to go very far in the story to be able to even get the items necessary to upgrade her. 

Anniversary can be it‚Äôs own topic. However, as a player who has played since the beginning, always bought Welkin moon and battle pass, along with the occasional top ups, it‚Äôs very disheartening to see how stingy Mihoyo was with anniversary rewards. The company does not care about its player base, so why should I as a consumer care about giving them money?

If you play, do so as free to play only, as I will moving forward.

Mihoyo went from being very generous towards genshin players, but as time went on and more, Mihoyo became greedy and catered mainly to p2p players. while it‚Äôs not necessarily bad, Mihoyo is a billion dollar company that refuses to even give us decent anniversary rewards, which is unfair to all genshin impact players. we all expected something like a free character, or at the very least 10 free wishes to HOPEFULLY win their terrible gacha system, but all we‚Äôve received so far is a web event where you walked through your adventures (which was nice) and 40 primo gems for all of the work and money that‚Äôs gone into this game. For something that‚Äôs supposed to be going on for 10+ years, Mihoyo sure did cost themselves over one anniversary, and that‚Äôs just disappointing

This game is so amazing. An open world game that actually feels like an open world game that belongs on the ps4. The characters are amazing the story is interesting. Hard to put into words. You can feel it in the world, and how it‚Äôs been crafted. it feels like they genuinely care about this game. I could definitely be wrong. But you can usually tell the difference between when a product is good because a company threw money at it until it was good, and when a product is good because someone had an idea for a world they were genuinely interested in building. And guess what? These guys did a spectacular job making this world something I want to explore every nook and cranny of.

This game is really good for a long time. Seriously really good, but once you hit a certain point the cracks begin to show. 

The gacha system is already bad so I won‚Äôt talk about that, but the stamina system is so bad it makes the game just miserable. You are gated hard by the amount you can play because of the stamina system. It makes too hard to raise new characters. So optimally you invest in 1, but even doing that, there‚Äôs not enough stamina to get enough materials/money to even afford 1 character. At that point why roll for new characters when you won‚Äôt be able to even use them?

Not only that but the content is just not there. Once you have explored the world, done the story, and opened all of the chests, your content is now running around opening common chests that have respawned and drop virtually nothing. All so you can push your AR higher to get stuck at another upgrade wall by the stamina system. 

Again this game is incredible until you hit the wall then it just becomes a game of frustration, with no answer from the devs about anything.

This game has brought me a lot of joy, and is absolutely stunning both aesthetically and sound-wise. I do have a couple of suggestions and or opinions on a couple of things. If you‚Äôd like to see, keep reading, if you don‚Äôt, just know that i do recommend this game to nearly anyone! <3

Some of my suggestions are...
Some of the SFX for footsteps aren‚Äôt exactly correlated to what the character is walking on, most noticeably, stone. Stone, for some reason, sounds like dirt, and water sounds like squishing a handful of soap excess in your hands. Those two are the only I‚Äôd complain about. 

Now, here‚Äôs what irks me a bit. The obtaining of characters. It‚Äôs so much of a hassle, that I have remorse for the game itself every now and again. It seems really unfair, once it gets to a certain point. There‚Äôs only so much work a player is willing to do just to get a weapon or an item you don‚Äôt need.
Otherwise, this game is delightful.

This game is great, but let‚Äôs be honest, its nearly unplayable on mobile because it lacks controller support. It was developed alongside two other versions that support controller and mouse and keyboard, but this one doesn‚Äôt even support controller. 

For one, it‚Äôs a pain to just pick up items. constantly moving the position of my hand to mash away on items, or even to simply talk to someone is extremely annoying. 

Combat isn‚Äôt undoable, but it‚Äôs clunky compared to mouse and keyboard and controller. Archery is a pain unless you‚Äôve been playing a lot of shooters on touch controls, and tbf, I‚Äôve played mobile shooters and it just seems sloppy on here in comparison to say COD or PUBG. 

It‚Äôs a small feature to add, to simply map the same controls you mapped for the other two versions, and I‚Äôm certain many of us will appreciate that. Otherwise, an excellent game, I‚Äôd give it 5 stars instead of 4 with the addition of controller support.

With the new-coming Sumeru update, I was really hoping that we would get some well-needed representation. In the most recent livestream, we got a sneak peak for a long awaited country that is meant to be inspired by Middle Eastern and South Asian culture. In the footage, all we got to see were pasty pale people. I‚Äôm not saying that pale people don‚Äôt exist in these places, but having an entire country based on a culture of people who often have darker skin, and not showing that representation is horrible. In recent surveys, they asked us what we would wish to see in Sumeru, many people replying that more variety in skin color would be welcome and wished for. It‚Äôs not as if we haven‚Äôt asked. I truly love this game but it is wrong that the only representation is Xinyan.

I really didn‚Äôt think you could get any lower, and lo and behold. No decent optimization for lower-end devices, horrible rewards for F2P players, a disgusting gacha system; what else? These rewards are pathetic; the fact that people have to spend so much money just for the character they want is absolutely absurd. The fact that you have to pressure every player to log in every day and do such tedious commissions is even worse. If not done, the lost Primos start to build up, especially with how HORRIBLE the gacha system is.

game developer standpoint to not actively
listen to and communicate with your player
base about relevant issues.

Genshin Impact‚Äôs gameplay is fun, but it has a few major flaws.
1. Genshin Impact has terrible rates. There is a six percent chance to get a five star. You may argue that you can complete the game without five stars, but it is really hard. Look at other gacha games, their rates are much better than Genshin Impact‚Äôs rates.
2. Terrible anniversary rewards. You can only get ten pulls from the daily anniversary rewards. TEN. ONLY TEN. Many other gacha games give way more pulls on their anniversary.
In conclusion, Genshin Impact‚Äôs gacha has terrible rates compared to other games and has such bad rewards that I‚Äôd rather want to dig a hole and fill it back up for the rest of my life than claim the anniversary rewards.

the game over ALL is pretty good. nice visuals, good character designs, etc. but the rewards players get- ESPECIALLY if theyve been playing for a long time are lackluster.  open the game, do your commissions, spend your resin, send expeditions, repeat.  you pay so much and get so little, the welkin package is basically the only good thing. the rewards aren't the best- you get more for bug repairs and maintenance than the FIRST ANNIVERSARY, which is a cheaply crafted web event to get people to advertise their game.  the company is endlessly greedy, so unless you're willing to drop hundred of dollars to get what you want, or have insanely good luck, this isn't the game for you. heavy grinding that takes ages, gacha rates that spit in your face, and a broken resin system and artifact harvesting

Genshin Impact is a very pretty game with great exploration, music, characters, etc. It is very fun for a few months but there is a noticeable lack of endgame repeatable content. Spiral abyss resets every two weeks and does not take much time to clear. Eventually the gameplay is reduced to just logging in, spending resin and doing commissions, and logging off. This problem is somewhat negated by events, but it is still a bit of a problem. Overall, I think it is still a pretty solid game, especially since a lot of new content is coming in 2.0

An in-depth and content-filled mobile game marred by a predatory gacha system fueled by hype-up marketing campaigns to draw characters into the monetization. If you want to spend on this game, be prepared to sink entire paychecks to obtain the characters/items you want. That being said, it is entirely possible to have fun as a F2P player and get the gacha characters/weapons you want, but there are rng components that can invalidate the hard work grinding currency. 

If you‚Äôre prone to gambling addiction/impulsive microtransaction purchases, definitely stay away from this game. I can‚Äôt in good conscience recommend a game, no matter how much I enjoy it, when they contain monetization systems like this that encourage high spending.

I have been absolutely enamored with this game since around Christmas time of 2021-Until playing Genshin Impact,I honestly thought I had lost my ability to immerse myself into a game world due to worsening depression over the years and the general apathy towards even enjoyable things that came along with it.

In all honesty,I cried as I wrote this.

Sincerely,Nicolette.

The game is definitely a gacha game.  Everything is based around spending energy.  But you don‚Äôt have to spend money, there‚Äôs enough free characters you can get high constellations on.   I like the game, I still play it.   

That said, their website bugs out constantly, I cannot access it on an iPhone using safari, chrome, or Firefox.  On the pc I can only access it on Firefox, and it still times out.

Their launcher for pc is broke.  It forces most pc users to manually install, and it‚Äôs been broke for years too.  So if you thought you would have a fun multi platform game, think again.  

The news updates in the mobile app never load (and I mean never, they‚Äôve only ever loaded from the pc client).  The links to events or surveys in the mail used to work a year ago but no longer work (probably due to the website which has not functioned properly for months).

Fun game, could be loads better.   Don‚Äôt play it if you don‚Äôt like gacha games.  It‚Äôs not a jrpg.  Its an energy based p2w.

This only negative thing I have to say is the lack of things to do once you have finished most of the story mode, and the lack of materials/mora to progress other characters. Currently I just logon to do the dailies, burn through my resin and left with nothing else to do. 

Besides that, the actual gameplay is amazing. The combat system, the ability to fly freely and discover secrets here and there. And if your into storylines, this game has it.

Genshin Impact is a lot of fun, I have been playing it non stop recently. The only thing I would say it lacks is the ability to customize at least your main character. Most people like to play as characters that look like themselves, including myself. However, there are no redheaded female characters, only men. I understand that red hair isn‚Äôt necessarily a common trait, but It still be really cool to play as one. Hopefully either a customizing feature will be released in the future or a redhead female character will be created!

Good content and characters but the controls on mobile are clunky. In battle it‚Äôs much worse. The camera will often focus on empty land while enemies are attacking you. The flight controls are extremely sluggish so when you depend on them for battle, you‚Äôre out of luck. Automatically starting to climb on objects is a problem because the camera is so unstable so mid battle you‚Äôll start climbing and often get attacked. Recovery from getting knocked down needs work too. It‚Äôs often a long process leaving you open to follow up attacks. Reaction time is the main issue with the mobile version of the game.

Most beautiful game on phone and best game I could ever ask for but there is one problem.... they are good at making the game looks amazing, smooth, breathtaking, and addictive but they are not good at making events. But I am sure that will change in the future I am looking forward to better events and better ways to progress through the game more and not wait a long time for resin to recharge. I enjoy exploring the whole map cant wait for the next areas to be unlocked and I am really looking forward to seeing this game grow.

this game is the only mobile game I‚Äôve actually put real hours into. About 60+ hours right now. but this is happening more frequently and it makes it really hard to keep wanting to play. It‚Äôs very disheartening. otherwise, timed challenges are unreasonably short sometimes. all the missions I am stuck on are because of the just too short time limit. When I first saw this game I was so hyped. It looks amazing. The graphics, the characters, everything just looks so polished and well done. So of course I installed it. But when I opened the app, all i saw was a white screen. I thought it was just a minor bug so I sat there and waited for the game to load in. I searched online and it seems that lots of other people are having the same problem. Hopefully the developers can fix this bug so I can play this great looking game. For now, I will rate it as a 1 star because it is unplayable.

This game has far exceeded my expectations. Coming from the semi open maps on Honaki Impact to the fully immersive map in Genshin Impact is outstanding. However, if you are looking for a true open-world RPG on mobile, this is it!

Let me start off with something: I love this game. It‚Äôs amazing, and I love the characters and combat system. But It crashes SO much. This game is definitely a 5/5, the story is great, the characters are great, the art style is great and really everything is great, I‚Äôm not gonna go too deep into anything but the only negative thing in this game at all is sometimes I get frame rate drops and the loading time is a bit slow (I am only on an iPhone 7 though) a lot of people have been comparing in to breath of the wild and it is very similar but it‚Äôs it‚Äôs still so different and I love it

Again, 5/5 stars and definitely my favorite game this year

There are many pros and cons to this game, but I would like to start with the pros. 
 fun playstyle - theres a very big variety of playstyles of your liking, which is great
 
so much to explore - at the start of the game, theres so much to do and you cant get a break 

fun events - personally, many events for the game are actually very fun and you can get many rewards, such as primogems, free 4* characters, etc 

theres many more, but i wish to make this as short as possible, now i will begin with the cons
 
terrible representation - starting off with the obvious, many characters are pale lightskin, theres nothing wrong with that, but for a region based off south asia, there should be more dark skinned characters, not just 2-3. 

racist and terrible character designs - another obvious, for example Yae Miko's design is very disrespectful and is meant to be a SHRINE MAIDEN 
pain to gain good characters - farming constantly? not exactly the best sadly, plus the rewards are so low its painful

Just here to explain why the game takes up so much data- basically it‚Äôs a huge world, with over 100 quests (probably more like 2-3 hundred) that couldn‚Äôt be supported if it took any less space. at the end of the day, genshin is a computer game optimized for mobile. It takes about 15 gb (as of 2.4), but as there are currently 17 regions (yes, only three countries, counting by statues of the seven) the game‚Äôs huge size is almost understandable.

I‚Äôve really been enjoying Genshin since I got into it a little over a year ago, however my biggest issue with the game has been the size. I‚Äôm a mobile player, and as time goes on I find myself deleting things to make room for new updates, its getting really close to the point where I won‚Äôt be able to play anymore, at least not on my phone. My biggest suggestion would be to make changes to what is and isn‚Äôt currently being used so save space or possibly move into new platforms like Xbox.

1. The intro to the game lagged my 6th Generation iPad and at first I thought my device wasn‚Äôt compatible (only come to find out that I was just being impatient).
2. The controls are a lot trickier as opposed to Honkai Impact‚Äôs, meaning whenever I try to go forward, I often find myself moving to the right or left (I will say that adding a system that lets you ‚Äòwalk‚Äô is absolutely awesome, bravo devs).

All-in-all, I thoroughly enjoyed the game. My only wish though, was that it was also available for Xbox One and not just PS4 (I mean seriously, 343 damaged Xbox‚Äôs reputation with Halo 5 so they kind of need a bone here).

Assuming you‚Äôre unwilling to wait the several months it would take you to Payless-ly acquire the 90 rolls it would take you to guarantee your first 5 star, (which otherwise has a .6% chance of being rolled on any banner,) we‚Äôre talking a price point of $1050 to get you through those rolls and guarantee you a COIN TOSS on whether or not you‚Äôll get the unit you actually want.

Regardless of whatever this game brings to the table, no game should be allowed to pick the pockets of their player base in that way, and I will not be giving money to this studio again so long as they continue these kinds of practices.

Objectively speakimg, the game itself, including character design, gameplay, graphics, storyline, and music, is great. However, there are a lot of problems with this game. There is no late game content, and MiHoYo does not seem to care much about it. The game requires a lot of grinding, which is okay, but there is like a stamina system to force players to pay if they want to grind. The recent controversy showed that MiHoYo does not want to communicate with the player base and does not give any appreciation towards them. Beware of disappointment if you want to invest in this game. In a conclusion, it is a great ‚Äúfree‚Äù game if you do not take it serious. However, do not pay for in-game content because your money is not appreciated AT ALL.

Soundtrack and world building are top of its class. That‚Äôs how they trick you into staying on this game despite all of the glaring issues that the game has with long-term players. This game has much potential, but instead of using profits to fix issues about the game and making it better for the player, the company is content with keeping things as is and raking in the cash. Do NOT support this type of predatory practice. This game/company has shown time and time again that it does not care for its users. Find a game that communicates to its players and feedback, and that is designed around keeping players happy, as opposed to farming them for cash.

Amazing game, I‚Äôve played it for a full year now. It‚Äôs had it‚Äôs fair share of problems but Mihoyo had tended to be good with listening to the community.  It has its fair share of problems with the monetizing of characters, and even in game play time but it‚Äôs had plenty of events to make up for it. Since it‚Äôs lack of endgame, they keep us entertained with whatever they can come up with to include a rhythm game. Now anniversary, the time gacha games give back to the community for sticking with them for so long. And they do what? Spit in our faces, have a crappy anniversary banner. Nothing to do and nothing to look forward to as of 2.1, wait another year before you start the game. Maybe it‚Äôll be more full.

I‚Äôm what you would consider a whale in this game (almost 2k spent) and I have decided I won‚Äôt be spending anymore. The developers have made too many decisions that are just distasteful. They released too many characters that have been tested and demonstrated to have flaws in their kit - but devs refuse to make buffs. The story arc for the third part of Inazuma was extremely rushed and I couldn‚Äôt even enjoy the war scenario. The anniversary rewards are the worst part. They reward their players for playing for the past year with rewards that are the same as a previous event - so they‚Äôre not even special. The game is great - but with the developers heading in this direction I don‚Äôt really want to support them anymore.

After playing for an entire year, you‚Äôd think I‚Äôd be able to get decent artifacts, but the system is so skewed against players that the only stats and substats you get are DEF and HP. Either implement a pity system for that or allow me to convert my stats somehow, because it‚Äôs so disappointing to not get a single good artifact after two months of farming domains. I understand this system exists to make me want to pull for new characters, but it‚Äôs disheartening and makes me want to quit. 
Also, the anniversary rewards could be more generous, and would make me feel more appreciated as a player who‚Äôs been around since the beginning. It‚Äôs just seems like MiHoYo is just another greedy and selfish company lately.

Players‚Äô feedback is ignored, and the gacha system is the stingiest out of any that I have seen. It really feels like Hoyoverse doesn‚Äôt care about its playerbase in the slightest. Fine for casual play, but disappointing beyond that.

This game was absolutely wonderful when I started playing it. The world building was fantastic, the graphics were phenomenal, and the gameplay was fair. However, I cannot turn a blind eye to the increased mistreatment of the player base. Between nonsensical chat filters, unjustified bans, and flat out corporate greed, this game has devolved from an enjoyable gacha to a sad  cash-grab in recent months. Recently released characters feel incomplete, content feels rushed, and the developers have become increasingly stingy on what services are provided for free-to-play players. As much as I used to enjoy this game, it has been ruined by poor decision making in management and I cannot possibly give it a good review.

This seems like an awesome game. But, here‚Äôs why I uninstalled it: I really don‚Äôt like that the movement control (touch analog style) is bound to a single tiny area which you can‚Äôt enlarge (there is no option). I was constantly moving in a direction that I didn‚Äôt intend to. Super frustrating. The best option would be a control area that follows wherever you place your thumb like in COD or PUBG. Also, the camera doesn‚Äôt follow your character when you turn. So, you have to constantly adjust your view to see where you‚Äôre going. The combination of the two issues gave me a headache and I stopped playing. Maybe I‚Äôll check back later to see if the developers have fixed the problem.

Edit: Time limit in quest should also be removed or be made optional to be turned on off for anyone who like a challenge. Not everyone want to be rushed in videogame. I play to relax not to punish myself.

Genshin impact is a really good game. It has stunning graphics and runs well on mobile devices. The good: good graphics, good story, optimized for mobile devices, fun gameplay.
The bad: some objects don‚Äôt have collision, you can clip into walls. Characters clip into cliffs they are climbing, climbing can be quite buggy. The game is extremely p2w and you need insane luck to even stand a chance late game. There is almost no enemy variety, it‚Äôs just slimes and hilichurls.

Overall Genshin is a good game, it just has lots of bugs that need to be fixed. A three star rating will have to suffice.

This game plays like how all AA games should play. Smooth performance, beautiful sceneries, fantastic combat/party elements. 

The issues I do have are as follows:

1. Lack of meaningful co-op quests, adventures and gameplay. The one event that just came out, the Elemental Crucible, was buggy and laggy most of the time. I guess this could be due to the server overload. It gets lonely and boring running stuff by yourself all the time. 

2. Lack of Resin - The resin gets spent so fast that you find yourself running around in other people‚Äôs world stealing their materials just to spend quality time together.

3. Clunky artifact equipment 
system - no mechanism to lock the artifacts that you want to keep. When combining weapons or artifacts, no info interface to tell you what you‚Äôre combining. And I don‚Äôt know..just feels clunky. 

4. Stamina could be improved upon a bit, or give us a mount...

5. Could be a little less grindy.

First 30-40 hours of gameplay are great. Full open world and things to do.

Then endgame hits and you cant do anything

Once story ends very abruptly and you lose all easy ways to get adventure exp, you are stuck doing dailies and burning resin for everything.

Especially burning resin for EVERYTHING

Progression is directly tied to resin since you need resin for any meaningful accumulation for everything.

Leylines for Mora and Character exp? 20 Resin
Artifacts? 20 Resin
Weapon Ascension Mats? 20 Resin
Talent Mats? 20 Resin
Character Ascension Mats? 40 Resin
Weekly bosses that can only be done 1/week? 60 Resin

This would be better if they had a short resin regen and high cap right? 

Regen is 1/8 minutes and the cap is 120

Doing weeklies will take up half of your saved resin, and why bother doing anything else that day? 

This is not including the 6-7 layers of gear RNG tied to each artifact. 

Its a fun one-off at the beginning 30-40 hours of play, but once you hit endgame you should just delete and find something else.

More in-depth complaints and criticisms of the game can be found on the reddit

When i first started playing genshin, playing kept me busy for a long time. Now, that i am an higher ar rank, i decided to finally write a review.

Like i said earlier, when you first start the game you get many quest and things to do.

However, i have noticed that after ar 20, things get very repetitive. i honestly don't like doing the same things over and over again, to farm books and decent artifacts. in my opinion, even doing daily commissions feel like a chore.

but don't get me wrong, genshin impact is a great game with well designed characters and beautiful terrain.

ignoring the fact that it literally burns up my phone.

like seriously, 10 gb?!

my phone can only handle 32 gb!

Made a region based off of south Asian culture. Used south Asian clothing, traditions, foods, and other versions of their culture. And yet EVERY CHARACTER except ONE for this new region currently have pale skin, while the people in the regions it (Sumeru) is based off of are largely tan. It is clear that Hoyoverse is picking and choosing what parts of south Asian, especially Vietnamese culture they enjoy and want to conveniently include in their game, and what parts they do not like. It is racist and horrifyingly harmful. And they‚Äôve been VERY DIRECTLY informed of the issue. As a former lover of the game, it is a disgusting a very disappointing outcome. I do not want to force, but do encourage anyone to withhold from spending money on Genshin until this is addressed. Thanks for reading.

For a mobile game, it‚Äôs quite impressive what they were able to accomplish (hence why it‚Äôs 2 and not 1 stars), but the title says it all and let‚Äôs not beat around the bush. 

This is Gacha at its worst. Required for progression in the form of the absolute best characters and weapons with no alternatives, stingy as hell after frontloading is over, rates being actual garbage compared to something like Dragalia Lost, and dupes of ultra-rare-due-to-terrible-rates stuff being required to max out power. It‚Äôs blatant pay to win and honestly ruins what could otherwise be an innocent RPG taking direct inspiration from BotW, but alas, greed has once again corrupted a promising venture.

The new leaks about characters in Sumeru is extremely disappointing and disrespectful to see. Having stereotypical depictions and insulting animations to Islamic and Muslim culture a long with outright saying the region is based on South Asia, only to proceed in making every single character INCLUDING the god of the region white? I‚Äôve been a long-time fan of Mihoyo‚Äôs work, especially Honkai Impact, and it genuinely pains me to see how poorly this game turned out. It looks amazing, don‚Äôt get me wrong, but mobile devices simply cannot keep up with this level of graphics. The game crashes if you open a menu. The game crashes if you use certain waypoints. The game has to be manually reopened every time you walk into the town of Monstadt, which functions as the hub world for the main game, the central hub of the first half of the story, and where you return for after each daily. The game may one day be significantly reworked and optimized for mobile, but until then, do not download it.

Unlike most gacha games, however, where stamina increases along with level, the resin cap stays the same as you level up. This means around AR 30+, you can‚Äôt do much since you the bosses take up so much stamina. This game has such great potential and is being held back by the resin system.

I loved genshin for so long but the lack of any meaningful diversity is honestly disappointing. With the release of sumeru and the discovery that many characters based on historical figures and myths that were not only appropriated but subsequently sexualized and white washed many people will start to drop this game. Regions that historically have a majority of darker skinned or tan people are being represented in a game that has historically portrayed lighter skinned cultures very accurately with as little diversity as possible. Not one character in this game has curly hair, not one is darker than a tan, and with the hints that Natlan may be based on latin american cultures I have come to dread opening the game. It is really a simple fix, add more representation.

I just wanted to come on here and write a review on the characters of this game. Although genshin has good aspects, like the (environment details, exploration, and lore,) there needs to be improvements made with the characters. Clearly each nation is based off certain areas of the world, and the sumeru characters are just not culturally accurate, as they are supposed to be inspired by/based off of South Asia. Very disappointed in the representation in this game. There are so many characters, and only two of them so far have a little bit of melanin. If you‚Äôre going to base Sumeru off of South Asia, make the characters have darker skin.

I‚Äôve been playing Genshin Impact since almost day 1 and I won‚Äôt lie the game used to be so fun but lately the game dev became so greedy. They barely give the players any rewards. But that‚Äôs not the thing I‚Äôm annoyed about the most. In fact it‚Äôs the end game content especially for those who pays money regularly in the game. I‚Äôm talking 50$ a month on average since release. The game is so easy at this point and most of the events require you to do boring stuff such as collecting stuff or doing repetitive tasks. The only thing that‚Äôs considered hard in the game right now is the Spiral Abyss and even f2p players can clear it with ease nowadays.

Everything is gacha-heavy and it‚Äôs getting exhausting. Farming rng artifacts and leveling up rng artifacts, both of which end up useless the majority of the time because the rng just so terribly rigged. The wishing system is unbearable, constantly getting the same bad characters and weapons. I‚Äôve put so many hours into grinding this game but my hard earned gems go to complete waste and my effort is meaningless. The anniversary events and rewards are a joke. Many of which are also gacha and no better than the regular rewards that we get. It‚Äôs sad how this is how devoted players are rewarded. It‚Äôs tiring me out, many others too, and I‚Äôll soon follow their leave.

Genshin Impact transports the player to the immersive world of Teyvat, on a quest to find a lost sibling. Along the way, a myriad of quests & jaw-dropping visuals will stun & delight.

After receiving your flying license, you can soar alongside the birds in Teyvat‚Äôs endless skies.

Want to swim into any icy river or rippling lake & catch fish? You can!

Want to stroll along the beach, basking in breathtaking sunsets, & round up a few scuttling crabs while you‚Äôre at it? You can!

Days & nights pass with gentle spring showers, mind-boggling sunrises, & a bevy of good friends, taverns, libraries, castles, & forests.

Utilize various heroes to see what effect  their elemental magic has on enemies throughout the world, then cook up tasty meals by collecting ingredients & simmering them over a fire, to heal your heroes.

No detail has been overlooked in this truly immersive game. Hours of adventure or leisure lie ahead, for those who travel to Teyvat.

I love this game to bits and I‚Äôve been playing it since just three days after it‚Äôs release, but it definitely isn‚Äôt without its faults. I‚Äôll admit one of the new characters (Nilou) is pretty well done in terms of research on her heritage, which is based on Iranian culture. But I certainly expected there to be different shades of skin tones for the new region, especially considering the region it‚Äôs based on (however ambiguous that may be). Hoyoverse can‚Äôt continue to release the single token dark skinned character. We need more variety. It doesn‚Äôt even have to be a lot for the new region, just a couple more than one.

I love this game but the lack of care and accuracy towards SWANA cultures is very concerning. Sumeru is a region heavily inspired by Southwest Asian and North African cultures and the developers are neglecting to portray them respectfully. Every npc from Sumeru has had pale skin despite a majority of people from SWANA cultures having a darker skin tone. Where is the care and consideration that regions like Liyue and Inazuma have? They have 3 separate regions inspired by Europe and 2 separate regions inspired by East Asian countries. Sumeru is a mashup of multiple cultures and play into a lot of orientalist stereotypes. I‚Äôm very disappointed with the direction the developers are going with Sumeru and I won‚Äôt be pulling for any characters that don‚Äôt accurately portray the cultures they‚Äôre based on.

Mobile games are known for being pretty ****, but Genshin delivers on everything it promises. While it‚Äôs not as smooth and refined as its PC port, it is stellar for being a mobile game.

If you want most of the event characters or a max constellation prepare to spend a chunk of cash or wait for 4-6 re-releases in order to save up naturally. However, its pity system makes the gacha balanced for F2P and all characters can become ‚Äúbusted‚Äù with enough love and attention.

The map and graphics are top notch and the storyline is sooooooooooo good. It adheres to an anime inspiration and the regions reflect various cultures.

The events are also fairly frequent and filled with rewards and goodies. Every time I miss one I always find myself regretting taking that short break.

Overall, 10 out of 10!
